jobs.title: WebGL Developer
jobs.content:
As WebGL Developer you are able to create and realise captivating experiences within a team of front-end developers. Your experience in 2D & 3D graphics plays a vital role in all web projects that need rich visual effects. Performance is key to a pleasing user experience, so you are able to optimize code until there’s nothing left to optimize. You are able to work with in-house and external 3D artists to define and set up an efficient workflow and production pipeline to push the limits of what possible within browsers even further.


We find it important to help you grow as a person and in your career. As a growing company we offer several opportunities to learn and advance yourself within Superhero Cheesecake. We care about continuously training our team members into becoming top-notch developers. Our regular code review meetings make sure everybody can learn from mistakes and get up to speed with best practices.

jobs.title: Talented .Net Developer Required in Central London
jobs.content:
We are a small, dynamic start up, looking to hire an experienced .Net developer for a senior role in Clerkenwell, central London.


We are using NLP to add value to Social Media analysis and are building an API to deliver our content.


Our technology stack is largely Microsoft but, as we integrate with other data sources and technologies, a good industry awareness is a real bonus.


As a start-up we value self-reliance and individual contribution; a positive, proactive attitude is as important as good technical skills.However, we are a close-knit team and the successful candidate will enjoy a relaxed, friendly, and rewarding working environment.


 This is an opportunity to help shape the very heart of our product and be instrumental in bringing our offering to market.


Core job requirements



  • Have primary responsibility for development and maintenance of our code base

  • Work with our existing .Net developer in refactoring and streamlining existing code

  • Consult with front end development to provide the API they need

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Full Stack Engineers are the glue that keeps our Engineering team together. We’re looking for generalists that are as versatile as they are passionate about their craft. You'll help us transform the boutique fitness and gym landscape by creating awesome experiences for people looking to live a more active lifestyle.


We currently run on JavaScript, CSS, Angular, Python, Java, MySQL and more. We make the most of modern tools like React, Webpack and SASS. Whether we're working on a consumer feature or working on our API services, we strive to create the best possible experience for our end users. We’ve built small, tight knit squads so you’ll work closely with a small number of engineers, a designer and product manager on an product that’s seen 10x growth in the last year.


What you'll do



  • Build web and mobile client applications and the backend services to support them



  • Write, review, and discuss efficient and reusable code to build features and tools on our consumer and studio platform



  • Collaborate with the front end and back end, product, design and business intelligence teams

jobs.title: Head of Design
jobs.content: ClassPass is hiring a Head of Design in New York, NY

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Join us!


Want to help us transform one of the few industries where true digitalization is yet to happen?


Min Doktor connects you with a doctor or healthcare specialist at the touch of your hand. We’re an online service that provides evaluation, diagnosis and treatment by medical professionals, all while delivering the same accessibility and convenience that you expect from modern day service providers.


At Min Doktor we’ve built a service that will truly change the way we think about primary care and will certainly improve lives of both patients and doctors.  
We are strengthening our development team to bring the Min Doktor brand and our service to the public and prepare for international expansion.


We haven’t set languages and work methodology in stone but right now the backend is written in Go (golang.org), Angular 1.4x and React Native for the mobile application. If you have no previous experience in those languages that is fine as long as you are willing to learn.

jobs.title: Senior Product Management Consultant
jobs.content:
Dell Software empowers companies of all sizes to experience Dell’s “Power to Do More” by delivering scalable yet simple-to-use solutions to drive value and accelerate results. Dell Software Group’s portfolio now includes the products and technologies of Quest Software, AppAssure, Enstratius, KACE and SonicWALL. We are uniquely positioned to address today’s most pressing business and IT challenges with holistic, connected software offerings.

Role Summary

Participate in the direction of Dell Software’s data protection product(s) to ensure a competitive market advantage and champions the development of new solutions to meet market opportunities consistent with the organization’s short- and long-term goals and objectives.

Role Responsibilities

Participates as a proactive member of the Dell Software Product Management team and contributes to the company as follows:

– Meets or exceeds short- and long-term revenue results for assigned product.
– Takes accountability and resolves any issues preventing the achievement of timely, quality, and cost effective results.
– Takes strategic risks toward achieving operational excellence
– Maintains high standards of excellence, strong work ethics and legal compliance.
– Creates and maintains an accurate and up-to-date executive overview of product(s) including market, financial, and strategic data analysis to ensure effective communications of goals, key issues, and progress towards objectives.
– Develops accurate and timely Market Requirements Documents (MRDs) that contain feature functionality descriptions to be used by development team and Business Requirements Documents (BRDs) to assess the validity of a proposed feature or new product offering.
– Conducts market analysis to determine product relevancy and adjust course as needed consistent with desired company goals and objectives.
– Develops prototypes and mockups of new versions, workflows, etc.
– Creates and delivers training materials for support and sales.
– Provides necessary content to external customer Product Marketing team to ensure effective product collateral materials to support short- and long-term revenue objectives.
– Collaborates with other areas of the company (Development, Support, Marketing, etc.) to ensure efficient operation of product development and release.
– Works with management to set revenue forecasts.

Qualifications

– Experience equivalent to a 4-year education with an emphasis in technology, product marketing or management.
– 5-6 years of experience working in product management function within the data protection space or similar space with a proven track record of sales and marketing results.
– Implementation experience of data protection products.
– In-depth understanding of the data protection and storage products in the market today.
– Excellent interpersonal and communications skills, including verbal and written communications.
– Must have effective networking skills in order to establish relationships with customers.
– Travel 15% on an annual basis.

Why work with us?

-Life at Dell means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology.
-When we see something that could be improved, we get to work inventing the solution.
-Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships.
-We invest in our people and offer a series of programs that enables them to pursue a career that fulfills their potential.
-Our team members’ health and wellness is our priority as well as rewarding them for their hard work.

Dell is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages.

Life At Dell

Equal Employment Opportunity Policy

jobs.title: Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
SecureWorks is a global leader in providing intelligence-driven information security solutions.  We play an important role, as no organization in the world is immune from cyberattacks and the nature of the attack is changing every day.  Internet security is a problem that will never be solved.  Unlike point products that address a specific technology issue, we attack the problem holistically by analyzing threat actor tactics, techniques and procedures, and develop solutions using best-of-breed technologies to protect our clients. We are one of the best in the world at understanding the threat.

In short, we give our clients an early warning capability.  SecureWorks was founded in 1999 and headquartered in Atlanta, Ga., with offices in all the major security markets around the globe.  We have more than 2,000 team members, and partner with more than 4,200 clients in 59 countries to keep the bad guys out of their networks.  We’ve been consistently recognized by industry analysts, readers’ polls and as a leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for managed security services, worldwide.

Role Overview

An Automation Engineer facilitates business activities by automating common tasks that need to be performed on client premises equipment. Common tasks involve data gathering, configuration backups, and password changes. Tasks involve interacting with multiple platforms. A passion for efficiency and excellence in service delivery contributes to the employee’s overall success in this role. The ability to work in a team environment with little direction from management is desired.

Role Responsibilities

  • Design automation logic
  • Write expect and perl scripts to perform tasks
  • Monitor job status and correct errors
  • Be a subject matter expert for improvements to automation platform

As a managed security provider, SecureWorks expects its employees to understand and apply commonly known security practices and possess a working knowledge of applicable industry controls such as NIST 800-53. Employees will be expected to acknowledge their security responsibilities in writing prior to gaining access to company systems. Employees will be required to maintain a working knowledge of local security policies and execute general controls as assigned.

Requirements

  • Programming experience in Perl
  • Programming experience in Expect
  • Strong knowledge of Linux OS
  • Strong desire to learn and ability to adapt to new technologies

Preferences

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field or equivalent experience
  • Command-line experience with the following platforms:
  • Linux
  • Cisco ASA
  • Cisco IPS
  • Sourcefire NG
  • Checkpoint Firewall1
  • Fortinet Fortigate
  • 2-3 years work experience in a technical Network Security service role.

Dell is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind:

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. jobs.title: Analytics, Trading, and Execution Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:50212



Every day, trillions of dollars pass through the Bloomberg Terminal. As a result, hundreds of thousands of financial professionals turn to our 500 applications to manage their portfolios, execute their trades and analyze the markets. As engineers, we're the ones who build the applications our clients rely on to not just stay informed, but stay ahead of the market. We connect supply and demand across all asset classes on worldwide exchanges. The applications and infrastructure we build embody the speed, agility and financial data that make Bloomberg the go-to for financial professionals across the globe.

You'll have the opportunity to learn about the financial markets and take ownership in growing our industry-leading applications. You'll be able to lead projects, partner with the business and meet clients to understand their workflows. We work primarily in C++, but we believe a smart engineer can learn any language with some ramp up time. If you're from a different OO background but you're willing to learn C++, we still want you to apply. We have opportunities in all phases of the SDLC, so if you want to make an immediate impact and work on the financial world's toughest technical challenges, apply today.

You need to have:

  • 2+ years of experience with object-oriented programming such as C++, C# or Java
  • Strong problem solving skills


We'd love to see:

  • Experience with multithreading
  • Familiarity with SQL, Python and JavaScript
  • Experience with high volume, high availability distributed systems
  • Interest in the financial markets


When you apply, tell us which of our teams you'd like to join. Here are snapshots of each one.

Trading Solutions (TS)



TS empowers the biggest players in the financial world to manage their portfolios, execute and settle their trades and make decisions that move the markets. Trillions of dollars pass through our systems on a daily basis so our applications need to be fast, accurate and scalable. Our integrated platforms interact with a number of agencies and governments around the world, and we use the best technology the industry offers to build them. We are full stack engineers who specialize in everything from the UX to server-side development and are always looking for new ways to make our products better. As engineers, we live at the intersection of technology and finance, so you'll have the opportunity to learn about the financial markets and suggest new ways we can lead the industry.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics



We build a highly scalable and available system that processes billions of data points per day. The scale of our product (more than 250,000 analytical runs per day) imposes technical challenges around the stringent availability, throughput and responsiveness metrics on our system. Portfolio Managers use our system for performance analysis and returns attribution, risk analytics, intraday monitoring, optimization and idea generation. To keep pace with the tremendous growth of our product, we're constantly looking for ways to improve using new technologies. If you're interested in high performance distributed systems, a modern software code base and are looking to build new products using the latest technology, we want you on our team.

Tradebook



Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker and technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform that trades equities, futures, options and FX trading around the world. We're developing real-time black box and algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions to more than 120 liquidity venues globally. This year, we are building our next-generation system that leverages Bloomberg's expertise in data and analytics to optimize algorithmic trading. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and help us break into more markets. You'll work some of the industry's smartest engineers to shape the future of brokerage technology. To learn more about our product, check out our blog at http://www.bloombergtradebook.com/

Equity Trader



We're building the best trading platforms in the financial markets. We offer an end-to-end ecosystem that provides market insight through advanced real-time alerting, the analytics that traders need to make quick informed decisions and the tools they need to automate their workflows. We build the trading interfaces that provide access to markets across the world through more than 5,000 liquidity destinations. Our complex system handles millions of transactions per day, which are published and mined for real-time analytics and post-trade execution analysis. Clients rely on our advanced technology to power their trading decisions and stay ahead of the markets.

Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities Trading (FICC)



We're the engineers behind the global FICC product that facilitates dealer-to-client trading, liquidity and straight through processing using the Bloomberg terminal. FICC is the primary mechanism by which our buy-side clients source liquidity. Over the last 20 years, we've evolved from selling a simple dealer platform to offering a sophisticated trading platform with an array of trading styles. We build multithreaded and distributed services, which have high transaction rates, and we work on everything from infrastructure design and implementation to database management and user interface development.



Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Polyglot Developer - Trade Ideas
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49120



Trade Ideas' is a leading research and investment platform in a niche market used by high profile customers. It can be used to exchange investment ideas and recommendations in order to demonstrate their stock-picking skills. Our robust set of tools help people to create and share research, estimates and proprietary data in a cost-effective and straightforward way.

This is a unique team in Bloomberg as you will have the opportunity to really get to know your customer base and their needs. This means that you will genuinely have an impact on their workflow and see the tangible difference you make. You will also work closely with your dedicated sales and product teams to ensure you're delivering exactly what is needed.

We're continually developing and improving our offerings, which is where you come in. Our engineering team are looking for a creative, enthusiastic and motivated individual to help design, build, and realise the next iteration of 'Trade Ideas'.

We'll trust you to:

  • Quickly deliver high quality code and effectively roll out new features using an agile methodology;
  • Convert requirements from your business partners into usable product;
  • Help us design and develop a new Microservices architecture as the team continues to move in this direction;
  • Be truly technically agnostic. You should love to identify the right technology for the task at hand.


You should have:

  • Strong knowledge of TypeScript/JavaScript or Python. Both would be fantastic;
  • Proficiency in C++;
  • Strong collaboration skills. You will be working with many people - colleagues, internal Bloomberg clients and external customers.


We'd love to see:

  • That you're comfortable working in an Agile/Scrum environment;
  • Exposure to Test Driven Development;
  • Familiarity with design principles such as DDD and patterns such as Event Sourcing;
  • Familiarity with scripting languages, Bash for example;
  • You're self-motivated with strong teamwork skills and like to "get things done".


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Front End Web Developer - Contractor
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:53033



Here at Bloomberg New Energy Finance (or BNEF for short), we provide leading analysis, tools and data for decision makers making an impact in the energy space. We help clients stay on top of developments via our comprehensive web and mobile based platforms.

Operating with a start-up mentality within the larger enterprise, our responsibility is to develop & deploy cutting-edge software that meets the needs of our high profile customers.
We're seeking a high-energy and talented front-end software engineer with strong technical and programming skills to join our team and help refine and expand our customer-facing web pages. This detail-oriented role involves building website layouts and user interfaces in HTML, CSS/Sass, and AngularJS, including integrating data from various back-end services and databases.

We'll trust you to:

  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices
  • Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
  • Be responsible for maintaining and scaling out the site
  • Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends
  • Cooperate with web designers and product owners to match visual design intent
  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
  • Collaborate within an Agile, multi-disciplinary team
  • Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues


You'll need to have:

  • Strong exposure in web programming
  • Top-notch programming skills and in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS/Sass
  • Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, particularly AngularJS
  • Thorough knowledge of how web applications work including security and session management
  • Knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming and web application development
  • Creative problem solving skills


We'd love to see:

  • Experience working in a Continuous Delivery environment
  • A real passion for standardisation, style guides and process efficiency
  • You can demonstrate a deep understanding with AngularJS 1.X
  • You have familiarity with PHP


If this sounds like you:



Apply if you think you're a good match! We'll get in touch with you to let you know the next steps.

jobs.title: Mobile Developer - Android

Imagine the challenge of helping the worlds finance professionals work from anywhere. Making that all important trading decision walking between meetings. Looking at up-to-date market news whenever they glance at their mobile device, explore in-depth market analysis, or getting instant notifications on critical market moving events. jobs.title: OpenCart Developer - UK/EU Only
jobs.content:
Cyber-Duck is helping our client Sparks Electrical to find an OpenCart developer / code artisan to develop new features and maintain existing ones for several PHP based applications across the group. 


Sparks Electrical is a leading UK independent electrical lighting wholesaler founded in 1998, providing expert advice and professional support to electricians, building contractors, architects, hotels, interior designers, and the general public.


Their office and showroom is based in Holloway Road in Archway N19, North London, and they are looking for a talented developer to help fuel their growth by developing cutting edge features to improve the user experience and conversions of our sites.


This will include developing additional backend connections to our back-office tools for live stock and price updates from our OpenCart-based eCommerce engine, migrating an outdated POS system into a new internal CRM to streamline the order fulfillment process. This will involve developing interfaces to interconnect POS orders, online orders, suppliers invoicing and re-ordering process as well as accounting reports.


Sparks benefits include:



  • Competitive salary

  • Company laptop

  • PHP conferences 

  • Pension scheme

  • And more!



To learn more about Sparks Electrical, please visit https://www.sparksdirect.co.uk

jobs.title: Technical Customer Success Contractor
jobs.content:
At Mixmax, our mission is to do the impossible with email: to make it as rich, interactive, and developer-friendly as the web. We’re looking for a part-time technical customer success contractor, to delight customers and help diagnose and resolve technical issues.

We’re a distributed & international team, so if you’re looking to work with us remotely, we encourage you to apply! And we’re seeking customer success coverage across time zones to support our international user base.

Responsibilities

  • Provide email-based technical support 10+ hours per week — schedule is flexible
  • Communicate with customers to answer product questions and diagnose technical issues
  • Reproduce reported issues, file bugs, and communicate with the engineering team
  • Identify patterns in customer questions and feature requests, to inform our product development process
  • Potential to expand your role on the customer success team to include testing new features and writing user-facing documentation

What are you looking for in a team member?

Your specialization is less important than your ability to learn fast and adapt to shifting technologies. We’re especially fond of people who:

  • Love to experiment with new technology
  • Enjoy analytical thinking and practicing your problem-solving skills
  • Have prior experience in a technical support role for software or hardware products
  • Communicate clearly and effectively, especially in writing
  • Strive to grow personally and professionally, with a really fun and rewarding group of people

jobs.title: Product Designer (Growth)
jobs.content:
Hi there!

We’re looking for a Product Designer to join the design team at Zapier. Want to create meaningful experiences that help people automate their tedious, everyday tasks so they spend less time working extra hours, and more time enjoying what matters most to them? If that sounds exciting to you, keep reading!

We know applying for and taking on a new a job at any company requires a leap of faith. We want you to feel comfortable and excited to apply at Zapier. To help share a bit more about life at Zapier here are a few resources in addition to the job description that can give you an inside look at what life is like at Zapier. Hopefully you’ll take the leap of faith and apply.

  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work
  • Zapier Code of Conduct

About You

You’re a maker. You have a broad range of digital design skills and are always learning more. On a daily basis you might be creating mockups, writing HTML and CSS, collecting design feedback, and iterating on the core Zapier product. Today, Zapier serves over 1 million users, enabling them to connect over 700 apps in more ways than we can count.

You love code. You’re comfortable designing in the browser with HTML and CSS, and you’re not afraid of JS. You’ll be committing your work alongside engineers in our production codebase, so you know enough Git to be productive. If you get stuck, you have no ego when the time comes to ask for help and our engineering team is happy to teach. The frontend of Zapier is primarily built in React which you’ll get introduced to if you’re unfamiliar. We require our designers to write HTML and CSS. If you’re a photoshop only designer stay tuned to the jobs pages. There may be other positions for you.

You design for success. You set your own personal opinions of your designs aside and optimize for what helps the end user of your design best achieve their goal. You design with clarity and success in mind. And you enjoy collaborating with data scientists, user researchers and copywriters to improve the success of your designs.

You design for the web. Your visual style is modern and clean. You’ve built functional web-apps before and understand the ramifications of web-app trends. You spend less time in Sketch than you do in your code editor and browser. You probably spend an equal amount of time with Chrome Dev Tools open as you do closed.

You’re a team player. Your design process may include wireframing, low-fidelity mocking, high-fidelity mocking, and plenty of user testing along the way. You don’t “toss designs over the wall”, and would dread doing so. Instead, you work closely with engineering, copywriters, customers and other stakeholders to implement your designs, and maintain the implementation of each and every detail, no matter how small it might seem.

You can prioritize the multiple projects on your plate. We’re a small team, and there’s no shortage of things you could be doing in a day. But you’re a pro at prioritizing your work. You’re comfortable communicating with your team, and when something is blocking you, you aren’t shy about reaching out to fellow teammates to get back up and running as quickly as possible.

You wear many hats. You love working with customers and teammates to help understand customer needs and generate a product spec. You enjoy turning that spec into reality. You understand the complexities your design might introduce, and can clearly work through them with your teammates.

You love doing things efficiently. At Zapier, the work you do will have a disproportionate impact on the business. We believe in systems and processes that let us scale our impact to be larger than ourselves.

You’re resourceful. Once we’ve established a shared set of goals, you set your own course and start exploring ideas. At Zapier, you’ll have a weekly project meeting and then you go make things happen. You default to action. You reach out to teammates to learn more about your project, and start collecting feedback as soon, and as often as possible.

Things You Might Do

  • Continuously iterate on designs and optimize for specific goals, like increasing MRR and conversion rates
  • Help conduct A/B tests and other experiments to guide future design iterations
  • Implement your designs in HTML, CSS, and some JS
  • Create marketing assets and launch landing pages
  • Work and ship product independently
  • Give back to the community via open source and blog posts
  • Help customers via support to ensure they have the best experience possible
  • Ship to thousands of active users every day

The Whole Package

Location: Planet Earth

If you want to work remote, that’s cool. If you want to work near others, that’s cool too! The current product and design teams are located in Georgia, Illinois, California, Colorado, Ohio, Michigan, Missouri, New York, Canada, and the UK.

Compensation:

  • Competitive salary (we don’t use remote as an excuse to pay less)
  • Great healthcare + dental + vision coverage
  • Retirement plan with 4% company match
  • Profit sharing
  • 2 annual company retreats to awesome places
  • 14 weeks paid leave for new parents

Pick your own equipment. We’ll set you up with whatever laptop + monitor combo you want plus any software you need.

Unlimited vacation policy (plus we insist you take at least 2 weeks off each year – this isn’t a vague policy where unlimited vacation means no vacation). Work-life balance is really important to everyone at Zapier – we believe it and practice it!

Work with awesome companies around the world. We partner with the best software companies in the world and you’ll constantly get to interact with people from these great companies.

How To Apply

We have a non-standard application process. Creativity is certainly encouraged. To jump start the process we ask a few questions we normally would ask at the start of an interview. This helps speed up the process and lets us get to know you a bit better right out the gate. Make sure to answer each question, and include all requested resources in order for your application to be considered. Have fun with them.

Complete this form with the answers to the below questions.

  1. Tell us why you’d be a good fit for this role.
  2. Share links to sites that showcase your professional works (GitHub, LinkedIn, Twitter, Personal Site, etc). We want to see at least one live-on-the-internet product you’ve designed and built, and an online portfolio of visual design work.
  3. Tell me about a time you worked on a project designed to increase conversion rates or usage of a specific feature. What was the process, who did you collaborate with, and what was the outcome? Make sure to include sketches, wireframes, mockups, screenshots, and narrative to effectively describe your design process towards designing and building this feature.
  4. Look at this list and pick the 10 things that most excite you. Also pick the 10 things that least excite you. Don’t pick by your opinion of importance, this is mostly to see interest/experience.
  5. Optional: Share anonymously some demographic information about yourself to help us better track trends related to the backgrounds of candidates interested in working at Zapier in order for us to build a team that represents the users at Zapier and the broader world population.

Finally, wait for us to reply. We reply to everyone, even if we don’t seem like a good fit.

jobs.title: Growth Product Manager
jobs.content:
Hi there!

We’re looking for a Growth Product Manager to join the product team at Zapier. Interested in helping grow a product that helps the world automate their work so they can get back to living? Then read on…

We know applying for and taking on a new a job at any company requires a leap of faith. We want you to feel comfortable and excited to apply at Zapier. To help share a bit more about life at Zapier here are a few resources in addition to the job description that can give you an inside look at what life is like at Zapier. Hopefully you’ll take the leap of faith and apply.

  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work
  • Zapier Code of Conduct

About You

You are a maker. On a daily basis you’ll help plan, coordinate, communicate, design, mock, test, and iterate to grow Zapier. Today, Zapier serves over 1M+ users, enabling them to connect 500+ apps and we’re just getting started.

You have grown products before. A core part of this role is growing Zapier. Alongside a small team, you’ll set and execute on a roadmap of growth projects that impact key metrics like revenue, signups, churn, and more.

You are technical. Whether you were an engineer in a previous life or you code in your spare time, you’ll drive technical projects and be responsible for delivering simple user experiences. You thrive at abstracting away complexity and love delivering a joyful, easy-to-use experience to each customer so they can succeed at using the product.

You are a skilled written communicator. Zapier is a 100% remote team and writing is our primary means of communication. You’ll use summaries and reports to communicate findings, objectives and plans to the team. You’re also help manage the day-to-day cadence of projects in our team’s Slack channels.

You are good at saying no. There’s plenty of projects you could be doing at Zapier, but you’ve gotten good at saying no to good ideas and only focusing on the great ideas. You’re comfortable setting and communicating project timelines with your immediate project teams and working to scale scope to meet deadlines.

You’re willing to do and learn anything. You’ll be primarily working on small fluid project teams with designers, engineers, marketers, and data scientists. You don’t need to be an expert in those things you but you should have a basic grasp of their roles and what they bring to the table. You’ll act as the glue to fill in any skill gaps.

You love talking to users. User experience is key to Zapier’s success. Product Managers at Zapier are two-sided. One side is figuring out what we should build next. The other side is making it happen. Talking to users serves both sides and is especially important to growing the user experience alongside key business goals.

You design for the web. You’ve helped build functional web-apps before. You probably spend an equal amount of time with Chrome Dev Tools open as you do closed. You have likely built and deployed a basic web app using something like Heroku.

You are data driven. A/B testing and optimizing conversion rates are your mantras. You’re comfortable with SQL queries. You understand statistical significance. You use this data to prioritize projects to achieve business results.

You love doing things efficiently. At Zapier, the work you do will have a disproportionate impact on the business. We believe in systems and processes that let us scale our impact to be larger than ourselves.

You love to set your own course with our shared set of goals. At Zapier, you’ll have a weekly project meetings and then you go make things happen. You default to action.

Things You Might Do

Zapier is a startup, so you’ll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. Here are some things you’ll get a taste of:

  • Talk to users and figure out what we should build or optimize next
  • Set and execute a roadmap of growth projects alongside a small team
  • Understand the technical architecture of Zapier so you can make good product decisions
  • Conduct A/B tests and other experiments
  • Write HTML, CSS, and maybe JS to help perfect and ship a feature
  • Ship to hundreds of thousands of active users
  • Maintain a high level of autonomy
  • Give back to the community via open source and blog posts
  • Help customers via support to ensure they have the best experience possible
  • Experiment: this is a startup so you’ll have the opportunity to wear many hats

The Whole Package

Location: Planet Earth.

If you want to work remote, that’s great. If you want to work near others, that’s cool too. Our team is distributed because it lets us work with the best people. You don’t have to be located in the USA either. Some of the team live in the United Kingdom, Thailand, New Zealand and Australia. You just have to be talented!

Compensation:

  • Competitive salary (we don’t use remote as an excuse to pay less)
  • Great healthcare + dental + vision coverage
  • Retirement plan with 4% company match
  • Profit sharing
  • 2 annual company retreats to awesome places
  • 14 weeks paid leave for new parents

Pick your own equipment. We’ll set you up with whatever laptop + monitor combo you want plus any software you need.

Unlimited vacation policy (plus we insist you take at least 2 weeks off each year – this isn’t a vague policy where unlimited vacation means no vacation). Work-life balance is really important to everyone at Zapier – we believe it and practice it!

Work with awesome companies around the world. We partner with great software companies all over the world and you’ll constantly get to interact with people from these great companies.

How to Apply

We have a non-standard application process. Creativity is certainly encouraged. To jump start the process we ask a few questions we normally would ask at the start of an interview. This helps speed up the process and lets us get to know you a bit better right out the gate. Make sure to answer each question. Have fun with them.

Complete this form with answers to the below questions

  1. Why will you be a good fit for this role?
  2. Share links to sites that showcase your professional works (GitHub, LinkedIn, Twitter, Personal Site, etc). We want to see at least one live-on-the-internet product you’ve built.
  3. Briefly detail two growth projects you’ve worked on that represent your best work. Share your role and overall results for each.
  4. When working on growth projects, what metrics do you like to pay attention to and why?
  5. How have you balanced growth with user experience in past projects?
  6. The goal of these pages is to convert signups. Create a couple wireframe redesigns of that page that you’d like to A/B test to see if they increase signups. Explain why you think each version might work.
  7. Optional: Share anonymously some demographic information about yourself to help us better track trends related to the backgrounds of candidates interested in working at Zapier in order for us to build a team that represents the users at Zapier and the broader world population.

Finally, wait for us to reply. We reply to everyone, even if we don’t seem like a good fit.

Zapier is an equal opportunity employer. We’re excited to work with talented and empathetic people no matter their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, physical or mental disability, or age. Our code of conduct provides a beacon for the kind of company we strive to be and we celebrate our differences because those differences are what allow us to make a product that serves a global user base.

jobs.title: AWS Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
Position Summary
The Higher Logic platform resides within Amazon Web Services (AWS). The Operations Engineer is responsible for managing the AWS environment and implementing best practices.


Major Responsibilities 



  • Implement and manage continuous delivery systems and methodologies 

  • Understand, implement and automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation 

  • Define and deploy monitoring, metrics, and logging systems 

  • Implement systems that are highly available, scalable, and self-healing 

  • Design, manage and maintain tools to automate operational processes

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer, Analytics
jobs.content:
As a software engineer in analytics team at Celtra, you will build, maintain and improve all parts of our data processing pipeline, processing 2B+ analytics events per day, producing insights used by top brands, publishers and agencies.


Why you should care


We are not your typical "Ad tech" company. We were one of the early adopters of Apache Spark. (use in production since 0.5, long before it became well known), one of the first three companies to start using Databricks and are early adopters of SnowflakeDB, a new cloud data warehouse. Also, we are looking into streaming solutions (Kinesis). We’re constantly re-evaluating our technical infrastructure to deliver faster, better, and more reliable software.


We use Scala for ad serving and data processing and PHP for REST API.


What we’re looking for


You care about proper engineering and clean code. You write consistently high-quality, maintainable code and are aware of industry best practices and trends. You proactively identify and clean up technical debt before it turns into a long-term problem and encourage others to do the same.


Your code runs in production somewhere. You have production experience with some of the parts of our stack: AWS, Spark/Akka, Scala, MySQL, DynamoDB, Snowflake, etc. and for the parts you don’t, you are excited to learn.


You have something to teach us. You have had exposure to other big data technologies that we do not use in production. Whether it be streaming solutions (Kinesis, Kafka, Storm, Samza) or storage/databases (Vertica, Teradata, Redshift, BigQuery), we go by saying: “Be conservative in what you use, be liberal in what you learn.”


You own what you do. You have owned larger parts of codebase before and have had the phone ring on you because something went wrong.


What a great candidate looks like



  • Experience with AWS or another cloud computing platform

  • Good knowledge of Scala or knowledge of Java with interest in functional programming

  • JVM ecosystem experience

  • Exposure to Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Vertica, Teradata or other MPP columnar databases

  • Experience in analyzing and manipulating complex, high dimensionality data sets using tools such as Spark, Pig, Hive (or other Hadoop tools)

  • Strong SQL experience


Nice to have



  • Open-source involvement


Our culture



  • We care about product, company and its people.

  • We believe in high standards and long term code quality.

  • We ship. Features and fixes are deployed weekly.

  • We believe in an open and proactive culture where engineers are expected to learn and contribute in ways outside the usual coding assignments.


We take good care of our people. This is what we offer



  • Receive a highly competitive base salary, benefits and quarterly bonuses for performance.

  • Enjoy a generous education budget for conferences, classes, literature or studies.

  • Choose your equipment.

  • Work in our cosy office in San Francisco, CA.

  • Our fridge is always full and we drink the best coffee.

  • Travel between US and Europe.

  • Not from around here? No problem: If you are the right person, we are more than willing to help you relocate.

jobs.title: Sitecore Ontwikkelaar
jobs.content:
CZ heeft een openstaande vacature voor de functie van:


Sitecore Ontwikkelaar


Tilburg, 38 uur



Wat ga je doen als Sitecore Ontwikkelaar?
Binnen onze eigen ontwikkelafdeling wordt gewerkt met de nieuwste technologieën en moderne ontwikkelmethodes. Als senior ontwikkelaar ben je in staat om onder druk functionele specificaties te vertalen naar kwalitatief hoge technische oplossingen binnen de CZ architectuur. Om tot de meest efficiënte oplossing te komen, maak je een gedegen afweging tussen het gebruik van standaardcomponenten en maatwerk. Je bent als Sitecore Ontwikkelaar verantwoordelijk voor de realisatie van functionaliteit samen met je collega's in een multidisciplinair team. De laatste ontwikkelingen binnen het vakgebied, specifiek op het gebied van softwareontwikkeling, volg je op de voet door het lezen van vakliteratuur, actief te zijn in blogs, conferenties te bezoeken of door het volgen van training.

jobs.title: Microsoft Dynamics Specialist
jobs.content:
CZ heeft een openstaande vacature voor de functie van:


Microsoft Dynamics Specialist



Tilburg, 38 uur


Wat ga je doen als Microsoft Dynamics Specialist?
Je werkt in een multidisciplinair team, met veel verantwoordelijkheid en je staat stevig genoeg in je schoenen om de klant te bewegen naar de standaard CRM - functionaliteit. Mocht er toch maatwerk noodzakelijk zijn dan draai je daar je hand niet voor om. Qua techniek: Microsoft Dynamics beheers je als geen ander, je kunt business logica, integraties en rapportages ontwikkelen in Javascript, SSIS en/of .Net. Daarnaast bedenk en neem je graag de verantwoordelijkheid voor de technische (CRM) architectuur en draagt dit binnen je team en omgeving uit.

Ben jij de Microsoft Dynamics Specialist die we zoeken?
Drie komma vijf miljoen Nederlanders zijn voor zorg verzekerd bij CZ. Zo, dan weet je meteen wat het belang is van werken voor 1 van de grootste zorgverzekeraars van Nederland. Een verzekeraar die opereert in een zeer dynamische markt die altijd onderhevig is aan tal van ontwikkelingen. En dan begrijp je ook waarom ICT de kurk is waarop onze organisatie drijft. We werken bij CZ agile, in scrum teams, met de nieuwste technologieën.

Innovatie volgen we op de voet: eens in de maand nemen we tijdens Innovation Friday de laatste stand van zaken door. Waar kunnen we bestaande processen of systemen nog verbeteren? Daarom werken we bij voorkeur met collega’s die echt niet van vastroesten houden. In het bijzonder binnen de afdeling Software en Services. Het is de afdeling die de wensen van onze business vertaalt in pasklare ICT-oplossingen. Als MS Dynamics CRM Specialist heb je een spilfunctie op de afdeling.

Aantal werkuren en salaris
Het gemiddeld aantal werkuren ligt op 38 per week. Het bruto jaarsalaris is marktconform. Daarbij ontvang je 8% vakantiegeld en 8,5% eindejaarsuitkering. De secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn een zeer interessante aanvulling op je basissalaris. Onder andere op het gebied van persoonlijke ontwikkeling en opleiding steekt CZ met kop en schouders boven het reguliere werkveld uit.

Afhankelijk van opleiding en ervaring kan een aanloopschaal van toepassing zijn.

jobs.title: Senior Software Development Engineer, Java Services and APIs Team
jobs.content:
About The Team:

The Platform group owns tools, frameworks and services that enables other development teams within the organization to build and ship software quickly and with a high bar of engineering excellence. This team builds awesome frameworks that development teams use to rapidly develop new experiences. We provide processes that keep our teams unblocked and highly productive but we do so in a way that’s much more exciting than this sentence. We listen to our customers and the tech industry and it’s our responsibility to push Audible into new places; wherever our customers are listening. That’s really an excuse to experiment with things like adaptive streaming, home automation, wearables or even the Raspberry Pi.



This opportunity specifically is on the services team within the Platform group. This team is building a 3rd party API that is being used internally and externally. We build the APIs that enable all Audible listening experiences whether through our apps, or externally. We are also evangelists for our API and work with business development and through events like external hackathons. We also build frameworks for other Audible teams to enhance productivity and scalability. Globally! We need your help to develop and deliver on this vision in an iterative manner. Success means we lay the foundation for continued expansion of our company without disrupting an already tremendously successful and much loved product.



About The Role:

As an engineer on our team you'll be expected to write great code, execute on your ideas, challenge the status quo and generally make things better. You'll need the soft-skills too; Communication, influence and passion are key to the success of the team and ultimately the company. You'll experience all the challenges, ambiguity and opportunities of a new team with a new mission.



How does Amazon fit in?

We're a part of Amazon, they are our parent company and it's a great partnership. You'll get to play with all of Amazon's technologies like EC2, SQS and S3 but it doesn't stop there. Audible's built on Amazon technology and you'll have insight into the inner workings of the world's leading ecommerce experience. There's a LOT to learn! Your career will benefit from working with teams like Kindle, A9, P13N and many more.



If you want to own and solve problems, work with a creative dynamic team, fail fast in a supportive environment whilst growing your career and working on high volume (2000+ tps) services that support millions of customers worldwide we want to hear from you.



As engineers we like specifics so here's some of the standard info:

  • Own key components within our platform. Owning means envisioning, designing, creating, building and supporting. These services need to operate with a high degree of operational excellence (we measure EVERYTHING).

  • Support our developers. Support means be the go-to-person for questions but never be a bottle-neck, see around the corner and anticipate developers' needs, host brown bags, knowledge-transfer sessions and generally evangelize the platform.

  • Partner with product management to imagine, design, develop, test, and launch software that wows our community and inspires our peers.

  • Be willing to explore and learn un-prompted. Bring problems AND solutions to the table.

  • Lead the way - Lead means staying up to date with tools, trends, technologies and frameworks both industry-wide and within Amazon and then sharing that knowledge in a meaningful way with the community.





Benefits:

We have a comprehensive benefits package but here are some of the fun perks:




  • Free catered lunch daily, breakfast on Mondays, all the snacks you can eat and Happy Hour on a Friday

  • Free onsite gym and 25% fitness reimbursement

  • Ruthless ping-pong tournaments and seasonal sports clubs - volleyball, basketball, soccer, etc.

  • Endless company sponsored events

  • Transit reimbursement, paid parking and shuttle service

  • Tuition assistance

  • Annual Amazon discount

  • Access to Amazon Web Services and much more...





Audible is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer-Minority/ Female/ Disability/ Vet

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
As a Front End Developer at Sparx, you’ll be integral to the team from day one, helping to make decisions, shaping team objectives and driving both your own and the rest of the team’s technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be involved in the development of the core technical framework of our web and tablet- based system and constantly push its evolution. You’ll work with all members of the team – from data scientists to content developers – to find solutions to the most challenging problems we face when building a system of this scale.


You’ll be involved in designing and creating the key front end components used by students, teachers and content creators, using cutting edge web technologies to create first class user experiences. You’ll also have the opportunity to dive into the backend server code and databases, working on our full web stack.


Our technology stack is constantly evolving as we pick the right tools for the job, but you should expect to be working with web, server and native technologies such as Angular, React, Redux, Immutable.js, Pixi.js, Less, Django, Nginx, Postgres, Sqlite and RabbitMQ, in languages including Javascript, Python, Objective C, C++ and Lua, on iOS, Linux (Debian) and OS X platforms.

jobs.title: Graduate Developer
jobs.content:
As a Graduate Developer at Sparx, you’ll be an integral part of the team from day one, forming the heart of our technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be joining our team of games and software developers, supporting the development of the technical framework of the Sparx system. You’ll get to see software you’ve helped program go live in a classroom the next day. Then you’ll be diving straight back in to making it better, getting into the detail, zooming out to look at the bigger picture, solving each problem and trying out the next idea.


If gaming is more your thing, you’ll be supporting the designing, programming and testing of high quality games for a variety of subjects. The games you help create will need to get under the skin of what makes students tick and, working closely with the expert team around you, uncover exactly what is going to help them overcome each obstacle in understanding that they face.


Things happen at breakneck speed at Sparx and you’ll need to think creatively to help the team get from A to B. Our work is ever evolving so you’ll have plenty of opportunities to make your mark and take on increasing responsibility as time goes on.


Our technology stack is constantly evolving as we pick the right tools for the job, but you should expect to be working with web, server and native technologies such as Angular, React, Redux, Immutable.js, Pixi.js, Less, Django, Nginx, Postgres, Sqlite and RabbitMQ, in languages including Javascript, Python, Objective C, C++ and Lua, on iOS, Linux (Debian) and OS X platforms.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Software Developer at Sparx, you’ll be integral to the team from day one, helping to make decisions, shaping team objectives and driving both your own and the rest of the team’s technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be involved in the development of the core technical framework of our web and tablet- based system and constantly push its evolution. You’ll work with all members of the team – from data scientists to content developers – to find solutions to the most challenging problems we face when building a system of this scale.


You’ll be responsible for designing and implementing components for the Sparx system, writing robust, reusable code that focuses on usability, scalability and innovation. Program it how you want, see how it works in a classroom the very next day and you’ll get instant feedback to be able to dive straight back in to make it even better.


Our technology stack is constantly evolving as we pick the right tools for the job, but you should expect to be working with web, server and native technologies such as Angular, React, Redux, Immutable.js, Pixi.js, Less, Django, Nginx, Postgres, Sqlite and RabbitMQ, in languages including Javascript, Python, Objective C, C++ and Lua, on iOS, Linux (Debian) and OS X platforms.

jobs.title: Freelance Drupal Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: New York, NY
URL: http://www.barrelny.com

Barrel is an interactive agency based in New York City that partners with clients to deliver best-in-class design and technology solutions. We work primarily with healthy lifestyle brands to create impactful digital experiences to help our clients grow their businesses.

We are seeking a freelance Drupal web developer to work on a per-project basis. We will brief you on the project requirements and negotiate on a project fee. You will become a part of a project team and collaborate closely throughout the development, QA, and post-launch phases of the project.

This is a remote position but you are also welcome to work out of our office. We communicate through various video, chat, and project management tools and you must be available through these channels throughout the day.

Requirements
  • Previous experience working with an agency
  • Working knowledge of git version control system
  • Working knowledge of node-based gulp workflows
  • Intimate knowledge of Drupal theming
  • Ability to expertly and professionally continue development of an existing project
  • Familiar with interpreting and viewing Sketch files and Invisionapp
  • Familiar with JIRA issue-tracking software
  • Willingness to work with existing processes for git (branching and merge requests), JIRA (bug fixes, undocumented or missing specs), and QA (manual testing)
  • Familiar with remote communication tools such as Basecamp, Google Docs, Screenhero, Slack and/or HipChat
  • Responds in a timely manner (1-3 hours) to requests via communication channels
  • Advanced front-end development experience, having taken complex designs and making cross-browser compatible, mobile-friendly websites
  • An understanding of current SEO best practices
  • A working knowledge of performance optimization strategies and their importance (such as caching, asset minification, CDNs, etc.)
  • A good sense of design and an eye for the details
  • Excellent written and verbal professional communication skills
  • A high level of self-management and organizational skills

To apply: If you’re interested and meet the above requirements, please send your resume and a link to your portfolio or sample projects on GitHub to jobs@barrelny.com. We are looking to select a developer immediately. Please apply only if you have immediate availability.

jobs.title: Back End Developer
jobs.content:
ROLE: Back End (Dev Ops) Engineer



LOCATION: London, UK





 



OUR MISSION: Import.io is on a mission to free the data from the world's web sites. Web sites are great for us humans so long as we like viewing the data in situ. Imagine the possibilities if that data were available in an easily manipulated form such as a spreadsheet, csv or json format? What if you could schedule regular data exports? What if you could access it all via APIs? At import.io we care passionately about making that vision a reality. We want everyone to be able to access data painlessly not to mention making life easy for machines also. Import.io is an exciting business with an aggressive roadmap, demanding customers and an amazing team.



NOBODY KNOWS DATA LIKE WE DO:  Billions of data points pass through our platform every day. And when all that data gets fed to our algorithms, something magical happens; we machine read the web.



AMAZING PLACES, AMAZING PEOPLE: On the product side, we've assembled a crack team of engineers, data scientists and product gurus whilst our GTM team are client centric, driven and passionate about working to understand and meet the needs of our users. You'll find us in San Francisco and London, working hard to bring you the next big thing in data.



THE ROLE:  Working within our backend development team, you will be responsible for the implementation and well-being of our mission critical infrastructure. You'll work well within a dynamic and collaborative team, and be passionate about coding, scalable architectures and technical innovation.  



Key areas of focus:



Resilience, availability and operability



Security, user management, data management, monitoring and alerts



Crawling, data extraction, proxies, IP pools and anti-scraping technology



Capacity management, scheduling, dynamic and pre-emptive scaling



Instrumentation, CI, automated testing, responsive, agile, devops





 



RESPONSIBILITIES:



Design and implementation of distributed self-healing and fault-tolerant systems



Reviewing, measuring and selecting new technologies



Optimization and automation of key platform components



Ensuring our products are secured using best practises and effectively monitored



Placing within the products the instrumentation required to ensure timely and responsive resolution of issues both during development and on operational platforms



Capturing and sharing knowledge within the team, within the business and beyond



Rotored out-of-hours emergency operational support. Engineering's responsibility doesn't stop with the last commit. We own our technology throughout its lifecycle.





 



ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE & KNOWLEDGE:



The implementation of micro service based solution on AWS using J2EE



Experience of using Docker as a container platform



In-depth knowledge of configuring and managing Linux platforms.



Experience tuning Java applications



Team player who can have fun working hard









 



DESIRED EXPERIENCE & KNOWLEDGE



Experience of CI tools and familiarity with the CD methodology



Extensive experience as a DevOps or Systems Engineer within AWS.



Python scripting



Scrum



NEED MORE REASON TO JOIN THE TEAM? HOW ABOUT THIS....



Great location - With UK offices on London's Old Street, and US offices in San Francisco and San Jose, we are in the heart of the technology scene in both the US and Europe.



Great people - We've assembled an incredibly diverse, talented and spirited team who genuinely enjoy coming to work everyday.



Challenges - The freedom to grow and define your own role so you can leave work every day knowing you've made a difference in an area of technology that is just about to explode!



Learning on the job - Investigating new technologies is always encouraged



Healthcare - You get coverage for medical, dental, and vision insurance.



A share in the company - All employees are eligible to participate in our stock option scheme

jobs.title: Software Development Java EE for people and car access solutions
jobs.content:
The fact that you’re joining a worldclass
company is not all that unusual.
But finding that start-up spirit still alive at
SKIDATA may well come as a surprise.


This global leader in access solutions is seeking an experienced programming talent (m/f) for


Software Development Java EE


The technology behind our turnstile gates and access readers perhaps comes as a revelation, but it is already working efficiently in over 100 countries – for example, in ski resorts, airports, stadiums and theme parks.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES


You plan and develop Java Enterprise applications and services. In doing so you work with software teams around the world – in Austria, France, India and the USA.


WE SURPRISE WITH

  • Freedom that motivates

  • An international team of specialists

  • The attraction of an international market leader

  • Good development opportunities

  • Global prospects

jobs.title: Product designer
jobs.content: Ritual is hiring a Product designer in Toronto

jobs.title: Creative Thinker
jobs.content:
Horizon is fun, challenging, fast-paced and exciting. We have no shortage of interesting and challenging software problems that need solving. While many of our software stacks include Python, we are not set on any one framework or development stack and are eager to expand our own technological horizons within the FOSS community. Our development process most closely resembles an Agile approach. 


We are looking for an experienced, hard working, and friendly developer to join our talented team at Horizon Investments in Charlotte, NC.  Our office environment is emblematic of a growing business. While working remotely does occur here on occasion, we believe that earnest face-to-face conversation is often required to collaborate and solve hard challenges. As such, this is a full-time, on-site role. 


Flexible work hours are available.

jobs.title: Full stack software engineers for varied projects with expanding consultancy
jobs.content:
Zuhlke is a European software engineering consultancy that helps businesses turn ideas into reality. We need people who are capable, talented, and engaged to help build systems for our clients, based mainly in our expanding Manchester office. We take on interesting projects in many domains, including media, finance, heavy engineering, and medical devices.


Your job will involve working closely with clients to develop, test, and ship software that meets their needs. You will be looking both to contribute to the company and to grow personally.


Our reputation is fundamental to our business, so our culture emphasizes quality, reliability and respect. As a privately-held company owned by past and present employees, and run by engineers, Zuhlke takes a long-term view. For example, you will receive twenty days training per year, including a budget to support activities such as conference attendance, our annual technical camp, and participation in focused topic teams. We like our staff to be technically flexible so, if you don’t have a required skill now, we can support you learning it.


Your job will include:



  • Helping our clients understand what they really need

  • Building quality systems to satisfy those needs

  • Working collaboratively with colleagues and clients

  • Keeping technically sharp

  • Getting things done

  • Sometimes travelling to other locations in the UK and mainland Europe


You will benefit from:



  • A generous allowance for training (9% of your time and a budget)

  • An achievement-based career path where you can gain responsibility while remaining technical

  • A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package


Our work is mainly at or within an hour's travel from our Central Manchester office.


If this appeals, then please get in touch.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.
