With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

We have a lot of exciting things to do, and we’re looking for the right people to grow with us!

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN

Working at GitHub is, to put it simply, a special slice of the universe. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique perspective, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed physical workspaces around that encourages you to work as you work best. Right now, over 60% of our employees are based outside of our San Francisco (SOMA) headquarters and work according to how they get their best stuff done.

Ensuring that GitHubbers are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how GitHub stays awesome. Part of this is ensuring that our benefits* are out of this world.

In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people with many different backgrounds and lifestyles, and we like it that way. We invite applications from people of all stripes. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences that people imagine to discriminate against one another. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate.

*Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask your recruiter!

jobs.title: Enterprise Support Agent - North America (Remote)
jobs.content:
More and more companies are using GitHub Enterprise, so the support team is growing. When our customers have problems, they contact us and it is our goal to help them as quickly and awesomely as possible. This person will join GitHub as part of our global support team and support our customers around the world. We're looking for Enterprise Support Agents in North America (US and Canada) who will answer incoming phone calls, triage issues, and help provide solutions.

The position reports to an Enterprise Support Manager and works closely with other teams and leaders across the company.

GitHub works remotely and asynchronously as much as possible. While this role does not require you to live near our office, it will require some travel to meet with co-workers or attend company events.

Responsibilities:

  • Take in-bound phone support requests
  • Triage incoming support tickets
  • Work collaboratively with other support teams
  • Manage communication around customer tickets
  • Troubleshoot and help solve highly complex support tickets
  • Escalate issues to other support engineers and managers as applicable
  • Work with our Engineering team to prioritize issues and development
  • Work with our Documentation team to improve customer-facing resources

Qualifications:

  • Must have current working authorization to work in the U.S.
  • Knowledge of Linux servers
  • General understanding of how modern web applications work
  • Enthusiasm for working directly with customers
  • Ability to clearly write and orally communicate technical information
  • Ability to review and understand code (Ruby / Bash)
  • Must have a workspace conducive to answering phone calls
  • Prior experience providing technical support
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Strong empathy for GitHub users and GitHub Support

Bonus points if you have:

  • Technical experience (QA, documentation, systems administration, etc.)
  • Familiarity with Git and GitHub

jobs.title: Business Systems Analyst - Financial Systems
jobs.content:
GitHub is looking for a full-time Financial Systems Analyst to join our new Business Systems team to manage, scale, and expand our Financial systems and technology.

The Business Systems Team is a new addition to GitHub that's developing new ideas to help scale the company as it moves to the next level. Tasked with the exciting challenges of the growing company, you will be expected to find new capabilities, recommend best practices to our business parters, recommend business systems of choice, and drive their implementations and integration.

The Role

GitHub is the gateway for software development. Our impact and customers are global, and so is our vision. We're looking for someone who will materially advance our business and culture.

Your role will be the administrator and gate-keeper of our Financial Systems, assist in building out our vision for business systems including business process designs, system implementations, project management, change management, training and information security compliance. We are ever-evolving and improving so you will be on the lookout for ways to enhance our internal processes and how to impact those improvements in our systems.

You'll partner with other awesome teams here at GitHub, such as Finance (Accounting and Strategic Finance), Product, Sales, Marketing and Engineering to transform their challenges into systems-driven solutions. Collectively, we're a resourceful bunch that enjoys mastering new and sometimes difficult subject matters, strives for efficient and effective processes, and works both independently and as part of a goal-oriented team.

Our primary customers are our internal business partners. We like to make sure they are set up to be successful by assisting in general change management during the introduction of process or system changes. Training and documentation is key though we're tactful in how we roll these out to keep us all nimble and focused on executing.

This position is based in our San Francisco office and reports to the Business Systems Manager, Financial Systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Administer, design, and scale our Record-2-Report and Procure-2-Pay processes and systems (GL, PO, AP, AM, RevRec, Financial Reports)

  • Assist to build business systems roadmap to include business process design, system implementations, project management, change management, training and information security compliance

  • Build cross-functional partnerships in order to translate business requirements into systems-driven solutions

  • Support continuous improvement and evaluate impact and prioritization of individual projects

  • Document end-2-end business processes, maintain best practices, procedures, and controls established within the internal financial reporting systems

  • Collaborate with leadership across all functions to drive decisions and execution plan

  • Maintain professional knowledge and skill relating to security, compliance, technology and best practices and make recommendations for process or service improvements, cost reductions and efficiencies

  • Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 2-3 years of work experience in Financial or related systems administration

  • Experience working with Netsuite, Zuora, CallidusCloud, SFDC, or Coupa

  • Proven track record of cross functional collaboration

  • Knowledge of financial reports (balance sheet, income statement, cashflow)

  • Ability to work in a dynamic, ever-changing environment with some ambiguity and a need for directing energy and thinking

  • Excellent written and oral communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills

  • Self-starter and ability to multi-task while performing a variety of complex tasks

About GitHub

WHO WE ARE

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over ten million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

We have a lot of exciting things to do, and we’re looking for the right people to grow with us!

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN

Working at GitHub is, to put it simply, a special slice of the universe. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique perspective, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed physical workspaces around that encourages you to work as you work best. Right now, over 60% of our employees are based outside of our San Francisco (SOMA) headquarters and work according to how they get their best stuff done.

Ensuring that GitHubbers are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how GitHub stays awesome. Part of this is ensuring that our benefits* are out of this world.

In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people with many different backgrounds and lifestyles, and we like it that way. We invite applications from people of all stripes. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences that people imagine to discriminate against one another. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate.

*Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask your recruiter!

jobs.title: Communications Program Manager
jobs.content:
GitHub believes that healthy internal communications is a critical part of being an awesome place to work. The internal comms team creates and maintains communication channels that enable Hubbers to talk about their work, engage and collaborate with each other, understand and live our values and culture, and be a part of our Hubber community. We’re looking for a program manager to join us in our mission.

As a program manager on the internal comms team, you bring event, video production, and/or project management skills to operationalize and execute on our recurring internal comms programs. You’re outstandingly organized and love making order out of chaos. Spreadsheets, schedules, and to-do lists are your tools of the trade. Your creative flair, supernatural ability to predict logistical needs, and project management skills help you succeed in this role.

You thrive on working with others across business functions and timezones, and you’re comfortable in a multi-tasked, high-energy environment. This role is based in San Francisco with periodic travel opportunities.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work with the internal communications lead to develop the vision, goals, and strategy for our recurring internal programs (video shows and in-person events)

  • Oversee program production, helping to corral content development, AV production, vendor management, logistics, invitations, and more

  • Oversee program execution to ensure Hubbers, whether they’re attending in person or remotely over livestream, receive valuable information and have a great experience

  • Use analytical skills to conduct post-event reporting to measure our programs for effectiveness and health

  • Provide advisory support to help operationalize internal programs run by other teams (e.g., creating templates and runbook for weekly Engineering All Hands)

  • Operationalize the way the internal comms team deals with requests for help/service, providing other teams with an easy way to track their requests

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • 3+ years of professional experience in event, project, or program management

  • A diplomat and mentor. You’ve got a track record of motivating successful teams with positive-minded leadership. You develop and carefully maintain productive working relationships with Hubbers and vendors. You understand the abilities and needs of the team to deliver amazing program experiences that combine our full efforts.

  • Grace under fire. You've got the guts and calm mindset to make decisive calls that solve problems when stuff breaks, the power goes out, or plans have to be rewritten on the spot.

  • Advanced degree in cat-herding. You communicate effectively with partners, leaders, vendors, and a wide range of Hubbers. You excel at managing stakeholder expectations, and you’re skilled at sharing detailed event logistics with others in any medium.

  • Highly organized and skilled at juggling. You’re highly organized and self-motivated, able to oversee timely and first-rate execution under pressure. You can effectively handle multiple interdependent projects while staying under deadline.

  • Smart with technology and the web. You always know the best tips and tricks when collaborating online or you’ve taught yourself basic HTML and CSS.

  • Constant self-improvement. You’re always seeking ways to grow. You’re unafraid of constructive criticism, and committed to finding ways to enhance your strengths or work out your weak points.

  • Positive and collaborative mindset. You naturally seek solutions. You’re great at working with others, and you’re skilled at bringing people from different functions together to do great work.

  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States

BONUS  IF YOU HAVE:

  • Experience in communications

  • Experience working with video production teams

  • Experience with remote communications or working on highly distributed teams

  • Experience working in an engineering/developer-centric culture

  • Experience using GitHub

WHO WE ARE

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over ten million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

We have a lot of exciting things to do, and we’re looking for the right people to grow with us!

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN

Working at GitHub is, to put it simply, a special slice of the universe. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique perspective, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed physical workspaces around that encourages you to work as you work best. Right now, over 60% of our employees are based outside of our San Francisco (SOMA) headquarters and work according to how they get their best stuff done.

Ensuring that GitHubbers are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how GitHub stays awesome. Part of this is ensuring that our benefits* are out of this world.

In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people with many different backgrounds and lifestyles, and we like it that way. We invite applications from people of all stripes. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences that people imagine to discriminate against one another. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate.

*Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask your recruiter!

jobs.title: Content Writer
jobs.content: Full Time: Content Writer at GitHub in Remote

jobs.title: Back End Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a smart back­end developer who will participate in building, scaling and evolving our constantly growing product and infrastructure. You will be part of a diversified squad with a PO, front­end developers and designers tasked to deliver new product features in complete autonomy, as well as to provide support for clients and operational teams.


As a back­end developer, you will also work on long­term projects such as infrastructure (re)design, datastore and processing optimization, solving complex problem similar but not limited to: full text search, massive data querying (100TB+ Elasticsearch, 25TB+ MySQL cluster), service monitoring (20+ HTTP APIs, 25+ Processing Daemons), data denormalization.


What you’ll do



  • Design, develop and deploy backend services with focus on high availability, low latency and scalability

  • Build and operate infrastructure, toolset and deployment pipelines

  • Collaborate closely with other engineers and become a valued member of an autonomous, cross­functional team

  • Take operational responsibility for the services that are owned by your team

  • Work in an environment that supports your individual growth


Why choose us


To work :



  • with an experienced team

  • on unique technical challenges combining big data volume and real­time processing  

  • in the very heart of Paris (1er arrondissement, métro Pyramides) 

  • for an attractive salary + choice of laptop and sponsored participation in conferences

  • while enjoying flexible working hours.

jobs.title: Senior User Interface
jobs.content:
HealthEdge is looking for a Senior User Interface (UI) Engineer who is passionate about user experience and usability to join our team. The HealthEdge suite of products is leading the industry in enterprise-class healthcare systems and we want our front end applications to represent that same leadership. You'll be designing and implementing features which are the "best of breed" in visual design. 


This position will challenge you to deliver applications which take the complexity of health care and turn it into a streamlined and empowering experience for our users. As a Senior UI Engineer you'll have experience in the design of complex UI's, as well as solid middle-tier technical skills. You'll be working on a team of dedicated and collaborative engineers and product managers using the state-of-the-art technologies (Microsoft .Net Windows Forms and Windows Presentation Framework). You will be involved in all phases of software development including: requirements definition, design, architecture, development, testing, and integration to bring cutting edge technologies to market.

jobs.title: Senior Java Engineer
jobs.content:
You will be working on the product from top to bottom while creating and enhancing capabilities in various modules. You will be handling performance tuning and addressing customer issues. You will be the chief problem solver with plenty of unique assignments within the department.


Looking for an experienced Java developer with a background in Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) and enterprise application integration (EAI) concepts and development. You will be responsible for design, implementation, documentation, and day-to-day support of application components developers in Java on the WebLogic Application Server platform.

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
In 2002, Aspen Systems, Inc. manufactured a high-performance computational cluster that was named as the world's eighth fastest supercomputer. From 2003 through 2006, Aspen Systems, Inc. was ranked on Deloitte & Touché Technology Fast 50 Program for Colorado; a prestigious list of the fifty fastest growing technology companies in the area. Colorado Biz Magazine listed Aspen Systems, Inc. among its Top 250 companies in Colorado over four consecutive years (2003-2006). Aspen Systems, Inc. is a certified audited vendor for Lockheed Martin and was honored to hold the esteemed Lockheed Martin Star Supplier award in 2008; an accolade granted only to the top 0.1% of LMCO suppliers. Aspen Systems, Inc. is an ISO9001: 2008 certified company and manufactures in our own fully compliant ANSI/ESD S20.20 facility. This is non-smoking environment for our employees. 



Responsibilities Include:



  • Maintaining and improving our growing E-Commerce site - We feel as if our e-commerce site is the best in the High Performance Computing industry.  We're looking to take it to the next level and beyond. 

  • Maintaining and improving our custom internal applications - Building new, and improving our custom internal apps is something we strive for every day. 

  • Working with product managers on adding new products to our E-Commerce site - Our staff is committed to providing the most accurate and relevant HPC products and services to our growing site.  

  • Involved in full life cycle development process - From the front of the stack to the back end, this is where your talents can shine.  

  • Gather requirements, coding and development, support and maintenance - You will have all the tools you will need in order for you to be the most successful you can be.  

  • Working with our in-house engineering team - Our engineering team is the best and brightest in High Performance Computing. 

  • Interact well with company leaders and marketing team in order to accomplish business goals - Our team is dedicated and driven to be the best in HPC.  

  • Suggest innovative solutions to business problems/processes that leverage technology to provide marketing differentiation, performance improvements, and better user experiences - We are open to your ideas and solutions to continue to help our enterprise grow.  

  • Contribute to and improve team and company processes.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Senior .NET Developer who will be responsible for building, supporting and enhancing web based (SOA type) services for a high-transaction volume web application.  The Senior .NET Developer will work with indexing and database technologies building services that extract relevant content and inventory from backend systems so that they can be consumed by the UI layer for formatting and presentation to web consumers.  Experience with travel industry technology and knowledge of industry terminology, such as GDS, consolidators, merchant inventory, and booking reservations is highly desirable.


Responsibilities:



  • Web application support and troubleshooting complex issues.

  • Code to business/technical specifications using .NET

  • Must be able to work independently with little or no supervision at times and work in a managed team environment other times. 

  • Ability to adapt to changing priorities.

jobs.title: Senior Java Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
As a core member of the development team, you will build innovations for our flagship product, Concur Expense. With a user base of over 30 million business travelers with year-over-year growth exceeding 30%, Concur Expense is the key component of Concur’s product delivery and growth.


In the first 12 months you will be involved in:



•Creating REST based Web Services: Creating highly scalable services that leverage Concur’s internal cloud as well as other commercial cloud platforms such as AWS to build and scale.

•Transforming our product into services based architecture: Moving our product into a more modular and scalable solution.

•Owning the software lifecycle from design to delivery: We run small agile teams with a mission, so that our engineers have full visibility and ownership of the product, including full-stack service development and operations. (11324)

jobs.title: Principal Architect I
jobs.content:
Shape the future of SaaS architecture


If you want to take the front seat in shaping future architecture of Software as a Service (SaaS) come and join us at Concur!


Be a part of R&D organization setting standards for new development and deployment models, and enabling development teams to migrate legacy systems into future. Concur delivers its vision of the Perfect Trip to customers by empowering developers to build their own vision of a perfect career in a friendly, collaborative, and agile team environment.



In the first 12 months you will:



Design and build Java framework to provide utilities, flow and platform for development of new features and services
Prototype and provide path of migrating legacy code (Progress 4GL) to Java
Enhance the technology behind Concur’s Travel, Expense, Invoice, Analytics, and Government stacks
Work with your team and product managers to identify problems that can be solved as we transition from legacy n-tiered architectures into a modern service-oriented, microservices-based approach
Grow the community and practice of architecture across Concur and facilitate information sharing, adoption of design patterns, and cross-pollination of ideas between teams in R&D organization
Become a liaison between the Concur Government R&D and other Concur/SAP R&D teams



In order to accomplish this you will need to:


Have solid grounding in computer science fundamentals, especially hands-on experiences working at consumer-facing software-as-a-service providers and utilization of public cloud infrastructures
Knowledge of state of the art techniques fundamental to enterprise architecture, as well as demonstrated leadership in transforming organizations’ infrastructures
Gain complex product functionality and architecture knowledge
Use computer programming languages, software tools, and software development environments to code, modify, and prototype programs
Participate in company-wide initiatives to develop design patterns, and champion them on the relevant R&D teams
Provide feedback on functionality requests regarding feasibility and complexity
Actively participate in code and design reviews
Construct Java microservice development/packaging/continuous integration/deployment environment and flow with GitHub/Docker/Kubernetes or similar tools
Have results driven personality, high enthusiasm, energy, and confidence

jobs.title: Dev Ops Engineer
jobs.content:
DevOps Engineer


Data Organization






Be a core part of the Data Organization and help deliver the promise of a better and more interesting tomorrow today. Use data from over 25 million consumers to provide them with enhancements, feedback, and that “wow, that’s awesome!” moment that only data organization can give.


In the first 12 months you will:



  • Drive operational activities related to service management of our rapidly expanding business around the world.

  • Plan capacity, monitor, and manage alerts for services hosted by Concur.

  • Be responsible for day-to-day health and uptime of one of the fastest Data organizations in the K

  • “Keep the lights on” for our Cloud Services and related deployments and constantly find ways to improve reliability and uptime. You love working on HA systems and understand the challenges involved.

  • Work with a wide range of platforms such as Hadoop, Kibana, Linux, Windows, SQL Server, RabbitMQ, F5 and Elastic Search.

  • Write and deploy automation to maintain our deployments across multiple datacenters and environments.

  • Find and fix problems. Be the engineer that can find a needle in the haystack.

  • Provide assistance to Development and QA groups including building out environments and troubleshooting deployment/configuration related problems.

  • Create/Maintain puppet modules for our Cloud Deployments across all tiers. Automate everything.

  • Audit our Cloud deployments and generate triggers and reports relating to system health.

  • Create system dashboards in Kibana or other tools that help improve our product availability.

  • Troubleshoot issues to perform root cause analysis 

  • Occasional on-call every 6-8 weeks.

jobs.title: Software Architect to create enterprise software with consumer scale!
jobs.content:
Step away from the details and see the big picture as an architect supporting Concur’s Travel, Expense, and Invoice products. Be part of a small group that provides high level design and thought leadership to our flagship offerings. Set the direction of the code and help change how we do business by future-proofing our products and ensuring we remain technically cutting-edge. In your first 12 months you will:



  • Use computer programming languages, software tools, and software development environments to code, modify, and prototype programs.

  • Gain complex product functionality and architecture knowledge.

  • Analyze internal development process and make recommendations for changes.

  • Produce Design Documents for assigned application features/enhancements.

  • Provide feedback on functionality requests regarding feasibility and complexity.

  • Investigate assigned product issues, analyze layers of code for origin of bugs, and recommend solutions to cross-functional teams (Development\Product Marketing).

jobs.title: Java technologist sought to create exciting cloud-based software!
jobs.content:
Integral to this role is using JVM technologies to break old paradigms. You will be creating web services that consume data from a massive back end containing complex logic that consistently helps 30,000 businesses in over 100 different countries manage their Employee Spend. If you have strong Java, are technically savvy across a myriad of technologies with a relentless determination to solve difficult problems, Concur would love to hear from you. In the first 12 months, you will: 



  • Design communication interfaces and system integrations using web services and other protocols between enterprise applications using SOA best practices.

  • Create intelligent and intuitive software which helps us provide an even better extended service to our clients, collaborating with our Data Science team in the US if required.

  • Manage and maintain development and test application stacks from OS to web server to web page. 

  • Participate in code reviews and pair programming to validate effectiveness and quality of code

  • Troubleshoot, modify, and maintain existing code within enterprise applications and databases

jobs.title: Senior Java Engineer for DevOps culture embracing end-to-end service ownership!
jobs.content:
Use your full stack Java experience to deliver critical features to over 30 million SaaS users and help us bring consumer scale to complex business software as our user-base continues to grow rapidly.. From inception to deployment, incorporate cutting-edge architecture and technologies to deliver world-leading micro services. Collaborate and communicate with highly skilled teams around the globe to deliver exceptional customer satisfaction for Concur’s innovative Expense products. In your first 12 months you will:



  • Help us create an event driven service that dynamically updates enterprise configuration at scale.

  • Add features/enhancements to current Expense Management services within an agile environment.

  • Gain product & domain knowledge while collaborating to tackle critical customer facing bugs.

  • Be comfortable working across the technology stack from UI to persistence layer.

  • Demonstrate your knowledge of quality engineering practices and principles

jobs.title: Mobile App developer- take Travel Expenses to the Next Level!
jobs.content: From the team that brought you TripIt, comes ExpenseIt. Capture receipts on the go and automatically pre-populate your expense line items—all without typing, hassle, or headaches. We’re proud of what we’ve accomplished so far, but we’re driven to take ExpenseIt to the next level. The Mobile Application Developer will help get us there. You are the type of Developer that is driven by keeping up to date and developing Mobile Apps (using technologies such as iOS and/or Android). You are also not afraid to tackle development challenges, and use your Agile knowledge for the good of projects! You will work alongside ExpenseIt’s Developers, Designers, Product Managers, and Quality Engineers. You will be responsible for providing Mobile Development expertise and support on relevant ExpenseIt components.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby or PHP Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Bigcommerce, is looking for a Senior Software Engineer for our Sydney office who wants to make a difference to millions of merchants around the world by creating something that can help them grow their brands and businesses online.


What You Will Do



  • Build beautiful, scalable products

  • Advocate for modern development practices and tools

  • Collaborate with our product and design teams to define feature specifications and timelines

  • Build new features with a focus on testability and extensibility

  • Engage in technical discussion of new solutions and architectures

  • Review other engineer’s code to maintain and improve quality

  • Work with our operations team to improve the architecture while building and scaling our back-end services

  • Support an open, positive, and energized culture

  • Encourage innovation and foster an environment of continuous improvement

  • Ensure that technical decisions support our goals of quality, performance, scalability, reliability, availability, and security.

  • Mentor and coach other software engineers

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer - Javascript, Node.js, Angular
jobs.content:
Bigcommerce, named "Best Place to Work" in Austin 2014 is looking for Front-End Engineer in our Downtown Austin office who can help us scale our UI development to the next level. Work on our Omni-Channel services to help business owners sell more!


What You Will Do



  • Build beautiful, scalable products and be an expert in the Front End domain

  • Build high-performance, maintainable user interfaces using the latest web technologies

  • Advocate for modern development practices and tools

  • Collaborate with our product and design teams to define feature specifications and timelines

  • Ensure that technical decisions support our goals of quality, performance, scalability, reliability, availability, and security.

jobs.title: Python Developer
jobs.content:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.


We are looking for exceptional and ambitious Python developers who would love an opportunity to learn more and become full stack developers. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 120,000 users from 184 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.


What are we looking for?


As a developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. Besides Python, you will also be given training on front-end languages and frameworks (such as AngularJS) allowing you to become a full-stack developer.  You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

jobs.title: Front-end Developer
jobs.content:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.


We are looking for exceptional and ambitious front-end developers who would love an opportunity to learn more and become full stack developers. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 120,000 users from 184 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.


What are we looking for?


As a developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. Besides JavaScript, you will also be given training on back-end languages (primarily Python) allowing you to become a full-stack developer.  You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content: We have an outstanding opportunity for an experienced java developer who are interested in an exciting career in a fast-growing technology company.  We have a larger than average R&D division of high-performing engineers/developers working in an agile environment, across Java, web, mobile, firmware, analytics and testing. We employ only the best and we ensure our staff have the skills, training and technology to do their best work.

jobs.title: C++ Contractor
jobs.content:
We’re looking for an experienced contractor to work with our embedded software team developing a number of screens for a new product. You will be an expert in developing high level software or UI based applications using C++ and have a really strong understanding of UI frameworks, Unit testing, architecture, development methodologies and standards.


Being a contractor at EROAD means you get the best of both worlds - we consider contractors to be part of the team and from day one you will be embraced as a full team member and your ideas and opinions considered as valid as anyone else. You’ll also get invited along to our Friday drinks!


Our headquarters are in Albany, so if you live on the Shore you’ll have a short commute, free car park, be five minutes’ walk from the bus station and so close to the beach you can enjoy a lunchtime swim.


Flexibility is important for us, so you can use the tools that make you most effective, have some flexibility in start/finish times and wear whatever you want. We’ve got a huge lunchroom with comfy couches, coffee machines and plenty of lunch options right next door.

jobs.title: Data Warehouse Engineer
jobs.content:
The opportunity


As a Zalando Data Warehouse Engineer you will become a critical part of one of the most innovative teams in ecommerce. You will consult and support different stakeholders across the entire company by providing data-driven solutions to business and technical challenges. You’ll join our accomplished team of experts in integrating data from many sources into our single-point-of-truth data warehouse. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we're looking for



  • Demonstrated professional experience programming in Python, Java, or PL/SQL

  • Experience maintaining, refactoring and extending large code bases

  • A preference for agile methodologies

  • A passion for working with relational databases: reading, writing and optimizing complex statements; modelling data structures, and designing ETL processes

  • The ability to communicate effectively with diverse teams

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Develop expertise in understanding our business processes and the many related requirements

  • Collaborate with our analysts to create and implement new initiatives based on our stakeholder requirements

  • Act as a liaison between your team and other teams within Zalando Tech

  • Maintain, optimize and extend our data warehouse infrastructure using Oracle, Exasol and PostgreSQL databases


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

jobs.title: Software Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
The opportunity


The testing team assists development teams to identify, execute, maintain and enhance testing tasks. We are internal consultants who help product teams to be more productive by giving them testing tools, processes and frameworks. You will get to know different aspects of the Zalando platform by working with all kinds of different teams.


What we are looking for



  • You have an above average degree in IT or related technical field

  • You have very good analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to details

  • Excellent coding skills in Java. Knowledge of another language (Scala, Python, Javascript) is a plus.

  • You are a confident user Linux/Unix based systems

  • The usual tools of the complete software lifecycle are known to you (e.g. Jira, Jenkins, JUnit, WebDriver)

  • You have experience with the latest test tools such as Jenkins, JIRA, Sonar, Testlink, Cucumber, Selenium (Webdriver)

  • You have experience with Continuous Delivery and End-to-End Testing

  • You have worked with database management systems (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL) before

  • You will ideally have experience of SOAP web services and REST-API and related technology

  • Modern software architecture (Microservices, loose-coupling, asynchronicity) does not scare you

  • Experience with Docker is a plus

  • Your are able to work independently and self organized in an agile environment

  • Communicating and documenting in English is an easy task for you


Your responsibilities



  • Enable our software development teams to build world-class software by building advanced testing frameworks and tool

  • Be a go-to person on software quality, instruct and consult other software engineers

  • Close working relationship with autonomous development teams to consult them on optimizing testing, e.g. by reviewing the test methodologies or test tools

  • Develop tests and testing-infrastructure as part of a team of engineers

  • You will be responsible for evaluating and developing new technologies and tools based on feedback from other teams

  • Co-Work with Test Infrastructure to optimize test environments


What you can expect from us



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to professional networking

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with micro services, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Krista Vanhala at krista.johanna.maria.vanhala@zalando.de

jobs.title: Big Data Architect
jobs.content:
The opportunity


As a Big Data Architect at Zalando, you will be in charge of building, scaling and architecting one of the largest big data platforms in ecommerce. You will develop big data solutions, services, and messaging frameworks to help us continuously process our data faster and more effectively. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we are looking for



  • A university degree in Computer Science,  Mathematics, Statistics or comparable subject, with an academic record of high achievement

  • Fluency in at least one programming language, such as Python, Java and/or Scala

  • Solid knowledge of data structures and applied machine learning techniques

  • Demonstrated experience working on time-critical, mass data-processing, parallel data-processing and database initiatives

  • Deep knowledge of Hadoop, Cassandra, Spark, MapReduce, Storm, Kafka, and/or other big data technologies and their capabilities

  • A passion for working with relational (e.g. PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, Redis) databases

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures and RESTful APIs

  • Peerless analytical and critical thinking skills

  • Creative thinkers who value accountability, goal-setting and focusing on solutions instead of problems

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Prototype, design and build a mass data-processing and log data-processing architecture that will supplement to our existing analysis and DWH architecture

  • Align multiple teams to support new big data solutions

  • Help evaluate and push for the adoption of technologies that are best suited for specific projects

  • Share your knowledge via coaching, code reviews, articles and tech talks

  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills and act as a liaison between your team and others


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more



  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Backend
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.





You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.


You Benefit From


Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.

jobs.title: Android Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The opportunity


As an Android engineer at Zalando, you will design, build and implement award-winning apps used and enjoyed by millions of people. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we evolve into a “mobile first” company. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand--while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we are looking for



  • A degree in Computer Science and at least 3 years of programming experience

  • Demonstrated experience producing object-oriented, structured, readable and testable code

  • Deep understanding of Android SDK and Java

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services (especially REST)

  • Familiarity with Roboguice, Android Annotations, Dagger and other Android frameworks

  • Prior experience with ProGuard preferred

  • Experience using modern version control systems such as Git and SVN

  • An attitude of accountability and knowledge-sharing—you enjoy reviewing others’ code and sharing your knowledge

  • Excellent communication skills--you can spar with engineers, product owners and other stakeholders

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Follow agile methodologies to continuously improve our Android app

  • Help our team to develop amazing user experiences for mobile

  • Identify and share your knowledge of state-of-the-art technologies that will help us innovate faster


What you can expect from us



  • One-month mentoring program  

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Maria Ulbrich.

jobs.title: Algorithmic Software Engineer
jobs.content:
THE OPPORTUNITY



As a Zalando Algorithms Software Engineer, you will design and build the personalization, recommendation and optimization engines driving customer experiences enjoyed by millions of people. Whether junior- or senior-level, you will have the freedom to challenge our status-quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will be able to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand - while receiving meaningful support at every step.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • A degree in mathematics, physics, statistics or computer science

  • At least one year of professional experience programming in Java, Scala, or Python

  • Solid knowledge of algorithms and data structures

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to technical algorithmic problems

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures, distributed systems and RESTful APIs

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • English language fluency


Additional preferred skills



  • Knowledge of applied machine learning / data mining techniques

  • Knowledge of graph theory, combinatorics and optimization methods

  • Experience with building and / or running large-scale applications

  • Experience with building applications using large data sets

  • Knowledge of R or other machine learning tools (Mahout, Spark, etc.)


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Research, design and implement algorithms to improve our recommendation, personalization and optimization engines

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

  • Communicate effectively with our engineering, data science and algorithmic research teams and use agile processes

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack week’s, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • Zalando shopping discount and commute discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Elena Ognyanova at jobs@zalando.de.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Search/Recommender Systems
jobs.content:
THE OPPORTUNITY


As a software engineer you will focus on developing Zalando’s in-house search engine service and recommender system into state-of-the-art microservices providing highly relevant personalize search results and recommendations for the customer. Your main task will be positioning this technology as a “software as a service” component which can be fully leveraged within the Zalando platform. You will be part of a small, autonomous, and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced Java and Scala developers, and expert data scientists.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • You have at least 3 years of experience, working as a Java or Scala Software Developer

  • You are experienced with Lucene-based technologies like Solr and Elasticsearch

  • You are keen on collaborating closely with data scientists to bring data centric 

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to Enterprise level

  • You know the most common design patterns and you know in which context to apply them

  • A background in applied machine learning is a plus

  • You love to optimize processes and code, and to use new technologies

  • You are experienced in building, evaluating, maintaining and improving data-driven products at scale, which are real-time oriented

  • You have worked with current big data technology (e.g. Hadoop, Amazon Elastic MapReduce)

  • Knowing near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our recommendation and personalization engine in short release cycles

  • You will implement highly scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our recommendation engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Our recipe to success: Think big and act fast. Your contribution today will influence millions of customers tomorrow. At Zalando you have the opportunity to work for a fast growing international company that wants to offer the world’s best fashion experience. Obviously we offer you much more:



  • An exceptional opportunity to develop your skill set while learning from a team of top experts who will inspire and support you

  • Use of cutting-edge open source technologies and cloud services

  • Learning and growth opportunities: weekly tech talks, company-hosted tech meetups, rich team library (which you can expand with your book requests), possibility of visiting conferences

  • Complimentary fruit, beverages, table soccer, ping pong and band room

  • Employee discount for all Zalando shop products

  • Powerful hardware system environment

  • Through our mentoring program you will get up to speed and become productive very quickly

  • You will never be bored! Zalando offers a very exciting and fun working environment 


ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Krista Vanhala at krista.johanna.maria.vanhala@zalando.de
