jobs.title: Senior Engineer - Big Data
jobs.content:
Position Summary
 
Are you interested in pioneering the next generation of real time processing of high volume streaming data?  Are you interested in building out a scalable and reliable technology platform that will act as a business intelligence (BI) enabler to the global HERE organization?  The platform we are building can power real-time dashboards, generate alerts, and drive real time business decisions that will help HERE become the leading location cloud.
 
HERE is building services and platforms to help people solve daily challenges and enrich their lives. It is our goal to help people live delightful, safer, more economic, more sustainable lives while respecting their privacy by providing the right map and the right experience, for every moment.
                                                               
Built on more than 25 years of experience in cartography and drawing on more than 80,000 sources of data, HERE offers "Maps for Life" for more than 190 countries, voice guided navigation in 95 countries in more than 50 languages and live traffic information for 41 countries. To learn more about HERE, visit our official blog at http://360.here.com/
 
The product development team in Seattle is expanding to help realize this vision, and searching for engineers at all levels with expertise building large scale distributed systems. We are looking for candidates that are entrepreneurial, have a strong sense of ownership, and are highly motivated with their own opinions who want to shape product and implement pioneering technology that matters to consumers.
 
Main responsibilities



  • Work closely with product owners and engineers to design, implement, test and continually improve low latency and highly scalable web applications and services running on AWS.

  • Develop products using agile methods and tools.

  • Develop commercial grade software that is user friendly and suitable for global audience.

  • Support production issues both directly and indirectly with customers.

  • Investigate, evaluate, and present new technologies for use with web applications/services.

  • Participate in design reviews, code reviews of your work and the work of your peer engineers.

  • Participate in architecture and design efforts across multiple teams, across multiple HERE divisions.

  • Be a technical lead for key complex systems or services, working closely with other engineers and testers to deliver high quality software on time.

  • Mentor and assist other engineers in or out of your areas of ownership and expertise.

jobs.title: Sr Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you interested in pioneering the next generation of personalization that blends physical and virtual worlds seamlessly leveraging the richest map data in existence, all things digital, social networks, and real-time predictive analytics at scale (big data) to create an in-the-moment experience that enrich people’s lives? HERE is building mobile apps and services to help people solve daily challenges and enrich their lives. It is our goal to help people live delightful, safer, more economic, more sustainable lives while respecting their privacy by providing the right map and the right experience, for every moment. Built on more than 25 years of experience in cartography and drawing on more than 80,000 sources of data, HERE offers "Maps for Life" for more than 190 countries, voice guided navigation in 95 countries in more than 50 languages and live traffic information for 41 countries. To learn more about HERE, visit our official blog at http://360.here.com/ The product development team in Seattle is expanding to help realize this vision, and searching for engineers at all levels with expertise in mobile app, web services and big data. We are looking for candidates that are entrepreneurial, highly motivated with their own opinions who want to shape product and implement pioneering technology that matters to consumers. The ability to have fun turning great ideas into inspired products is a must. Main responsibilities



  • Work closely with product owners and engineers to design, implement, test and continually improve low latency and highly scalable web services running on open source stacks (Linux, Java).

  • Develop products using agile methods and tools.

  • Develop commercial grade software that is user friendly and suitable for global audience.

  • Extensively use test automation or Test Driven Development during development process.

  • Continually create and update domain expertise documentation for internal and external customers.

  • Support production issues both directly and indirectly with customers.

  • Investigate, evaluate, and present new technologies for use with web services.

  • Drive design reviews, code reviews of your work and the work of your peer engineers.

  • Drive architecture and design efforts across multiple teams, across multiple HERE divisions.

  • Be a technical lead for key complex systems or services, working closely with other engineers and testers to deliver high quality software on time.

  • Mentor and assist other engineers in your areas of ownership and expertise.

jobs.title: Sr Architect -
jobs.content:
HERE is the leading global provider of maps, and location-based services. We are developing technology that will make personalized navigation, autonomous driving and augmented reality part of everyday life.


HERE is looking for a solutions architect to help design and build the next generation of the HERE Platform. Essential requirements include a proven track record of the development, deployment and the support of large scale distributed services.


Key Responsibilities



  • As part of the Architecture Team, within Platform Operations & IT (POIT) organisation you shape the future of the HERE platforms as well as Production and Corporate IT services

  • Enable product teams to develop, launch and operate high-quality services in a fast-paced environment

  • Interface with the extended architecture community within HERE to develop standard solutions to common requirements

  • Rapid prototyping of new technologies in areas all the way from datacenter infrastructure to development tooling and the business intelligence area

  • Support senior management with reliable and consise analysis of a broad spectrum of technology areas

  • Continuous alignment of the POIT offering to the needs of the internal customer-base

  • Provide architecture support and expertise to Software Engineers and Systems Engineers to ensure infrastructure and software standards and security standards are met for new and existing applications, products and Infrastructure

  • Lead programs to build solutions across many departments within HERE while ensuring the progress and stakeholder satisfaction

  • Lead cross-disciplinary teams to dig into the hardest, most impactful problems and solve them

  • Plan and carry out POC (Proofs of Concept) for POIT services


Skills Required


Excellent background in Systems and Software Architecture and Engineering, understanding of the components of infrastructure as code, public Cloud (AWS), distributed systems theory and design, and big data concepts and systems, but also feel at home in strategy discussions, budget planning, project management as well as software development. 



  • Prior experience with deep knowledge in software development/engineering and managing large-scale server cloud infrastructure

  • Big Data analysis and machine learning experience are a plus

  • Experience with systems management platforms at scale

  • Automation and CI/CD systems experience required

  • Good understanding of networking and storage technologies and concepts.

  • Solid understanding and experience with Cloud technologies and public Cloud services (particularly AWS)

  • Excellent organisational, analytical, problem-solving and presentation skills

  • Communication of technical issues to a wide and varied audience, from engineers to executives

  • Working with remote teams and across time zones globally

  • Desire and capability to continuously learn new things in all areas (technology, communication, business, culture, …)


HERE is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, parental status, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

jobs.title: Jr. Android Developer
jobs.content:
About the Role


We’re looking for a talented Jr. Android Developer to join our growing Brooklyn-based mobile development agency. You’ll work with our Clients, Designers, Project Managers, and other Developers to create cutting-edge codebases for our clients’ diverse native mobile applications.


The people who thrive in this position can switch modes easily between solo efforts and team projects, and can overcome a wide array of coding challenges. They enjoy the rigor of producing high quality code that’s at the forefront of industry innovation. They’re thorough, detail-oriented, and take pride in their work. We are these things, too.


Working at App Partner


Fact is, the kind of people who work at App Partner could work just about anywhere. They’re smart. They’re creative. They’re fun. They’re engaged. And they take a ridiculous amount of pride in doing what needs to be done to make sure our clients get what they need, when they need it. So why do they choose to work at App Partner? Simple. Because we get it.


We get that most people want to work in a great office in a vibrant neighborhood like Brooklyn – not some office park in suburbia. We get that work needs to be fun, vibrant and exciting – but never distracting. We get that transparency, communication and opportunities for growth matter. A lot. And that free snacks don’t hurt, either. We get that work is a big part of your life, but it’s not your whole life. And we get that smart, creative people want to be around other smart, creative people. Think you have what it takes? Apply and let’s talk.


Responsibilities:



  • Create, modify, and test high-quality code

  • Work from specifications drawn up by our Sr. Developers or Head of Development

  • Collaborate closely with project managers, designers, developers, and strategists

  • Take ownership of the projects you’re assigned

jobs.title: Application Architect/Integration Lead
jobs.content:
ProSight is looking for experienced and motivated candidates who combine strategic thinking, creativity, and technical skills to drive results at a fast growing, dynamic company.  ProSight’s business model focuses on specific customer niches and delivers a competitive advantage through a deeper understanding of the customer and superior underwriting execution.


The Architect / Integration Lead will lead the development of application programming interface (API) in support of ProSight’s Digital Strategy.   The Architect will analyze the current eco system and will design solutions to expose core data to our digital channels. 


The Architect will work with the development resources to create application/integration frameworks, reusable components, or proof of concepts as needed.  The role will partner with the leader of Digital Products and business analysts to align on design decisions and implement the solution to meet the desired business outcomes.  This role reports to the leader of Architecture and Data Management.


The role has direct responsibility for leading code development and for effectively communicating solution concepts.  A candidate will need to have a firm understanding of object orientated analysis and design, design pattern usage and service orientation.  The design and development work for the role will be project related but will need to align with the enterprise architecture.  Design deliverables will go through a design and gate review.


 Responsibilities:









  • Responsible for technical analysis, estimates, and technical design of solutions

  • Lead the execution of proof of concepts when appropriate

  • Perform system analysis and designing of new integrations

  • Creation of Project documentation including High Level Design (HLD) and Detailed Design Documents and diagrams when appropriate

  • Design and govern the reusable service repository, design patterns and reusable technical components (e.g. Web Services, Rest and SOA components, ESB orchestrations, data transformations, error handling, auditing, logging etc.)

  • Collaborate with the infrastructure/operations team, DBAs, technical leads, developers and business analysts for design activities

  • Write technical designs according to standard templates; using use cases, UML diagrams and descriptive narratives in a clear, unambiguous, and concise manner

  • Manage changes to base lined design through effective application of change control processes and tools

  • Partner with Project Managers and Business Analysts to ensure API services are delivered in a timely

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
A Day in the Life


As a member of the Ruby Software Engineering team, you'll work closely with our receptionists and other team members to deliver WOW-worthy solutions for both our clients and partners.


We work in two-week sprints, iteratively advancing multiple company initiatives.  The work typically spans multiple technology platforms, including various .NET applications, on-premise and cloud-hosted web services, mobile applications, and multiple web sites.


We're looking for a strong cross-functional developer who can move between roles and technologies as needed – you might be coding a RESTful endpoint in the morning, and debugging a stored procedure in the afternoon.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
The What and Why Now


We are looking for an experienced web developer to help us evolve our award winning, live receptionist service into a world class communication system for small business.


A Day in the Life


As a member of the Ruby Software Engineering team, you'll work closely with other team members, as well as our Product and UX departments, building WOW-worthy websites for both our clients and partners.


In particular, you’ll help us as we rebuild an existing ASP.NET website using the latest front-end technologies and SOA.  You’ll also help us iterate and improve other web properties, by improving Salesforce integration, working with our Marketing team to improve analytics and tracking, and in general, using your strong knowledge of front-end technologies to create fantastic user experiences.

So this is really you?


You're passionate about technology, are proud of the work you do, and want to work for a company that shares your values.


You’re also fun and collaborative, and you have a reputation for doing what you say you’ll do.  Others would point to you as someone they’d love to work with, and your brilliant mind and innovative solutions inspire us all to do great work.


We recognize you have choices.  You’ve got the experience and work ethos so many employers are looking for.  Call us crazy, but even in this competitive environment, we’re not going to compromise on our commitment to hiring only the best, brightest, and friendliest people in town.  And that is why we want YOU.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you wish you could live and breathe sports every day? We are looking for a software engineer who would love to create highly engaging products for sports teams and fans!


Who you are: You're a talented engineer and have an insatiable appetite for basketball, football, baseball, and/or soccer. You want to join a small team and work in a fast-paced, high-energy, results-oriented environment. You communicate complicated ideas simply. You embrace the freedom to make important decisions and be accountable for them. We believe in sharing the ball, and you, too, are a team player (to a fault).

jobs.title: iOS Developer- 3740
jobs.content: Asynchrony Labs, a subsidiary of World Wide Technology, Inc., has opportunities for developers interested in building exceptional iOS applications. Developers at Asynchrony Labs are responsible for the development of applications to solve business, engineering, and scientific problems. Asynchrony Labs is a highly collaborative environment where developers work very closely with other team members and clients to solve problems.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content: Asynchrony Labs has opportunities for a highly motivated .Net Software Engineer.  Candidates will be responsible for the analysis of business, engineering, and scientific problems, and the documentation and development of well-defined methods, procedures, and programs in the delivery of practical systems solutions. Should have experience with hands-on .Net development. This includes detailed software design, developing code with unit tests to implement the design, correcting flaws based on requirements testing, and integrating the applications.­­

jobs.title: Quality Advocate- 3748
jobs.content:
The Quality Advocate works closely with other team members to build quality in, through the following responsibilities:



  • Keep the team and stakeholders informed of a holistic view of the product’s quality.

  • Elicit examples that act as or clarify acceptance criteria.

  • Encourage collaboration and discussion about doing better testing within the team.

  • Help developers plan and build automated checks at the right levels of the system in order to provide the optimal return of feedback to cost of ownership of the test suite.

  • Evaluate the product’s fitness for purpose by learning about it through exploratory testing and experimentation to complement automated checks.

  • Work with stakeholders to determine which features and defect fixes are critical to the end user and business.

  • Work with stakeholders to identify reasonable quality goals based on product needs.

  • Work with the team to improve processes to ensure that the team meets those quality goals.

  • Measure how closely the product meets the quality goals set forth by the stakeholders, including risk as it applies to the quality of the product.

  • Carry out root-cause analysis of defects when they occur.

  • Partner with everyone from the product owner to operations to help ensure that everyone is working towards the goal of delivering a quality working product into production.

  • Pair with developers to write clean and maintainable test code.

  • Ask questions and challenge others to consider the consequences of design decisions.

jobs.title: Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job listings do not always do justice to a company's environment and who would work well inside that culture and environment. If you would take the time to read this short article, besides the listing of skills below, it does an excellent job of describing who we are looking for. If the article speaks to you and what you are seeking in your career, please contact me. 


The Best Job Description for an Engineer Ever Written



Asynchrony Labs, a subsidiary of World Wide Technology, Inc. has opportunities for Java Software Developers to assist in the analysis of business, engineering and scientific problems, as well as the documentation and development of well-defined methods, procedures and programs in the delivery of practical systems solutions.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job summary


Position is responsible for performing requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, verification and validation, and maintenance of enterprise custom desktop and web-based solutions for editing and reporting on geospatial databases with links to legacy systems. Responsible for developing software code to standards, meeting requirements on schedule and with minimal defects while also assisting in test development. This role involves working within a software support team in a collaborative environment.


Summary of essential job functions



  • Modify existing software to correct errors, allow it to adapt to new hardware, or to improve its performance.

  • Participate in full software lifecycle development, including requirements elicitation, design, development, testing, and verification, either entering a project at a certain stage or taking a project from beginning to end

  • All Skyline Software engineers are expected to be able to be customer facing; while this position is in our headquarters, meetings occasionally take place to review status and discuss future potential opportunities

  • Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer @ Thunder
jobs.content:
Why is Front-End Engineering important to Thunder?


Thunder has built the very first Creative Management Platform. We often push the limits of what can be done in a browser. We have wowed some of our biggest clients with the technology that we have created. Thousands of users interact with our platform every day and we strive to make that interaction as seamless as possible. The face of our entire operation is built by our talented and dedicated Front-End Engineers.


What does a Front-End Engineer do?


Front-End Engineers are responsible for building cohesive design and UX components as well as shaping the future of what our product can do. Our stack is Angular, Backbone, and SASS but we think that the right engineer can use their experience with any MVC (MVVC, MVVM, etc…) type framework and translate it to success on our team. We are looking for Engineers that have expertise in building efficient, and scalable front-end applications that connect to public and internal APIs, using both pure JavaScript and frameworks. At Thunder you would be building the face of a platform with huge amounts of impact across the entire company.


What is something you might work on?


We have some pretty big projects in the pipeline. Some of them are internal and some are external. There are a couple we are very excited about.



  • Building an interface and experience for creating ads with custom, user-defined animations

  • Creating a real-time, collaborative process for editing ads


What are other important traits and focuses?



  • Writing testable and tested code

  • Enjoys code review

  • Continuous Learning and Teaching

  • Automating Everything

  • Strong opinions, weakly held

  • Promote best practices and coding standards

  • Strong focus on correctness, simplicity and maintainability

jobs.title: Senior .NET Engineer
jobs.content:
WHO WE ARE


Cylance is one of the fastest growing companies in cyber security. By successfully applying artificial intelligence and machine learning to crack the DNA of malware, Cylance has redefined the endpoint protection market, garnered acclaim from industry analysts and won numerous awards including “Best Emerging Vendor” from SC Magazine. If you have the passion and desire to disrupt industries, protect the world from cyber attacks, and be at the forefront of a revolutionary new technology, we want you to join us!


THE POSITION


Cylance is seeking a Senior .NET Software Engineer to help contribute to the design, creation, and testing of our cutting-edge cyber security platform. You'll design architectures and interfaces, and write high-quality, secure code and unit tests. We want you to be passionate and enthusiastic about everything you do. Ready to make a difference?

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you seeking an environment where you can drive state of the art technologies to improve productivity? Do you want to work with scientists, analysts, and software developers? Are you passionate about building and running big data systems impacting millions of people's experience with Amazon every day? Do you want to play a key role in the future of Amazon's Retail business?



As a member of the Forecasting Experimentation Platform team, you'll play a key role in solving some of the world's most complex technical challenges associated with experimentation at Amazon scale. You will apply Large-scale computing, Distributed systems, Data mining, Scalability, Machine learning and Statistical Algorithms techniques.



You should love solving hard problems, never take 'no' for an answer, and strive to innovate and simplify. Join our team of top-notch software developers, who work hard, have fun, and make history.

· Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field with 2+ year relevant experience.

· Demonstrated proficiency with Java, C++, or equivalent object-oriented programming language; or demonstrated ability to quickly learn new programming languages and tools.

· Object-oriented analysis and design skills.

· Problem solving and analytical abilities.

· Understanding of algorithmic design and complexity analysis.

· Experience developing and operating medium to large sized software systems.

· Experience in Object Oriented Analysis and Design skills.

· Strong verbal and written communication skills and an ability to work in a team environment.



· Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers.

· Experience applying machine learning, statistical modeling or related analytic techniques is a good plus.

· Experience building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.

. Experience with Hadoop, YARN, Docker, or large data storage access design and implementation is a plus.

· Experience collecting software product requirements, describe software product features, and creating technical designs.

jobs.title: Program Manager
jobs.content:
Amazon is looking for a talented, smart and passionate Program Manager PC Gaming (m/f). The person in this role will develop marketing strategies to drive demand and new customer acquisition across multiple traffic channels, supporting our vendors and partners. This person will also work closely with the Vendor Management team to build, implement and analyze marketing and merchandising programs that promote top brands on Amazon.



The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities who strives to answer business/marketing questions and who operates independently and works across functional boundaries. We are looking for someone to develop a healthy obsession with understanding our customer and providing services that meet their needs. This person must also enjoy being a creative contributor and thrive in working in the exciting PC Gaming environment.



In this role, you will have the opportunity to display your skills in the following areas:

  • Act as the voice of the customer in understanding their behavior and needs.

  • Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing marketing and traffic metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.

  • Create an engaging One-Stop PC Gaming Store experience that makes shopping both easy and fun for customers. Integrate state-of-the-art website features in the store and on detail pages.

  • Plan, coordinate and execute innovative marketing and merchandising initiatives to drive traffic, revenue and conversion across Amazon product lines (e.g. PC, Video Games, Electronics)

  • Develop a Gaming hardware launch strategy to establish exciting customer experience.

  • Work with vendors and vendor managers to create on-brand, best-in-class content to promote our Gaming products across Amazon product categories.

  • Negotiate and manage marketing budgets with alliance partners.

  • Collaborate with vendors, alliance partners and PR on E-Sports events.

  • Operating as an effective point of contact for Merchandising Managers, Vendor Managers, Instock Managers, Legal, and PR. Interacting with vendors and other external partners, and working with internal technical teams to roll-out new website features.




  • Multiple years in digital marketing or related field, including e-mail, SEO, traffic analysis

  • University degree required ideally in a technical or analytical discipline

  • Outstanding organizational, attention to detail and multi-tasking skills.

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to influence others internally and externally.

  • Experience designing and executing visible online customer experiences

  • Proficiency in Excel and data analysis

  • Demonstrated positive, results oriented attitude.

  • Excellent team player capable of learning and sharing knowledge in a team environment.

  • Experience interpreting and communicating analytics




  • Gaming industry experience preferred

  • Superior analytical skills. Demonstrated ability to identify and solve ambiguous problems. In particular, identifying customer needs and inventing new ways to meet those needs

  • Experience in data mining (SQL, ETL, data warehouse, etc.) and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.

  • Proven track record in vendor negotiation and relationship management

  • Extreme attention to detail and willingness to roll up your sleeves.

  • Demonstrated success planning and executing innovative and targeted marketing programs

  • Strong bias for action with ability to prioritize, multi-task, and meet deadlines


Your benefits:


  • The opportunity to work for a leading worldwide online retailer

  • An engaging working environment with excellent career progression

  • A competitive salary including stock units and other benefits


By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Amazon Video, Living Room Team
jobs.content:
At Amazon Video, we're fundamentally changing the way millions of customers access, consume and interact with video content worldwide. Inventing on behalf of our customers is in our DNA: Prime Video, X-Ray and Amazon Studio Originals (The Grand Tour, The Man in the High Castle, Transparent, Shaun the Sheep..) are just a few of the features and capabilities that delight our customers. It's a green-field space overdue for disruption and we'd like you to join us in our mission to enable everyone to search, discover, consume and interact with video content anytime, anywhere and on any device.



The Amazon Video Living Room team is responsible for ensuring that the rich and fluid Amazon Video application behaviour is maintained across a wide set of customer devices including Smart TV’s & Games Consoles. This involves working on 3D graphics pipelines, image algorithms, scene graphs, rendering methods, web technologies and integrating with media playback application and player teams in Amazon.



This role bridges between embedded and web platforms and is suited to candidates that want to grow their knowledge from either direction.



As a Senior Software Development Engineer working in the Amazon Video Living Room team, you will lead the design and development of significant technical projects by both achieving results through other SDE's as well as writing critical-path code yourself. In collaboration with the Software Development Manager on the team, you will influence your team’s technical and business strategy by making insightful contributions to team priorities and approach, take the lead in identifying and solving ambiguous technical problems, architecture deficiencies, or areas where your team’s software bottlenecks the innovation of other teams. To achieve results through others, you will demonstrate technical influence over 1-2 teams, either via a collaborative software effort or by increasing their productivity and effectiveness by driving software engineering best practices. You'll also lead design reviews for your team, actively participate in design reviews across the org, provide insightful code reviews and actively mentor other engineers.



Whether your background is working within a small start-up or a big multi-national you should have a proven track record of delivering customer impacting solutions. You should be comfortable in a culture of experimentation and innovation, learning new skills as needed.


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Understanding of computer science fundamentals such as algorithm design, problem solving, complexity analysis, data structures and object orientated design

  • Experience taking a leading role in designing, building and implementing complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

  • Experience influencing software engineering best practices within your team and across others for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills, and make them more effective, product software engineers

  • Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy

  • Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming language such as C, C++, C#, Java, or Perl




  • Experience with embedded computing platforms such as games consoles, mobile phones, set-top boxes and Smart TV’s

  • Exposure to and understanding of 3D graphics pipelines, image algorithms, scene graphs, rendering methods and web technologies

  • Experience with distributed computing and enterprise-wide systems

  • Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between

jobs.title: Head of On Site Experience, The Book Depository
jobs.content:
As one of the world’s fastest growing booksellers, The Book Depository (BookDepository.com) is working to offer the largest range of titles in the world, available for dispatch within 48 hours. Founded in 2004 to make ‘All Books to All’ we focus on selling ‘less of more’ rather than ‘more of less’, differentiating ourselves from other retailers who increasingly focus on bestsellers. Having forged unique publisher and supplier relationships, we have the ability to dispatch over twelve million titles within 48 hours, with free worldwide delivery, enabling customers to find the books they want. In November 2011 The Book Depository was acquired by Amazon.



Position

The Book Depository is looking for an enthusiastic, creative Head of On Site Experience to help build and grow our Books business internationally. This leader will develop the category’s content strategy, including the overall merchandising calendar, meeting the needs of the business while protecting the integrity of the customer experience. He/She will lead a team to propose, plan and execute new features, partnering with business and technical teams to achieve project goals. This person will drive strategy and ambitions on behalf of the category team, will set goals that all functions may be involved in achieving and will liaise with tech teams, Amazon and other global category teams to execute.



Seen by the team and vendors as an expert in books and its customer base, the Head of On Site Experience will actively stay on top of new products, brands, trends and propose strategies for optimizing them from a content and promotional standpoint, keeping the site relevant, fresh and engaging. The Head of On Site Experience is viewed as a standard-bearer for high-quality, high-impact content and as someone who creatively and proactively finds win-win solutions that benefit the category as well as the overall business.



Key responsibilities include:

  • Commercially driving and contributing to the business for The Book Depository, focusing on discoverability, site engagement, customer retention, conversion and overall customer experience

  • Devising and implementing strategic plans for merchandising and customer experience

  • Managing the quality of our catalogue and the resulting customer experience; managing related projects such as improving product data quality, attribute and image collection, browse cleanups, etc.

  • In addition to executing on promotions and features, helping to shape them by brainstorming new ideas and working with the team to optimize the merchandising strategy

  • Developing a Customer Centre of excellence, providing insights of our customer base base on their journey and personas

  • Adopting and implementing country-specific On Site initiatives and campaigns

  • Management of data analysis and metrics to measure the performance of sales- and conversion of traffic-driving initiatives

  • Contributing to maximise Search engine optimisation impact as per the approach defined by the marketing team

  • Operating as an effective point of contact for Merchandising Managers, Vendor Managers, In Stock Managers, Legal, and PR. Interacting with vendors and other external partners, and working with internal technical teams to drive tool fixes and improvements

  • Regularly testing new merchandising tactics, documenting the results and sharing best practices with the team

  • Supporting the planning, development and execution of compelling e-mail campaigns in conjunction with the marketing team

  • Developing the On Site Experience team both as individuals and as a work group




  • A deep understanding of all traffic-driving mechanisms (Email, search, browse, SEO, etc.); actively engaged in optimizing the conversio of the traffic coming from those channels

  • An in-depth understanding of merchandising and customer behaviour metrics, plus regular use of such data to guide decisions and recommendations

  • Demonstrable ability to think on your feet and make smart decisions

  • Online retail experience

  • Strong planning and time-management skills

  • Highly skilled at communicating ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing.

  • Excellent written English and strong attention to detail is essential

  • High computer literacy, with ability to learn new systems quickly

  • Experience in people management




  • MBA or similar business qualification

  • Self-starter with ability to manage multiple tasks in a deadline-driven environment

jobs.title: Full Stack Ruby Developer
jobs.content:
The Digital Experience team is seeking an experienced Full Stack Ruby Developer to deliver cutting edge shopping experiences on MasterDynamic.com. This role offers an exciting opportunity to be a part of a growing brand that is born in digital and rooted in technological innovation.


As the Lead Developer at Master & Dynamic, you will be responsible for back and front-end web development for all Master & Dynamic Shopify properties (.com, .co.uk, & .eu) and integration with 3rd party cloud services. You will also play a pivotal role as Master & Dynamic expands our international e-commerce presence into future markets. 


This position works closely with the management team and has an integral role in shaping Master & Dynamic's future. This role is based at our Midtown Manhattan headquarters.

jobs.title: Remote DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The Ceros platform empowers designers and marketers to create and publish beautiful, interactive content experiences without the need for developers.


Our users work collaboratively in real-time on a browser-based digital canvas to create pixel-perfect experiences with rich animations and interactivity. The experiences they publish work consistently across all browsers and devices, and all customer engagement is tracked with extensive analytics. All without writing code.


About the Product


Designing and building the Ceros platform is no easy task. We require the best-of-the-best web developers, designers, and QA testers, ready to bring the functionality of desktop software to the web, often pushing web browsers to the limits of what’s currently possible.


Our codebase is 95% JavaScript and the Ceros product is comprised of multiple single-page applications with a client-heavy focus. We use libraries like jQuery, Require, and Backbone. The Ceros Studio is architected around the HTML5 Canvas element.


We’re not language zealots. We believe in using the right tools for the job, and our current server-side infrastructure runs PHP, Node.js, Redis, MySQL, Chef, Grunt, etc. on the Amazon AWS cloud.


About the Team


As part of the Ceros product team, you’ll be working with a cross-functional group of the most talented people you’ve ever worked with. We hire only passionate and creative people with a proven and unquestionable ability to execute, and every member of the team is equally responsible for moving the product forward.


We have a dynamic company culture that collaborates daily. We care deeply about the user experience, and we debate passionately about our ideas. When you work at Ceros, you check your ego at the door, and you aren’t afraid to be honest, especially to yourself. We take our jobs seriously but ourselves not so much -- whether it’s cracking jokes in the chat room or poking fun at the CEO’s atrocious spelling.


About the Job


Working completely from home, you’ll be communicating often through chat rooms, email, and video conferencing. We offer flexible working hours and an extremely flexible vacation policy. And we provide excellent gear (15” Macbook Pro, iPad, external monitor, etc.). We’re looking for a seasoned engineer who is comfortable writing product code and has a passion for devops. You understand the pros and cons of various infrastructure technologies and are excited to scale the infrastructure of a rapidly growing startup.


As a DevOps focused developer, your typical day-to-day involves:



  • Evaluating, testing and building new infrastructure tools and technology

  • Writing maintainable code (probably goes without saying)

  • Carrying out and being on the receiving end of intense code review sessions from your peers who hold your work (and their own) to the highest of standards

  • Working closely with the rest of the team to deploy new releases and data migrations without hiccup

  • And finally, ensuring the availability of the Ceros platform


Next Steps


If you’re interested in being part of the Ceros team, please send your resume and a cover letter to us. We’re a company of passionate, honest, and sometimes silly people, so don’t be afraid to express yourself.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
What is Skuid? Skuid is a cloud user experience platform to rapidly create bespoke web apps without writing code.  Our mission, "Interface forward," describes our belief that human-machine interactions should be adaptable — constantly evolving to empower people to do more with less. Enterprise software should not dehumanize. Instead of "enduring" a painful interface, use Skuid to interface forward, making your work more productive, meaningful and enjoyable.


As a Skuid Product Engineer you will be responsible for developing world-class software products that will be used directly by customers and partners across every major vertical.  We are changing an industry and are experiencing massive growth and adoption.  


Responsibilities



  • Individual contributor role in a product engineering team to develop well designed, testable, code for software products sold to customers across all major industries around the world.

  • Contribute in all phases of an agile development lifecycle.

  • Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review.

  • Build in quality, reusable code and processes to all development activity.

  • Develop with reusable, scalable design.

  • Maintain and address issues.

  • Work closely with the Skuid Technical Support team to assist with customer issues as needed.

  • Create technical documentation as needed.

jobs.title: Back-end Web Developer
jobs.content:
TradeKing Group, Inc. (www.tradeking.com) consists of companies that provide online brokerage services, education and social collaboration channels for investors, and more. Its subsidiary, TradeKing Securities, LLC, is a nationally licensed online broker/dealer dedicated to empowering the independent, self- directed investor. TradeKing Advisors, Inc. is an SEC registered investment advisor. Brokerage accounts are serviced and securities offered through TradeKing Securities, LLC, member FINRA and SIPC.


Position Description


You aren't satisfied with simply knowing that things work. You want to know the how and why and its impact on security, performance, and maintainability. You are excited about the latest language features and frameworks but you have the maturity to know when to introduce them into a project. You love having the freedom to innovate and take responsibility but you value doing that in the context of a team. The more you learn the more you realize you don't know and you need others and they need you. You test everything and let the data drive your decisions. You love what you do!


Job Responsibilities


You will be an integral part of a small cross-functional Scrum team (2-4 Developers, 1-2 QA, 1 Product Owner). The team analyzes requirements, makes design recommendations, designs the architecture, develops the code, creates the documentation, develops automated tests, performs manual testing, and ultimately deploys the code. Through all of this you are considering the impact your decisions have on security, performance, and maintainability. You design and implement the best solution given the constraints, and identify technical debt to be addressed.

jobs.title: Software Developer - Content Platform for Hulu!
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


The ingestion, review, management and syndication of content is core to Hulu’s business and success. The Content Platform technology team is responsible for the end-to-end technology needs to acquire content from over 500 partners and deliver the highest quality video to tens of millions of users. We’re looking for sharp, motivated individuals to help build the technology backbone of Hulu.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Content ingestion systems and APIs

  • Content publishing tools and workflows

  • Caption editing format manipulation to support every platform

  • A state-of-the-art Content Partner portal

  • Scaling our CDN distribution technologies

jobs.title: Software Developer - Android
jobs.content:
Hulu is seeking a Software Developer on Android with a passion for mobile applications to join our team in Seattle, WA. Our small, high performance team is responsible for the apps that millions of Hulu users experience their premium TV content on every day. We strive to create and maintain the best Video on Demand (VOD) application on a broad set of Android devices, from phones to tablets, from older hardware to the bleeding edge of devices coming out.


In this role, you will work with other software developers to improve, rework, and reimagine our Android application. We also work closely with the backend services that our apps consume to provide a seamless cross-platform experience. Successful candidates will have solid experience developing and releasing mobile applications, a passion for building quality software, and critical eye for quality and attention to detail.


We would love to see samples of your work. If you’ve got something to show, please make sure your resume or application links to your Github account or an app in the Play store.

jobs.title: .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Ansira is the leader in modeling and activating 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data, delivering performance marketing programs at a national and local level with unprecedented results and long-term profitability. 


Ansira’s development focuses on development and support of various marketing solutions using Microsoft technologies as applied to a multitude of business environments. Flexibility and a positive attitude in an ever-changing environment are important attributes for this position.


Due to client growth, we are seeking a .NET Developer to join our awesome team of developers.  This position will be responsible for development, implementation and support of various proprietary applications utilized by both external and internal clients.


Selected candidate will interface with clients, account management, application development, QA and IM teams. This is an exciting position demanding a strong aptitude for application development and Software Development Life Cycles.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Build and support applications in production, pre-production environments and coordinate QA and UAT cycles

  • Managing production support, stability and maintenance

  • Identifying, troubleshooting and debugging defects

  • Design, development and deployment of UI and functional features for web applications

  • Perform database and application operations

  • Provide application support to internal and external clients

  • Identify, analyze and articulate problem areas and work with others to devise solutions focusing on stability, performance and scalability

  • Working with a fair degree of independence on concurrent implementations

  • Follow internal processes for project management, change management and defect management

jobs.title: PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Ansira is the leader in modeling and activating 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data, delivering performance marketing programs at a national and local level with unprecedented results and long-term profitability.  We have a great opportunity for a PHP Developer to join our team in our Addison, TX office.  


This role will be responsible for supporting the development and maintenance of client and internal web applications. This position requires a deep understanding of PHP, extensive knowledge of web application architecture, application frameworks and LAMP environments. Analysis and problem solving skills are required along with excellent communication skills. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment on several projects concurrently. Preference is given to candidates who can demonstrate resourcefulness in creating technical solutions leveraging production quality open-source libraries and services.


What You Will Do



  • Work as a part of an on-site development team, which will coordinate with other internal departments.

  • Maintain and introduce functionality to existing systems.

  • Collaborate with leads to develop solutions and complete projects successfully and on time.

  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously.

  • Contribute to the quality of code through participation in code reviews, refactoring, and unit testing.

jobs.title: User Experience Researcher
jobs.content:
The User Experience Researcher reports to the UX Lead.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute research plans and objectives based on an understanding of company’s strategic goals.
  • Employ qualitative methods to understand user needs, motivations, and behaviors. This may include but not be limited to field studies, usability studies, diary studies, user interviews, and surveys.
  • Help the company and the rest of the community build empathy for users by synthesizing and communicating user insights.
  • Collaborate with our UX designers, front/backend engineers, product managers and the rest of the community to determine what features should be built, how they should behave, and what the priorities should be. This is mainly done on our public issue tracker.
  • Use quantitative data to complement qualitative data about users to inform company and product decisions.
  • Build and maintain a participant database for user research recruiting.
  • Recruit and screen participants for user research that are willing to work in the open.
  • Write blog articles and respond to comments about GitLab’s usability.

Requirements for Applicants

  • A minimum of 2+ years experience as a user researcher
  • Degree in cognitive psychology, human factors, human-computer interaction, or related field.
  • Collaborative team spirit with great communication skills
  • You share our values, and work in accordance with those values.

Avoid the confidence gap; you do not have to match all the listed requirements exactly to apply. Our hiring process is described in more detail in our hiring handbook.

Work remotely from anywhere in the world. Curious to see what that looks like? Check out our remote manifesto.

jobs.title: Director of Developer Relations
jobs.content:
As the Director of Developer Relations, you will be responsible for managing and building the team that focuses on supporting the GitLab community. You will help to make it easy to contribute to GitLab, help our community give feedback to our product and documentation, and help to create educational programs for GitLab.

Responsibilities

  • Build a global team to focus on the the developer experience of the GitLab community.
  • Lead the developer advocacy team.
  • Build and execute a plan for the growth of the team.
  • Lead the technical writing team as they focus on making the GitLab documentation and developer content machine scalable and educational.
  • Define and execute a plan for community meetups.
  • Work with the technical writing team and content marketing to plan and help create engaging developer content for our blog, video, social media, and other outlets.
  • Work with our content marketing manager and technical writing team to define a scalable tutorial and quickstart guide plan. Launch this plan.
  • Work with our product marketing lead to support our monthly release with developer education tools for the new features and products launching.
  • Focus on developer experience and how developer relations can help get user feedback into the product and documentation.
  • Work with the field marketing manager to support events efforts through developer advocacy.

Requirements

  • You were a full-time developer in a previous life but prefer to work with the developer community to improve experience and support through education.
  • Be creative. You’ve made people happy with your quirky campaigns.
  • You give a great keynote and have videos to prove it.
  • You’ve led and built a team before.
  • Excellent spoken and written English.
  • Familiar with Git, Ruby, and GitLab.
  • Is your college degree in French foreign politics with a minor in interpretive dance but you’ve been hacking together websites since you were 12? Perfect. We understand that your college degree isn’t the only thing that prepares you as a potential job candidate.
  • You are obsessed with making developers happy. You know that the slightest trouble in getting started with a product can ruin customer happiness.
  • You share our values, and work in accordance with those values.

Avoid the confidence gap; you do not have to match all the listed requirements exactly to apply. Our hiring process is described in more detail in our hiring handbook.

Work remotely from anywhere in the world. Curious to see what that looks like? Check out our remote manifesto.

jobs.title: Business Development Representative
jobs.content:
You love talking about GitLab to people and no question or challenge is too big or small. You have experience working directly with customers in order to answer questions on getting started with a technical product. Your job is to make sure our customers are successful, from the single-shop development firm all the way up to our Fortune 500 customers, and that everyone gets the appropriate level of support.

Responsibilities

  • Work with our demand generation manager to develop the proper qualifying questions for all type of customers. Be able to identify where a customer is in the sale and marketing funnel and take the appropriate action.
  • Work with our demand generation manager to follow the process from which leads pass onto sales, support, etc.
  • Work with our demand generation manager to document all processes in the handbook and update as needed.
  • Work closely with support to build a process where we can identify customers that would be interesting for EE and pass those onto sales.
  • Manage and help inbound requests to community@gitlab.com and sales@gitlab.com.
  • Work with our CMO and demand generation manager for all outbound messaging for demand campaigns.
  • Work with our demand generation manager and developer marketing manager to create a signup email campaign for all users of GitLab.com. The goal of this campaign is to introduce more users to our on-premises offerings.
  • Own the competitive analysis and comparison page for GitLab. Work closely with sales to identify new competitive technologies and systems and understanding the drawback and benefits.
  • Work closely with our developer marketing manager to identify customer stories from all of the conversations you have with our customers.

Requirements

  • Excellent spoken and written English
  • Experience in sales, marketing, or customer service
  • Experience with CRM and/or marketing automation software is highly preferred
  • An understanding of B2B software, Open Source software, and the developer product space is preferred
  • Is your college degree in French foreign politics with a minor in interpretive dance but you’ve been hacking together websites since you were 12? Perfect. We understand that your college degree isn’t the only thing that prepares you as a potential job candidate.
  • You are obsessed with making customers happy. You know that the slightest trouble in getting started with a product can ruin customer happiness.
  • Be ready to learn how to use GitLab and Git
  • Start part-time or full-time depending on situation
  • You share our values, and work in accordance with those values.

Avoid the confidence gap; you do not have to match all the listed requirements exactly to apply. Our hiring process is described in more detail in our hiring handbook.

Work remotely from anywhere in the world. Curious to see what that looks like? Check out our remote manifesto.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - .NET
jobs.content:
Ascend RMS is a complex, multi-tier application providing a retail management solution to independent bicycle dealers.  This position reports to the Ascend RMS manager of Software Development and provides expertise in developing, designing, enhancing, and maintaining applications.  


The position is focused, but not limited to, developing software for Microsoft .NET Web Applications using ASP.NET MVC deployed to Windows Azure Services. 


 The successful Software Engineer will:



  • Design, code, create test plans, test, debug and document applications

  • Communicate face-to-face with their peers and customers in a participatory environment

  • Ensure architectural, business, coding, design, and quality standards are adhered to

  • Be responsible for the quality and timeliness of their own work

  • Stay current with the latest technologies, methods and toolsBe self-motivated and require minimal supervision

You will collaborate, work hard, have fun, and build something game-changing while learning from your teammates.

jobs.title: Senior Windows Kernel Engineer
jobs.content:
About Barkly


We’re passionate about helping organizations feel and be more secure. Our mission is to bring enterprise-class security to all organizations by delivering a new type of protection for both laptop and desktop endpoint devices. We are implementing a SaaS-based, patents-pending solution that automatically recognizes and immediately disrupts new attacks not previously profiled.


We’re looking for individuals that bring deep technical expertise and a drive for making the world a safer place for commerce and community.


Your day to day:



  • Write high-quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage designed to detect and stop malware at the Windows kernel level.  You’ll be participating in all stages of software creation from design and architecture through deployment and support.

  • Participate in standups and contribute to all aspects of the agile development process from design to implementation to testing.

  • Contribute to and learn from an incredible team on the ground floor of a game-changing startup.

jobs.title: Senior Back-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Backend Engineer



Empirical is a digital product design agency headquartered in beautiful Portland, Oregon. We incorporate research & design to create great user experiences for our well-known clients – eg Jaguar Land Rover, Intel, Samsung, Dreamworks, etc.



Up to this point, our current development services have been mainly front-end, but we recently added full-stack development to our menu of offerings. We need you and your skills in back-end development to help get us there.



You will be a Sr. Engineer, working with our front-end developers on projects that require full stack development. You will interface with our client engineers, shore up our current development processes, work with internal and contract developers, help estimate projects, and generally be a technical badass.



Of course this means that you have a wide range of talents, skills and perspectives. Not only are you an amazing at back end dev but also have a great understanding of how the two-worlds of front-end & back-end interact. And let's not forget your voracious, never-ending appetite for new tech and how quickly you learn them, sometimes in a matter of days.



Here are some bullet lists for those of you that like them.



You will:



  • Work with our designers to create kickass user experiences in a wide array of industries and cutting edge technologies

  • Build solid solutions for our clients

  • Live in Portland and work out of our Portland offices



You have:



  • 5+ years of development experience (preferably in both agency AND product environments) with a track record of shipping clean code that other engineers might regard as poetry.

  • Some experience in Python

  • Some experience with Python web frameworks like Django and Flask

  • Experience working with cloud technologies

  • Understanding of modern web services and SOA

  • Knowledge of testing and continuous integration

  • Exposure to other languages and their ecosystems, especially Ruby and modern JavaScript

  • Experience communicating with clients in a manner which is honest, clear & respectful

  • Skills to organize yourself and projects so that nothing will fall through the cracks



You have experience in one or all of the following:



  • Ruby, JavaScript, C#, TypeScript, Elixir, etc

  • Apache, nginx, haproxy, node, etc

  • Celery, Beanstalk, SQS, etc

  • MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, memcache, etc

  • Heroku, Google App Engine, AWS, Docker, etc

  • Jenkins, Capistrano, Ansible, etc

  • Basecamp, Lighthouse, JIRA, Trac, Redmine, etc

  • Extreme Programming, Kanban, Scrum, etc

  • Command, Decorator, Actor, Template, Promise, Facade, etc




We offer:




  • The opportunity to work with a variety of clients and tech on interesting projects – eg, IoT, IVI systems, big data, etc. many projects will be cutting edge and secretive (seriously secretive! though not quite FBI-level, but you will be under NDA)

  • A very supportive environment with people who aren't afraid to tell you that you're awesome (well, because you are awesome.)

  • A flat hierarchy without micro-management. we want to get out of your way so you and others can operate at your best

  • A team of smart, talented people who work together to get stuff done. if we had egos, we would check them at the door

  • No cubicles, nor time cards, nor set hours – seriously, ...none ...never ...ever. just flexibility when you need it because Life Happens

  • A beautiful, hip office with views

  • A stocked refrigerator with snacks and drinks, and Friday happy hour

  • A freakin' fast Mac laptop and a big ol' monitor



When responding, be sure to include your github account (or similar) so we can see all of the cool projects to which you've been contributing. Also include a link to one of your favorite pages from xkcd.com or theoatmeal.com (we won't judge).


Thank you!

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Cambridge, MA
jobs.content:
Hopper is a travel startup based in Cambridge, MA and Montreal, QC.

We combine insightful research on massive data sets with intuitive design to help travellers make informed decisions about air travel.

We launched the Hopper app (iOS) at the end of January 2015. Since then, the app has been featured in outlets such as Mashable, TIME, Travel + Leisure, and Buzzfeed. In February, Apple featured Hopper in the App Store ("best new apps").

As a Software Engineer you'll work directly with Product Designers, other Developers and the CTO. You'll be part of a small team with big ambitions: delivering a delightful and powerful product that empowers travellers. We are a versatile full-stack development team. Were always looking for smart, adaptable engineers to help us build great things throughout our stack, which includes:

  • Mobile application development for iOS (Objective-C and Swift) and Android (Java).
  • Middle tier APIs, processing pipelines (Kafka, Storm, Spark) & web services (Finagle) in Scala.
  • Analytics on big data sets (trillions of rows) using Spark (Scala and Python), Hive and Hadoop.
  • Internal web applications using Play (Scala) and Javascript (AngularJS).
  • Development Operations (DevOps) for all of the above, using Mesos, Marathon and Ansible.

What youll do:

  • Write beautiful code: well designed, testable, efficient and maintainable.
  • Learn new languages, technologies and frameworks from one project to the next.
  • Work on a problem from design through to deployment and operations.
  • Collaborate with everyone in the company to solve tough technical and product problems.

***Please note: We are hiring for this position in both Montreal and Cambridge, this application is specifically for the Cambridge-based position. If you are applying for the position in Montreal, please click 'All Jobs' at the top of this page and select the Montreal opening.


Benefits


Compensation will be competitive including equity in an early stage startup backed by top-tier VCs (Atlas Venture, Brightspark and OMERS Ventures).

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Big Data Developer / Java Backend Developer
jobs.content:
.

RBC Investor and Treasury Services (I&TS) has developed a multi-year business transformation strategy, Advanced Client Engagement (ACE), that focuses on aligning our clients’ requirements with system enhancements designed to improve their overall experience, enhance operational efficiency and reduce risk. You will be part of a highly skilled agile team and work in a very collaborative environment where you will have continuous learning opportunities and challenging work. We are using continuous integration,  Hadoop based solution and leading edge architecture to quickly deliver a next-generation portal for our clients.

Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title.

What you will do?

•Design, develop and test a large-scale, custom distributed software system using latest Java and Big data technologies.

•Employ Agile development practices including test and deployment automation as well as Continuous Integration using Jenkins to improve overall execution speed and product quality.

•Be a technology advocate and share expertise with other team members.

•Be a key partner to the business and the rest of the team throughout the delivery cycle.

•Think through challenging and interesting problems and solve them with your team.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Haves:

•3+ years software development experience.

•Proficient with Java technologies and ecosystem: Java (6-8), Spring Suite, Maven, jUnit.

•Proficient experience using CI and automated testing tools such as Jenkins, Selenium.

•Knowledge of UNIX/Linux scripting languages.

•Experience using SCM tools such as SVN, & GIT.

Nice to have:

•Experience with Hadoop or understanding of its components (HDFS, Pig, Hive, HBase, Spark)

•Experience with data modeling and data management tools.

•Experience working in an agile environment.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

•A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.

•Leaders who support your development through training and study groups.

•Be a key enabler of RBC agile and technology transformation.

•Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.

•Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.

SFBD

About RBC
Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We employ approximately 78,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 39 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com.


Join our Talent Community
Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Its easy! Join our Talent Community and get the inside scoop on the jobs, career paths, and recruitment events that matter to you.


Diversity and Equal Opportunity Employment

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Arlington, Virginia
URL: www.TryHungry.com

Front End Developer
Arlington, Virginia
Job Type: Full-Time

Hungry, the first ever mobile marketplace connecting passionate foodies with local talented chefs just launched in Washington DC and is looking for a go-getter front-end web developer to join the team.  Do you want to push browsers to their limits with HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript? Do you have an eye for design and comfortably walk the line between front-end and back-end environments. Join HUNGRY on and help us build web apps and web services for a hot young start-up changing the way people eat round the world!

What you'll do:

  • Collaborate in the development of building HUNGRY’s web app service.
  • Create cross browser/platform compatible services in a team environment with Information Architects and Designers.
  • Implement and advocate for the use of standards based and semantic HTML and CSS to solve design problems.
  • Assess existing sites/systems for code quality and interactive appeal.
  • Evangelize for best practices for front-end development.
  • Create accessible dynamic interfaces with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Passionate about building world-class, cloud-based highly scalable API services.
  • Work with an agile team.

What you bring to the table:

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience.
  • Solid portfolio showing at least 2–3 small to medium level projects.
  • Deep understanding of HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript.
  • Ninja-like JavaScript abilities. Experience with Backbone.js preferred, knowledge of other frameworks such as Angular, React, Knockout, or Ember a plus.
  • An eye for design, developing highly responsive apps with Bootstrap and Sass.
  • A passion for writing testable, well-covered code.
  • Experience integrating with REST APIs.
  • Experience with local storage, IndexedDB, WebSQL.
  • Experience with push integration via websockets.
  • Experience with Node.js, Ruby-on-Rails a plus.
  • Experience with charting frameworks such as D3.js a plus.
  • Experience collaborating with others and working in small effective teams.

Why you’ll love it here:

  • All employees are owners.
  • Flexible work hours.
  • Fun environment & professional development.
  • Amazing, world-changing services you can check out here.
  • Great new office space overlooking the Clarendon Metro.
  • Choose your own rig and dev tools.
  • Early stage equity.
  • Flexible hours and remote work.
  • Coworkers are passionate about food and lots of Chef made dishes to try.

About HUNGRY
We at HUNGRY have a dream, a dream of returning fresh and delicious fresh-cooked gourmet meals to the dining tables of America. Through our innovative mobile food marketplace, HUNGRY is revolutionizing the world of fresh food. We connect foodies craving delicious, freshly-cooked meals with ambitious local professional chefs eager to unleash their talents in a whole new way.

To apply: Shy@TryHungry.com

jobs.title: Cloud Software Architect
jobs.content:
The Position


Prophix is expanding its business and driving innovations in our industry, together with customers. In order to expand and take our software to the next level, we are now searching for key personnel to contribute to Prophix’s software development team. 


As a Software Architect for cloud solutions, you will be a part of the team leading the company’s cloud/SaaS technology development and contributing to the development of future offerings. You will have the opportunity to participate in shaping the company’s future through collaboration with highly skilled domain experts and developers, alongside dedicated leaders.


Tasks



  • Lead the work selecting the technologies and patterns needed for supporting the future business needs.

  • Help shape the software platform to equally serve on-premise and cloud based customer needs.

  • Advise the business units in the company on strategic paths involving technology choices, and how to balance the combination of business and technology.

  • Be a software architect mentor to the rest of the engineering team.

  • Work in cross-functional agile teams to produce and release new applications, features, and enhancements to improve the user experience, applying a full understanding of software engineering discipline and industry best practices.

  • Design and rapidly prototype proposed solutions.

  • Work closely with senior development team members on major architecture projects, including design and implementation, along with reviewing functional and technical requirements.

jobs.title: Software Security and Compliance Specialist
jobs.content:
The Software Security & Compliance Specialist is part of the core engineering team(s) and is responsible for performing, evaluating, and supporting Prophix Cloud application security policy, assisting in the execution of source code audits, supporting the business with IT Security related tasks, managing development security related projects, and assisting on the day-to-day information security operational objectives.   As a Software Security & Compliance Specialist, you will:



  • Ensure that Prophix’s software protects its customer’s information and financial data from unauthorized access, inappropriate use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

  • Provide guidance and independent evaluation of the software/code to management through various reporting streams.

  • Handle the day to day management of Audit/Testing on internal controls, remediation where possible, and the escalation of issues.

  • Forge strong relationships within the business, especially in areas where diplomacy is needed to help ensure that new policies and procedures gain the support they need to be adopted by the organization.

  • Proactively offer internal security consulting on policy, baselines standards and best practices to business functions and Development/QA teams.
