jobs.title: EdTech Developer - Help schools make the most of technology for learning.
jobs.content:
Imagine you could save every teacher in a school one hour a week. Instead of an hour of drudgery, they could be preparing their lessons, teaching or actually having a life outside the classroom. At Firefly, you can help do exactly that.


Firefly is a highly-regarded learning platform used by hundreds of schools worldwide to create, share and learn. We combine easy content creation with deep school integration to make a useful tool for class work, homework, and coursework. We’ve grown organically but rapidly over the last decade, and are on track to continue doing so.


As an established company serving many customers and integrating with a variety of other services, we’re continually learning how apply best practices to existing code, whilst still deploying new features and bug fixes for teachers and students every two weeks. We're currently focusing on getting better at separating of concerns and building up an automated testing suite. We’re also improving the speed and reliability of our infrastructure, and trying new technologies to keep current (e.g. Swift and React).


There are four main things we are looking for at Firefly:



  • skill: your colleagues would say you get things done. You work to a high standard, and know about and apply appropriate best practices in your work. You are at home with improving and extending existing code as well as new development.

  • a desire to learn: despite (or perhaps because of) you being good at what you do, you want to get better. You seek out best practices, new ideas, honest feedback, and unknown areas of code, in order to know more and work better.

  • understanding: Our product team is great but not infallible. You’ll be happy to challenge and clarify product decisions with our users’ best interests at heart. Similarly, our QA team is meticulous but not your babysitter. You’ll be handing something polished to QA, not throwing the first thing that compiles over the wall. Overall, everyone at Firefly shares responsibility for the product making sense and being of high quality.

  • clear communication: We have a lightweight process, so most days, other than a morning standup meeting to share what’s going on and what’s planned, you’ll be responsible for your time. This also means that, when there are issues, you need to inform the right people, explain what’s going wrong, and help get things resolved and moving forward again.


Speaking of process, we have a design team who handle HTML and CSS, a product and UX team who produce clear specifications, a QA team to help us build things well, and a two-week sprint cycle for getting things done. Other than that, we’re pretty small-a agile and are happy to try things out to see what helps.


In terms of experience, we have one essential requirement:



  • You are comfortable with iOS or a web platform.


Our server-side code is written in C# and our web front end has some Javascript, so you’ll need to know these or be able to pick them up. We work as generalists, so experience of any of the following would be a positive:



  • Experience with: Android, Windows Phone, shell scripting

  • Knowledge and experience of infrastructure automation

  • Detailed knowledge of databases, particularly SQL Server


We offer competitive salaries dependent on experience. All of Firefly participate in a yearly bonus scheme based on the success of the business and their contribution. We’re committed to everyone’s professional development, so we offer a flexible training budget for you to spend on attending training courses or other events. In development, we have a weekly lunch-and-learn to hear about new topics and a Kaizen day for self-improvement and experimentation every fortnight.


So, if you’ve got an interest in education and a desire to learn your craft alongside others making the same journey, we want to hear from you.


About us


We're small, which means we can stay close to our clients and develop and improve our products very quickly to meet their needs. It also means you'll get great exposure to all of the things that go on in a fast growing business, and have a chance to have a big impact very quickly. We're also quite a close-knit team, so we're keen to find somebody with good social skills who would enjoy and thrive in this environment. Read about our values to find out more about what we all have in common.


We're based in Hammersmith, West London, very close to Hammersmith Station.

jobs.title: Front End Developer

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
We are an innovative and technology led software company who produce awesome casino and bingo gaming content in an agile manner and using best practice techniques and approaches.


We are looking to expand our team in line with growth across other areas of our business. The current team is a good mix of graduate, mid, and senior level developers, ­and for this role we are looking for an experienced senior developer with excellent technical skills, strong leadership & communication capabilities, and commercial exposure to web development that can help to drive our team forward.


We are looking for people who are passionate about producing good quality products and keen to contribute positively to the productive and fun working environment we’ve established at Bede.


Successful applicants will enjoy a productive yet relaxed working culture, highly skilled colleagues, company­ paid training and certifications, and being involved in a company where talent and passion is richly rewarded. This is a very exciting opportunity to learn the latest and greatest tools used to deliver compelling casino experiences, with our current toolstack consisting of cutting edge technologies such as ES6, SASS & websockets.


We offer an excellent package including matched pension contributions, BUPA healthcare, mobile phone and a modern forward­ thinking work environment.

jobs.title: Senior Art Director, Books
jobs.content:
Callisto Media, one of Publishers Weekly’s fastest-growing U.S. publishers, is seeking a talented full-time Senior Art Director. Callisto is a fast-paced and successful startup at the forefront of a new publishing venture, creating books in Cooking, Health, Diet, Business, Crafts, Reference, and Fitness, among other genres. The Senior Art Director position is an exciting opportunity to be a part of our growing team of award-winning Designers. The ideal candidate has proven experience creating book covers and interiors, solid skills in managing freelancers and junior design staff, and an established track record in collaborating successfully with in-house editorial teams. Please view a sample of our books at the following link (optimized for Safari): https://sites.google.com/a/callistomedia.com/callisto-media-creative/

Responsibilities
• Report to the Vice President, Design and collaborate closely with Design and Editorial colleagues
• Support Vice President, Design in providing mentorship and design guidance to the Team
• Assist in implementing Design Department initiatives
• Create book designs to conform to company-defined objectives
• Produce cover mechanicals and print-ready files
• Manage freelance designers, illustrators, and photographers in executing books and contributing art
• Create and adapt interior design templates, help manage typesetters, and review composed pages
• Adhere to demanding design schedules
• Provide support to Supervisors and fellow Designers on additional production, design, and
administrative tasks

Desired Skills and Experience
• At least 3 years art direction experience
• At least 2 years experience managing junior in-house design staff
• Proven experience in book design, preferably in Trade publishing
• Excellent attention to detail
• Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
• Extensive knowledge of typography and proper typesetting conventions
• Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
• Superior organizational skills with ability to multi-task, prioritize assignments, and meet tight deadlines
• Ability to take initiative while also working collaboratively with Design and Editorial colleagues
• Adaptability in a fast-paced and dynamic startup environment
• Expert proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign
• Bachelor’s degree in graphic design or equivalent education and experience
• ebook design and production skills a plus

Callisto Media offers a competitive salary, full benefits, stock options, and a friendly working environment. This is a full-time, onsite position at our office in Berkeley, California. Please submit a resume, digital samples of your work or your online portfolio, salary requirements, and a cover letter describing why you are an ideal candidate.

Please be advised that only candidates with demonstrated book design experience will be considered for this position.

jobs.title: Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
Independent School Management (ISM) is seeking a highly motivated and talented Web Application Developer to join our Software Development Team and help implement a wide variety of cutting-edge web applications.



Who we’re looking for



  • A person who is excited to start new projects, and is passionate about Web Development

  • A team-oriented developer who knows that open communication should be the only form of communication

  • A flexible developer who is organized and can manage multiple projects and timelines on any given day

  • Someone who is willing to dive in and help out the team with every opportunity

  • A forward-thinking developer who thinks that thorough comments and documentation are equally important as readable code

  • A person who can help take a project from design to launch

  • Someone who can help gather and interpret project requirements and bring them to life

  • An eager developer who wants to expand their web chops by experimenting, reading, and asking questions, in that order

  • Someone who wants to research, share, learn, and teach the newest ideas and technologies

  • A developer who enjoys solving difficult problems through careful thought and deliberation with others

  • A person who loves to discuss nerdy things



The perks



  • Competitive compensation package

  • Open, relaxed atmosphere

  • Casual dress code

  • Industry standard and modern development tools and environments

  • Professional development opportunities



The technical stuff



  • B.A. or B.S. in a related field preferred

  • At least 2 years experience in the field

  • Experience working in a team

  • Experience with relational databases and server-side programming required

  • Experience with Javascript

  • A firm understanding of Object-Oriented Programming

  • Experience with version control



Other things we’d love to see



  • Experience with PHP and MySQL

  • Experience with or knowledge of RESTful web services

  • Experience with HTML5 and CSS3

  • Experience with Git, Vagrant, Grunt/Gulp

  • Experience with CSS/Sass, jQuery, AngularJS

  • Experience with Linux servers



Want to join our team? — we want to hear from you!

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Pair programming, Agile, Test Driven Development
jobs.content:
Pivotal Labs: We Transform Ideas into Software.


As a recognized leader in highly disciplined agile software development practices, Pivotal Labs has been building high reliability software for over 20 years. We build consumer and enterprise web and mobile applications for global clients, and have a growing practice building applications for the iOS and Android platforms. We also developed Pivotal Tracker, the project management and collaboration tool used by thousands of software developers worldwide.



We Can Go Fast Forever.
 
We pair program, all day, every day because we know it delivers remarkable results. We practice and teach an approach to software engineering that applies across industries and organizations, so you’ll experience all types of teams, products, and technologies. And we believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge and refocus.
 
We Court Perfection.
 
Working at Pivotal means you get better at what you already do well. We set up regular retrospectives to figure out what we're doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we're doing right so we can improve on it. We consistently practice Test Driven Development, which results in high-quality, reliable and more maintainable code. And we believe that methodical, steady, relentless forward momentum drives consistent results.
 
Get Breakfast Everyday. And Get Paid to Master The Latest Technologies.
 
To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks are available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded Pivots who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers on beer night.



What we do.




  • Pair program, all day, every day.




  • Experience all types of teams, products, and technologies.




  • Regular retrospectives to figure out what we’re doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we’re doing right so we can improve on it.




  • Test Driven Development.




  • Collaborative, open-plan office space




  • Weekly Tech Talks, ping pong, and other social events.




  • Free Breakfast everyday weekday and unlimited snacks.





What We’re Looking For




  • Strong knowledge of Java / Go / Ruby and/or other programming languages



  • Strong knowledge of Spring and/or similar frameworks


  • 3+ years of relevant work experience




  • Strong communication skills and interest in a pair-programming environment




  • Passion for growing your skills, tackling interesting work and challenging problems



  • Exceptional software engineering knowledge; OO Design Principles


  • Experience in test first development and pair programming a plus




  • Experience in web front-end development a plus




  • Experience deploying to cloud environments a plus



  • English fluency is a must, and ideally you speak fluent French also



Interested in becoming a Pivot? We’re seeking amazing developers to grow our Paris office which is opening soon. Apply by sending us a CV and a cover letter.

jobs.title: Linux System/Driver Developer
jobs.content:
Cloud Platform Group at Intel is looking for a person to work on pathfinding projects in the area of compute offloading and compute acceleration in a cloud. Big part of considered area of acceleration spans image and voice recognition and HW Neural Networks implementation and learning. We are seeking a software engineer who is highly motivated, creative and innovative, and has a strong passion for designing, developing and implementing new software running driving Intel Hardware. An engineer who has a good understanding of low level software engineering mainly based on Linux Operating system. As a member of the team you will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and maintaining device drivers and Operating System that support the Intel chipsets. You will have an opportunity to work very closely with internal and external stakeholders.



Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:



  • Collaborate with business and other technical leaders to clearly understand business objectives, customer needs, and product requirements. Create requirements documents.

  • Research on acceleration technologies that push the boundaries and capabilities of the current software solutions in the area of machine learning, visual and audio processing, security, coding/decoding.

  • Actively participating in all major stages of software development lifecycle, e.g. create high and low level design documents, scope tasks and provide SW estimates, complete implementation and code reviews, unit-test and validate the code

  • Design and implement automated HW-SW integration tests, execute them and report results .

  • Work in an efficient manner with no assistance from the supervisor

  • Work in a diverse team environment, as well as independently

  • Occasionally travelling to and assisting the customers or other Intel teams located across the globe

jobs.title: Drone Software Engineer / UI designer

Formed by a recent acquisition, we are a small but successful startup within Intel and operate in a highly dynamic and largely independent environment. We are looking for a passionate UI/UX Designer Drone Applications to help us build our next generation platforms.

Our flight platforms are our universal platforms to collect and generate data. Software turns this data into meaningful knowledge. Starting from the product idea, you will be part of a team that creates new solutions for existing and for future customers. You will be part of one of the most exciting trends in the industry, creating products for diverse and highly sought-after solutions. Since we are able to operate like a small independent unit within Intel, we offer flat hierarchies, fast decision making and great atmosphere combined with the benefits of a competitive compensation.

jobs.title: Implementation Engineer
jobs.content:
InFlight is looking for an Implementation Engineer who understands the root causes of the problem, delivers a full resolution to the customer, and makes strategic recommendations to the developers. A hybrid support person who does so much more, including work on other development and process-improvement projects as needed. 


What we do


At InFlight, we believe that multimillion dollar enterprise software can and should be every bit as easy-to-use as a $1 smartphone app.


InFlight modernizes and mobilizes business critical enterprise applications for Fortune 500 customers, giving them full control over the user experience.


Our technology is unique in the market and enables customers to completely re-imagine cumbersome and complicated applications to put users first and make it easier for them to complete tasks.


Thanks to InFlight, there are currently over 1 million users who are now more productive and more engaged with the software they rely on to do their jobs.


So what do we need? Someone who wants to:



  • Participate in our team-based sales process (setting up compelling customer-specific demo environments, analyzing customer requirements to determine our product’s suitability, etc.)

  • Install and configure InFlight products in customer environments

  • Help build installer scripts (or helping augment customer-provided installer scripts) for migrations to Production and pre-Production environments

  • Manage the InFlight customer support portal and associated processes

  • Take ownership of customer reported issues and resolving them without the need for escalation

  • Document troubleshooting and problem resolution steps

  • Provide training to customers as needed

  • Champion best-practices to help make InFlight “harder, better, faster, stronger”

jobs.title: Senior / Lead SQL Developer

Exceedra is seeking experienced developers to become either Senior or Lead SQL Developers, who have created robust and scalable OLTP or Data Warehouse solutions.


Candidates should have multi-year experience in both TSQL and Stored Procedures. While experience in either SSIS or SSAS is an advantage, cross-training in relevant BI technologies will be available for successful candidates from a pure OLTP background.


Bringing development experience and best practice to Exceedra’s EMEA Delivery team, Senior and Lead Developers will be accountable for significant portions of projects spanning multiple clients. This will include discussing and agreeing requirements before designing and implementing solutions using the SQL Server stack, ensuring high quality standards are achieved throughout.


Senior and Lead Developers can expect to be recognised as subject matter experts, have leading roles on projects, and mentor junior staff on a day to day basis.


They will report directly to, and be supported by, the Technical Principal (EMEA).


Role Responsibilities:



  • Use analytical, problem solving and engineering skills to deliver solutions built upon Exceedra’s award-winning technology stack.

  • Own significant parts of client implementations, and ensure their high quality.

  • Be responsible for the timely delivery of multiple concurrent projects.

  • Proactively identify risks to implementations, suggesting appropriate remedial actions.

  • Follow internal processes, methodology and best practices, contributing to their continued evolution.

  • Understand the Exceedra technology stack from both a technical and business perspective.

  • Develop your own skillset and that of the team around you, providing expert advice on all areas of the SQL Server stack.

  • Liaise directly with Project Manager, stakeholders and other team members to ensure a common understanding of task progress.

jobs.title: Senior Java
jobs.content:
Our IT-Team takes care of the concept and realization of our web application. We continuously develop our online loan marketplace and implement new product features. Currently we are looking for a really experiencedJava professional who (1) wants to take engineering responsibility for a new financial product. Who (2) knows, that engineering is about supporting business and (3) not choosing the newest framework just because it’s new. 


If you think you could handle the mentioned challenges successfully, please keep on reading. Otherwise please skip.



Team insights



  • https://www.smava.de/Bilder/development_infographic.png

  • https://www.smava.de/jobs/project/it/


Our backend techstack



  • JavaSpring (DI, Security, Scheduling, Tx)

  • PostgreSQL

  • JUnit

  • maven

  • ActiveMQ 

  • Apache CXF


What we would like you to do



  • Take engineering responsibility for a new financial product with option for Teamlead position

  • Support FE developers in your team with mechanisms to obtain and manipulate data

  • Pick up requirements from PM and Architects and turn them into execution plan

  • Integrate 3rd party systems into the platform

  • Deliver high quality code to Release Management team

  • Be a part of one of the full-stack teams working according to Scrumban  principles

  • Nothing more nothing less


How we would like you to do it



  • Implement REST endpoints to query, manipulate and persist data

  • Implement Spring based services that handle business logic

  • Adjust database to store required information

  • Control access rights using Spring Security

  • Make sure that frequently accessed information is cached in ehcache

  • Work in Confluence with our architects on implementation concept

  • Split epics and user stories in JIRA into specific tickets with precise estimation

  • Generate SOAP service stubs and Data Types from WSDL using Apache CXF

  • Implement secure communication with 3rd parties

  • Make sure that our system is not overloaded and is distributed using ActiveMQ

  • Ensure data consistency by controlling transactions scope

  • Submit your code to your feature branch in our Git repository

  • Manage Jenkins jobs to deliver your code in QA

  • Manage dependencies of multi-module maven project to build in fail-safe and timely fashion


Some real life examples



  • REST endpoint with CRUD operations on Loan Adviser - Lead relationship is created

  • Spring beans that autowire DAOs and perform entities manipulation

  • PostgreSQL Tables creation and adjustment

Contact

Claudia Heilmann; mail: claudia.heilmann@axelspringer.de

jobs.title: System Engineer
jobs.content:
BESTSELLER E-commerce is all about technology and fashion. We are currently looking for an experienced ‘System Engineer’ who is passionate about building and maintaining the platforms to support our E-Commerce operations and functionality. With more than 100 colleagues from all over the world our E-commerce business is constantly growing.


The department and the position


As a System Engineer you will be part of a strong tech team, based in our Ecommerce headquarters in the centre of Amsterdam. Here you will find a young, fast-paced and agile environment and you will play a key role in leading the way to help BESTSELLER E-commerce push for quality systems and high converting websites in 12 countries and for more than 17 different brands, such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, JUNAROSE, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, Y.A.S, ADPT. and more.


We have high standards and expectations for our E-commerce operations group and are looking for disciplined responsible engineers that take personal pride in scalability, availability, and automation.


Specific Job Responsibilities:



  • Function as a technical generalist responsible for the overall health and performance of our technology including both platforms and tooling

  • Build and maintain technical infrastructure using configuration management and automation.

  • Responsible for continuity of both infrastructure and application landscape (security, disaster recovery, availability)

  • Responsible for software deployments and the availability and maintainability of our technical ecosystem.

  • Monitor the inner working and performance of our technical systems

  • Work with development teams to harden, enhance, document, and generally improve the operability of our systems

  • Adopt the DevOps way of working and become familiar with corresponding tooling

jobs.title: Backend developer
jobs.content:
Are you the engineer, who is all about continuous delivery, XP and building high traffic software? Do you want to be part of a dynamic and fast-growing fashion E-commerce department? Then we are looking for you!


As our new Backend Engineer you will be part of our E-commerce department in the centre of Amsterdam, where you will be working together with more than 100 colleagues from all over the world in a young, fast-paced and agile environment. You will play a key role within our Amsterdam office, leading the way to help BESTSELLER E-commerce push quality of the systems to the next level. In the technology team you will, together with your colleagues, ensure that we improve and maintain our E-commerce platform, omni-channel initiatives and our backend systems, such as our Order Management System.


Moreover, your tasks will include:



  • Building new features into different micro services within our AWS architecture

  • Conducting code reviews and writing automated tests

  • Defining improvements for the application(s) you’re working on 

  • Implement Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices

  • Defining improvements to our way of working

  • Sharing knowledge with your team members

  • Fixing bugs and analyse errors using all available information and tools


Why work for us?


Sound interesting?  Besides being a challenging and inspiring place to work, we value a good work atmosphere and equally offer good benefits. To this extent, you can think off an excellent daily lunch made by a professional cook, a ‘fit for less’ plan, regular Friday events with colleagues and on a monthly basis our own office games, the ‘BSE Olympics’. Last but not least, we have employees from all over the world and encourage international candidates to apply. If applicable, we will assist you in relocation formalities, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.

jobs.title: Backbone Network Engineer - GNS Core Services
jobs.content:
This position will be responsible for daily operations and engineering within Core Network Services, supporting Apple’s MPLS backbone as well as its extensive edge connectivity. The successful candidate will demonstrate leadership and collaboration skills in working both with other IS&T organizations and their peers to build and maintain the networking infrastructure. They will need to develop and maintain clear documentation and procedures associated with designing and implementing new deployments, provisioning new circuits, and sustaining operations. This position provides the opportunity to build and manage a world-wide, multivendor network that includes metro and long haul optical interconnectivity.


Description


This position will support and implement Apple’s backbone network to address a wide variety of business challenges. The candidate will need to excel in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with the ability to multi-task and provide not only operational support but work closely with members of the Core Services team to provide solutions to grow our network infrastructure. This position requires a collaborative team player who will work in cross-functional groups and have the ability and willingness to work with others. The responsibilities also include updating and maintaining existing networks to current standards, sustaining operations, and contributing to technical documentation. The position includes participation in an on-call (7x24) support rotation with other members of the global network team. This person will need to obsess over the customer experience and to drive operational excellence in every aspect of their work. In addition to the technical networking skills, this position also requires strong people skills and an individual who enjoys the dynamic nature of Apple’s environment.

jobs.title: 7.5TB per day read from our production MongoDB cluster - Help us scale up!
jobs.content:
DevOps Engineer


Sky Betting and Gaming aims to bring the excitement of sports betting, casino, poker and bingo to a rapidly growing number of customers in the betting and gaming market. Through our close relationships with Sky Sports we can provide a unique opportunity to deliver a real experience that makes us stand out in the online gaming sector.   We're striving to be the best digital business in the UK and we're well on our way, this year we've been nominated as one of The Sunday Times Top 100 companies to work for as well as bagging a handful of accolades at the 2015 EGR awards and we're not planning on slowing down anytime soon! From our base in Leeds and across all our sites, we are experiencing rapid growth and are constantly looking for the best talent to help us in our continued success. Are you in?


If you have the right skills and experience, DevOps at SB&G is where we will test it all.  We bridge Delivery and Service Operations.  We sit with the devs, but we are on-call for the services.  We work with the Platform team and 3rd parties.


If you join us, you'll:
•    Be on-call sometimes 24x7 for the main sites and applications
•    Support internal development, test environments and help the devs
•    Own the release of internal code and push out config changes
•    Help automate things and bring older systems and processes forward
•    Be a guardian of code quality, helping the devs to make not just good features, but good systems
•    Set up monitoring for everything in sight - if it moves, graph it
•    Be a point of contact into Operations for various teams


We're looking for a developer with sys-admin war stories, or a sys-admin who can get into the code up to their elbows.  Mainly you need to know your stuff.


Data management - SQL, NoSQL, size, performance - these are mere details; you can make the data dance and the engine hum.


Code - you can branch, code, test, (code, test, code, test…), commit and deploy across a complex estate on just one cup of coffee.


Scaling - you can take a server's temperature, read a load-balancer, you know when to throw tin at it and when to go back to the code.


Automation - you understand the quandary of Chef vs Puppet, and you've had to choose; you know Jenkins' little foibles; your bash skills are strong.


Source - you have a favourite source-control system, a least favourite and the one you love to hate, but mainly you can handle the codebase no matter the size.


Systems - you know your Linux, know your sar from your iostat, you can nurse a sick server back to health in the wee small hours and find out how to make a given application fly…


Experience - whether you've been there and done that or are relatively junior, you've learned from every twist and turn and never tire of new things.  We will consider junior, senior and in-betweeners.


Systems we use


We want you to help manage the LAMP stack but there's other things too - Mongo, Redis and Memcached, RabbitMQ, Tomcat.  There's a lot of internally-written systems.


We write our code in PHP and Javascript, making heavy use of NodeJS.  There's the usual mixture of bash, a little Python, some Ruby.  We use TrafficScript.  Source control is Git.


We have OpenBet systems for the gaming side.  We use Rundeck, Chef, Graphite, Opsview, Splunk, Hadoop, TeaLeaf, Riverbed Stingrays.


We're a RHEL/CentOS house.


As a valued employee you will benefit from Free Sky+HD premium package, an excellent Pension Scheme, Private Health Care together with a range of other benefits to help you make valuable tax and national insurance savings.


Grow with Sky Betting and Gaming


37.5 hour working week

jobs.title: Page content can change 750 times per second; 25 million times per day. Can you?
jobs.content:
PHP Software Engineers


Sky Betting and Gaming aims to bring the excitement of sports betting, casino, poker and bingo to a rapidly growing number of customers in the betting and gaming market. Through our close relationships with Sky Sports we can provide a unique opportunity to deliver a real experience that makes us stand out in the online gaming sector.   We're striving to be the best digital business in the UK and we're well on our way, this year we've been nominated as one of The Sunday Times Top 100 companies to work for as well as bagging a handful of accolades at the 2015 EGR awards and we're not planning on slowing down anytime soon! From our base in Leeds and across all our sites, we are experiencing rapid growth and are constantly looking for the best talent to help us in our continued success. Are you in?


Your Responsibilities



  • Reporting to the Lead Software Engineer, you will deliver first-class software solutions, which are secure, unit tested, perform well, and help provide a thrilling customer experience

  • Implement highly modular and refactorable components across a horizontally scalable application framework designed to maximise reuse across multiple channels.


  • Actively participate in and lead application design, database design, data-flows and detailed technical design.  Ensure that analysis includes the wider view of technical and business impact. 




  • Deliver software solutions to specification and on-schedule that are cost effective and fit for purpose.




  • Work with Product Owners and Business Analysts to propose, analyse and negotiate business requirements, and translate them into technical requirements.




  • Participate in the definition of scope of projects and estimates of timescales for development and maintenance work.




  • Analyse functional and non-functional requirements to determine their impact on technical systems.




  • Work with Software Engineers to balance the commercial needs of the business against the ideal technical design, proposing sound phased or tactical implementations where appropriate.




  • Produce accurate and unambiguous functional and technical documentation of products, systems and services prior to and during development.




  • Proactively suggest ways to improve the quality of software releases. Work with the Scrum Master and Engineering Manager to ensure that development follows an agreed waterfall or agile model throughout the delivery of an individual project.  Ensure that project reports are accurate and reflect known risks and issues to enable progress to be properly reported.




  • Actively support the implementation of continuous integration to enhance deployment processes in line with SB&G delivery/release evolution plans.




  • Define and implement best-practice solutions within the team




Skills & Experience



  • A relevant degree or equivalent experience.

  • Commercial experience of internet application development, to include a proven understanding of browser behaviour and issues.

  • Knowledge of Portals and Content Management Systems.

  • An understanding of building high traffic/high load applications.

  • Exposure to web application security practices.

  • A strong understanding of application design and architecture, including database interactions, server-side scripting, form handling and general application development.

  • Good knowledge of internet and networking technologies and protocols, including HTTP, TCP, IP.

  • Strong understanding of using SDLC methods and processes, including Agile development methods (Scrum/Kanban/XP), TDD, automated builds and continuous integration.

  • Commercial experience of OO development and design patterns.

  • Commercial experience of designing and developing software in an online business.

  • High availability (24×7×365) web systems experience.


As a valued employee you will benefit from Free Sky+HD premium package, an excellent Pension Scheme, Private Health Care together with a range of other benefits to help you make valuable tax and national insurance savings.


Grow with Sky Betting and Gaming

jobs.title: Senior Devops Engineer
jobs.content:
Role: Senior Devops Engineer


Date issued: 14 June 2016


Full Time Post


Salary: £58,000 to £68,000 incl London Weighting


Citizens Advice, based in Central London near St Paul’s, have made the strategic decision to move to Ruby as our de facto open source development language. As we build our new digital development capability and transition from PHP, we require a Devops Engineer who will report to our Head of Software Engineering as we build a fantastic engineering team.


This is an exciting time as you will have an opportunity  to assist in the direction of this important national charity as the team is scaled up . We have a number of exciting internally and externally customer facing digital projects with opportunities for R&D Fridays and creative thinking.    


We help change millions of people’s lives each year. And we need your help to make even more difference.


Why should I choose Citizens Advice?




  • A competitive salary 26 days paid holiday (on top of public holidays), up to 6.5% employer pension contributions.




  • The technology - it's always the latest stuff and forward looking. We are full AWS and deployed Google Enterprise for work across all 6 of our core offices in the UK.




  • Developers kit. Every developer has a Macbook Pro and whatever else we can provide to help you get the job done.




  • Our office is open plan and a great place to work.  




  • We will invest in your personal technical development to keep your skills sharp and encourage you to attend conferences covering the latest techniques to improve yourself  and the team.




  • We are flexible with one or two days of remote working from home.




  • We recognise the benefits of R&D time and opportunity to work on Alpha products.




  • Our great digital products help more than 22m users a year to solve their problems, and make a proven difference in people’s  lives.




Who We are?




  • A leading non-profit with more than 20,000 staff and volunteers in the wider service, and over 2,500 locations.




  • Awesome reach: 22 million people engage with our public facing web sites, and 6.2 million issues are handled in person locally.




  • Amazing customer satisfaction: 95% of our clients say they would recommend us.




  • We have a diverse digital portfolio of consumer products across different areas and markets, including money advice, consumer tools, witness service.




  • Citizens Advice is responsible for listening to people’s experiences, collecting data and then helping the government to instigate reform, as well as helping the millions of people across the UK desperately in need of advice.




What’s our tech?


We spend a lot of time picking and refining the right tools:




  • Our tech stack includes Docker, Jenkins, Chef, Ansible, Git, Elastic Search, Redis, Postgres, MySQL, Ruby, PHP, Ubuntu, Amazon Linux, AWS, CloudFormation, EC2, S3, CloudFront, Serverspec, New Relic




  • We have a road map for continuous deployments and ultimately continuous delivery across all of our digital products.




  • We use GitHub, Atlassian,  Invision, Slack, Google Hangouts et al to stay organised and in touch.




  • We are fully agile using either scrum or kanban.




  • Our approach to testing is to use the best practices for BDD/TDD.





Candidates must be eligible to work in the UK without Visa Sponsorship

jobs.title: Senior PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Helloprint: the most attractive work environment of the Netherlands


Tired of busy offices, where marketing and customer service frequently interrupt you during complex programming? Working with cheap hardware and an OS which does not suit you, while the HR department imposes difficult procedures and salary scales which do not take your teams and your individual performance into account? Working for a manager who doesn’t know the difference between Java and JavaScript? Tired of all the bullshit management, unnecessary rules and lack of courage and creativity?


At Helloprint we can imagine that. Our board is formed by guys and girls like you! Therefore, we dare to say that the work environment we provide, is quite simply the most attractive in the Netherlands:



  • The most amazing office location: at the heart of Rotterdam, in the middle of the Witte de With street (next to Blender). Bad for your health, great for the atmosphere;

  • Flexible working hours (between 07:00 am and 21:00 pm)

  • High-end laptop and/or desktop with OS of your choice and 2 monitors.


Work hard, play hard


Ok, that sounds cool. But print? Isn’t that a boring business? Well, not at Helloprint. You may know us from our label ‘Drukzo’. With a young and highly motivated team Helloprint develops innovative business models at lightning speed, renewing the market continuously. You might think print is a boring business in an ancient culture, but at Helloprint it is anything but. Meet the most ambitious start-up of the Netherlands:



  • We currently have about 100 colleagues and grow by 10 to 15 employees each month;

  • Our tech team is large and diverse enough to learn from each other, but small enough to have a serious impact on results and outcomes;

  • The average age of our team is 29 years;

  • We are the fastest growing e-commerce business in the Benelux countries;

  • An international environment which allows you to grow at rapid pace. With offices in Rotterdam and Valencia and very soon in France;

  • Fast career growth: individual development plans, fast routes-to-success, Zend Certification and conferences such as Laracon and PHPcon;

  • The possibility to grow incredibly fast in our organization and make it to our board. Seriously, our whole board is formed by guys like you;

  • Freedom, responsibility and creativity. At Helloprint, you decide how you fulfill your job yourself. We are quite different in this compared to other companies, to be frank, because we truly belief in responsibility;

  • We offer good salaries and great bonus schemes which can exceed 35 % of you yearly salary. We love to share when we have success and hard work and success will pay off;

  • We pride ourselves for our parties and work trips. ‘Work hard, play hard’ is our motto.


Invent, develop and challenge!


Invent, develop and challenge the market, that's your job. As a software engineer you are fully responsible and informed of all business flows within the Helloprint platform. You know all the ins and outs of the supporting processes. You’ll build new cool elements and consider it a sport to get them live. You know what to do in case of escalation and provide guidance to internal and external customers.

jobs.title: Front End Web Developer
jobs.content:
Who We Are:
Outdoor Voices is an active lifestyle brand. We believe in freeing fitness from performance, and embrace activity with ease, humor, and delight. We feel that Doing Things – moving your body and having fun with friends – outlasts a win when it comes to inspiring sustainably active lives. Our mission is to get people out there and Doing Things together, to redefine recreation as part of everyday life.

Our Story:
Outdoor Voices Founder and CEO Tyler Haney was always an athlete, but stopped resonating with the neon/black/mesh apparel on the market and the harder, faster, stronger mentality that went with it. She realized that what inspired her to stay active was completely different – more balanced, fun, and freeing – than the pressure to perform that once fueled her competitive edge. While studying at Parsons School of Design, she became obsessed with technical fabrics and shortly after graduation set out to create a new category of activewear.

Our Position:
Freeing fitness from performance.

Our Promise:
Technical Apparel for Recreation.

Our Purpose:
To spark bonds through activity and redefine recreation as part of everyday life.

Our Team:
We’re casual joggers, dog walkers, hikers, dribble-dribblers, and team players who integrate activity into everything we do –from product design to team culture. Our goal is to grow the OV Community by participating in it, to inspire Doing Things together by Doing Things, together.

About the role:

We're seeking a front end web developer to help us build and expand our eCommerce platform and general web presence. OV is a young company, and as such you'd be joining a very small engineering team to help us define and build foundational systems and processes as we quickly grow. The role provides an opportunity for a self-motivated and intellectually curious person to take on high-responsibility tasks and solve problems in an environment that encourages independent thought, action, analysis, and reflection.

If you're interested in expanding your skill set, the position also offers the opportunity to get your hands dirty with server side development. Your day to day responsibilities will include leading new web product initiatives, building business tools, aiding with support of marketing programs, bug fixes/maintenance of our existing codebase, and adding your technical point-of-view to discussions.

About you: (minimum requirements)

  • 3+ years as a software engineer
  • HTML/CSS/Javascript development experience
  • Knowledge of the latest UX frameworks and interest in user interface design
  • Experience with Python or React.js
  • Comfortable interfacing with 3rd party APIs
  • Capable of working with Unix command line tools and version control tools such as Git
  • Experience building and expanding web platforms
  • eCommerce and/or web design experience a big plus
  • Proactive self-starter; highly organized, excellent multitasking and time management skills, and detail oriented
  • Excellent problem-solver and troubleshooter
  • Can work independently and as part of a team
  • You’re familiar with the Apparel industry.
  • You enjoy Activity.

Benefits/Perks

  • Competitive salary and equity.
  • Health insurance
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • The latest OV gear and—of course—Recreation.

We encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply! When you reach out, please include all pertinent links and code samples. Send along a casual cover letter and work. This position is full-time and on-site at our headquarters in New York, NY.

jobs.title: Backend Software Engineer

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Portable is a web innovation company based in Collingwood, Melbourne. We were founded in 2005 and today work across multiple sectors delivering meaningful solutions to real problems (often this involves creative thinking, digital strategy and building web applications). We like working with progressive organisations that want to make a difference, and as a result we take on, large scale career defining infrastructure projects for governments, not-for-profits and startups. We are passionate about open source and have a user-centric approach.


We’re looking for a full stack developer to help us out with some of the projects we have flowing through the studios at any one time.  We need somebody with all round technical ability who enjoys working on complex problems.


Some things that we’d like you to have:



  • Strong and broad skills across the back-end (LAMP)

  • Sysadmin type skills, you’ll be able to set up an AWS server and configure and use things like Jenkins, Vagrant etc.

  • Ideally some front-end skills too, HTML5, CSS3, JS/jQuery.

  • Experience with various frameworks and CMS such as Symfony, Drupal and Wordpress.

  • A passion to keep learning and trying new technologies.

  • A desire to be a champion for technology in a business.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and people skills

  • Experience working with Agile methodologies.


Remote work is also an option for the right candidate. 



If you’d like to apply, please submit your resume by following this link: http://smrtr.io/8-YAMA . Please ensure you provide your github or equivalent repository.

jobs.title: Platform Quality Engineer
jobs.content:
Broala, Inc is seeking a talented, collaborative, and deeply curious Platform Quality Engineer to help us create a new family of cybersecurity products. We are an ambitious startup based in downtown Berkeley. Our customer list includes 10% of the Fortune 50, and we are growing rapidly.

In this important role, you will be a champion for product quality:



  1. Using well-honed instincts for how systems fail, you will identify creative and diabolical techniques to stress our products and make them break.

  2. You will find solutions for the issues you discover, gaining deep knowledge about our platform in the process.

  3. You will test integration with external products and systems (for example: Splunk), and strive to automate every aspect of your work.


We expect you to help mold this role based on your skills, perspectives, and interests.  We’re a dynamic startup, and inevitably you’ll be involved in other engineering projects as well (brainstorming, troubleshooting, prototyping, testing ideas).

To apply, please send a cover letter and CV or resume to jobs@broala.com. Be sure to let us know where you heard about the job, and feel free to send links to any projects or code you’re proud of.  


We are located in downtown Berkeley, and we also have a small team located in Columbus, Ohio - another possible work location.   


https://www.broala.com/platform-quality-engineer.html

jobs.title: Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Broala, Inc is seeking a talented, resourceful, and collaborative Platform Engineer to help create a new family of cybersecurity products. We are an ambitious startup based in downtown Berkeley. Our customer list includes 10% of the Fortune 50, and we are growing rapidly.

Built on top of the Linux kernel and other open-source software, our appliance platform runs the Bro network monitoring framework in an environment optimized for performance and stability. As a key contributor to our technology, you will translate product strategies and feature requests into working code, in collaboration with the Manager of Platform Engineering and other technical staff.  

In the process you will have an opportunity to:



  1. Write and adapt code and scripts in a number of languages.

  2. Expand your knowledge of Linux programming, testing, optimizing, and debugging.  

  3. Contribute to our backend deployment and management technology, hosted in Amazon Web Services (AWS).

  4. Solve complex technical problems uncovered during quality assurance testing.

  5. Make contributions to improve the open-source Bro code base.


We expect you to help mold this role based on your skills, perspectives, and interests.  We’re a dynamic startup, and inevitably you’ll be involved in other engineering projects as well (brainstorming, troubleshooting, prototyping, testing ideas).  For someone with prior Bro experience, this position could also involve advanced technical support of large-scale customer Bro deployments and innovative Bro scripting work.

To apply, please send a cover letter and CV or resume to jobs@broala.com. Be sure to let us know where you heard about the job, and to send links to contributions, projects, or code you’re proud of.


https://www.broala.com/platform-engineer.html

jobs.title: Network Engineer / Senior Network Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Network Engineer to architect, implement, maintain, and support our growing network infrastructure.  You will be part of a team responsible for designing and developing scalable, maintainable, highly available network architectures that meet today’s demanding business objectives and SLAs in a leading edge, technology driven E-commerce Company. 

In our team you will be part of a group that drives projects and innovation. We collaborate with peers internal and across the globe in virtual and physical labs, proving conceptual designs that will be the foundation of next iterations of our IAAS. Then we work with peer teams to plan, deploy, automate, monitor, and maintain those technologies in cutting edge public and private clouds.

What you will be responsible for:

  1. Architect, engineer and install next generation networking solutions in a fast-paced global company.
  2. Analyze network performance data and statistics and provide recommendations and roadmaps.
  3. Stay current with industry trends bringing new solution options
  4. Interface with our company service groups for efficient project delivery
  5. Provide training, mentoring and tier 3 oncall rotation support to other staff on technical topics and network design.
  6. Define, document, and enforce system standards. 

Soft skills we are looking for: 

  • Analytical Skills: Review systems and issues to find corrections or room for improvement
  • Attention to Detail: Create diagrams that convey topologies and traffic flows, insuring systems interoperability.
  • Leadership Skills: Poses the ability to demonstrate calm and professional demeanor when handling critical situations
  • Organizational skills: Project Delivery experience in planning, executing and maintaining a project from start to finish.
  • Teamwork: Collaborate with multiple IT and business teams for the successful planning, execution and delivery of all initiatives. 

What we’d like to see in your experience:

The following are core requirements

  • Production Experience with Enterprise and/or Service Provider Routers 
  • Production Experience with Enterprise & Datacenter Ethernet switching 
  • Production Experience routing protocols including BGP, OSPF, MP-BGP, MOSPF, GRE/IPSec, VPN, VPLS, MPLS, RSTP/STP, Aruba wireless controller and Aruba ClearPass solution.

Additional experience we would prefer

  • Traffic load balancing techniques and design and operational challenges (Nginx, HAProxy, F5 LTM, Citrix Netscaler)
  • Security postures and policy management (Juniper SRX , Palo Alto)
  • Experience with network management platforms and protocols such as Splunk, NetConf, SNMP, RMON, MRTG, Cacti, and Net/J/SFlow.
  • Working knowledge of L4+ DDoS mitigation solutions a plus
  • Linux administration is a plus
  • Experience with programing languages as Python, Perl or Lua scripting, Ansible/Puppet, and experience with Orchestration, Databases MySQL, MSSQL is a plus

Education requirement

  • Typically requires Bachelor's in CS, EE, or IS or equivalent experience
  • Cisco CCNP preferred or equivalent experience/certification
  • Cisco CCIE/Juniper JNCIE or equivalent experience/certification a plus

jobs.title: Agile Transformation Lead
jobs.content:
15+ years ago, priceline.com transformed the travel space. We are now looking for some to work with us to transform how we continue to do that. We are looking for an Agile Transformation Lead to deliver consistency and accelerate our Agile & Scrum practices and mentor process change throughout the organization. The ideal candidate will bring deep experience and a collaborative attitude to enable us to increase velocity, improve visibility, and raise quality throughout our organization.  This position will coach teams at different levels of maturity -- across disparate programs and development teams.  Our group is poised to drive dramatic change within the organization, a successful candidate must be hungry to learn and hungry to teach. 

Responsibilities

  • Work with stakeholders at all levels to be an evangelist and catalyst for our adoption and roll-out of agile methodologies: ceremonies, practices, and values.
  • Articulate the business value of Agile Practices (i.e. answer the question why do we do it this way)
  • Serve as a thought leader to evangelize Agile and industry best practices
  • Establish a coalition of supporters to help drive awareness of Agile processes and Atlassian's software solutions
  • Analyze our current processes, prioritize areas for improvement, and work alongside teams to implement change
  • Manage projects in JIRA and Confluence to ensure stakeholder-appropriate visibility into project status, including the Senior Leadership Team.
  • Monitor and report on key Agile performance metrics
  • Develop and deliver trainings on Agile processes/best-practices and Atlassian software for internal customers (including new hires) of varied levels throughout priceline.com so that everyone sees benefits from Agile and to foster Agile leads who can manage high-performing teams
  • Mentor team members: defining and manage product scope, objectives, milestones, roles and accountabilities, deliverables and approach, and backlog management, Agile rituals, reporting, MVP definition, validated learning, test-driven development, and conflict resolution
  • Function as Scrum Master or manage Scrum of Scrums, depending on need
  • Actively communicate with project / program stakeholders to ensure alignment, visibility, and transparency into all aspects of assigned projects and programs. 
  • Above all else, foster and model a collaborative, cross-functional team environment that's driven to build great products and solve customer-needs and enterprise goals.

Detailed Qualifications

  • A belief that Agile enables individuals to more fully understand, participate, and engage in business objectives.
  • A belief that Agile fosters open team communication, transparency, and the ability to make honest trade-offs in project decisions.
  • A deep understanding of MVP and the ability to guide priceline.com through the pitfalls of process versus flexibility
  • Proficiency with Scrum processes, Lean Agile methodology, JIRA, Confluence, and the rest of the Atlassian suite
  • Experience driving change across companies or industries and deep experience developing teams and helping to align team objectives with business goals
  • Experience using JIRA's Agile performance metrics to drive accountability and continuous improvement
  • 1-2 years of experience supporting and teaching Lean methodologies and practices like Iteration Planning, Prototyping, Release Planning, Retrospectives, Writing User Stories and Acceptance Criteria, Velocity-based Planning, Continuous Delivery, Behavior-Driven Development
  • Empathy and an exceptional bedside manner are essential in gaining alignment and excitement around Agile processes
  • Experience managing software development efforts for large scale web applications using Agile and Lean methodologies with in-house and outsourced teams.
  • The ideal candidate has mentored companies that are transitioning to Agile, Scrum, or the "Lean Startup" method.
  • The ideal candidate has used Atlassian's toolset to foster fostering organizational changes and implement agile processes throughout multiple disciplines (software development, QA, marketing, networking, devops, customer service, help-desk) and industries. 
  • The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of Agile PLM technologies, as well as very strong conceptual, analytical, judgment and communication abilities, including with nontechnical audiences.

General Qualifications

  • 2+ years of experience as a Scrum Master / Agile Project Manager
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related discipline
  • PLUS: Masters degree in computer science or related discipline
  • PLUS: one or more Agile certifications (e.g., CSM, CSPO, CSP, PSM, PSPO). SAFe certifications (SA, SP, SPC) highly desirable.\

jobs.title: Android Mobile Developer
jobs.content:
Priceline.com's team was awarded a Top Developer badge on Google Play! 

Come join us and be a part of our high-performing engineering team! 

Priceline is looking for optimistic and collaborative, developers to roll up their sleeves and join our mobile team. We believe in hiring people who love what they do. Are you passionate about Android, mobile technology, and building great products? If so, we want to hear from you!

You will work closely with Product Managers and UI/UX specialists to create fast, efficient, stable code, with core Android technologies such as: Content Providers, Sync Adapters, View Animations, Property Animations, JSON, and more. Additionally, you'll be implementing A/B tests and real-time analytics, as a member of a tight-knit, fast-moving team that includes server-side developers.

Demonstrated experience creating one or more production-quality Android apps using Android Studio: Send us your Google Play links if you have ‘em!

Strong fluency of the Java programming language, the Android SDK (versions 2.3 (Gingerbread) and up), Dalvik VM, RenderScript, memory management, strong command of object oriented principles, data structure optimizations, security, IPC, third party service integration (e.g. Google Play Services) and the Android development environment.

Experience as a member of a development team that uses Agile development techniques

Strong written and verbal communication skills: You communicate with other team members frequently and effectively

Thorough understanding of REST-ful API design: You can design and document a client-server protocol, and you can implement the client side of a documented protocol.


Required Experience:

  • Strong coding abilities and experience with Java and Android SDK (version 2.3 (Gingerbread) and up)

  • Integration with Google Play Services
  • Implementing REST APIs

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Priceline.com, the leading online destination for smart travelers, is seeking an intelligent, motivated full-time front end developer to join our growing team.  Our creative, flexible company culture merges the agility of a start-up with the stability of an established, international public company.

The ideal candidate is passionate about creating well-architected solutions; well-versed in the latest web technologies, such as SASS, node.js, AngularJS, and NoSQL; comfortable with distributed version control; and fluent in current best practices for responsive and accessible design. 

Our agile development process centers around A/B testing incremental changes and empowering our technologists to suggest best practices. We understand the dynamic nature of front-end technology, and we support our developers’ efforts to stay on the leading edge by attending meet-ups, going to conferences, and educating one another through code reviews and presentations. 

What You’ll Do:

You’ll be working in a small, tight-knit team, supporting our high-traffic Hotel, Airline, Rental Car and Vacation Package businesses, building applications that deliver real value to our customers.

You’ll be working closely with Product and Design team members on a modern technology stack grounded in node.js, with an MVC-based javascript framework (currently AngularJS) delivering data from our REST-based APIs. You will be optimizing our sites for cross-device performance, including mobile, desktop, tablets and phablets, with an emphasis on time to start render.

Your Skills Include:

* JavaScript

* At least one modern MVC-based JavaScript framework (Angular, Ember, Backbone, Knockout)

* node.js

* REST-ful API design; Spring framework a plus

* HTML5

* CSS (SASS/Compass a plus)

* Git

* A collaborative work ethic and the ability to work within a self-organized, cross functional team

* Familiarity with agile techniques

* Great communication skills

* Familiar with web server-side technologies, such as JSP, PHP, Ruby or Python

* Previous startup experience

* A degree in computer science or equivalent work experience

Required experience:

Associate Front End Engineer: 1-2 years’ experience or equivalent proficiency with the skills outlined above

Front End Engineer: 3-5 years’ experience or equivalent proficiency with the skills outlined above

Senior Front End Engineer: 5+ years’ experience or equivalent proficiency with the skills outlined above

jobs.title: Senior Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Here's a bit more about the Software Engineer position:


The Software Engineer  is responsible for designing and analyzing applications, developing project plans, coding, testing and documenting all code utilizing Java and web-based programming tools.  The Developer will also be responsible for maintaining and upgrading existing applications and will communicate with customers to understand their requirements and assist in the implementation of work requests.


Java: Candidate will be responsible for creating software that is both customer-facing and internal, primarily in the Java programming language.  Candidate must demonstrate proficiency with common aspects of the Java language such as generics, collections, auto-boxing, as well as awareness of common software patterns.


Object-Oriented Design: The candidate must demonstrate a solid grasp of object-oriented design principles, such as polymorphism, encapsulation, the Liskov substitution principle, composition, and inheritance as they are expressed in the Java language.


Common Enterprise Software: We use several industry standard Java libraries, tools and frameworks that the ideal candidate will have experience with: Spring, Hibernate, jsp, Struts, Tomcat, Maven and Jetty.


Relational Database Systems: Interface with a relational database is done via both SQL and through the Hibernate object-relational mapper, but the latter is not a substitute for the former, so understanding of common SQL constructs including joins, sub-selects and grouping, preferably with experience in Oracle syntax and tools, is required.  If you can expound on the merits or demerits of object-relational impedance mismatches bonus points will be awarded.


The Browser is the Client: Knows how to use the browser as the exclusive client interface to server-side business logic. Understands the basics of the http protocol and the ramifications of its stateless nature, the basics of what web browsers do both in the html/css presentation layer and how Javascript interacts with the DOM to effect client-side behavior using vanilla Javascript or jQuery.


Web Services: Is a veteran of consuming remote web services via SOAP and REST clients.


Coder: Lack of UML is a virtue, working code is the measure.  Loves to hack out code almost as much as one loves to delete code in a fit of ruthless refactoring.


Self-improvement: Wants to lean new things, try new technology, seek more efficient means and ways,  but is able to strike a balance between the embarrassingly fashion-driven nature of the IT industry and the entrenched inflexibility of the common enterprise coder.


Flexibility: Is able to work without micro-management, without daily meetings, with colleagues local and remote, on multiple projects that interweave and overlap, on small teams, sometimes at strange hours.


Job Responsibilities:



  • Design and analyze applications, develop project plans, code, test and document all code

  • Maintain and upgrade existing applications

  • Interface with customers to assist in implementation of work requests

  • Assist support personnel in resolving moderately complex program problems

jobs.title: Computational Biology Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Great Lakes Bioenergy Research Center (GLBRC) is one of three Department of Energy centers established to conduct fundamental, genomics-based research on microbial and plant systems required to realize the national need for low-cost biofuels. The GLBRC is housed at the University of Wisconsin with collaborators at Michigan State University and other universities and national labs.

As a member of a research team of faculty, staff, post docs, and graduate students, the Computational Biology Software Engineer will be part of an Informatics team supporting the research objectives of the GLBRC in scientific computing and computational infrastructure. The position requires a highly motivated team player who will participate in the design and implementation of custom web-based and desktop applications and databases for use by GLBRC scientists. Specific duties may include database design and implementation; requirements gathering; and software analysis, design, implementation, documentation, testing, deployment, and support. This will require effective communication and collaboration with end users (including researchers and bench scientists), bioinformaticians, software developers, and operational IT personnel.

The candidate will design, develop, maintain, and operate scientific and analytical software, databases, and knowledgebases required by GLBRC. The well-qualified candidate will have knowledge of, and experience in developing and maintaining, medium-to-large scale strategic solutions in a research environment, using best practices with minimal supervision. The candidate may also help in developing and delivering user training and should be comfortable communicating in a variety of formats to scientists, management, and staff at all levels of a research institution.

This position requires the ability to work both in a team and independently and the ability to communicate and collaborate with members of an inter-disciplinary team. Willingness and ability to rapidly learn new skills, concepts, and technologies is essential.


TO ENSURE CONSIDERATION


Application must be received by: JULY 06, 2016


----------------------



If you need to request an accommodation because of a disability you can find information about how to make a request at the following website:  http://www.oed.wisc.edu/478.htm


NOTE: Please indicate in writing if you request that your identity be kept confidential. If you do not indicate your preference to remain confidential, the University may be required to disclose your identify and/or application materials. The identity of finalists and successful candidates will be revealed upon request. See Wis. Stat. sec. 19.36(7).  


UW-Madison is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
We promote excellence through diversity and encourage all qualified individuals to apply.


A criminal background check will be conducted prior to hiring.
A period of evaluation will be required

Headquarters: Los Angeles, CA
URL: https://www.stansonhealth.com/

Stanson Health is a healthcare technology company in Santa Monica, CA specializing in clinical decision support. As an engineer on our team, you’ll be working our healthcare intelligence platform. Experience in the healthcare domain is helpful, but not necessary.

We're a 100% remote engineering team with people all over the US.

US Residents only please.

Requirements
We’re looking for a well-rounded engineer comfortable in fast-paced environments. Our current stack includes an Angular application with a Java/Postgres Linux backend, Spring Boot based web APIs, and a set of backend services written in Python. Our infrastructure is automated with Ansible / GoCD and provisioned in AWS.

An ideal candidate would have experience developing and supporting one or more of the following:
  1. Web APIs (prior experience with Spring Boot and Drools is helpful)
  2. Data ops / backend workflows in Python (prior experience with Luigi is helpful)
  3. Web applications with a complex, data rich domain (prior experience with Grails / Spring Boot and Angular is helpful)
  4. Automated provisioning / deployment pipelines and other dev ops tooling (prior experience with Ansible / GoCD is helpful)

Most importantly, we want someone who values good engineering practices like continuous integration/deployment, automated testing, thorough test coverage, and so on.

To apply: please send your resume and a small blurb about yourself to jobs@stansonhealth.com

jobs.title: Full Stack Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Beanworks is looking for a Full Stack Senior Software Engineer.


You will be designing and developing our single page app, with beautiful user interface, backed by a solid REST API’s. You will be deploying using Docker and Ansible, and automate as much as you can! We work in a distributed Linux environment, using Postgres, Mongo, Riak and several programming languages but mostly PHP/Symfony2. This is mainly a Linux shop, with some .NET opportunities. We’re extending our reach by developing an in house iOS/Android application to enable our customers on the fly access to their data.


Writing clean code, developing good unit tests and deploying daily are all Bean Team values but it’s not all about the technology. This is a highly collaborative environment with a lot of opportunity to make a difference. We are not stuck on the way things have been done in the past and relish new ideas that make us more productive and create a better experience for our users. You should be passionate about building features that customers love and mentoring junior developers. We are looking for people who like balancing our vision for the future with taking pragmatic steps that get stuff done today.


This is a young, fast moving company so it is essential that you have a can-do, entrepreneurial spirit - ideas are good but execution is better (especially when it’s executing on good ideas)! We are a small team, we are good at what we do and we like working together. You will have autonomy and respect from day one. Learning and keeping abreast of new technology and sharing with the rest of the team are activities we all enjoy and encourage.

jobs.title: Senior C++ Developer for trading firm in Chicago's River North area
jobs.content:
Old Mission Capital, a proprietary trading firm with offices in Chicago, London and New York, has immediate openings for Senior C++ Developers.

  • Research and develop new ultra low latency architectures

  • Write new market data and order entry handlers

Our Environment



  • We run CentOS on our servers

  • We write our systems in C++11 using GCC

  • We use Python where it makes sense

  • We manage our software development process with GitHub Enterprise and Buildbot
