jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
It is the primary responsibility of the development team to design and build tools that will help our customers provide quality health care at a lower cost.  As a Software Developer, you will assist with the integration, development, administration and support of our systems. The position will work closely with end users, as well as IT and Engineering staff to develop, upgrade and maintain customized applications and solutions.


Although we work in a collaborative team approach, as a Software Developer you are empowered and encouraged to use creativity to choose the best solution that fits each unique problem and then vet it with the team.  


In Software Development role at InXite Health, you can make a difference and affect change.  We welcome ideas and feel this position will give you a chance to give your ideas or thoughts on making aspects of development easier, better, faster, cheaper.


Job Duties



  • Develops software solutions using PHP, MySQL, Apache/NGINX, Linux (Ubuntu).

  • Documents solutions with clear code and comments.

  • Maintains current working knowledge of modern development tools, techniques, and equipment; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.

  • Monitors database activities to ensure data integrity, data security, and information availability.

  • Protects operations by keeping information confidential.

  • Clearly communicates service issues and development lifecycles.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer - JavaScript, MS full stack
jobs.content:
The Senior Developer is responsible for designing, developing and troubleshooting high performance and high availability web applications using both front-end technologies including HTML/CSS/LESS, JavaScript, jQuery, Knockout, WebPack, and NPM as well as back-end technologies including C#, ASP.NET MVC, WebAPI, and SQL Server to meet the company’s strategic objectives. He/she is also responsible for adhering to CoStar’s development frameworks & best practices and follow CoStar’s SDLC processes.


Objectives



  • Analyze technical requirements and design new components, web pages and controls to meet CoStar’s functional, performance and availability requirements.

  • Design both front-end and back-end components that leverage the appropriate object oriented design principals and patterns to attain high reusability and maintainability.

  • Develop an in-depth understanding of CoStar’s product architecture and frameworks. Maintain and contribute to CoStar’s product platform as necessary.

  • Maintain and support CoStar’s products that are released to stakeholders and customers.

  • Build consensus among different teams working on software development projects.

  • Facilitate discussions among other developers to exchange new ideas and improvements.

  • Continually evaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends and best practices that can be used to strengthen CoStar’s technology platform and development practices.


Competencies, Knowledge & Skills



  • Possesses at least 3 years Enterprise development experience.

  • Ability to work with minimal supervision or assistance to complete tasks (after initial onboarding).

  • Possesses strong analytical and problem solving abilities.

  • Demonstrates solid knowledge of OO programming and design patterns.

  • Demonstrates solid knowledge of C# and the .NET platform

  • Demonstrates working knowledge of web application development, including:

    • HTML/DOM/CSS

    • Core JavaScript fundamentals (prototypes, closures, single threaded, promises, etc.)

    • AJAX (XmlHttpRequest, JSON, etc.)

    • Performance (code bundling, minification, image sprints, etc.)

    • AMD and/or other module patterns for client code organization



  • Demonstrates good working knowledge of web services, ideally ASP.NET MVC, WebAPI, and/or WCF

  • Demonstrates working knowledge of ADO.NET, TSQL and stored procedure development.

  • Demonstrates basic understanding of relational database design, normalization methods and performing tuning techniques.

  • Possesses direct experience with, or at least familiarity with, the Scrum agile software development methodology.

  • Demonstrates solid understanding and experience with various software testing techniques, including unit, integration, functional, and performance testing.

  • Ability to clearly communicate thoughts and ideas within and across teams.

  • Ability to work well with other developers and management.

  • Awareness of emerging technologies.

  • Eagerness to learn.


DC Office Benefits:



  • Work for an environmentally conscious company in an environmentally friendly building that is LEED Gold Certified

  • Available Segways and bikes for personal use - free

  • $100 / month in Metro SmartCard Benefits

  • Beautiful roof top terrace with expansive views of the city; great for lunch and after work hangouts

  • Green roof

  • Electric vehicle charging stations

  • Underground parking

  • Complete fitness center with locker rooms onsite - free

  • Onsite free Yoga

  • Complimentary Fresh fruit, juice, vegetables, and yogurts stocked daily

  • Complimentary shuttles between Metro Center and our office on L Street

  • Full HD video conference system between any CoStar office

jobs.title: Senior SQL Developer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about software? Are you constantly pushing yourself to learn new technologies to develop better, faster and more efficient applications? Then CoStar is the place for you. CoStar is deeply committed to delivering high-performing applications that change the way our users consume and use commercial real estate data. We are THE leading data provider to the $11 trillion commercial real estate industry. Every day customers use our data and products to make multi-million dollar investment decisions. We are growing rapidly and searching for a Senior Software Developer who can take us to the next level. Are you up for the challenge?



The Senior Database Developer is responsible for database design in both transactional and decision support environments, as well as development of stored procedures, DTS/SSIS packages, jobs, and database scripts in support of software development projects to achieve the company’s strategic objectives.   He/she is also responsible for troubleshooting performance issues on existing code, and conducting performance analysis on new code



Responsibilities




  • Analyze technical requirements and design new data models or update existing data models using ER Studio and Visual Studio Database Edition.

  • Analyze technical requirements and recommend ETL strategies and provide visual representation of design using Visio

  • Code stored procedures of high complexity to meet product requirements

  • Conduct Index and Performance Analysis  to ensure products provide optimal performance

  • Deliver  work products that meets specifications, are free of defects, and have optimal performance

  • Maintain Costar Database Designs and Models

  • Define and keep up to date Database Architecture and Development best practices

  • Build design consensus among different teams working on software development projects

  • Facilitate discussions among database developers to exchange ideas and introduce new database technologies

  • Evaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends and best practices that can be leveraged to strengthen CoStar’s technology platform and development practices.

  • Demonstrates expert knowledge of database design

  • Demonstrates expert knowledge of T-SQL programming

  • Demonstrates expert knowledge of performance tuning

  • Works effectively with Internal & External Clients

  • Mentoring other developers

  • Ability to effectively communicate requirements & design specifications  within & across teams

  • Adaptability/Stress Tolerance

  • Strong Knowledge of SDLC

  • Software Testing (Unit, System, Integration, Functional, Performance)

  • Continuous refactoring of database design and/or code to accommodate changing requirements

  • Participate in recruiting process to hire ‘A’ players.

  • Awareness Of Emerging Technologies



Benefits

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description




As CoStar’s next Senior Mobile (Android) Developer, you will have a direct impact on highly visible applications that touch millions of users.  You will be an integral part of an innovative and passionate team where your ideas will flourish and will influence the $11 trillion commercial real estate industry – come help us change the way the world of commercial real estate does business!



About You –



  • You love finding better, faster, more amazing ways to develop mobile applications

  • The thought of using bleeding edge technology excites you!

  • You are a self-motivated, passionate, out of the box thinker

  • You have experience with mission critical, high volume, mobile apps and/or web-based systems

  • You have a knack for developing awesome UI using HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, etc.

  • You have 4+ years of hands on experience with native app mobile development for Android using Android Studio, Android SDK, and related languages (Java).

  • You consider yourself an expert with Object Oriented Programming and design patterns, MVC, and SOA, etc.

  • You hold a Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field (or comparable experience)

  • If you have knowledge/experience with iOS, Unit Tests and Test Driven Development we will consider it a plus!



The role-



  • You will develop applications that scale and reach 30,000+ users per day

  • Continually evaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends, and best practices that can be used to strengthen CoStar’s technology platform and development practices

  • Develop mobile applications for HTML 5, Android devices.

  • Consult with clients to ensure we continue to be the leader in the industry by gathering information about program needs, objectives, functions, features, and input and output requirements

  • Write and maintain documentation to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes, and corrections

  • Provide technical guidance regarding errors, problems, or questions about programs

  • Design and code screen layouts, graphical user interfaces, printed outputs, and interfaces with other systems

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Description


Who are we? CoStar Group is the leading data provider of Multi-residential and Commercial Real Estate Data in an industry valued at over 13 trillion dollars. We own and run some of the most highly trafficked sites in commercial real estate like www.Apartments.com, www.ApartmentFinder.com, www.Loopnet.com, www.LandsofAmerica.com to name a few.


Responsibilities:



  • Work in a fast-paced environment managing multiple products across the organization to include www.Apartments.com, www.LoopNet.com to name a few.

  • Manage all components in the full stack, and assist with building out server automation across the entire infrastructure. 

  • Ensure critical systems, applications, and services are always up and running by monitoring, gathering, and analyzing data from different network sources.

  • Oversee and administer the operations and processes of a virtualized environment.


Qualifications.



  • At least 5 years of experience managing a highly available public facing webserver or website.

  • Expertise in configuring, maintain and troubleshooting issues.

  • Hands-on experience in at least 2-3 of the following:



  • Chef or Puppet or similar tools,

  • F5, Web configurations, caching, and content delivery networks.

  • Scalable and open architecture of IIS.

  • Experience with monitoring tools.

  • Experience with Virtualization.

  • Scripting guru.

  • Good understanding of storage and Networking.

  • You consider yourself a borderline developer – but you know that you enjoy playing the coveted role in operations.


Good to have:



  • Experience with AWS or Azure

  • Have supported iOS or Android applications.

  • Experience with SSIS and ETL.

jobs.title: Agile Project Leader
jobs.content:
Job Title: Agile Project Leader (Software Engineer, mobile)


Location: Portland, ME


Job Description


Newforma is seeking a senior, versatile, and experienced Agile project leader in Portland, ME.   Join our team that is transforming the construction industry by delivering state-of-the-art web and mobile applications.  Our office is located in beautiful downtown Portland in a second-story office with a view of the harbor.


Primary Qualifications



  1. You have the experience to lead software teams following Agile best practices.  

  2. You value customers and users -- and know how to manage and motivate your team so that they are inspired to champion customer experience the way you do.  

  3. You have the ability to empower team-members to maximize their ability to deliver working software.

  4. You are an experienced software development leader, and understand what it takes tactically to lead successful software projects.

  5. You see beauty in simplicity, and strive to simplify process, status, and communication needs between the delivery team and project stakeholders.  

  6. You understand the dependency between requirements and delivery -- and don’t settle for soft or poorly articulated requirements.  You recognize what a risk it can be to start software projects too early, or create backlog stories that are poorly defined.

  7. You are trustworthy and respect the responsibilities that come with leadership.  You communicate honestly and openly about needs, status, risks, and progress.

  8. You are able to work with other product stakeholders to fulfill the role of Product Owner

jobs.title: Manager, Software Development - Identity and Access Management, Job ID 1029290
jobs.content:
About Pfizer
 A career at Pfizer offers opportunity, ownership and impact. All over the world, Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.

Role Description

This role can be based in New York, NY, Groton, CT, Peapack, NJ, or Collegeville, PA.

 The Digital Credential Services Engineer is responsible for the development and management of service technologies for the Digital Credential Services (DCS) area. The DCS Engineer will work with the Delivery Manager and Service Lead on enhancements, continuous improvements, and guide the work activities of developers and other technical resources. The role responsibilities include requirements gathering and definition, technical design and specification, development, testing, and implementation support. The DCS Engineer will develop new solutions and maintain the existing technology to engineer world class global Digital Credential Services. This position is responsible for the end-to-end technical management of DCS solutions encompassing Multi-factor authentication and high-assurance credential management processes. The processes and services provided are audited regularly and are required to meet all corporate security policies. This is an Operations role with 24x7 global service support responsibilities along with continual monitoring of the service for quality levels, and response to outages or performance issues with a sense of urgency.

Responsibilities
•Develop and deploy solutions to ensure that Digital Credential services are performing according to specifications, meet defined procedures, and comply with applicable information security policies and requirements.
•Integrate applications and third-party products into internal services and support and upgrade implemented systems.
•Partner with internal teams to define and implement solutions that improve Pfizer processes and end user experiences.
•Collaborate with the Service Lead, Service Delivery Manager, and customers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
•Maintain highest levels of development practices including technical design, solution development, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution, writing clean, modular and self-sustaining code.
•Develop and maintain service patterns used for application integration.
••Manage technical work activities of contingent worker resources to support enhancements and continuous improvements to services.
•Support 24x7 management and oversight of BAU operations.

jobs.title: SQL Report Developer
jobs.content:
Connance is looking for a talented SQL Report Developer who is passionate about designing and implementing great software, able to quickly become familiar with our platform, and make immediate contributions to the team. The Report Developer will be a key member of a small Scrum team that is focused on building reports that integrate with our existing web platform.  It is these reports that help our clients gain visibility into their revenue cycle and provide insight on revenue performance.


Responsibilities:



  • Build new reports using Logi Info Studio and Microsoft SQL Server

  • Investigate existing queries and/or write new queries with performance optimization in mind

  • Display report data in a web platform using data tables, charts, graphs, and other data visualizations

  • Investigate production issues pertaining to reports to determine root cause and then implement a solution

  • Build well-designed and secure software in a way that is generic, reusable, and easily extensible, as well as solves the business needs and requirements

  • Participate in code reviews, design reviews, testing, and deployment

  • Contribute to standards / processes that are appropriate for our business for software design, implementation, documentation, QA, and releases

jobs.title: Director of Engineering, Android
jobs.content:
iHeartRadio seeks a seasoned Android leader with deep hands-on experience to lead our 10-12 person Android engineering team. You must be driven to build great Android apps, be fluent in good architecture design, and able to work within a fast paced Agile team structure to lead engineering efforts across several Android form factors. Delivery, accountability, and passion are three words your peers use to describe you; you excel in setting the right standards in continuously delivered clean, well tested code. You have the experience supported by a successful track record of delivering solutions in a complex and fragmented Android ecosystem.


In your first year on the job, expect to lead several large platform wide initiatives (think brand new product, full app redesign, i18n, etc), in addition to platform improvements of your own design. We want to preserve battery life, maintain a high Play Store rating, and you know exactly how we will accomplish it. You set the standard for good code reviews and know how to operate in a variety of product team structures. You are a proponent of unit tests, continuous integration and rapid deployment. You write code that runs on Lollipop and doesn't break on Marshmallow. Or an Android TV. Or a 4:3 screen. Or a smartwatch. Or a Chromecast. Or inside a Ford.


Responsibilities:



  • Manage a team of 10-12 engineers and remote contractors encompassing a variety of Android specialties

  • Develop, architect and deploy major new features on iHeart Android apps

  • Build and maintain common code libraries used in phones, tablets, TVs, smart watches and automobiles

  • Create innovative solutions in media streaming and mobile user experience

  • Maintain high unit test coverage and continuous integration principles

  • Cultivate an environment of excellence, through code design, code reviews

  • Mastery of the Android development and hardware ecosystem, from devices to the Play Store


Requirements:



  • 5+ years of hands on experience with the Android platform (additional experience with server side Java or Scala highly preferred)

  • Experience building high volume consuming facing applications at massive scale

  • Considerable experience debugging and profiling Android applications

  • Experience with continuous integration tools like Jenkins or Travis CI and automated testing frameworks such as Espresso

  • Ability to independently set tasks and complete work for yourself and your team with limited direction

  • Ability to manage competing priorities in a complex environment and maintain high productivity

  • Ability to devise creative technical solutions

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field preferred

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Android Applications
jobs.content:
Since its inception, Google has built products that change the way people all over the world live and access information - looking up recipes, finding their favorite song, turn-by-turn directions, checking their email, and so much more. How and where people view this information continues to change as the world becomes an increasingly mobile place.


As an Android Applications Software Engineer, you’ll drive new innovations and build beautiful user experiences on the largest mobile platform in the world. You’ll work with world-class mobile developers and resources to drive the next generation of apps at Google. Whether building native applications on Google’s core products and services - Search, Gmail, YouTube - or pioneering new visions - like Google Now on Tap, Android Wear, Cardboard - you’ll impact people’s lives wherever they interact with our products - in their homes, on the go, or someplace in between!


You will develop applications primarily in Java and using the Android SDK. You might design and develop open-source Android applications that are part of the Android Open Source Project or closed-source Google applications that are the interface to Google services on Android.


Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.


Responsibilities



  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s products.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support large, complex web applications like Gmail, Google Search and Google Maps.

  • Write scalable, performant server-side code. Build on top of our world-class infrastructure to create the services that support an amazing mobile experience.

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
Are you a great dev who wants to work on new and interesting projects, with new problems to solve all the time? We’re looking for great devs who want to work on really interesting projects.  


You know that Android is the dominant smartphone platform, and will be powering many different types of devices in the years to come.  At touchlab, Android is our focus and our goal is to be the best Android development shop around.  Period.  Come help us make that happen.


We need developers that want to help define what great software development is, both for Android specifically, and small, agile teams in general.


Besides just “coding”, we like to stay involved and give back to the community. Our team runs the NY Android Developers meetup and Droidcon NYC, so we’re looking for people who want to increase their visibility and contribute to the community.  If you’re interested in teaching others how great Android is done, we’re launching a training school in the fall, so this is the place for you.


We're entering a major growth phase for the company and looking for the right people who want to help make that happen.  Rev share and equity plans to the right candidates.


Relocation assistance can be discussed.  Visas are a different story, but will do what we can.

jobs.title: Automation Test Engineer
jobs.content: Hearst Television reaches more than 25 million people across the US every month on its 26 local digital properties connected to loved and trusted brands like WCVB – Boston, KCRA – Sacramento and WESH – Orlando, to name a few. We’re crafting new, elegant digital experiences that make our local news that matters come to life across all platforms and devices. Check out our recent native app re-launch by searching WTAE in the Apple and Google stores. We’re unifying our publishing tools and user experiences to enable talented editorial teams to tell more engaging stories more often.  We’re creating a game-changing modern content technology stack - built from the ground up to give our users, editors, and advertisers tools that enable them to tell these amazing stories.  We’re building an open, service-oriented platform driven by APIs, and believe passionately in crafting simple, elegant solutions to complex technological and product problems.  We’re committed to test-driven development and need a talented contract Automation Engineer to join our team who is passionate about ensuring the quality of products used and valued by our users.  You express your passion through code, relentlessly seeking to enhance the release process and ensure integrity across our sites and apps.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content: Aviso Coaching has an immediate position available for a talented software engineer. Our current needs lie with both front and back-end technologies, thus, candidates possessing front, back or full stack experience will be considered. The right individual must quickly understand challenges and be able to recommend and implement technical solutions to solve them. This position will require you to work with our small, fast-paced team of technical experts. Your input will be valued and well-designed solutions coveted.

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us


Appboy is an industry-leading customer relationship suite for mobile marketers. Thousands of global brands use Appboy's robust audience segmentation and advanced multi-channel messaging system to create highly personalized lifecycle marketing campaigns in every relevant channel -- from push, in-app, and web to email, wearables, and emerging technologies -- across billions of user profiles worldwide to better engage, retain, and monetize their customers.


We have a cool office and fun people.  Our benefits are great and we get lunch catered every day.


About the role


On the mobile team, our customer is the engineer. That means we build bulletproof, performant, adaptable SDKs that support any environment you throw at it.  We build SDKs that the worlds best app engineers are excited to put in their app.  The APIs must be clean and intuitive, the integration must be quick and easy, and the footprint must be minimal.


As a member of the mobile team you will be contributing to SDKs that the worlds top apps use to understand and engage their users.  Your code will run on hundreds of millions of devices and you’ll have the opportunity to work on multiple platforms.  You will be on the bleeding edge of mobile development, working with a great team and owning critical pieces of our product.

jobs.title: C# / ASP.NET MVC Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Shift Digital is a cutting edge digital marketing and technology company, providing innovative business solutions that power the most successful and cost-effective digital programs. Since 2000, the Shift Digital team has built, deployed and managed easy-to-use solutions focused on the retail distribution channel of our clients. While focusing primarily on automotive digital advertising, Shift Digital has grown into other verticals such as home building, power sports, and finance verticals.



We are currently looking for Senior Software Engineers to join our growing Web Development team in Birmingham, MI! We want to talk to bright folks interested in things like search/display advertising, social, cloud computing, and analytics/big data solutions. Our Software Engineers are part of a larger delivery team, working alongside Digital Project Managers, Business Analysts, and a team of Creative professionals.



What You Will Be Doing
You’ll be working on one of our many different product sets such as Lead Management Systems, Analytics/Data Sciences, CRM, or our proprietary CMS solution. Each product is design for enterprise scale using the latest and great bits such as Microsoft Azure, MVC 5, SignalR, AngularJS and so much more. As a client driven organization, we move at an incredible pace and believe in the philosophy that shipping is a feature.

This is a full time position with Shift Digital. In addition to our excellent benefits package, we offer very competitive compensation, paid holidays, generous paid time off (PTO) and other employee perks

We’re looking for passionate front-end developers to join our engineering team… passionate about creating products for older adults, passionate about working with on-the-ground Care Professionals, passionate about seriously innovating on technology that directly impacts people’s lives. The product team is small, lean, and fast so if you thrive on getting your coding fingers in a lot of important pies, Honor could be the place for you.

jobs.content: Honor’s mission in life is big, really big. We want to change the world, and not in a small way. jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer, AWS & Continous Integration + Perks

We are searching for a Sr. DevOps Engineer to join our team. This role will provide support for the Developers, Big Data, QA and Product teams and will focus heavily on automation, monitoring and scaling the infrastructure.


How your skills and passion will come to life at Headspace:



  • Build and maintain Production, Development and QA environments

  • Improve performance and scalability of existing systems

  • Monitor and troubleshoot server related issues

  • Develop and document best practices for disaster recovery and application deployment

jobs.title: Senior .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Designs, prototypes, implements, and maintains products that address business needs and achieve enterprise wide/global strategic goals. This may include analyzing, researching, processing and administering investment data; analyzing, developing and deploying reports; designing, developing, and testing software applications.


Provides consultancy and advice on functionality, applicability and usability of solutions (process and/or technology) to project requirements.  Recognizes and manages business trade-offs and market pressures.  Works with business partners to assess related business process changes and impact to users/clients.  Guides business partners to ensure communication and organizational preparedness activities occur to address changes as a result of process and/or system changes.  Identifies opportunities to improve current processes and act as a champion to change within the business analysis practice.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Telo is a rapidly growing telecom-focused data company in Atlanta, Georgia. Our company provides B2B API products that power the mission critical services of thousands of companies. We are looking to find a kick-ass developer who can join us in here in our new office in Buckhead.


Telo works with people who are exceptionally talented, motivated, and fearless.  Telo team members welcome challenges and devise clever solutions to overcome them.  We are inventors, creators, and hard workers.  We believe in upholding a strong code of ethics. We believe in pushing the envelope and testing boundaries to discover limits rather than merely accepting conventional assumptions.  We see the big picture and work together passionately, putting forth full effort so that the entire team can enjoy long-lasting and uncommonly-generous rewards.



Do you believe in the same things that we believe in? Then you belong right here, at Telo. Take a look at our company website or feel free to take a look at our products OpenCNAM and EveryoneAPI.

jobs.content:

  • can build complex User Interfaces created by our inhouse design team.

  • thinks of frontend development as an art form, not a coding job.

  • is always wanting to push the limits of speed optimization & load times.

jobs.title: SR WEB DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
FMA is looking for a full-stack Sr. Web Developer to help grow and support our websites.


We use modern, object-oriented PHP in the Laravel framework, with MongoDB and MySQL on the back-end and Bootstrap and jQuery on the front-end. We also work with WordPress and Drupal, and our sites mostly run on Linux and nginx.


It's a relaxed environment with flexible work hours and partial remote work opportunities, but we expect quality work and love to build great products. You'll work with internal product owners as well as some external partners, but we aren't an agency. Our top publication site, thefabricator.com, has experienced 30% annual growth in unique visitors each of the past two years and our industry outreach effort, mfgday.com, boasted over 2,500 events last year. Join us to make a difference on a small, but impactful, team.


Note: FMA is currently located in Rockford IL, but is relocating to Elgin IL in December, 2016.


In this job, you will:



  • Design, develop, test and implement web applications in PHP, HTML, CSS and JavaScript

  • Design and maintain databases in MySQL and MongoDB

  • Lead projects within the web department

  • Provide detailed specifications and serve as a technical resource for coworkers

  • Work with a designer and digital marketing manager to continuously improve UI/UX

  • Monitor website performance and make improvements as needed

  • Implement SEO techniques to improve and maintain rankings

  • Fix bugs and address other issues submitted to the web help desk


Benefits:


FMA offers a competitive salary & benefits package that includes health, dental, vision, life, & disability insurance; flexible spending plans; 401(k) plan; 529 plan; generous paid holidays, vacation, & sick time.


FMA also offers company-wide incentive plan; paid professional development & memberships; tuition reimbursement; & fitness reimbursement.


We encourage you to visit our websites: fmanet.org; thefabricator.com; fabtechexpo.com; mfgday.com; nutsandboltsfoundation.org.


When applying, please include a cover letter noting your salary requirements with your resume.

jobs.title: Proving ground for junior / lower mid-level developers
jobs.content:
Starkwood Media Group is a well-established company with a series of products in the market and coming to the market.


Reporting to the CTO you will be responsible for working within our Web Team to deliver new functionality & enhancements to a brand new SaaS offering alongside working maintenance tasks for our existing systems. All work is done via 2 week sprints where 90% of the work is specified up front so that you know exactly what you will be working on.


This role will be perfect for someone who wants to work in a thriving vibrant environment making frequent high quality releases to our systems. Your opinions and knowledge will be highly valued and will be used by the senior management team to help prioritise future work. This will allow you to directly influence the direction & the quality of our newest products.


This role would be ideally suited to a recent graduate or a junior developer looking for the right environment to make the jump to mid level or even senior developer.


This is an office based role so you must be able to commute to Camberley

jobs.title: Back End Web Developer
jobs.content:
Our core dashboard app, running on Rails, Angular, Elixir, provides our clientswith analytics and statistics on the thousands of apps which we track worldwide. You'll be working closely with colleagues from the front end and back end teams to implement and design new functionality, keeping our commitment to provide a robust, strong and practical dashboard.    


    •    Contribute ideas for the improvement of the overall solution
    •    Significant participation in core product design
    •    Planning and realization of product features
    •    Work closely with tech & product teams

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.content:
adjust.com is a leading business intelligence platform for mobile apps that is crunching 2 Petabytes of event data each month. For our database infrastructure we are looking for an experienced C developer, who is interested to become a PostgreSQL expert to help us process 60 Terabyte of RAM.


You will learn how to hack Postgres for real-time analytics over terabytes of mobile app data, streaming in every day. We will show you how to build extensions that support new data types, run and optimize SQL queries in shardered  environments on billions of rows. Moreover, you will get the possibility to contribute to Postgres.


adjust is a fast-growing mobile marketing analytics company with offices in Berlin, San Francisco, Shanghai, Tokyo, Paris, Sydney and Istanbul. We build business intelligence for mobile apps, placing a high premium on scientific statistics, hand-in-glove UX, and lean, pragmatic product iteration. Mobile is growing faster than any market on Earth, and being part of a B2B startup in this space means you’ll be moving nimbly for businesses large & small and daily punching above your weight.


We offer you some of the best equipment money can buy, an ergonomic and healthy work environment, company bikes, flexible hours, competitive salaries and conferences across the continent. Moreover, we organize twice-yearly coder's retreats, meetings over breakfast or some spare ribs, and of course a proper beer fridge.


Responsibilities:



  •  Extend Postgres and optimize Postgres features

  •  Optimize & update databases for performance and functionality

  •  Run and optimize high performant real time analytical queries to improve our clients’ campaign performance

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
You will play a key role in shaping the technology roadmap of Swarm64 to secure our ongoing success. The Database Software Engineer will have the experience, expertise and confidence to become a major contributor in our team of outstanding software engineers. Further, you will interact with, learn from and educate our hardware development team. You will be a member of the team defining and implementing Swarm64’s software architecture.


Responsibilities:



  • coming up with sound solutions to complex software architecture challenges

  • adapting existing and inventing new database concepts to use Swarm64-DB (see “About Swarm64” below) to its full potential

  • crafting lean implementations with a strong focus on testing and continuous integration

  • being a team player and performing the previous points with a “talk first” mentality

  • take on bigger challenges over time and make use of opportunities to grow your skills and your personality

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
At Swarm64, parallel processor experts and database software specialists teamed up to create a full-stack software and hardware accelerator plug-in for databases. Swarm64’s Scalable Database Acceleration platform plugs into Linux-based servers and delivers huge performance increases without need of changes to the customer’s application.


Our product expresses our ambitions and our style: We strive to create outstanding results. We invent cross-functionally. We work in teams and put people first. We collaborate with customers. We embrace an agile culture.


Responsibilities


The Senior Application Engineer will be a hands-on engineer with the experience and knowledge to:



  • create and maintain the development and production environment for Swarm64’s engineering processes

  • create a production quality server-platform for Swarm64’s SDA including software versioning, packaging, release tests, and continuous deployment

  • be a point of contact at Swarm64 for technical customer interaction


In Swarm64’s cross-functional teams, contributions outside of specific specialisations and skills are strongly encouraged.

jobs.title: .NET Software Developer
jobs.content:
At BearingPoint Ireland, we are growing quickly and have a number of exciting new projects to challenge the very best Developers. We are working with a wide range of clients, on a number of complex projects that are transforming the way business is being done in Ireland. We are looking for talented .NET Developers to join our Software Development team. As a .NET Developer, you will join a team delivering a range of enterprise and web solutions for our clients using the latest technologies.


The role:


Responsibility for design and implementation of software projects and play a key role in ensuring the quality of solutions we build.

jobs.title: Software Delivery Manager
jobs.content:
At BearingPoint Ireland, we are growing quickly and have a number of exciting new projects to challenge the very best Developers. We are working with a wide range of clients, on a number of complex projects that are transforming the way business is being done in Ireland. We are looking for talented Development Leads to join our Software Development team. As a Development Lead, you will join a team delivering a range of enterprise and web/mobile solutions for our clients using the latest technologies and Agile methodologies.


The role
We currently have an opportunity in our Dublin office for a Development Lead. In this role, you will work closely with Development, QA, Analysis, Project Management and Architecture personnel in on large scale delivery projects.


The role will involve:



  • Leading software delivery projects from an organisational and planning perspective

  • Adapting and implementing Agile oriented delivery methodologies

  • Liaising with clients and senior project stakeholders on project matters

  • Team coaching and mentoring

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
At BearingPoint Ireland, we are growing quickly and have a number of exciting new projects to challenge the very best DevOps Engineers. We are working with a wide range of clients, on a number of complex projects that are transforming the way business is being done in Ireland.


The DevOps Engineer (Java) will be responsible for maintaining and improving an enterprise continuous integration / delivery framework. This person is responsible for recommending, developing, and implementing the automated frameworks to maximize the efficiency of the build and release process. You will work within an Agile delivery environment and support multiple project teams and codebases to enable the deployment of application releases to controlled test and production environments.


The role:


We currently have an exciting opportunity in our Dublin office for a DevOps Engineer. As a DevOps Engineer, you will work within our Release Management Team and work closely with the Development and QA Teams on all software builds and releases.


The role will involve:



  • Collaboration with Software Development, QA Engineers, and System Architects to continuously improve the efficiency and reliability of build and deployment processes to support all phases of development, QA and production releases.

  • Providing and maintaining a detailed understanding of the structure and inter-dependencies of systems and leverage this knowledge to improve our build and release processes.

  • Maintaining and enhancing our Continuous Integration environment on a real-time basis, monitoring builds, maintaining configuration, and developing automation.

  • Demonstrating expertise in a range of automation tools and approaches in a Unix environment (e.g. Jenkins/TeamCity, Maven, Ansible), as well as other scripting languages.

  • Automating the build, Continuous Integration (CI) and deployment processes.

  • Supporting automated build, release & test solutions, internal tools development for automation, maintenance of build environments, etc.

  • Coordinating releases including pre-release checks, validation of release change sets,    release schedule, code freeze, SVN to GIT migration, etc.

  • Creation of new environments and updates to these environments including configuration of Jenkins and application support.

  • Solid experience of the SVN/GIT, Jenkins/TeamCity for Continuous Integration builds.

  • Experience working with DevOps methodologies.

  • Experience with rapidly troubleshooting application configuration issues in Unix environments.

jobs.title: Java Software Architect
jobs.content:
At BearingPoint Ireland, we are growing quickly and have a number of exciting new projects to challenge the very best Software Architects. We are working with a wide range of clients, on a number of complex projects that are transforming the way business is being done in Ireland. We are looking for talented Java Software Architects to join our team working in an agile delivery environment and to promote continuous improvement in our development processes.


The Role


The Software Architect will provide strategic technology advice to software development teams and take an end to end role in technology delivery projects. They will be responsible for the design and for ensuring that all the components of the solution integrate together.


Responsibilities



  • Leading detailed design sessions with development teams

  • Technically owning and managing the process of ensuring build and integration of the    various elements of the solution

  • Ensuring technical standards, including coding standards, tools or platforms are adhered to

  • Quality assuring all contributors to the end to end solution

  • Acting as a single point on all technical issues

  • Provide technical leadership and support development teams

  • Review IT architectures, projects & improve business processes & technology innovation

  • Research emerging technologies, processes & best practices

  • Manage risk identification and risk mitigation strategies associated with the architecture

  • Resolve technical problems

  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal (including fluent English)

jobs.title: Release Manager
jobs.content:
Release Management is central to the way we deliver IT and is one of the most exciting transformations at BearingPoint today. Your position as Release Manager will govern the release process working with diverse teams who drive our delivery success. You need to have experience managing outsourced partners both onshore and offshore and enjoy that diverse challenge.


You’ll think “big picture” and continue to transform Release Management into something that will be a best in class framework of delivery for our clients’ products and services, with the probable opportunity to build and develop the release management function and associated team over time, as more platforms are added. You’ll use your experience gained in a large commercial organisation to inspire, influence, get people on board and lead change especially with our senior management and executive community.


We are working with a wide range of clients across many industries on a number of complex projects that are transforming the way business is being done. We are looking for a talented Release Manager for a permanent full time role in our high performance ITA (IT Advisory) team focused initially in telecommunications.


Responsibilities



  • Support the delivery of projects and programmes for a specified Release through the application of the Release Management Framework

  • Manage relationships with partners, internal and external stakeholders to successful implementation of the specified Release and contribute to the evolution of the Release Management Framework

  • Working both internally with our development, design and test teams, project managers as well as working with the Client (release managers, project managers and other senior clients) to agree and work to a joint process to deliver every release cleanly

  • Drive/evolve our processes, gain clarity on roles and responsibilities as well as working towards “continuous improvement”

  • Act as a point of escalation for all Release Management activities related to the specified Release

  • Own the Critical Success Levels for the specified Release (CSLs) – monitoring critical success levels and quality measures, reporting where decisions will impact our ability to achieve the targets

  • Provide reports on key Release Management plans, metrics, risks and issues, own the regular management reporting for the specified Release and drive continuous improvement

jobs.title: Java Developer - All Levels
jobs.content: BearingPoint Ireland has exciting new projects to challenge the very best Java Developers.  We are working with a wide range of clients, on a number of projects that are transforming the way business is being done in Ireland and across Europe.  We are expanding our team and are current looking for talented Java Developers to join us.

jobs.title: Security Architect
jobs.content:
• Analyze and design security solutions for applications and infrastructure, and provide expertise and consulting to clients.

  • Identify and document information security risks and propose mitigating controls

  • Will be responsible for understanding complex business IT needs, requirements, and projects scopes, with a focus on information security requirements.

  • Research, design, and develop new information security controls for clients

  • Assess current IT environments and make recommendations to increase security

  • Assist clients in troubleshooting and resolving information security issues

  • Author project and support documentation and diagrams

  • Implement security solutions.

jobs.title: Senior PHP, Drupal, Symfony Developer
jobs.content:
6+ month temp to perm opportunity. Once hired permanently, benefits package included. 


We are a fast paced, creative digital agency in Syosset, NY, looking for a Senior PHP Developer with proven success developing custom applications on leading MVC and CMS frameworks including Symfony 2, Drupal 7 and above. The ideal candidate can hit the ground running, bringing their skills and experience to bear on multiple projects, designing robust architectural solutions and contribute towards the strategy of business growth and needs. Work with senior team members and mentor and guide junior team members to support the implementation, development, integration, and maintenance of web-based software.

jobs.title: Help us evolve our highly concurrent, distributed, micro-service architecture!
jobs.content:
The Demand Side Forecasting engineering team is focused on building a high performance, well engineered forecasting engine that generates accurate predictions from ~20 billion daily data points in milliseconds.


Help us evolve our highly concurrent, distributed, micro-service architecture where we use technologies such as :



  • Java 8 with Lombok & persistent collections

  • Couchbase

  • Groovy, Grails & Gradle

  • Jenkins & Sonar

  • Docker

  • AWS cloud


We really believe in the open source model of software development. In the last six months this team has released the following projects (with more to come) :



  • micro-server: Simple Rest micro-services (https://github.com/aol/micro-server)

  • cyclops-react: A comprehensive functional reactive platform for JDK 8  (https://github.com/aol/cyclops-react)

  • cyclops : Integration modules for RxJava, Project Reactor, Functional Java, Javaslang and Guava (https://github.com/aol/cyclops)


What You’ll Be Doing


You’ll be helping build highly scalable tools for ad campaign performance prediction across display, mobile and video. We are focused on quality and this team produces a platform that has very few production issues. If this sounds good to you, and you like to write high quality well tested code, we have many interesting challenges including



  • performance optimisation

  • ensuring system responsiveness, robustness and high availability

  • handling and processing large data amounts (TBs per day), and responding in milliseconds to user queries


This team is also responsible for training the Dublin site in Java 8 and functional programming.

jobs.title: Linux Project Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you want to build the software that manages the fastest computers in the world? Do you want to change the world forever and combine High Performance Computing with Big Data and Cloud computing?


Built for the OpenStack cloud, ClusterVision has developed Trinity, a private-cloud next-generation management system suitable for High Performance Computing, Big Data and Cloud.


As our company is rapidly growing, we are looking for an eager Linux Project Engineer with excellent technical skills.


This position involves installing, configuring and testing of our clusters, as well as some technical escalation support. To succeed in this role you need to analyse the technical issues first and solve them in a very pragmatic way. You are able to work alongside our customer and put across out of the box solutions. If necessary, you will provide training in order to support our customers.


You will work with the latest hardware and software technologies such as cutting edge massive storage platforms, high speed network interconnects as InfiniBand, Omnipath and 10GE as well as modern High Performance Computing software.


There will be ample opportunity to develop your skills and professional growth.

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer - Location Barcelona / Malta or Remote
jobs.content:
What is Casumo


Casumo as a company is a technology startup formed in 2012, Casumo as a product is a recognised and award winning online casino. Casumo as a concept though, is literally a whole new universe. We’re not working with casino, we’re working with changing what the common perception of casino is. Through design, technology & innovation we aim to disrupt a young, but in many ways immature, industry by ignoring rules.


Following initial success and growth Casumo is wholly committed to its focus on great technology as the driving force behind the way we work. We all share the responsibility of finding the right tools which allow us to preserve and fully embrace the flat organisation, and highly democratic workflows we enjoy today.


What would be your role?


Here at Casumo we have our lovingly crafted desktop app, our award winning mobile app, and a suite of bespoke tools to support us in being the best we can be. These are all constantly evolving through the combined creativity of everyone here. As part of the team you will help guide this evolution in collaboration with a full stack team of developers and designers, while working closely with our content producers, marketing gurus, player ambassadors, and anyone else who wants to get involved.


There are many great ideas being suggested here at Casumo, so you will need to explore them and discover for yourself what you find most interesting, and then get stuck in! Collaboration works best with great communication so you will need to share what you are up to with the team, and reach out for help when you need it. We all share the responsibility for improving our products, our code and our teamwork so you’ll need to get involved, and above all be the change you want to see.


Who are you?


You are a JS developer who has worked on a number of interesting and successful projects, where you have needed to collaborate but also driven the project forward yourself. You are an open minded, honest and a driven problem solver who is, not only hungry for more learnings, but also able to spread knowledge to others around you.


Does this sound like you?



  • Takes pride in the code they write and understands the importance of writing in a scalable and maintainable way.

  • Has a true interest that reaches beyond any course or education.

  • Eager to keep up to date with the latest JS developments and tools.

  • Loves that batman joke.

  • Independent and self motivated.

  • Can create positive changes, without losing friends over the existence of semi-colons.

  • Can work with backend developers to design awesome apis.

  • Excited to write in a declarative functional style.

  • Strong with TDD, Unit and Functional Testing in JavaScript.

  • A jolly good sentient being.

jobs.title: Software Architekt
jobs.content:
Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Definition, Dokumentation und Pflege der Software-Architektur für komplexe Infotainment-Systeme unter Berücksichtigung von System- und Hardware-Architektur

  • Umsetzung von Software-Anforderungen in der Software-Architektur nach Anforderungs- und Machbarkeitsanalyse

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Digital Analytics Team
jobs.content:
The BlueLabs Digital Analytics team is a fast-paced, innovative, and agile group that is at the forefront of revolutionizing the ways that citizens use and learn about services. Our analytics support ranges from strategic analysis—such as identifying year-over-year trends in demand and availability—to operational support—such as measuring the effectiveness of specific outreach tactics. Our work focuses on individual targeted outreach efforts across email, SMS, phone, and mail, empowered by a culture of testing. These contacts have direct, measurable impact on the lives of millions of individuals. We work closely with internal government innovation groups, and build on the analytics methodology pioneered in e-commerce, advocacy, and retail.


AS PART OF THE DIGITAL ANALYTICS ENGINEERING TEAM AT BLUELABS, YOU’LL...




    • Make a difference. The digital analytics engineering team supplies the engine at the heart of our analytics operations. Your role will be first and foremost about enabling the BlueLabs team to succeed in its mandate to improve the lives of citizens.

    • Learn and adapt. As a member of the digital analytics engineering team, you will work in BlueLabs cutting-edge technology stack. You’ll be called on to wear several hats: frontend, backend, DevOps.

    • Design. We’re building a platform to support teams like our digital analytics team, and our engineers are the driving force behind it. You'll need to understand the problem and define it. Your own expertise and experience will help us design the solution we need.

    • Collaborate. Every project benefits from diverse viewpoints from the very beginning, and so you’ll work closely with analysts and data scientists and with our clients to develop the technology that empowers them to drive change.

    • Create. Ultimately, we’re looking for you not just to write code—but to create apps, systems, and solutions that are challenging and exciting.



AS AN ENGINEER ON OUR DIGITAL TEAM, YOU'LL...




    • Join a team of engineers with responsibility for the development, deployment, and support of BlueLabs technology in support of the government analytics team.

    • Architect and implement the data pipelines that power the day-to-day work of our analysts and clients.

    • Participate in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, and deployment, with a focus on owning small-to-medium features.

    • Engage in pairing, design review, and code review to improve our code and systems.

    • Contribute to engineering team’s mission to improve continuously, by leading and participating in planning sessions, code reviews, and best practices discussions.

jobs.title: Systems Architect - Fight cancer with code
jobs.content:
Offer


RaySearch is developing the next generation oncology information system to support improved cancer care and is now looking for talented systems architects. This is a unique opportunity to build software that improves the lives of cancer patients around the world.


You will be part of a project consisting of several agile teams, each with the mission to define and develop key product and platform functionality in close collaboration with stakeholders such as other architects, product owners and hospital end-users. You will be part of designing and implementing a new robust and scalable software platform without legacy code.


RaySearch is an industry leader in software for radiation therapy with a strong focus on research and development that offers excellent staff benefits in a stimulating environment with highly skilled colleagues. The position is based at our new head office in central Stockholm and entitles fulltime, permanent work.


Job description


You will work with one or several agile teams. Your mission is to together with the teams define and implement a high-level architecture which supports the functional and technical requirements.


Your focus should be on sustainable software development, ensuring code quality and great engineering practices. You should be passionate about well-constructed and maintainable code.


You should enjoy getting your hands dirty with the source code in order to build great functionality and to get a good understanding of the system and the daily challenges faced by the developers.


Key responsibilities



  • Accountable for quality of code and architecture in your area

  • Establish and drive engineering practices around sustainable software development

  • Identify, motivate and specify internal technical projects and prioritize them with the product owner

  • Act as a role model and coach to other members of the team, using code reviews, coding standard oversight and best practices management

  • Ensure that there is no unmotivated long-term drift in key metrics, such as development speed, performance or memory usage

  • Create cutting-edge reusable and scalable Technologies



Please note: Due to summer vacations applications will be considered and responded to in mid-August.

jobs.title: Lead Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
We are leading the digital transformation of government, making public services digital by default, and simpler, clearer and faster to use. 

We work in small, agile teams of developers, designers, content designers and others. We build a minimum viable product, and then iterate – always asking how we can make things better for users, who are at the centre of everything we do. We designed, built and run GOV.UK, the starting point for 60 million citizens to experience government. 

But we're not just about websites. We're finding ways to help those without digital skills share the benefits of digital government. We’re building platforms like Verify, which confirms users are who they say they are, and the Performance Platform, which gives citizens statistics on how government services are doing right now. We’re also setting standards for digital platforms that are shared across agencies and departments, ensuring technology is consistent and spending is controlled. 

This is just some of what we do. You can keep up to date with our Technology at GDS blog. 

Help us make government better. 

GOV.UK Verify allows people to access their government records and services on GOV.UK securely and safely, without having to use postal or face-to-face services. 

The service is being delivered in a new way for the first time anywhere in the world. Rather than government seeking to verify individuals’ identity online and manage their login credentials, we are using a range of certified companies which users can choose from. 

GOV.UK Verify is currently in public beta and being used to support 9 government services with 3 certified companies on board. A proportion of people will be able to identify themselves to government services entirely digitally, in about 15 minutes. Over time, this proportion will grow as we continue to develop and expand the service. Keep up to date with our blog. 



The role 

As the Lead Web Operations Engineer you will be key in the development of the right tooling to create and evolve a resilient and secure platform on top of Infrastructure As A Service. You will be responsible for the day to day development of the infrastructure platforms supporting GOV.UK Verify, working closely with the Systems Architect. 

You will be working in a relatively unique technical environment where technical problem solving will be related to security, identity management, and scaling in a cloud based environment with heavy use of microservices. 

You will be key part in the development of the right tooling to create and evolve a resilient and secure platform on top of Infrastructure As A Service. 

Main responsibilities 



  • Leading by example both in how you conduct yourself and in providing engineering excellence to the build of the platforms identifying and promoting best practice 

  • Working with the Technical Architects, Head of Operations and Product Owner to provide robust, resilient and scalable platform for GOV.UK Verify. 

  • Mentoring junior webops personnel and developers in best practice for Cloud implementations 

  • Facilitating daily standups, team meetings, sizing and planning meetings, and incident retrospectives 

  • Setting an example for and encouraging positive and constructive communication both within the team and when communicating with other GDS teams 

  • Ensuring the team has right processes in place to deliver quality solutions 

  • Communicating concerns about potential production issues back to Technical Architects and Head of Operations

  • Identifying and measuring relevant KPIs to drive continual performance improvement 

  • Cultivating and maintaining relationships with other webops teams within GDS and HMG 

  • Working with consultants and accreditors on register of technical risks in relation to the Infrastructure 

  • Prioritising and delivering recommendations and improvements in response to incident retrospectives

jobs.title: API Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for ambitious developers to build our public APIs in a growing team of skilled engineers. You will get to develop and deploy features that reach 100.000s of users every day and together with your team you decide how to design and implement new functionality. We work on a .NET stack with a SQL Server backend. Our API serves more than 20.000.000 requests daily and we log more than a GB of data a minute. We index these logs in real-time and create dashboards for instant insight as we need it. We deploy when we want and aim to fix bugs before customers see them.


Is this you?



  • You love designing public APIs - both REST and SOAP

  • You’re a developer looking to gain and share knowledge

  • You're a team player who can also make independent decisions

  • You love to code and get a kick out of seeing your features in production

  • You make mistakes sometimes – but you learn from them and take pride in fixing any issues

  • You and your team are in control - no micromanaging here

  • You challenge status quo


We offer:



  • A chance to work with some of the best professionals in the industry

  • Influence on the tools and technologies in our stack

  • Professional and personal growth through inspiring colleagues, challenging tasks, conferences, hackathons and meet-ups

  • Excellent Christianshavn location with a view of Den Sorte Diamant across the harbor

  • Young and friendly colleagues with a running-club, Friday bars, etc.

  • Free phone, Internet and choice of Mac, Win or Linux work machine

  • First-class canteen


Responsibilities:



  • Build public APIs that directly impact and improve the daily work of 100.000s of customers and partners

  • Work closely together with a dedicated team of passionate developers and the partners that consume our API

  • Write elegant, clean, testable and effective code

  • Review the code of others and have your own code reviewed

  • Write automated tests, and watch them run green in our continuous integration setup after pushing your changes to GitHub

  • Push often, deploy early, and always measure and improve what you work on

  • Be responsible for the daily health of the API


Qualifications:



  • Knowledge of public API design

  • Knowledge of – or an urge to learn – new tools and technologies

  • Interest in Continuous Integration, DevOps and high frequency deployments

  • Excellent English communication skills

  • Burning passion for building, shipping and deploying business-critical web applications

  • You know more than one programming language


Please apply with both CV and cover letter


About Us


e-conomic resides on Christianshavn in central Copenhagen and is part of Visma. We build and design a cloud based accounting product that helps companies run their business. 100.000 happy customers use our product on a regular basis. We are 170 employees from 20+ nationalities.


The development department consists of 40+ people, including Product Owners, QA engineers and UX designers, working with technologies like C#, Node.js, React, MS-SQL, Swift and MongoDB.


We serve more than 50 million requests a day, push to production several times a week, love to talk about (and write) code, believe strongly in automation, and are driven by a desire to measure and monitor in order to constantly improve our product.


If you have any further questions regarding the vacancy, please feel free to contact team lead Sune Alkærsig, on +4561301114 or sal@e-conomic.com.

jobs.title: iOS Developer to work with Real-Time Sports Data in Barcelona
jobs.content:
Visca Web’s passionate team of developers is behind the popular Futebol.com and Marcadores.com brands. Our upcoming iOS native application will enable iPhone users to fully experience the features of the product: real-time results for 9 different sports and predictions contest with prizes to win.

The development of the first version of the application has been carried out by an external partner and is nearing completion. We want to bring the next steps of our mobile development in-house and we are looking for an iOS enthusiast and experienced developer to join our team in Barcelona, Spain.

Your Role:


As iOS Developer in the Marcadores.com mobile application team, you will have the objective to constantly improve the application and also add new features to it.
The existing code will need to be rewritten (with Swift), constantly adjusted and improved. The application will need to stay robust and stable as traffic and user-base grow.

Summary of responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the launch of the first version of the application

  • Constantly improve the quality of the code, rewrite parts of it, introducing Swift (the current app is based on Objective C)

  • Implement new functionalities (in collaboration with the backend team who develops the API)

  • Fix bugs reported by users

  • Suggest improvements on development and usage

  • Later, you may work on the watch version of the application.


Our Tools

We understand that to make great apps, you need great tools. Our IDE are the latest stable versions of Xcode and AppCode. When debugging use sometimes Charles to hack the API. FauxPas provides us automatic code review. Talking about API, we also use Paw when we need to test it.

We love continuous integration and continuous deployment. We use Bitrise to take care of building and deploying. We also love GitHub, which we use with the GitHub flow, working with pull requests.

We collaborate in English with JIRA and Slack is our favorite tool for team and direct messaging along with the odd GIF.

jobs.title: Software Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
If you enjoy being a part of the entire software development lifecycle; from design to deployment, ensuring the highest code quality and performance at every step, then you’ll love what we have here at Klarna.


We're growing our test engineering teams here at Klarna; building test automation infrastructure to increase test coverage and improve code quality across our entire engineering organisation.


Some of the stuff you’ll do;



  • Build test automation frameworks that enable development teams to deliver high quality software at speed.

  • Improve the quality and health of Klarna's systems by providing information on how their services are perceived from the outside (using both blackbox and whitebox testing).

  • Devise testing strategies for new business features.

  • Advise development teams on software design choices.

  • Act as a technical ambassador for quality throughout the entire engineering organisation.


Realistically, you’ll need experience building test automation tools and frameworks, as well as a strong coding ability; While we mainly use Ruby, we're searching for problem solvers that are confident working with different technologies and willing to learn new skills. You’ll need to know about contract-driven testing, context-driven testing, agile methodologies (pairing, TDD, BDD) and continuous delivery practices.


You'll work in our knowledge sharing culture, receive a generous occupational pension, 30 days paid annual leave, subsidised gym membership and a range of discounts on everything from electrical goods to flights and hotels.


Interested in finding out more?


Send over your CV and let's arrange a chat.

About us


Here at Klarna we’re simplifying buying - We do this by letting the consumer buy online without signing up for anything, they pay after receiving the goods; we assume the credit and fraud risks for the merchants.


We have more than 1200 employees and we’re active in 18 countries. We serve 35 million consumers and work with 50,000 merchants, processing over 400,000 transactions every day.

jobs.title: Software Engineering Team Lead

Benefits

Send over a CV in English and let's arrange a chat.

We do this through utilising and developing cutting-edge technology and empowering students, developers, engineers and companies to build and grow products with robust and constantly updated cloud skills.

We are looking for a product leader that will report to the CEO and will be in charge of our product execution across all our projects, working with a talented team of engineers and designers, including our R&D team. We build enterprise and consumer software to improve our content operations and UX on several levels using a set of technologies such as machine learning, NLP and data analysis.

In this role you are defining our product roadmap, build and help grow our product team and achieve short-term and long-term goals based on data, customer feedback and key stake-holders.

The person we are looking for has been working as a product leader for the last few years managing growing teams of talented engineers working with Content, Sales and Marketing executives. You are very comfortable building products and scaling them based on data and customer feedback.

This position is based in our Switzerland office of Mendrisio (Ticino), at 15 minutes from the Italian border and very close to both amazing Lake Como and Lake Lugano. We are looking for international leaders that would like to relocate here to lead our team and product operations travelling to our San Francisco offices during the year to sync with our management team.


Benefits


  • Competitive compensation
  • Yearly bonus based on your achievements
  • Stock options
  • Full benefits, including medical, dental and vision
  • Yearly budget for conferences/courses for your personal development
  • A very exciting environment with unlimited snacks and drinks
  • Regular travels to our US offices (San Francisco)
  • Your personal workstation (up to $2000)

We value diversity and are an equal opportunity employer at Cloud Academy. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Senior Python Developer
jobs.content:
What is Cloud Academy?

Cloud Academy is a startup, based in San Francisco and in Switzerland, which offers a platform to learn cloud computing and test your skills.

Cloud computing, today, is complicated: Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, and many other companies are offering a never ending list of services and features.

We are making it easier to learn whats necessary to master the cloud.

In just three years, we went from an idea to a solid platform, used monthly by tens of thousands of customers, to learn cloud and practice it with our hands on labs.

What we are looking for

We have been very successful in building our platform to manage thousands of companies and individuals using it every day in 150+ countries worldwide. Our product team is now looking for an experienced Python Developer to join our core product team to develop an entire new area of our product related to content management for our internal team and for our enterprise customers.

The ideal person has a deep understanding of the Python programming language, experience working with a SaaS product and loves to work in a team of 3 to 6 people to build web products that are used by thousands of people using the latest available technologies. A strong passion and knowledge of Amazon Web Services are a strong preference.

You will work on a new set of products in collaboration with our front-end team and content team.

This position is based in our Switzerland office in Mendrisio (Ticino, CH).


Benefits
