jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Our team is working on a set of web based systems, which we developed ourselves. We have multiple tools for planning and running our bus fleet, which are built as a service oriented architecture. We respect modern web technologies, open standards and contribute to open source projects. We live agile principles and own our process.


We are an extremely unusual IT team for the average bus operator: we consist of 100 people in multiple locations, speaking several languages and want to grow even more.


To augment our team in Berlin, we are searching for an experienced web developer (f/m) for immediate start.


What we offer:



  • Experience a fast growing startup with incredible offline value (You have probably already seen our green buses on the streets, right?)

  • Real agile development based on current situation, without Gantt-charts and dusty specifications

  • Join a diverse, experienced team to exchange your ideas and contribution

  • Professional trainings if you don't have any or too little experience with Symfony2 yet

  • Office at Alex

  • competitive salary

  • soft working hours

  • conference visits


Here is a video from our head of software architecture about why it is interesting to work for us: 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TUWB7cW8UTg

jobs.title: Relocate to Silicon Valley? Mobile, Web or BigData - choose your flavor.
jobs.content:
An adventure of a lifetime in sunny California?


We are looking for skilled and passionate developers willing to relocate to Silicon Valley. Web, Mobile or BigData – choose your flavor.

jobs.title: Scrum Master
jobs.content:
3DEXCITE R&D is responsible for providing applications and software components for realtime and offline 3D visualization, ranging from geometry optimization tools over scene editing applications to rendering solutions. You will be part of the Technologies team responsible for providing the Stellar rendering framework, acting as Scrum Master of two teams which work on distributed rendering and rendering in the cloud.


Job Responsibilities


Scrum Master for two 3DEXCITE development teams



  • Organise and moderate ceremonies

  • Help teams detect and remove impediments

  • Cultivate self-organisation within teams

  • Continuously coach developers, Product Owners, and stakeholders in agile practices and principles

  • Proactively facilitate communication between developers, Product Owners, and stakeholders

  • Closely cooperate with Scrum Masters and Product Owners of other teams

  • Live the role of servant leader by example

  • Supervise team members (set and review annual goals, relay requests for trainings, participate in hiring process)

jobs.title: Senior Automation Software Engineer - Sofia, Bulgaria location
jobs.content:
Responsibilities:

This is a position within VMware automation teams. Teams consist of highly experienced developers and automation experts, with a strong track record of delivering high number of automated tests for critical VMware releases. Candidate will own the UI and/or API automation of specific areas of the products by utilizing existing and extending existing frameworks, by overseeing the execution of these tests and analyzing the results. These frameworks are based on Java and Java + Selenium (FLEX) as well as industry leading automation tools that have been developed within VMware.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer for a Music Company
jobs.content:
You will be joining a midsized cross functional team, consisting of front and server side developers, a tester, 2 UX designers and a Scrum Master. The team works in an Agile way, utilizing Scrum to deliver shippable product increments in 2 week sprints. Everyone is encouraged to actively participate in the Scrum ceremonies i.e. Sprint Planning. The flat structure of the team ensures a level of autonomy, whilst encouraging collaboration and the generation of new ideas.


We are a music company with some very ambitious plans so there is a wide variety of challenges to get involved in. In the short term, you will either be assisting in modernising our website, ensuring that it contains all of the functionality expected from a modern commercial music provider, or working on our music services platform which helps get our music into other products via APIs and HTML plugins.

jobs.title: Medior & Senior .Net Developers needed for creating the future
jobs.content:
To further develop our next generation ERP system we need expansion of the development team. To create the future we need you and your skills to make the difference in the food industry and beyond. 


The team exists of 15 Dutch developers who will work closely with you and an external team of 5 Romanian developers.  


Based on the functionalities of the current ERP systems and the knowledge of the market of our sales department and implementation consultants you work on the successor of the current Reflex 3000 ERP system. Within the development team there is a lot of freedom in developing our future. 


Do you want to be part of a enthusiastic team, you will be more than welcome to respond. We are looking for a Dutch speaking addition of the Dutch branche.

jobs.title: Angular.JS & Node.JS fullstack web developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking a talented Node / Angular / full stack JS dev to join our growing team.


Constantly want to learn something new?


Want to be part of the whole development process from planning right through to product launch?


Tired of being just a dev in a cubicle?


Then read on...


We are looking to hire a dev who works well as part of a team, but also can get there head down and smash through large features independently.


Someone who enjoys working in an agile fashion and has experience of JIRA.


Having MEAN stack experience is a huge bonus. As this will form a large part of what we have planned in the coming year. 


Commercial experience is very important and a demonstrable portfolio is a must.

jobs.title: Web Developer Front-End
jobs.content:
Job Description

Are you a Web Developer looking to work at the forefront of technology and innovative products used by millions of players?

As you will be developing and maintaining systems to enable people to have fun, we strongly believe you in turn should have fun doing this. So we have an onsite pool and foosball table and a gym (that’s fun for some people!)

Focusing more on the job itself, as one of our highly skilled Web Developers, you will analyse user requirements and produce corresponding development tasks, ensuring their completion by putting together a robust end to end process. You will maintain our existing systems, develop new system applications and improve functionality to ensure high quality in any software releases. 

You will also be working on innovative projects such as: Real Time CRM, Marketing Platforms, Customer Messaging Systems, Web based Store, Back office applications and dashboards for our business customers etc

The Web Developer job is based in our Dublin service office forming part of our Software Development Services team. As part of this team, you will provide contract research and development services to our gaming companies. And trust us, there are plenty of pioneering projects across the Group.




Additional Information

The salary for this job is based on experience, so whilst we are not able to go into detail at this stage, we can say that we offer great salary packages and also like to throw in a discretionary annual performance bonus.

We offer health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address). In addition, you are entitled to an annual health assessment and to join our company pension scheme.

Our in-house training and development team deliver fantastic support in terms of developing your skills and helping you progress your career.

We have a canteen which offers hot and cold options for breakfast and lunch and we contribute €3 daily towards this. In addition, there is free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks.

jobs.title: Solutions Architect - come and help us design innovative client driven projects
jobs.content:
Are you looking to work on new projects designing solutions to help some of the world’s biggest companies deliver their ‘whats next?’?  If so please read on.


DigitasLBi is a marketing and technology agency that builds complex digital marketing solutions delivered to range of devices for an ever-growing portfolio of clients.  


As Solutions Architect we are looking for you to use your proven industry experience in working with web-centric technologies to help build large-scale digital platforms for our blue-chip clients.  Whilst learning from colleagues, Architecture Directors, and the Technology leadership team to further and grow your own career.   


Being a part of DigitasLBi means working in multi-disciplinary teams made up of specialist technologists as well as Creative, UX, Strategy, Data Science, Client Services and Project Management.  You’ll work collaboratively to challenge and stretch our teams and clients alike, towards the same end goal of solving the clients problem through combined and individual excellence.  As a Solutions Architect you will engage directly with clients to help them make the right decisions and help them implement the best solutions.


We have a strong community culture, regular off-project workshops and an opinionated but collaborative mind-set that helps us drive best practices from the bottom up.

jobs.title: Senior / Lead Front End Developer - come and help craft innovative solutions
jobs.content:

Being a part of DigitasLBi means working in multi-disciplinary teams made up of specialist technologists as well as Creative, UX, Strategy, Data Science, Client Services and Project Management.  You’ll work collaboratively to challenge and stretch our teams and clients alike, towards the same end goal of solving the problem through combined and individual excellence.   


We have a strong community culture, regular off-project workshops and an opinionated but collaborative mind-set that helps us drive best practices from the bottom up.

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs.content:
WOW App Inc. is a young and energetic start up that embraces great talents.

Our product, WOW Sports (www.wowsport.io) is the ultimate social platform for sports competition. It is a place where talented athletes can showcase their unique talents, compete against people with the same passion, and to climb up ranking and win achievements, so that they earn recognition, and have the opportunity to take their talents and dreams to the next level.

WOW App Inc. is looking for a FULL TIME Sr. Android Developer with a proven track record and work experience to spearhead our Android Development efforts.

Responsibilities Include:

  1. Design and build advanced applications for the Android platform
  2. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
  3. Work with outside data sources and APIs
  4. Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.
  5. Work on bug fixing and improving application performance.
  6. Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.

Benefits


  1. You will be a key part of a start up, and its future success.
  2. Potential Share Options
  3. Work with a great team, who is dedicated to our company.
  4. Competitive Salary
  5. Flexible Working Hours
  6. Great Learning Opportunity

jobs.title: Ready for your next challenge? Join Netcompany as one of our skilled developers
jobs.content:
At Netcompany, we are committed!


We are committed to our customers’ success – we are committed to our employees’ career – and we are committed to making our society a better one by delivering the best possible projects for our customers. This commitment has made us the most successful IT Company in Denmark.


Our success can be credited to our skilled and talented employees and we are proud to have the most skilled technical IT consultants in the sector. In Netcompany, we have our expertise in common: Everyone can code - including your project manager and the colleague next to you. Everyone is passionate about programming and coding, which creates a unique atmosphere.
We believe in giving you the opportunity to accelerate your career and become the leading expert in your desired field. Netcompany is geared to make you smarter through our in-house training programme, courses, and certifications in different technologies. These initiatives will equip you to take on evermore complex projects.


Lots of responsibility from day 1
We do not believe that you will get better at what you do from pushing papers around a desk for the first three months of your new job. On the contrary, we believe that you will learn and develop very quickly, when you are actively involved in our many challenging projects from the start.


As a developer in Netcompany you will be part of our Application Management Centre where you get the opportunity to be an important part of exciting projects and create solutions for our different types of customers’ existing systems. You will be coding both on your own and as part of a team because we know that you cannot wait to get your hands dirty.


Our Application Management Centre is organized into a number of teams comprising 5-12 committed Developers under the management of a Team Manager. A team is set up around specific clients and applications so that each team is responsible for the maintenance and further development of a portfolio of clients and applications.


The technology you will be working with will vary as it depends on the project and the client, but the majority of our projects use object-oriented programming such as Java and .NET/C#.


Furthermore, we work with HTML/CSS/JavaScript, SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Microsoft SQL-server/T-SQL, Sitecore, EPiServer, and Oracle Database etc.

jobs.title: Startup CTO/Chief Architect Full-Stack Ruby-on-Rails + JS Web Developer
jobs.content:
Join us and become a part of history as together we change the face of e-commerce for digital content and preserve the ability of authors to earn a living writing. We are looking for smart, creative engineering and development support to add a long list of functions to our existing web site, create dedicated mobile applications, and extend our database backend functionality for internal support and to provide ebook and audiobook content distribution through all the major ebook and audiobook stores on the web.


The current beta site has baseline functionality developed in Ruby-on-Rails running on AWS. We need your help expanding this and rapidly adding author and customer-attracting functions.


Highlights



  • Get in on the ground floor and become an owner of a new, industry-transforming company.

  • Consult with former kayak.com founding employee & Chief Architect Bill O’Donnell, who is a technical advisor to the company.

  • Create your own solutions to challenging technical problems.

  • Choose the tools that will be used by you and your colleagues.

  • Make mistakes, disrupt the status quo, and help us create the engineering culture that you would like!


If hired, you will receive a hefty equity grant relative to the position. You will also earn direct payment in the form of a revenue share on every dollar from the site, tools, and distribution your work enables, increasing as gross revenue increases, until those rev-share pay levels reach your target salary.


We are located in the growing Lebanon/Hanover, NH tech region around Dartmouth and the Lebanon airport, but during our launch phase, we expect candidates to work from home, wherever that may be. We will pay for relocation, should that become necessary in the future.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Analyst
jobs.content:
ForeFlight is looking for a Quality Assurance Analyst to join our QA test team. You'll work with product developers, leaders and the QA Team to develop and perform manual and automated tests on new and existing ForeFlight application, web services and server features.


Aviation experience is a requirement for this role. Technical skills are also important. Knowledge of how web and iOS applications work is key, including understanding of APIs, HTML5, CSS3, and how Javascript and Ajax elements work. Additionally, a qualified candidate would have QA experience with Map products including MapBox and Google Map. You should know your way around an iPad/ Mac and be an analytical thinker.


Professionally, this person is driven to execute, deliver, and complete projects independently, seeking advice and direction from team members when needed, and plowing ahead to completion when the path forward is clear. This person will be able to point to specific examples that highlight the individual’s ability to meet the objectives outlined above, and references will confirm this person’s unique abilities.


This position is based in the Portland, ME office.

jobs.title: Javascript Web Developer
jobs.content:
ForeFlight is looking for a talented web developer to join our team. This position is for a unique and technically well-rounded individual with experience building high profile web apps. This person will help us create the next generation of ForeFlight Web and continue our leadership in web-based aviation software.


While you know many different web technologies, you find yourself at home within a JavaScript/Python web stack.


You’re knowledgeable of both legacy and emerging JavaScript standards, frameworks, and tools. You know what prototypes are (and aren’t), general best practices for bending the language to your will, and are familiar with client-side performance optimization techniques. You know when using jQuery makes sense and when it doesn't.


You love Python for the simplicity and flexibility of the language, especially within the context of web development. You're comfortable working on back-end APIs in Python as well as serving up traditional, templated pages.


Shipping software is something you take pride in and you welcome the opportunity to make immediate contributions to software with a passionate user-base.


This position is based in our Austin, TX office. A pilot-coder, or individual looking to pursue his or her private pilot license, is a plus. We are happy to consider all levels: junior, mid-level, and senior candidates.

jobs.title: Server Developer
jobs.content:
ForeFlight is looking for a software developer to join our Server/API team in Austin. This position is for a technically well-rounded individual with experience in Java server-side web and enterprise app development that will have responsibilities for developing server-side features and APIs to support our mobile apps. Experience with weather products and APIs (aviation or otherwise), aggregation of data / mashups, and aviation in general are a big plus.


Technically, this person must have experience with Java programming, including use of one or more frameworks, search, and web services (RESTful, binary, and/or XML based). This person believes building applications in the cloud is cake. This person is naturally curious, exploring new technologies in order to stay current, but balances the use of new and old to ensure that execution is priority.


Professionally, this person is driven to execute, deliver, and complete projects independently, seeking advice and direction from team members when needed, and plowing ahead to completion when the path forward is clear. Junior candidates and recent CS grads are encouraged to apply.


This position is based in our Austin, TX office. A pilot-coder, or individual looking to pursue his or her private pilot license, is a plus. Benefits include medical insurance, 401K with matching, and flight training reimbursement. Relocation reimbursement will be provided if moving to Austin.

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
ForeFlight is looking for an iOS developer to join our team. This position is for a unique and technically well-rounded individual with experience building and shipping iOS apps. This person will help us create the next generation of ForeFlight Mobile on the iPad and iPhone.


Technically, this person is experienced in Objective-C and Cocoa development, with a track record of shipping exquisitely-designed apps. This person has a solid understanding of UIKit, database design with SQLite/Core Data, communicating with web services, and memory management with and without ARC. This person can hit the ground running on iOS 8 technologies, writing rock-solid code with blocks, GCD, Swift, and Auto Layout. This person is naturally curious, exploring new technologies in order to stay current, but balances the use of new and old to ensure that execution is priority.


Professionally, this person is driven to execute, deliver, and complete projects independently, seeking advice and direction from team members when needed, and plowing ahead to completion when the path forward is clear. This person will be able to point to specific examples that highlight the individuals ability to meet the objectives outlined above, and references will confirm this person’s unique abilities.


This position is based in our Houston, TX office. A pilot-coder, or individual looking to pursue his or her private pilot license, is a plus. Benefits include medical insurance, 401(k) with matching, and flight training reimbursement.

jobs.content:

ForeFlight is looking for an iOS developer to join our map team. This position is for a unique and technically well-rounded individual with experience building and shipping iOS apps. jobs.title: Director of Product, Kijiji Canada
jobs.content:
We are seeking a Head of Product who'll be responsible for leading the vision, strategy and execution for the end to end consumer experience for Kijiji Canada.



Kijiji, part of the fast-growing eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) at eBay, is the number 1 online Classifieds site in Canada. Reaching half of the monthly on-line population, Kijiji is one of Canada’s Top 10 digital properties, and a leader in helping people find and trade goods and services, including Autos, Real Estate and Jobs. We’ve succeeded because we behave like a dynamic start-up, have end-to-end control of our business and hire the best and brightest people for our fun, unique and engaging culture. Our new, stylish office is located in the historic King and Spadina neighborhood in Toronto’s hub of innovation.



As a leader, you’ll drive innovation in Omni channel and advanced user experiences for the business. This is a critical hire for Kijiji Canada leadership team as it will spearhead the redevelopment of the classifieds consumer experience product strategy and roadmap, define business requirements, features, functionality, set timelines and lead through development and implementation.



RESPONSIBILITIES




  • Lead development and delivery of the Kijiji product strategy and drive innovation

  • Build an elite product considering both core C2C optimization as well as monetization

  • Build trust and effective relationships with peers and provide leadership across the organization

  • Track record of leading Product Management and Design successfully in creating products and flawlessly executing at scale



JOB REQUIREMENTS:




  • You have a track record of leading Product Management and Design successfully in creating products and flawlessly executing at scale

  • You demonstrated leadership experience in developing a multi-year vision for consumer products that are aligned with business strategies

  • Experienced in making data driven decisions that are customer-centric, strategic and analytical

  • You have strong organizational skills, ability to thrive in a matrix environment where success depends on a high degree of cross-functional collaboration, while working on complex initiatives

  • Ability to collaborate and influence leaders at Kijiji Management Team and eCG level

  • Demonstrated leadership experience in developing a multi-year vision for consumer products that are aligned with business strategies

  • Experienced in making data driven decisions that are customer-centric, strategic and analytical



QUALIFICATIONS:




  • Bachelor degree required, MBA or MS preferred

  • 10+ years of relevant industry experience in product development, product management and design

  • Deep understanding and implementation of dual track agile

  • 5+ years in a leadership capacity

jobs.title: MTS, Front End Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay - a company you can be proud to be a part of.



eBay Checkout Experience team is seeking a highly motivated individual to join as amember of technical staff.This Front End Software Engineer position will require the candidate to lead our development efforts and work directly with our business partners to research, develop and deploying next generation web and mobileWeb applications on multiple technologies for high volume transaction environments. The candidate is expected to be effective as an individual contributor,team player,and a champion for results and incremental improvement. In addition to this, the candidate will be expected to have an excellent grasp of designing and implementing frameworks and architectures based on internal and external standards




  • Design and deliver highly scalable multi-tiered distributed software applications

  • Leading teams of software engineers on projects on and off-shore

  • Work with other Engineers, Managers, Product management, QA, and Operations teams to develop innovative solutions that meet market needs with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles

  • Estimate engineering effort, plan implementations, and roll out applications with cross-functional impact

  • Lead product initiatives and recommend improvements

  • Develop and support projects throughout all phases of the development life cycle

  • Work jointly with other team members to deliver complex applications

  • Strong code quality focus including design reviews, code reviews, unit testing and continuous integration.

  • Performing analysis and fine tuning of page performance and reliability

  • Mentor and guide developers in coding and design methodology and page performance

  • Conceptualizing, coding, deploying, and iterating on next generation prototypes

  • Flexible approach to analyzing technical issues and clearly communicating recommendations/solutions

  • Support site rollouts and available for on-call duties to resolve site issues

  • Proficient in agile development methodologies



About eBay:



eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) is a global commerce leader including the Marketplace, StubHub and Classifieds platforms. Collectively, we connect millions of buyers and sellers around the world, empowering people and creating opportunity through Connected Commerce. Founded in 1995 in San Jose, Calif., eBay is one of the world’s largest and most vibrant marketplaces for discovering great value and unique selection.




  • Design and deliver highly scalable multi-tiered distributed software applications

  • Leading teams of software engineers on projects on and off-shore

  • Work with other Engineers, Managers, Product management, QA, and Operations teams to develop innovative solutions that meet market needs with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles

  • Estimate engineering effort, plan implementations, and roll out applications with cross-functional impact

  • Lead product initiatives and recommend improvements

  • Develop and support projects throughout all phases of the development life cycle

  • Work jointly with other team members to deliver complex applications

  • Strong code quality focus including design reviews, code reviews, unit testing and continuous integration.

  • Performing analysis and fine tuning of page performance and reliability

  • Mentor and guide developers in coding and design methodology and page performance

  • Conceptualizing, coding, deploying, and iterating on next generation prototypes

  • Flexible approach to analyzing technical issues and clearly communicating recommendations/solutions

  • Support site rollouts and available for on-call duties to resolve site issues

  • Proficient in waterfall and agile development methodologies

jobs.title: Platform Architect
jobs.content:
Platform Architect



Gumtree - Richmond, London



eBay Classifieds Group is a creative leader in online classifieds, with twelve brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities - whether it’s a sofa, a car, a dress, job, an apartment, a concert ticket, or financial services. As the world leader in online classifieds, we pride ourselves on knowing the markets we operate in - our success is the result of tailoring our sites to the subtle distinctions of each market. Our sites have become a part of the local culture in many countries and play a big part in the lives of our customers.



People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust. We are in 17 countries across all continents and with our twelve unique brands - 2dehands.be/2ememain.be, alaMaula, BilBasen, Close5, DBA, eBay Classifieds (eBay Classifieds and eBay Kleinanzeigen), Gumtree, Kijiji, LoQUo, Marktplaats.nl, mobile.de, and Vivanuncios - offer online classifieds in more than 1,000 cities around the world.



Gumtree is part of the eBay Classified Group. Founded in London in 2000, Gumtree is today the UK’s leading classified site, with over 14.5m unique visitors every month and over 9.5m app downloads. The platform enables people to trade everything from cars to home items and find jobs, local services, community events and even somewhere to live.



Job Responsibilities:



The Platform Architect will report directly to the CTO. As Platform Architect you will be operating cross-functionally, providing leadership to ensure that agreed architecture, principles and practices are followed. Being responsible for ensuring alignment between architecture and the business, like ensure that the platform is structured around business capability - This requires a distinct focus on collaboration with domain experts and partners across the whole business.



As we continue to grow our business and our offerings, you will need to ensure that our architecture and technology offering scale with and drive, our business.




  • Previous experience with an eCommerce technology company as a lead architect.

  • A desire to execute on the current platform strategy. And to research current software design and architecture patterns. At the same time continue to evolve it to keep our company ahead of the industry.

  • Execute on a ‘divide and conquer’ architecture strategy - build and lead a team of architects around this.

  • Collaborate and lead engineering teams to ensure that implementations are consistent within our defined principles and standard methodologies.

  • Collaborate with product owners, domain experts and partners across the business to align between architecture and business.

  • Collaborate with Site Operations to align platform strategy with operational concerns - leading towards a DevOps culture.

  • Collaborate and knowledge share with senior architects, technology leaders and business partners across eBay Classifieds Group.

  • Identify opportunities for engineering productivity improvements and directions, and evangelize them successfully.

  • Identify gaps in skills/knowledge required to satisfy the overall technology needs of the development team and the business.

  • Lead, coach and mentor engineers across the whole technology team.

  • Strong interpersonal skills, intellectual curiosity, real passion for problem-solving, and comfort with ambiguity.

  • Experience with mobile/multi-device development.

  • Intense experience with agile work style like Lean Start-up, Kanban and Scrum.

  • High energy and a desire to work in a results-oriented, fast growth company that never lost its start-up spirit.

  • Fluent in English

jobs.title: Lead Software Architect for Early Stage Startup
jobs.content:
Join me as one of Turn’s first employees in Chicago and let’s build an innovative business together.


I'm Rahier Rahman, Founder and CEO of Turn Technologies. I previously founded Pangea Money Transfer and helped build the critical infrastructure for a global money transfer company, grew a stellar team to 40, developed international partnerships with major players in the fintech space, and raised $15M in venture financing. Prior to that, I co-founded an online apartment rental business called domu.com. And before all that I was on the investment team at Cerberus Capital and the start-up team at Time Warner that launched several magazines you know today.


I'm building Turn to help the next generation of on-demand start-ups grow by developing a platform that combines state-of-the-art AI, streamlined UI, and massive amounts of mobile data. What we will do will help many people redefine work and help on-demand companies scale.


There are three expectations we have of someone in a technical leadership role: we want you to be a technologist, a manager, and an inspirational leader.


As a technologist you should have a high-level understanding of what is possible through technology and be excited about the opportunities technology can bring to a business. You should be able to participate in high-level technical conversations, help break complex business needs down to technical capabilities, and help teams reach a technical consensus. We gravitate towards polyglots that use the best tools for the problems at hand and who are force multipliers and enhance the creativity and productivity of the team. 


As a manager you should be able to help an organization operate to its fullest potential. You should be able to increase team efficiency through communication, focus, process, and consistency - but not bring unnecessary bureaucracy or ceremony. You should be able to grow the people on these teams by providing them with personal and professional development goals and helping them achieve them!


As a leader you should put the needs of others first and help people develop and perform as highly as possible. You should be able to inspire the team to go above and beyond, to fail forward, and to surprise everyone. You should be able to have a vision for where our platform can take this business - and push hard to get us there. You lead by doing and your enthusiasm is infectious.


Most importantly, you understand how to help an organization stay focused, happy, and productive. You’re a leader, but you still have solid coding chops. We welcome new ideas and technologies – you’ll be critical in deciding exactly what technologies we use. You’re comfortable working in and leading teams – and have done so in the past, understand and appreciate the value of test-driven development, and love to work in an agile and rapid environment.

jobs.title: Hiring software engineers to mobilize the future of work
jobs.content:
We are mobilizing the future of work for 20M independent business owners in the US alone. Our first cohort will be comprised of two (2) talented and self-driven software engineers to form the core of our engineering team. You will be working on a mix of technologies from iOS (iPhone) and Android native development to interactive web widgets to python-based backend services to relational databases to payments to messaging (communication) to machine learning (scheduling optimization) to scaling a fast-growing backend service.


Your primary responsibilities will be to:
- Develop our mobile applications [Objective C, Android]
- Develop our payments, messaging and scheduling stack
- Develop our machine learning stack for payments and scheduling
- Develop & roll out unit test coverage in both mobile & backend stacks
- Build internal tools for code deployment, customer on-boarding / retention

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
About the Engineering Team


We work together in a pretty novel fashion - team leaders are elected by their teammates, and responsibilities normally held by a single manager are distributed across multiple roles. We have very open discussions about our product, our organization, and shared priorities.


We’re always iterating on how we work and what we build. We’re growing fast and we know that what may have worked a year ago won’t necessarily work a year from now. This applies to both the technology and the organization of our teams. We want to provide the best analytics experience for developers and co-create the best work environment for each other - willingness to evolve is essential.



About the Experience Team


Keen is building the future of analytics-by-API. Our team is focused on making the pieces of Keen that users interact with directly amazing. We build and maintain the core Keen website which handles signup+login, project and organization management, building and visualizing queries via our Explorer and Dashboards apps, and also the Keen internal administrative interface the company uses on a daily basis.


To meet these challenges we have to work efficiently and effectively, both as individuals and as a collaborative team. You will help us be thoughtful and deliberate about tackling the right problems at the right time. You’ll help make building and maintaining our projects easier. You’ll have the opportunity to gain deep understanding of every aspect of our service and teach others! Most importantly, you will collaborate with some pretty amazing humans.

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.content:
***Please note, we are only hiring from the United States and Canada for the Data Engineer position.***


Rocana’s Data Engineering team designs, builds, and tests advanced analytic pipelines that solve critical business problems. The systems we build handle billions of events per day and use that machine data to guide IT operators to the root cause of problems affecting their infrastructure. Engineers interested in applying their software engineering and machine learning skills to real-world, production use cases will feel right at home.


Some of the technology we use:



  • Java

  • Hadoop, Solr, Kafka, Impala, Hive, Spark, MLlib

  • Maven, Jenkins, Github, JIRA

jobs.title: .NET Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a creative, talented .NET developer to participate in creating business-to-consumer applications and frameworks supporting millions of transactions of some of the largest companies around.  Our systems have hundreds of thousands of business users and we provide large, scalable, enterprise-grade capabilities.


What You’ll Be Doing



  • Developing web-based applications using C#, HTML/CSS, JavaScript/JQuery and ASP.Net MVC

  • Utilizing your experience with test-driven development (TDD) and Domain Driven Design (DDD)

  • Working in a team environment with support for client management, integration testing, requirements analysis, and production support so you can focus on writing great code

  • Continually remodeling and refactoring our applications to grow and evolve with current technology, the market, and end-user needs

jobs.title: Lead Frontend Developer to make the world better
jobs.content:
Juicero’s mission is to make healthy living easy and accessible through technology and plant-based nutrition. Starting with the first ever countertop cold-pressed juicing system, and reinventing the “farm to glass” supply chain, we unlock 100% raw, fresh, organic produce directly to consumers everywhere.


The Software Team plays a critical role in realizing this vision, responsible for end-to-end development of the platform that knits together the Juicero IoT appliance, a large-scale, infinitely customizable fresh food processing and packaging operation, and a modern e-commerce front, all into a delightfully seamless customer experience.


As the lead frontend developer, you’ll own application development for our customer and internal facing features. Our ideal candidate will possess both technical depth in modern application development as well as a keen eye for design. With this unique blend of skills, you’ll provide invaluable input into both UI and API design alike, making our products better each step of the way.


Juicero is a Series B funded company with investment from leading venture firms such as Google Ventures, Kleiner Perkins Caufiled & Byers, and ARTIS Ventures.


Come have a fresh juice with us - we’d love to hear from you!


The Work:



  • Lead implementation of e-commerce flow and My Juicero web experience

  • Collaborate with designers, product managers, and software engineers to deliver compelling user-facing products

  • Architect efficient and reusable front-end systems

  • Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content: As a full stack Software Developer for PerfectVision, you will work on both individual and team projects, applying an innovative approach to your work. You should have a keen interest in cutting edge web-based and rich client technologies and enjoy keeping up with latest development tools and methodologies in the IT industry.

jobs.title: Business Operations Analyst
jobs.content:
PerfectVision Manufacturing, Inc. is currently providing an opportunity for a qualified professional to join a motivated business operations team, and to become an integral part of the continual success of the organization.


The Business Operations team goal is to create efficiencies through systematic enhancements, reporting, process identification and documentation, and data validation. Internally we collaborate across teams to identify, develop, and provide the information and systems necessary to successfully manage a profitable business. We create the tools that will allow PVM to support our customers in a manner that cultivates an integrated, long term relationship. This is all done to achieve our primary purpose, providing the operational support needed to execute the PerfectVision strategy.


The Business Operations Analyst is responsible for developing a deep understanding of PerfectVision, becoming a functional subject matter expert in business operations. This individual will work on an operational team that facilitates collaboration across departmental teams to translate business needs into detailed requirements that can be implemented by the MIS development team. This position will be responsible for the design, testing, and implementation of various processes and system changes. This individual will also be responsible for various manual reporting using a combination of Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Excel. Additional responsibilities include project management and leadership roles in a number of key initiatives for the organization.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer

You are the master craftsman of your trade - writing beautiful and powerful software. You have passion to build software systems with thoughtful design, testability and maintainability. You review your peers code with inspiring feedback and thrive in a learning organization that admires nothing but merit. You have bias for action and there is nothing to stop you from getting stuff done. You believe in shipping small and often. You relentlessly pursue tech-debt and influence technical direction in every step of the way in a very Agile environment.

If so, we have a Sr. Software Engineer position open for you to join our API platform team in Walnut Creek, CA.

Requirements

  • 7+ years of professional development experience, building SaaS and REST APIs.
  • Strong development experience with Java and Spring.
  • Demonstrated ability to work with distributed messaging stack such as Kafka or or RabbitMQ.
  • Excellent understanding of data structures, algorithms, software engineering design patterns and principles.
  • Ability to translate high-level requirements to a working system, while setting technical direction and mentoring junior members of the team.

Nice to haves

  • Experience building enterprise software.
  • Experience with search technology including ingestion, indexing, and retrieval of information using Elasticsearch (other Lucene-based search systems such as Solr also helpful).
  • Experience with database technology such as MySql or Postgres.
  • Experience working with distributed systems such as Hadoop or Spark
  • Experience with open security protocols such as SAML,OAUTH and LDAP.
  • Experience with AWS services (EC2, DynamoDB, S3, etc) or similar cloud environments such as Google Cloud.

About Advisor Software, Inc. Advisor Software, Inc. (ASI) is a leading provider of wealth management solutions for the advisor market. The company has pioneered the first enterprise rebalancing solution and a unique goal-directed investment platform that combines institutional-caliber analytics and a balance sheet approach to financial planning. ASI’s applications are designed for a wide range of asset management firms, broker-dealers, banks, insurance companies, online brokerages, registered investment advisor organizations and other financial institutions, enabling these enterprises and their advisors to deliver more insightful, actionable investment advice and build stronger, more profitable client relationships.

Salary / Benefits: Salary commensurate with experience ASI offers a comprehensive benefits package

To apply, please send cover letter and resume to asi_jobs@advisorsoftware.com You must put Senior Software Engineer in the subject line.

jobs.title: System Administrator / DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
About us: At Locus, we’re dedicated to the proliferation of sustainable energy solutions. To that end, we've built a Linux/SaaS platform in AWS to monitor, analyze and manage the performance of more than one hundred thousand solar power systems. We’re a close-knit team that is greater than the sum of its parts. Our organization is mature enough to offer some structure while still leaving plenty of opportunities to make your mark. We’re not perfect but constantly improving. We value folks who offer a new perspective and play nicely with others towards achieving our common goals.



About you: You’re passionate about sustainable energy and want to play a part of pushing our society in that direction. Nothing would excite you more than wedding your engineering prowess with your dreams of clean, green energy. You are thoughtful, curious and ask questions when you don’t understand. You take ownership of your responsibilities and see them through to the entire implementation lifecycle from design to maintenance.



Our Perks at Locus:



  • Conveniently located in downtown SF, a one block walk from Montgomery St station

  • Relaxed work atmosphere. Flexible working hours and work from home policies

  • Health insurance, 401k

  • Fruits, snacks. Bagels and lunch each provided 1x a week

  • A spacious new office complete with a living room couch, big screen TV, PS3, darts and a kegerator

  • Regular company sponsored happy hours and events



Your day to day responsibilities:



  • Responsible for ensuring the overall health, performance, scaling and maturation of our platform, working on monitoring, issue diagnosis & resolution.

  • Contribute to the overall design of new platform features and supporting tool development.

  • Contribute to improving security, redundancy and efficiency of the platform and the tools we use to develop and manage it.

  • Candidates must be willing to be part of the on-call rotation (team is very flexible and supportive about scheduling)

  • Candidates must enjoy a dynamic environment that is growing and moving fast!  You will not be a bored automaton

jobs.title: Tester for a cutting-edge software analysis product
jobs.content:
You will create and maintain unit and integration tests for various aspects of our innovative program analysis tool.


You will work in a team of top computer scientists, and you have the opportunity to learn various state of the art technologies. The tools we are developing are aimed at developers and testers themselves, and so you will be able to use your own product in your daily work, and influence its very design.


In your typical week, you will be talking to our developers about the features and user stories they are developing, and based on their instructions you will create and execute functional and regression tests. You will make sure that the testsuite is up to date, and will help the developers pinpoint errors in case of failed tests.


This job is offered as a part-time or full-time position,and is suitable both for candidates for whom a tester role is a career path, and for those who would like to evolve into other roles (developer, sysadmin) in our company.

jobs.title: Programmer Analyst II
jobs.content:
San Marcos, TX

Texas State University


Programmer Analyst II

Job Number: 2016526

Location: San Marcos

Department: Educational Technology Center

Recruitment Type: Open to All

Job Type: Full-Time

Monthly Salary: $5,417.00

Job Category: Exempt

Required Qualifications:

Strong client and server side web development skills.

Experience working with a team.

Ability to analyze and develop complex software in multiple languages/environments.

Ability to read, evaluate, and criticize code changes made by others.

Ability to translate non-technical user requests into technical requirements.

Ability to follow complex written and verbal instructions.

Ability to present complex material to technical and non-technical audiences.

Ability to contribute to design and strategy discussions.

Ability to complete a 2-4 hour project over the course of 2 weeks, as part of the interview process.

Preferred Qualifications:

Understanding of modular/layered software engineering practices.

Understanding of object-oriented programming.

Understanding of databases as they apply to mobile and web applications.

Understanding of Web Services, RESTful APIs, etc.

Understanding of common Accessibility issues.

Ability to manage a student employee.

Experience developing apps for iOS/Android.

Experience working with and contributing to open source projects.

Experience with common open source software (Linux, Apache, Tomcat, MySQL, Java, PHP , Ruby, Node, etc).

Experience in a higher education environment or other hierarchical organization.

Job Description:

We are looking for a developer with strong UI skills to contribute to our mobile apps, and contribute to our effort to improve mobile access to the variety of web applications used on campus. This person will supervise one student worker.

Job Duties:

Take primary responsibility for our existing mobile app.

Create new applications that leverage mobile technology.

Identify existing web applications that need better mobile support.

Contribute to mobile-oriented web development efforts.

Participate in design and strategy meetings for all team applications, not just mobile.

Identify projects that serve large portions of the university’s population.

Work closely with our support team to prioritize projects.

Work closely with our design and support teams to create the best possible interfaces.

Be an advocate for mobile access in vendor selection processes across campus.

Stay up to date on mobile best practices, advise others with what you learn.

Manage a student employee.

Occasionally present or suggest topics to improve our team awareness and practices.

Maintain documentation on project details, integration points, and routine tasks.

Other duties as assigned.

Additional Information to Applicants:

If selected for an interview, applicants will be required to answer written questions.

Schedule can be flexible.

Job Open Date: 08/09/2016

Job Close Date:

Open Until Filled: Yes

Normal Work Days: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

Normal Work Hours Start: 8:00AM

Normal Work Hours End: 5:00PM

Posting Notices:

YOU WILL BE REQUIRED TO ELECTRONICALLY ATTACH A RESUME AND COVER LETTER TO YOUR APPLICATION.

Legal and Required Notices:

Texas State University, to the extent not in conflict with federal or state law, prohibits discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, veterans’ status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

Employment with Texas State University is contingent upon the outcome of record checks and verifications including criminal history, driving records, education records, employment verifications, reference checks, and employment eligibility verifications.

Texas State University is a tobacco-free campus. Smoking and the use of any tobacco product will not be allowed anywhere on Texas State property or in university owned or leased vehicles.

Texas State University is a member of the Texas State University System. Texas State University is an EOE .

Texas State is committed to increasing the number of women and minorities in administrative and professional positions.

For a detailed description of this position and to apply, visit http://apptrkr.com/858446 or call (512) 245-2557 or visit our office at 601 University Dr., J.C. Kellam Bldg., Suite 340.

About Texas State and San Marcos:

Texas State University is a emerging research institution located in the burgeoning Austin-San Antonio corridor and in the beautiful Texas Hill Country. It is the largest of eight campuses in the Texas State University System and one of the 75 largest universities in the country, with over 36,000 students and 4,000 faculty and staff.

Texas State is located in San Marcos, a growing community of over 50,000 people located about half way between Austin and San Antonio. Texas State enjoys a setting that is unique among Texas universities. The beauty of the crystal-clear San Marcos River and the stately cypress and pecan trees on the campus add to the charm of the university's picturesque setting. Our location on the banks of the San Marcos River provides outdoor recreational activities throughout the year.

Employment with Texas State University is contingent upon a criminal history background check.

Texas State University is a tobacco free campus.

Texas State University is an EOE and a member of the Texas State University System.
