jobs.title: Project Reviewer
jobs.content:
Apply here: https://review.udacity.com/apply.html


Machine Learning Project Reviewers are experts on Machine Learning related topics, enjoy providing feedback, and are generous about sharing their knowledge with others. Reviewers have the opportunity to help thousands of students progress in their Nanodegree journeys and continue expanding their own skills through teaching. Reviewers care deeply about giving Udacity Nanodegree students project reviews because they understand the power of personalized feedback while learning new skills.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Ensure that students receive the best possible feedback on their projects by providing constructive evaluations.

  • Guide students to improve their projects in the reviews you provide them in a professional yet friendly and positive tone.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:




    • Machine Learning expertise. In particular, expertise with the following topics:


      • Principal component analysis, supervised and unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, Q-learning, feature selection and feature transformation, outlier detection and model validation. Knowledge of statistics and linear algebra is necessary.





  • Familiarity with Machine Learning in the fields of stock trading, robotics, healthcare, computer vision, education, artificial intelligence, or Deep Learning is ideal.



  • Familiarity with the following Python 2.7 libraries and software:


    • Scikit-learn, NumPy, Pandas, and matplotlib.

    • iPython (Jupyter) Notebook.


  • Excellent in debugging code

  • Excellent communicator

  • Passionate for learning and learning quickly

  • Empathetic and great mentor


    • Teaching experience is ideal, but not required.



JOB DETAILS:



  • Flexible work hours: review projects on-demand. Average time to review a project is 30-60 min

  • Flexible pay: get paid per project review. Average price per project is $55.

  • To ensure quick feedback to students, we require that you complete a project review within 2 hours of starting it.

  • Ensure that you are eligible to work as a contractor for Udacity.


Due to PayPal restrictions we accept reviewers only from the following countries: Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Brazil, Bulgaria, Canada, Chile, China, Costa Rica, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Emirates, Estonia, Finland, France, French Guiana, Germany, Gibraltar, Greece, Guadeloupe, Hong Kong, Hungary, Iceland, India, Indonesia, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Jamaica, Japan, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malaysia, Malta, Martinique, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Reunion, Romania, San Marino, Singapore, Slovakia, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Taiwan, Thailand, Turkey, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, Uruguay, Venezuela, Vietnam.

jobs.title: Junior Web Developer
jobs.content:
We are searching for a Junior Developer to join our growing web team. The ideal candidate will be someone who has both an enthusiasm and willingness to learn new things, be fearless [especially when admitting you don’t know something] and is ready to jump right in and get their hands dirty!


You will work under the direction of a knowledgeable senior developer on updating and maintaining our company's several websites as well as project focused work on changes to the overall sites as well.  You will get to collaborate with multiple departments with the ultimate goal of improving our customer's overall experience on our sites.

jobs.title: Sr. Application Integration Developer - ESB WS02
jobs.content:
Are you the super-smart go-to for middleware?  Are you up for designing, developing, building, reviewing, and unit testing software and solutions for a growing Fortune 500 company?  This requires strong technical and analytical ability in Java/JEE as well as knowledge of REST, WebServices, XML technologies, SOA, and Enterprise Integration Patterns.   


Note Visa Candidates: We will transfer visas for highly qualified senior-level candidates, but we do not offer NEW visas for persons residing outside of the USA or for post-OPT.

jobs.title: Drupal Developer
jobs.content:
Drupal Developer



University Marketing is seeking an experienced web developer to serve as a member of a communications/creative team. Responsibilities include website management and development, as well as maintenance of websites hosted primarily in Drupal. The developer will be expected to create new sites and themes in Drupal; understand, implement, and analyze/diagnose Drupal 7 modules; configure Drupal, set permissions, create content types, menus, blocks, taxonomies, fields, views, and features; install, configure, and customize modules as needed; test, analyze, and debug specialized functions and display issues; manage and deploy code to existing sites using Git; and ensure that sites conform to web standards and are accessible. This job will be filled as a level 2, or level 3, depending upon the successful candidate's competencies, education, and experience. Typically requires an Associate's degree or higher plus two years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience for a level 2. Additional experience and/or education and competencies are required for higher level jobs. The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to configure, customize, and secure Drupal websites, and develop custom themes based on graphic designs. Experience in Drupal site building, and custom theme development, writing HTML, CSS, PHP, and JavaScript in version control systems is required. Experience with LAMP stack administration, Drush, responsive design, CSS preprocessors, and Git version control is preferred. Candidates must be able to manage multiple high-priority projects in a deadline-intensive environment under general supervision. If you are the right candidate, you will work with an experienced team of marketing strategists, creative specialists, and web developers to design, develop, and support web sites for Strategic Communications, focusing on major image web sites for the University. The ideal candidate will demonstrate excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and thrive in a collaborative environment. This is a fixed-term appointment funded for one year from date of hire with excellent possibility of re-funding.



Apply online at http://apptrkr.com/859535



CAMPUS SECURITY CRIME STATISTICS: For more about safety at Penn State, and to review the Annual Security Report which contains information about crime statistics and other safety and security matters, please go to http://www.police.psu.edu/clery/, which will also provide you with detail on how to request a hard copy of the Annual Security Report.



Penn State is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Front End Web Developer


The JavaScript Engineer at Placester will directly impact the customers and deepen the value of our business while working alongside developers and designers on a varied technology stack. Our engineers work with product teams on collaborative projects to launch new products or enhance existing ones. To accelerate our success, we are constantly looking to push the limits on how our users interact with modern, attractive, and beautiful design. We utilize massive sets of MLS data within real estate to deliver large, highly scaled multi-tenant web hosting. Since we are engineering focused, your ideas and opinions will help shape our company and our products, every single day.


Here’s a bit about the role-
About you as a Front End JavaScript Engineer:



  • You deliver best-in-class UI front-end code for interactive web, mobile and tablet applications on multiple platforms (Mac, Windows, web, etc.)

  • You create UI web development in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript technologies such as jQuery

  • You are able to build large JavaScript application that accounts for site speed, Ajax calls, lazy loading, paired with a deep knowledge of how the browser calls assets

  • You know that sustainable systems win in the end, and sometimes a new feature means refactoring old code to help

  • You are passionate about building APIs that enable a great customer experience

  • You have experience building web applications on the client-side, server-side, and/or full-stack

  • You can work with other developers on a large code base

  • You aren’t a stranger to bug tracking systems and workflow tools

jobs.title: Back End Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a talented Back End Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative atmosphere. You are eager to join an innovative product team that emphasizes creative problem solving, fast iteration, and pushing the envelope with features.



What you’ll be doing:



  • Working closely with our small team of developers in an agile environment

  • Identifying and defining integration points with third-party solutions (analytics, libraries, etc.)

jobs.title: Junior/Senior Java Web Developer
jobs.content:
Interactive Brokers Group is seeking a Java Developer/Web Apps for our Web Development Group to participate in all phases of the development cycle for our customer-facing brokerage systems. We’re growing our team -- so if you’re a high-energy, self-starting Java software engineer, Interactive Brokers is the place for you. We take pride in providing our global client base with cutting-edge trading applications.


The successful candidate will design, build and maintain high-profile, interactive, extremely fast customer-facing multi-tiered web applications for our online brokerage services which encapsulates a total of 340,000 clients. The applications will support our customer registration, account management and other systems.


Duties for this position will also include integration, testing and documentation of web applications. A successful candidate must be highly analytical and adept at solving complex problems.


Interactive Brokers offers a generous compensation package which includes Base Salary, Cash Bonus, Stock, .10 Cent Dividend on Vested and Unvested Shares, Free Medical, Free Lunch and 16 days off, plus federal holidays. 401k match up to 5% of Gross Salary.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
DevOps Engineer


Are you a skilled and self-motivated IT systems administrator or systems analyst? Do you love to work with the latest, coolest, leading- edge technology? Do you want to play a key role in the expansion of our IT infrastructure? If you answered YES, YES, YES then keep reading!

As a member of the IT team, you will contribute to the design, architecture, and end to end deployment in mixed environment of Linux, Unix and Windows with a primary emphasis in applications hosted on Linux. Your duties will cover a large array of tasks from installing/configuring applications like apache on Linux servers to designing automated deployments of custom application and management inside our various labs and data centers. 

Your duties will also include installation of variety of software including web, java application, java messaging servers and NoSQL database. As an escalated point of contact you will utilize exemplary customer service skills to help support lab environments as well as our Data Centers. Your primary role will be to deploy and support the applications in Engineering Labs and Commercial production platforms, which consist of public and private cloud and utilize your advanced Linux skills to bring up new infrastructure and applications to support our ever growing needs across the enterprise.

jobs.title: Oracle EBS Developer - Systems Analyst
jobs.content:
Job Purpose:


Analyzes business needs and detailed system components, identifies, communicates, and resolves systems issues in support of core system functions. Performs systems analysis, design, coding, testing, documentation and implementation for application systems development software initiatives driven by business needs. Develops and enhances computer applications to support the implementation of difficult to complex business requirements. Performs specific assignments as part of a project team or works independently on small to medium-sized enhancements and production support assignments. May perform technical project management.

Major Duties:

Design/Configuration/Programming/Support of 3rd Party HR, Finance and other Corporate systems


Design/Programming (VB.Net, C#, MVC, ASP, PL/SQL, Java, Object Oriented Programming, Oracle, SQL Server, Unix) 


Design/Programming
• Interprets business requirements for system enhancements and projects, translates them into detailed design system specifications including process and data flows, screen and report specifications, stored procedures, batch scripts, and batch scheduling specifications.
• Recommends technologies to be used in building the solution.
• Develops system components based on business requirements and system specifications, codes, tests, and implements components in accordance with standards and procedures.
• Responsible for unit testing components and supporting DEV and QA testing.
• Performs design reviews and code reviews for other team initiatives.
• Coordinates and executes integration testing for development efforts.
• Develops implementation plans and supports migrations through the various environments.
• Responsible for the coordination and implementation of small to medium-sized enhancements and production support assignments from end to end.
• Prepares and maintains technical system documentation for system support and other needs.
Analysis
• Analyzes business needs and detailed system components, including input, process, and output requirements, data and system flows, and hardware and software requirements.
• Identifies, communicates, and resolves systems issues in support of core system functions.
• Identifies root cause of problems, provides options for resolution and documents outcome of analysis.
• Evaluates existing systems to improve their effectiveness and efficiency, reducing operational costs, and providing solutions to resolve data and system issues.
• Provides consultation in areas of expertise and/or 3rd party vendor software products.

Project Management
• Manages various technical aspects of small to medium-sized projects concurrently through the project lifecycle using the PMO process while managing to a budget, timeline and customer satisfaction and value.
• Responsible for estimating, project planning, communicating status of projects, designing, analyzing, coding (where applicable), testing, and documentation and implementation of components in accordance with standards and procedures.
• Works with management team to staff projects.
• Provides objective feedback to management regarding team and individual performance.
• Provides technical expertise and knowledge transfer for IT, PMO and Business user team members.

Relationships
• Establishes and/or maintains working relationships with both Business and IT partners to define, understand and evaluate business requirements and resolve production issues.
• Provides support in a matrix-management fashion to other areas as needed.

Leadership
• Provides knowledge transfer to other technical peers.
• Provides technical leadership and expertise to peers on small to medium-sized work efforts and production support.

jobs.title: Senior Manager - Quality Engineering
jobs.content:
Description



Come join the SBG Quality Engineering team as a Senior Manager - Software Quality Engineering and help deliver the next wave of products that will continue to help Small Businesses simplify the business of their lives. This group is within the Small Business Group, with exciting charter of experimenting its way to great products and delivering an awesome experience to our customers.



As a Senior Manager, Software Quality Engineering in SBG, your role is to lead teams and deliver awesome, high quality products. Using your detailed understanding of technologies and applying your intellectual curiosity you will help shape, test, and improve the features that help our customers run their businesses easily every day. 



Responsibilities: 




  • Deliver high quality customer-driven software products to market that simplify and solve for current customer needs while building for the future.

  • Responsible for initiating and driving the adoption of technology, product and process improvements throughout the software delivery lifecycle.

  • Provide technical leadership, career development, and management of performance, objectives, and priorities of all reporting staff - Build a high performing, results-oriented organization.

  • Drive and own the functional and non-functional testing roadmap for your product.

  • Drive initiatives to improve testing at all levels & deliver automation to ensure robustness and efficiency.

  • Embrace & implement new ideas that produce outstanding results for our customers.

  • Drive adoption of best practices, tools, systems and metrics.

  • Create a shared vision of product quality and maintain strong cross-functional relationships / alignment.



Qualifications




  • 3+ years technical management experience of software engineering teams that have successfully delivered customer-driven software products with highest quality.

  • Passion for being at the leading edge of technology with 10+ years of hands on software development and/or testing experience.

  • 5+ years of hands on coding experience; 5+ years of delivery experience with Agile software development methodologies.

  • Proven experience in delivering highly scalable solutions, automation & C2D solutions with open source tools.

  • Demonstrated experience leading positive change, empowering people, cultivating product technology visions and innovative solutions, and fostering effective engineering teams.

  • Adept at articulating the strategy and drive change with strong technical & business acumen.

  • Solid understanding of SaaS technologies, industry wide testing tools/services.

  • Ability to think and act strategically for all stakeholders; Possesses strong verbal, written communication & presentation skills.

  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or any Engineering Discipline.



Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune's “100 Best Companies To Work For” and Fortune World’s “Most Admired Software Companies” lists. Immerse yourself in our award winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide. Intuit is expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the industry. Utilizing design for delight and lean startup methodologies, our entrepreneurial employees have brought more than 250 innovations to market -- from QuickBooks®, Quicken®, and TurboTax®, to GoPayment, Mint.com, big data, cloud (SaaS, PaaS) and mobile apps. The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.Discover what it’s like to be part of a team that rewards taking risks and trying new things. It’s time to love what you do! Check out all of our career opportunities at: http://jobs.intuit.com. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer - Buying Squad
jobs.content:
Like everyone in Auto Trader the people that look after our Retail Management System have a customer focus. They look after our vehicle retailers and their aim is to ensure that every one of these customers has the best possible online experience. Six squads are responsible for our RMS and they are made up of Trust, Buying, Managing, Performance, Advertising and PayGo teams. They offer a wide range of online products to help retailers compete effectively in the marketplace in order to sell more vehicles, faster. The AutoTrader marketplace brings together the largest and most engaged consumer audience, with the largest pool of vehicle sellers, listing more than 400,000 cars each day. In fact over 80% of all time spent on classified sites is spent on Auto Trader.


This position is in our Buying squad who are responsible for the ongoing development of our Buying platform.  This is a trade-to-trade marketplace, allowing retail customers to buy and sell stock. All of the RMS squads are currently working together to rebuild the online journey so that our vehicle retailers have a seamless experience. They’re bringing together a number of online products so that everything we offer is housed in one portal. RMS is an AngularJS application with a Java Spring Boot backend.  It has a service oriented architecture with web services developed using Spring Boot and Drop Wizard.


Our developers have the freedom to take control of providing a beautiful experience for our customers. We love Agile and work in small squads to ensure each squad has a focus and a mission. This way we ensure every squad member counts, has a voice, shares ideas and is involved from the moment they join.


We use test driven / continuous delivery practices to build RESTful JSON web services and web applications using Java. We make sure our systems can scale to meet the demands of a high-traffic website as we can peak as high as 70 million page views per day. We really care about how performance impacts our customers. We are looking for people with a deep interest in technology who are comfortable finding and adopting new technical approaches all the way from the browser to the database - it's a fast moving market so we have engaged and responsible self-organising teams.

jobs.title: Front End Developer - Truck, Plant, Farm & Carzone Squad
jobs.content:
Our Truck Plant Farm & Carzone Squad are looking for a front-end developer to join them. The squad is unique as it wholly manages both CarZone and AutoTrader Truck, Plant & Farm, owning the entire customer journey from start to end. We operate like a true start up, it’s challenging, but the rewards are huge! The squad work in a very customer focussed, works in a true agile environment, which means they have the freedom to take control and ensure our systems can scale to meet the demands of our digital innovative business, and it’s all driven by our customer’s needs. The variety is endless, the development is plentiful and the opportunity for growth is massive!


You’ll be working with the TPF & Carzone squad but you’ll have the freedom to get involved with other squads where you can add value. You’ll be responsible for delivering engaging solutions across platforms and devices, in an environment where data is valued over opinion. We understand the impact that page performance has on user engagement, so that is a focus in everything we do.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Support Specialist-US Western Region & APAC-100% Telecommute
jobs.content:
The Senior Technical Support Specialist will be responsible for providing in depth technical support for Sonatype’s Western US and Asia Pacific region. This is not a typical technical support role. In fact, the current support team members all have development and/or quality engineering backgrounds.


In this role, you will work with other support and engineering team members in the US and around the globe to perform triage, root cause analysis, debugging and  troubleshooting of our product installations running at customer sites. You will help maintain our knowledge base of best practices, known issues and solutions and have an opportunity to extend our support infrastructure by designing and writing diagnostic tools/scripts. And you will probably even write some code.

jobs.title: .Net Developer
jobs.content:
Opportunity:


The Developer will take our big ideas and business dreams and help turn them into a reality. Specifically, they’ll have an active role in creating a new financial modeling platform that will change the way Americans look at retirement planning, and have the opportunity to contribute to more disruptive innovations in the world of financial planning.


This person will interact directly with the research and business teams while interfacing with enterprise applications across core business units. They will also be accountable for proactively leading process development and improvement activities. The Developer will communicate with stakeholders and other involved functional areas to define business requirements related to technology and database solutions.      


Responsibilities:



  • Formulate project plans, perform detailed system design and develop database solutions based on stated business and technology requirements for the innovative financial modeling platform

  • Develop software solutions that will interface between core enterprise applications, both locally and remotely hosted (cloud based) for the purpose of data exchange and/or enhancing processing efficiencies and functionality

  • Conduct testing of all new or modified software solutions before release to assure quality, including accuracy of data, user friendliness and response time

  • Ensure integrity/continuity of software development through the use of source control and versioning tools

  • Produce and maintain documentation for software solutions developed both internally and purchased/contracted via third party

  • Provide support for software solutions developed both internally and purchased/contracted via third party as needed

  • Perform database administration functions, such as server health monitoring, performance optimization, load balancing, data replication and data migration

jobs.title: Java Server Engineer
jobs.content:
younity (Entangled Media) is revolutionizing that way that people access and share their content (music, movies and photos) across devices and online services. younity builds your personal cloud, so you can have all your files on all your devices all the time, without syncing and without storage limits.


As a Java Server Engineer, you will be responsible for creation of new features, maintenance, and deployment of Entangled Media’s server stack, which provides remote access to local files for our client apps through a RESTful API.

jobs.title: Mobile Banking Developer III
jobs.content:
The Mobile Banking Developer III will primarily be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining the Digital Banking/Mobile Platform. These duties include developing and maintaining the Digital Banking Platform including middleware, Apple iOS client, Android client, Mobile website client and HTML 5 web client.


PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  1. Develop the digital banking platform: Android, Apple Object C and xCode, HTML 5 mobile website, JSON web service

  2. Participate in complete project life cycle. Provide technical requirements/specifications, project estimates, and system design configuration for simple to complex projects. Complex projects may include multiple business lines, technologies, and infrastructures

  3. Provide input on application architecture and design.

  4. Provide application support by diagnosing and remediating problems, performing root cause analysis, developing and maintaining application documentation, defining and maintaining application configuration, designing and executing application disaster recovery, tracking and remediating metrics and trends of application performance.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Discover & Watch
jobs.content:
Twitch has over 100 million users, and the Discover and Watch team is responsible for helping them connect with content they love on both live and recorded video. We’re building a number of features to make Twitch the most compelling destination for gaming video this year. Recently, we launched Clips and our HTML5 Video Player, and we’re just getting started.

We’re looking for engineers that love delighting people with incredible products and user experiences. On this team, you’ll work closely with our other engineering and product teams to craft a beautiful and engaging product, collect feedback, and iterate quickly. We value expertise in building applications for the Web, comfort working throughout the stack, and an understanding of product concerns.




A TYPICAL WEEK




    • You’ll brainstorm with designers and product managers to understand our video strategy and prototype new products

    • You’ll lead backend and frontend engineers to define the architecture around these products and ship an MVP, balancing product and engineering tradeoffs

    • You’ll collect data with our data scientists and plan subsequent iterations on these features with product managers

    • You’ll define engineering best practices, mentor junior engineers, and participate in code and design reviews

    • You’ll help our support team triage bugs, respond to user feedback, and fix production issues

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Search & Discovery
jobs.content:
We deal with some of the most challenging problems in the industry. Our scale and speed of our growth forces us to experiment with techniques and technologies only the very biggest websites ever need to use. If you would like to work in a challenging engineering environment where every new project is a learning opportunity, you've come to the right place. The Search and Discovery team at Twitch is looking for strong, technical engineers to help build upon and improve the user experience around finding new content. You have to have a knack for re-using existing technologies and understanding how to apply those in crafting the right recommendation systems. We have lots of users and lots of data to work with, so this will be fun and challenging. Ideally you have experience and wisdom from building large AI and Machine Learning systems around search and recommendations. A strong interest in doing so would be fine too, provided you are a stellar engineer.


RESPONSIBLITIES




    • Design, build, and maintain scalable search services, recommendation systems, and newsfeeds.

    • Cultivate engineering best practices within your group and engineering

    • Participate in code and design reviews.

    • Mentor and cultivate junior engineers

    • Participate in design and architecture sessions with other product and team leads

    • Providing engineering input into our product planning and scheduling processes

jobs.title: Product Designer (Conversion Team)
jobs.content:
As a member of the Design Team, you will collaborate with designers to improve and maintain our cohesive, holistic brand experience inside and outside of our product. You’ll work on the full life-cycle of your own product design projects. You’ll help us take design to the next level at Creative Market by contributing to and running important design team initiatives. Plus, you’ll get to kick it with a group of cool design nerds, too.

Conversion Product Team Member

As the lead product designer on the Conversion Design Team, you’ll be the spokesperson for great user experience design on a team that focuses on a/b tests, conversion optimizations, and “bets” that could make a huge impact on Creative Market. You’ll work directly with product managers, front- and back-end developers, and data analysts to evaluate, prioritize, and build quick product design iterations that could make a lasting impact to our company’s growth. You’re passionate about learning, iterative improvements, and always thinking about what we can test next to make the product better.

Responsibilities

  • Own our mission: to make beautiful design simple and accessible to everyone. Get the community excited to participate in our product and spread the word about our brand.
  • Create thoughtful, detailed product design work that projects the brand identity and design system consistently across desktop, tablet, mobile, and in-app experiences.
  • Lead the design effort behind new product features across their full life-cycle — concept, scope, design comps, prototype support, Q&A, launch, monitoring and optimization tests.
  • Analyze and provide multivariate a/b tests that improve existing features against key performance indicators such as adoption, purchasing, and retention. Review the results of these tests thoroughly and make strategic conclusions about what to test next and how.
  • Improve and maintain our product components. Keep our design system up to date and recommend where and how we make UI and UX improvements.
  • Look for ways to make the design team better and stronger in terms of process, tools, reviews, documentation, and more.
  • Contribute to the evolution of the Creative Market brand identity through product redesign efforts. Be willing to test new UI and UX in conversion product projects and communicate with the design team about how these tests performed. Collaborate with brand designers to align additions and updates to visuals in our product across all of our brand’s touch-points.
  • Be passionate about producing quality creative resources (e.g. icons, themes, fonts, brushes, more), and encourage and educate members of our community towards the creation of better assets too.

What We Offer

Note: This position is a contract (contingent) position. The starting time period is 6 months with the option to renew indefinitely pending performance. This position has limited benefits as offered through our third-party contract management service.

  • Competitive compensation.
  • A new workstation.
  • Work from anywhere.

About You

  • You’re a problem solver that always puts our diverse users and their experience first. You ask better questions in order to shape the best possible outcomes of projects you lead or participate in. You believe that brilliant designs are the result of finding the simplest solutions to complex user experience challenges and behavior dynamics.
  • You think high-impact to our users and the company and low-cost to produce. You operate in a constant state of learning, discovery, and sharing with the team. You adapt to what’s working well and what isn’t in your designs. You aren’t attached to the work, and you’re passionate about improving the numbers and user experience simultaneously.
  • You’re comfortable working on quick product design projects of low or high fidelity. You’re always thinking of what sort of impact current tests might make if they’re rolled into our product system, and you consider community, support, and purchasing behavior dynamics in your entire process.
  • You have strong communication and collaboration skills. You’re always transparent, honest, and humble. Our team is a highly collaborative team, so open dialogue and a positive attitude are crucial.
  • You have some experience designing for eCommerce, responsive, and user generated content disciplines, and keep up with best practices in these fields.
  • You have 2-5 years of experience designing multifaceted, responsive web projects that span desktop, tablet, and mobile. You’ve got a solid mix of client services, digital agency, in-house department, and/or start-up product building experiences under your belt.
  • Your web design skills are a force to be reckoned with, and you totally own all facets of what you conceptualize and design. You obsess over the details and always strive to produce pixel-perfect, retina-ready assets that consider implementation and optimization dynamics.
  • You love analytics, metrics, and tracking all user activity on the platforms you work on. You enjoy iterating and producing A/B optimization tests of your design work in an attempt to increase key user conversion benchmarks in the experience.
  • You craft amazing looking visuals for digital experiences, and you create functionality that always keeps simplicity, ease of use, optimization and context in mind.
  • You’re familiar with LESS, and have experience working with front-end developers to keep CSS and PS brand style components consistent, organized, and optimized.
  • You’re passionate about fluid design, web fonts, app design, UI optimization and beyond. You know and apply best practices for responsive and adaptive processes. You stay informed about the latest trends of interactive design.
  • You’re a self-starter who will actively seek out new ways to improve the Creative Market experience. You love to ideate, conceptualize, and champion your own feature ideas.
  • You have the tendency to start creative side projects that satisfy your curiosity.
  • You have front-end coding skills (HTML, CSS).
  • You’re passionate about giving back to the design community, and want to empower creators around the world to make a living doing what they love.
  • You add a large dose of fun to our positive team culture.

jobs.title: Data Integration Developer - Java, Scala
jobs.content:
The future of banking? Whatever you want it to be.


We’re looking for someone who really knows the ins and outs of Java and Scala to join our Information Management team. Your day to day will see you working closely with large quantities of data as you help build and implement a personal banking data strategy. Your work will make a direct impact on the lives of our 22 million customers worldwide.


(That’s a lot of data.)


Here’s what a typical day might look like for you:



  • Design and write code in Java, Scala or other functional programming languages. You’ll likely be working with data management solutions running in a Cloudera CDH.

  • Create code to automatically monitor, troubleshoot, and tune the work you create. Make your code work for you, not the other way around!

  • Write unit tests + integration tests and automate them using the Continuous Integration framework based on Jenkins, Bitbucket, Nexus, and other tools.

  • Nobody’s perfect. You’ll regularly participate in peer code reviews, and help us create and update coding standards.

  • Develop physical models based on the Personal Banking logical model aligned to the Teradata Financial Services Logical Data Model (FS-LDM).

  • Work with the Data Governance team on Semantic layer definition for data mapping and profiling.

  • Perform data profiling, discovery and quality assessment of the source system feeds.

  • Create and maintain technical metadata for source system feeds using Podium or custom Java or Scala code.

  • Perform data mapping, transformation and extraction from a Cloudera CDH cluster to another Cloudera CDH cluster development environment for analytics.

  • Create and update use stories and tasks in JIRA.

  • Create and maintain data architecture, data management conventions and standards, naming and metadata standards – and challenge them when you think we can improve upon them!

  • Use Confluence to collaborate with other team members and to publish technical artifacts. You’ll be working with a lot of talented team mates at every step of the way.

  • Last but not least, prioritize and manage own workload in order to deliver quality results and meet timelines. You know you best – let us know what you need to do your best work.

jobs.title: Senior Java Designer/Developer - Scala, Hadoop - Big Data focus
jobs.content:
You have a big passion for big data, and you aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves to get dirty – figuratively speaking, of course. You welcome the chance to wear multiple professional hats at once, providing strategic insight one day and technical support the next.


We’re looking for someone just like you to join our Information Management team, solving large scale data problems each day. The work you’ll be doing will establish new patterns of usage in our Cloudera CDH clusters, and will drive innovation within the organization as a whole.


For you, there’s no thinking outside the box. There’s only thinking about what comes next, box or no box.


If this sounds like you, drop us a line!

jobs.title: Digital Product Designer
jobs.content:
Who we are…


We’re an eclectic and multicultural team working on a very big and important challenge. We’re empowering the professionals who are responsible for helping you get a mortgage, get it done faster, cheaper and more effectively.


This is not a social pizza ordering live video app, we’re changing how $23 Billion (capital B) dollars worth of mortgages are transacted each year and we think that’s dead sexy . We move fast and we're not afraid to experiment while we work towards our goal of being the Canada’s leading loan management system. We’re well backed and gearing up to make a serious splash. We’ve doubled our team size in the last year and plan on doing so again this year. It won’t be easy, but that’s why we’re looking to have only the smartest minds riding shotgun with us.


Who you are…


As a core member of the Design team, you will be a part of the entire product design life cycle, from proposing initial concepts to ensuring we ship high quality features. You will be expected to contribute to all aspects of design, including product design, interaction design, and visual design. You are self-motivated with the ability to work in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous work environment.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Business Intelligence
jobs.content:
Job Title: Senior Software Engineer, Business Intelligence (BI)


Location: Portland, OR


Reports To: Senior Manager, Software Engineering



JOB FUNCTION:



The Software Engineer will join our BI Tech team to create and support business intelligence applications for internal and external customers. If you are a successful fit for this position, you enjoy working independently with minimal supervision; you are good at collaborating with designers and end users; you have good analytical skills, strong communication skills and a positive attitude.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Develop BI data models.

  • Work with other software engineers to manage and deliver data sets.

  • Design and maintain existing Qlik applications

  • Tune existing Qlik applications for efficient performance.

  • Maintain and ensure SDLC process and proper tools and standards for company BI development.

  • Work closely with the Product team to design external BI applications.

  • Work closely with stakeholders to design and maintain internal BI applications.

  • Train stakeholders on basic BI use and best practices.

  • Maintain BI source and source history.



QUALIFICATIONS:



  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Business or equivalent.

  • Minimum of 1 year experience with Qlik application design, charting, set analysis, scripting, testing and debugging.

  • Experience with basic SQL scripting

  • Experience with data modeling and Business Intelligence applications, concepts and patterns.

  • Experience providing training for users, internal and external customers.

  • Strong knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle

  • Familiarity with multiple 3rd party BI offerings to assist in evaluations as needs arise.

  • Familiarity with software and data security needs.

  • JavaScript, CSS experience preferred.


About comScore: comScore, Inc. (NASDAQ: SCOR) is the cross-platform measurement company that precisely measures audiences, brands and consumer behavior everywhere.


comScore completed its merger with Rentrak Corporation in January 2016, to create the new model for a dynamic, cross-platform world. Built on precision and innovation, our unmatched data footprint combines proprietary digital, TV and movie intelligence with vast demographic details to quantify consumers' multiscreen behavior at massive scale. This approach helps media companies monetize their complete audiences and allows marketers to reach these audiences more effectively. With more than 3,200 clients and global footprint in more than 75 countries, comScore is delivering the future of measurement. For more information on comScore, please visit comscore.com.

jobs.title: Python/PHP Developer - an exciting opportunity to carve your own role!
jobs.content:
We have a really interesting opportunity for a talented and passionate Developer to join our team in our state of the art, purpose built Reading Data Centre.



About us


After many years of sustained growth, both organically and through acquisitions, Namesco is entering a new phase of expansion. The company is now keen to improve existing systems and extend it’s product range, providing the opportunity for many exciting development projects.


About the role



The role requires a good general understanding of Internet technologies and their underlying protocols, such as HTTP, SMTP and DNS. PHP, Python and MySQL applications form the core of all of Namesco's systems and are used to manage the email, web hosting and server product infrastructures.


You will use your experience in PHP and Python programming to create systems that integrate, automate and control our network, data centre, web portal, billing, reseller and back office infrastructure, including the provisioning systems for our dedicated server products, exposing those systems to internal and external customers via our API and contributing to its development. Working with sensitive and business critical data requires a thorough understanding of security and data integrity issues on the Internet.


About you


The successful applicant will have an enthusiastic attitude for their work with significant commercial experience in creating secure, high-performance web applications.


Experience of Agile software development is desirable, working in our team of web developers you will take on the role Web Developer.


We are looking for a "can do" person with enthusiasm and drive to succeed in this position. The ideal candidate will be passionate about Agile methodologies, software development and technology, and have demonstrable problem solving skillsExperience with HTML, CSS, Javascript and working to applicable W3C standards is also required. Experience of working in an Agile software development environment, together with jQuery and knowledge of XML, Web Services, MVC and Zend Framework would be desirable.

jobs.title: Technical Project Manager
jobs.content:
Are you organized, communicative, and interested in shipping quality code on a timeline? Do you want to take ownership of projects and interact with several departments to take our technical projects to the next level? Do you enjoy watching software projects blossom into usable, production grade systems that make users happy?


Product management:



  • Determine overall strategy for multiple software projects at both an individual and integrated level and take a leading role in developing product vision

  • Filter feature requests in conjunction with CTO from stakeholders into actionable issues for tech team

  • Manage priority backlog, goal setting, roadmaps and project timelines in conjunction with founder’s strategic vision for all projects

  • Act as point of reference to clarify requirements between tech team members and stakeholders during implementation

  • Oversee QA and deployment procedures and maintain project uptime


Workflow optimization:



  • Research and implement workflow optimization tools to speed development, foster communication and improve code quality and reduce maintenance costs


Training



  • Identify opportunities to develop tech team members as a whole with external or internal resources

  • Drive individual success with specific training and troubleshooting when team members get stuck


Research/Prototyping



  • When necessary to define or investigate the feasibility of a feature request, research and prototype proof of concepts


The Technical Project Manager’s role is to improve efficacy among the software team through combinations of product management, workflow optimization, training, and research/prototyping. This position reports to the CTO.

jobs.title: Android/iOS App Developer
jobs.content:
Detroit Labs OnSite is looking for native Android and iOS developers to join our existing automotive app development team.


We’re building a native mobile app that will be a companion to consumer vehicles that will be on the road in 1-2 years. We’re writing greenfield code, implementing designs created in 2016 that incorporate the latest and greatest features and interactions.


Our teams are small and lean, and every member is encouraged to engage in discussions about application architecture and direction. As a mid-level/senior developer, you will be expected to help facilitate these conversations and guide the team to collectively make final decisions.


This role is with our OnSite business unit; successful applicants will work with existing developer team members for a period of time at our Detroit location, and then transition to working at the client site in the Detroit metro area. This is a full-time salaried role with full medical and dental benefits, 401k matching, monthly team outings, and more.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Back-End
jobs.content:
Alar Software is Hiring Backend Engineers


We are looking for experienced software engineers to help build out our platform. We're aiming to aggregate logistics data enabling customers to operate more efficiently and connect them with other logistics companies. We believe we're on to something big, but to get there we're working through complex problems in a complex domain. We're attacking those problems with an unconventional approach (event sourcing with a twist) and dealing with big data to boot. This isn't a run of the mill MVC app. Because of this complexity, we're limiting our search to two kinds of people: experienced engineers who can bring structure to the chaos as we grow, or those applicants who can make up for lack of experience with passion and creativity. Please don't apply unless you can demonstrate one of these somehow.


A little about us


We are not a typical startup. We're the skunkworks offshoot of an existing logistics company - we founded this startup to address logistics challenges we've faced since we started that company nearly 20 years ago. It turns out most of our competitors face the same problems, and the industry at large isn't making much progress to solve them. So the solutions we're developing are targeting real problems with real monetization potential. The founders have a good understanding of both the logistics industry and programming - so working with us isn't going to be an exercise in dealing with a pointy haired boss. We believe in solid development practices that avoid technical debt, and want to focus on product quality above all else. We also believe in independence and accountability - I'm not looking to add 'babysitter' to my job description.


We've been trying to tackle these problems in some fashion for many years, but development only really picked up in the last year. Right now we've got a remote team of 10, but we're looking to build a local team here in Chicago - the complex nature of the problems and the domain means we're really going to benefit from having a solid core group with lots of facetime.


Our stack


Primarily C#. Working to get our backend running on akka.net, although we're also considering Scala as we gain more experience with akka. Also a bit of postgres, some simple mongo for non-critical functions, and ASP.NET.


What You ll Do



  • Help design the core architecture that will drive our platform

  • Tackle problems unique to integrating big data


Compensation



  • Competitive base salary

  • Stock options

  • Medical, dental, and other benefits

jobs.title: Senior Android Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Vienna, Austria
URL: https://pspdfkit.com/jobs/#section_android

Job Description
We're looking to hire an Android developer to join our team working on PSPDFKit Android, our recently released PDF framework for Android. PSPDFKit is the leading PDF framework on iOS. It's used by Dropbox, IBM and Evernote, and we want PSPDFKit Android to match and surpass that level.

You will…
  • Make architectural decisions that will impact hundreds of apps for years.
  • Write code that's readable, cross-platform, well documented and has meaningful tests so shipping new releases can happen often and without fear.
  • Help and improve our PDF Viewer app written in Kotlin.
  • Build new features and fix existing issues.
  • Spend time to get things “right”, not to hack something up quick.
  • Collaborate daily with the whole team (Android, iOS, Support, Backend, Design) using Slack, GitHub and Google Hangouts.

Our ideal candidate
  • Has experience both with the Android SDK and NDK, using C++, Java (RxJava is a plus!) and Kotlin.
  • Has developed Android apps with a great user experience throughout.
  • Has a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
  • Has a good command of English for writing documentation and occasional blog posts.
  • Has worked remotely and understands the different challenges of a distributed team.

What you get
  • Room for personal and professional development.
  • A motivated team and a thriving work culture.
  • Numerous planned company events throughout the year.
  • The freedom to set up your ideal work environment.
  • Flexible working hours and vacation policy.

You should include these in your application
  • A writeup explaining who you are as a programmer. Sample questions you might want to address: How'd you get started? What projects have you enjoyed working on? Which have you disliked? What motivates you? What surprising things have you learned about yourself since starting to program?
  • A piece of code that does something you find interesting, and an explanation of why. (It doesn't have to be your own code.)
  • Links to online profiles you use (Github, Twitter, etc).
  • A description of your work history (whether as a resume, LinkedIn profile, or prose).

To apply: Send application to jobs+android@pspdfkit.com

jobs.title: Senior Front End Engineer

The challenge is to make it visually digestible with real-time speed using your expertise in Object Oriented JavaScript, AngularJS and Node.js.

jobs.title: Senior Test Engineer - Big Data
jobs.content:
Marin Software has taken our Quality Engineering practices to the next level with striving for 100% automated testing and continuous integration. To lead this transformation, we are looking for seriously experienced Quality Engineers / SDETs with strong software development skills and experience in developing and enhancing test automation frameworks. Our framework is built on Java & JUnit, using industry best practices and OO design patterns with very high quality standards. We are looking for folks to help join us and progress our automation/CI frameworks! 


In this role you are expected to take on the opportunity to build or enhance integration test frameworks for specific areas of the Marin product, creating live integrations for external systems (Google, Facebook etc.) and tying it all into a robust continuous integration setup on Jenkins.

jobs.title: Graphics Specialist
jobs.content:
SUMMARY: Responsible for daily requirements of internal and external graphic production. Represents Black Oak Casino Resort with respect and integrity at all times.
Essential Responsibilities and Duties: (Specific areas of responsibility including, but not limited to)
• Designs, coordinates, and produces a variety of marketing visual material for promotions, posters, fliers, advertisements, packaging and media outlets such as websites and other digital avenues for the Resort.
• Assists Executive Director of Marketing, Director of Marketing, Marketing Manager and Media/Promotions Supervisor in planning and executing published entertainment and promotional calendars for the Resort.
• Provides various graphic data for newsletter and all graphics related to the Resort’s printed materials.
• Provides input on branding and promotional graphic messages developed by Marketing including color palette and font choices.
• Translates a creative brief to a creative execution within the designated timeframe.
• Produces special menus for Hospitality, as well as special events graphics, and internal promotional material for all areas of the Resort. Occasionally assists with Tribal projects.
• Aids management with special design or consultation as needed to complete scheduled projects.
• Creates and develops website and mobile application graphics and content. Provides creative support for any graphic needs.
• Demonstrates proficiency in standard office software including Microsoft Office, Internet and FTP protocols, and scanning software.
• Utilizes existing project management system as a communication tool.
• Performs other duties as assigned.
Mandatory Requirements:
• Must be at least 21 years of age.
• Must possess a high school diploma, G.E.D. or equivalent.
• Must possess a Bachelor’s degree in graphics and graphic production, art, or design.
• Minimum three years of current experience.
• Must possess extensive knowledge of Mac-based computer hardware and software.
• Must possess extensive knowledge of standard graphic design applications in the Adobe Creative Cloud including Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Dreamweaver and Flash.
• Must have experience with graphic design theory, typography, and color theory.
• Must have technical expertise with graphic design, print, and web production software.
• Must have experience with publication layout and design, commercial printing requirements and practices.
• Must have ability to work in a team environment and embrace Black Oak Casino Resort’s Mission and Values.
• Must possess and maintain a valid California driver license and a Black Oak Casino driver’s permit.
• Must provide evidence of employment eligibility in the U.S.
• Must be able to obtain a valid gaming license.
• Must be able to pass a mandatory drug test.
• Must be able to communicate proficiently in English.

Physical Demands:
• Must be physically able to perform all job requirements.
• Must be able to lift 25 lbs and occasionally more with assistance.
Work Environment:
• Must be able to work in a non-smoke free environment.
• Must be able to work in a noisy environment.
• Must be able to work outside in all weather conditions.
• Must be able to work weekends, holidays, and special events.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
Description:


The Full-Stack Developer is responsible for developing and maintaining responsive, intuitive web applications for our products and internal tools. As part of the development team, you will develop and maintain new applications, as well as support existing applications for our clients and internal users.  Strong candidates will possess a self-starter attitude and exceptional communication skills.


Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Works with latest technologies such as Aurelia, Typescript, Angular 2, and ASP .Net

  • Develops complex user interfaces and intuitive interaction models for web-based applications.

  • Develops data and business layers on the backend to support client-side functionality

  • Implements responsive designs using standards-compliant Javascript and markup.

  • Profiles existing code to identify performance enhancements.

  • Promotes best practices in usability requirements.

  • Develops new applications, as well as provide enhancements and support for existing systems written in C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server and various Javascript frameworks

  • Develops and maintains data access layer using Entity Framework, stored procedures and T-SQL.

  • Evaluates and recommends new technologies and tools as necessary.

  • Provides training assistance to customers on the use of the respective systems or processes.

  • Can work on multiple projects simultaneously.

  • Testing the software and assuring its quality.

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer - 100% New Development - AWS - Cambridge, MA
jobs.content:
We are building a new service in the The Amazon Web Service (AWS) Cambridge Development Center located in Kendall Square, Cambridge, MA and are seeking a talented and passionate Software Development Engineers (multiple openings for mid to senior level Developers).

As a Senior Software Engineer in this office, you will design and build a new service that will accelerate help large, enterprise companies migrate their computing to AWS. Delivering a reliable and high-performance service at AWS scale requires engineers with extraordinary technical expertise and boundless creativity. At Amazon, we also expect engineers like you to interact with customers, to understand our business goals, and to innovate rapidly, delivering high-quality and ground-breaking functionality.

What does it take to thrive as a Senior Developer at AWS? You need to be creative, responsible, and curious while working with others to move quickly in turning code into customer solutions. You’re excited about rolling up your sleeves, implementing big ideas, and learning from those around you. You want the opportunity to grow your technical and professional skills while helping AWS grow. You relish the opportunity to dig into challenging operational issues and to help customers build the next generation of web applications. You’re somebody who knows how to be both productive and have fun with others.

jobs.title: Software Engineer: Data
jobs.content:
Postmates runs one of the largest real-time delivery fleets in the country. Building a software platform that is reliable, scales and stays agile under demanding product needs is a serious technical challenge. Postmates isn’t just another ad platform or mobile app for delivering static user generated content: We have real customers paying real money for a real service, all under an hour.


As a Data Engineer, you’ll be part of a team responsible for the integrity and accessibility of all of Postmates business-critical data. You’ll contribute to our data-pipelines, our analytics tools, and our data science and machine learning infrastructure, as well as help design and scale our architecture to meet future needs. You’ll work with teams across the organization, making sure that engineers have the tools to generate and store data and that business and data science consumers have the information they need at their fingertips.


We’re looking for engineers with a proven track record of shipping high-impact tools. We care much more that you understand how to build simple, clear, and reliable tools than you have experience with any given toolset or pattern. We love learning, and we expect that you will learn new things and teach us new things as we build out the Postmates data infrastructure.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and build tools that make our data pipelines and surfacing more reliable and easier to use

  • Work closely with backend engineers to roll out new tools and features

  • Triage, identify, and fix scaling challenges

  • Discuss cost-benefit analyses of short-term needs vs long-term scaling

  • Educate product managers, analysts, and engineers about how to use our tooling to answer hard questions and make better decisions


REQUIREMENTS



  • You have a curiosity about how things work

  • You’ve built large-scale data pipeline and ETL tooling before, and have strong opinions about writing beautiful, maintainable, understandable code.

  • You’ve worked professionally with both streaming and batch data processing tools, and understand the tradeoffs.

  • You have designed and maintained distributed systems and understand and look out for common pitfalls.

  • You understand the challenges of working with schema-based and unstructured data, and enjoy the challenge of collecting data flexibly and accurately.

  • You have extensive experience with at least one RDBMS platform, and advanced SQL skills in at least one dialect (Oracle, Teradata, MySQL, etc.)

  • You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to product managers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you.

  • You possess strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrieval.

  • You love it when things work, you understand that things break, and when things do fail you dive in to understand the root causes of failure and fix whatever needs work.


BONUS POINTS



  • A Masters degree (or higher) in a technical field (C.S., Math, Physics, Engineering…)

  • Experience building full stack web tools

  • AWS development and operations experience (EMR, s3, data pipelines, etc.)

  • A solid math and statistics background

  • Experience in small start-up environments


BENEFITS



  • Competitive salary

  • Generous stock option plan

  • Medical, dental and vision insurance

  • Choice of computer and gear

  • Snack filled kitchen

  • Awesome work environment at a company with a huge vision

  • Killer office located in Financial District just minutes from BART, Muni, AC Transit, and SamTrans

jobs.content:

jobs.title: Java Instructor-D.C campus
jobs.content:
If you live and breathe code as your craft, find joy in helping other people learn, and want ample time to pursue freelance, personal projects, or open source work, then this job was custom-made for you.


What we believe in:


First and most importantly, here are a few of our values when it comes to teaching someone how to be a developer:



  • Thinking over syntax - We believe syntax is the easy part of programming and that we are successful when we’ve helped someone learn to think like an engineer.

  • Quality over quantity – We’re interested in training true professionals, not getting as many people into our classes as possible.

  • Real projects over scripted assignments – People learn programming best by tackling hard problems with a mentor, not following a list of steps and taking a quiz.

  • Emphasis on open source – We deeply value the open source mindset and intentionally create and contribute to open source projects.


What the role and responsibilities look like:


Our instructors serve as lecturers and mentors to our students, helping them learn to think like engineers and hone their skills in a programming discipline. You’ll also help define and refine the curriculum to stay current with cool new stuff. Have a look at the courses we’ve already launched.


You’ll teach three, 12-week semesters each year. The remaining 16 weeks you’ll only have light duties for The Iron Yard, such as curriculum updates and interviewing students for future classes. Beyond those things, you’re free to work on whatever you want (such as personal projects, open source projects, or products that we’re building and launching as The Iron Yard). And, of course, you’ll want to take some well-deserved time off.

Each class will be no more than 15 students per instructor, and you will have a campus director to take care of all the non-teaching-critical parts of running a program.

Outside of teaching responsibilities, you’ll be an active part of the development community in your city (hopefully you already are).

jobs.title: Associate PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Sabre is the global leader in innovative technology that leads the travel industry. We are always looking for bright and driven people who have a penchant for technology and want to hone their skills. If you are interested in challenging work, being part of a global team, and solving complex problems through technology, business intelligence and analytics, and Agile practices - then Sabre is right for you! It is our people who develop and deliver powerful solutions that meet the current and future needs for our airline, hotel, and travel agency customers.



GENERAL DESCRIPTION:


Your Responsibilities:


• Develop PHP based applications in a fast paced environment.


• Be up-to-date and passionate about new technologies.


• Collaborate with the team to solve interesting and challenging problems.


• Ensure and improve performance, reliability, flexibility and maintainability of Sabre's PHP applications.

jobs.title: Senior Delphi Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for experienced Delphi developers to join us in developing world class software in the Family Entertainment industry.  Our software is used worldwide by arcades, water parks, bowling centers and movie theaters. The software you will be working on has tight integration with hardware such as turnstiles, cashless systems and advanced payment devices. We love and use mobile and have a strategy heavily focused around Android and Firemonkey. 


We are a company of about 60 people, though you will be joining a small team of 5 developers who work on this group of products. 


Our ideal candidate has many years of experience in Delphi or strongly competent in Delphi with many years of experience in other object oriented languages.  We are not looking for drag-and-drop coders.  You should know and have demonstrable experience in writing to interfaces and architecting maintainable code.  You will sometimes be asked to document your work for end-users and will often chip in with with QA during the testing cycle.


You will be expected to have an opinion on the right way to tackle a problem and must be able to defend it.  You must be a mentor to the rest of the team but be willing to learn as well. You will be tasked with finding obscure problems in very complex code and recommending solutions that are more creative than simply starting from the ground up. 


Experience in the Family Entertainment industry is preferred but the ability to quickly understand domain knowledge is all we require.  


This industry is fast paced and weekend based.  As such, your job will often require long hours or chipping in to help on the weekends. 


Ideally the developer we select would relocate to Meridian, MS to join our on-site development team, but remote is an option for a developer that is a perfect fit.


All applicants will be required to code a small Delphi application to our specification (approximately 1 to 4 hours) as a qualification to be interviewed.
