jobs.title: Web Development Lead Instructor, Principal Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Galvanize is seeking Lead Instructors to teach full stack web development in an intensive, 6-month course. At Galvanize, we don’t just teach, we guide. We use data-driven instructional design to differentiate for students’ diverse personality types, habits, and learning styles. We immerse students in an agile development process from day one to help them become the best developers (and life-long learners) they can be.

Full Stack Instructor curriculum includes these topics and more:

Learning how to learn - tools, habits, and mindsets
How the web works
Version Control
HTML and CSS
Programming fundamentals in Javascript
Test Driven Development
Node.js
Server-side frameworks with Express
Client-side frameworks with Angular
Responsive Design
APIs
Algorithms
Interview Skills





AS A WEB DEVELOPMENT INSTRUCTOR AT GALVANIZE, YOU WILL:




    • Lead lectures and class activities and support students during project work.

    • Plan daily lessons and assess students on an ongoing basis

    • Identify and schedule relevant guest speakers

    • Assist in student placements process

    • Give curriculum feedback to the instructional team

    • Help develop internal student tools.

    • Provide students with a meaningful training experience in the classroom.

    • Work alongside gSchool staff in providing prompt feedback on student progress.

    • Guide students through development of a final project that will showcase their web development abilities to hiring managers.

    • Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community.

    • Teach and plan a full work week, five days a week, for 24 weeks

    • Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community.

    • Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of turning their ideas into actual web application.

    • Contribute to local evangelism, admissions, and nurture activities, such as attendance at meetups, speaking at conferences, leading workshops, etc.





EXPECTED EXPERIENCE:




    • At least 5+ years of advanced JS, Node experience

    • Fluency in the following topics: HTTP, Rails, JavaScript, SQL (PostgreSQL), HTML ; CSS; databases

    • Experience working with agile teams – pair programming experience a plus.

    • Thrives in a continuous feedback environment and welcomes feedback from students and other instructors

    • Previous background in teaching and/or mentoring aspiring developers – or a deep interest in giving it a try. 

    • Eager to shape the skills, minds, and trajectories of the newest generation of web developers.

    • High performing current immersive instructor desirable

    • Great communication skills





PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT:




    • At Galvanize, we strive to providing meaningful professional development opportunities to all of our employees. Here are just a few of the ways you will continue to grow and “level-up” as a developer and a teacher:

    • There’s no better way to learn than to teach! You’ll be amazed at how much you’ll develop skills you thought you were already an expert in just by helping students and planning lessons.

    • Opportunities to work with and learn from other data science and web development instructors in a highly collaborative and intellectually rich environment. Rub shoulders and cross-pollinate.

    • Keep your skills sharp with the option to work with our expert services arm, Galvanize X, on industry web development and data science projects. Previous projects have involved: Machine Learning; Deep Learning, Data Engineering and Architecture, Applied Statistics and Statistical Modeling, Web Development Ruby on Rails, Angular, Ember, React, and Node.js and Express. 

    • Become the best instructor you can be with ongoing training and support.






Galvanize provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Executive Assistant (Mandarin Speaking)
jobs.content:
About Us:

Tea is the second most consumed beverage in the world after water. Rich in tradition and ritual, tea also has the ability to transform our body, mind and spirit. Teforia will combine the knowledge of a tea master with the best in modern technology to transform the tradition of tea into a modern sensory experience.

Our stunningly-beautiful connected machine intuitively understands the best infusion method for each tea varietal, reading each tea package and automatically initiating the optimal brewing recipe. Teforia makes the delicate, complicated process of infusion a simple, enjoyable experience and produces a perfect cup of tea every time.

The Role:

As the Executive Assistant in Teforia’s Mountain View headquarters, you will have a direct and influential role in the company’s daily operations and ultimate success. With your ability to enhance the efficiency and output of each of the company’s top executives while simultaneously keeping the office running smoothly, you will be a key player in Teforia’s future.

You Will:

  • Directly support the CEO, CTO, and CMO in a variety of administrative and operational tasks
  • Maintain Mountain View office services by organizing office operations and procedures, controlling correspondence, designing filing systems, reviewing and approving supply requisitions, and facilitating clerical functions
  • Coordinate event logistics, including rental booking, catering, transportation, etc.
  • Help support the SF satellite office as needed
  • Maintain office efficiency by planning and implementing office systems, layouts, and equipment procurement
  • Design and implement office policies by establishing standards and procedures, measuring results against standards, and making necessary adjustments
  • Keep management informed by reviewing and analyzing special reports, summarizing information, and identifying trends
  • Protect privileged and confidential information through diligence and discretion
  • Facilitate communication within the company and with outside vendors, stakeholders, and partners--including communication with Taiwanese partners in Mandarin
  • Contribute to team effort by accomplishing required results as needed
  • Adapt and learn new things in a constantly changing environment.

Our Ideal Candidate Has:

  • 2+ years in executive administrative support experience, or similar
  • Previous experience with vendor management, ordering, and operational office functions
  • Top-notch organizational ability with a particular focus on calendars/scheduling, travel arrangement, task prioritization, and follow through.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills
  • Exemplary written and verbal communication
  • A curious nature with an interest toward continued learning
  • Ability to speak fluent Mandarin

Bonus Points:

  • Experience supporting multiple people within an organization
  • Previously worked as an Office Manager or in a comparable role

What We Can Offer You:

  • Market-competitive salary and fantastic benefits
  • Equity in a strongly-backed startup with huge potential
  • A collaborative team of driven and motivated individuals in a fast, exciting startup working environment
  • Tea, lots of amazing tea!

jobs.title: Principal Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us:

EverString helps build new pipeline and increase conversion rates with the only account-based, full lifecycle, predictive platform for B2B sales and marketing. The EverString Decision Platform identifies a company’s ideal customer profile, and then finds the prospects that best fit that profile, both inside and outside the existing pipeline. EverString’s SaaS platform provides Predictive Scoring, Predictive Demand Generation, and Predictive Ad Targeting, empowering marketers with the full potential of predictive analytics and applied data science. EverString is backed by leading investors including Lightspeed Venture Partners, Sequoia Capital, IDG Ventures, and Lakestar.

EverString’s work environment is grounded in the principles of introspection, innovation, and a one-team mentality. We are dedicated to the well-being of our team members, and we provide strong mentorship, daily lunches, weekly happy hours, in-house workout classes, and a commitment to supporting your personal and professional growth.

The Role:

EverString is looking for an experienced full stack software engineer to join our engineering team in San Mateo, CA. As a member of the engineering team, you will get an opportunity to build a world class SaaS-based predictive analytics application. You will contribute to the full web application stack - JavaScript (Angular.js) for user interface, and Python for server-side development. You will collaborate with platform and data science teams to deliver cutting edge big data and analytics solutions to our customers.

You Will:

  • Develop state of the art SaaS applications to provide predictive analytics insights to 1000’s of enterprise customers
  • Contribute to the architecture and design of our products and platform
  • Designing high-performance RESTful web services that meet strict performance SLAs
  • Deliver high quality and scalable code with automated test coverage
  • Collaborate effectively with team members and product management
  • Be part of a fast-paced agile team

Our Ideal Candidate Has:

  • 5+ years industry experience, with a focus on SaaS development, big data, or both
  • Experience building web services using Python and Django or Flask, or Ruby on Rails
  • Experience working with large datasets (Big Data)
  • Strong grasp of Object-oriented design, CS fundamentals, and programming fundamentals
  • Proficient in schema design and SQL tuning on RDBMS and/or Data warehouses
  • Comfortable working in an agile, fast-paced startup environment
  • Team player with good analytical and communication skills
  • Ability to hit the ground running and learn/adapt quickly

Bonus Points:

  • Experience building and shipping products using a JavaScript framework (Angular.js, React.js, etc)
  • Exposure to distributed computing platforms like Hadoop, Spark, MongoDB, etc.

What We Can Offer You:

  • Market-competitive salary plus equity
  • Robust 401(k) plan
  • Healthy catered lunches and dinners, and a fully-stocked kitchen
  • A Fitbit Charge HR to participate in challenges & win prizes
  • Ergonomic workspaces and stand-up desks
  • Exclusive partnership with Equinox offering supplemented memberships
  • Generous PTO policy
  • Team off-sites and weekly happy hours
  • Onsite yoga and meditation classes
  • Flexible working hours
  • Semi-annual company-wide non-profit volunteering
  • We support charity fundraisers for causes important to our team
  • Dedicated to building our company and growing locally in San Mateo

jobs.title: Application Developer
jobs.content:
As a Wegmans Developer you will have the opportunity to work on front-end web apps and back end systems that are heavily integrated and customized. Using the full stack of Microsoft technologies, in the .NET framework with C#, you will be part of a team developing business applications that help our employees work smarter and faster.  These applications are essential to the success of our 45,000+ employees across six states as we grow our business and help customers.



As a Supply Chain Systems Application Developer, you will work on two primary projects supporting our Logistics teams as they look to continuously improve their operations.  In support of our Transportation Department you will work with a team that is ready to go live this month with the second phase of a multiyear project.   You will be implementing functionality to support inbound planning, outbound planning, dispatch, fleet maintenance, driver pay, yard management, appointment scheduling, internet bids and auto payment/claims.


Your work efforts on our Warehouse Delivered Cost project will help improve accuracy.   Together with the team you will write a processes to perform calculations and enhance existing applications that use and display those calculations. Experience with TFS, SSRS, SSIS and MSMQ is preferred. 



If you are someone who enjoys collaboration, solving complex problems, and implementing solutions, then this could be the job for you! If you have at least two years of experience, apply today to become part of this exciting team.

jobs.title: Assistant Construction Superintendent
jobs.content:
When you join Bozzuto Construction as an Assistant Construction Superintendent, you build more than beautiful and vibrant spaces that live and breathe in concert with the surrounding community. You build a career with a growing company recognized for superior quality and consistently named one of the Best Places to Work in the Washington, DC region.

Founded on values and built on integrity, Bozzuto Construction is one of the Mid-Atlantic’s fastest-growing general contractors specializing in complicated urban infill high-rise and mixed-use projects, retail, assisted and senior living. Since our inception in 1988 Bozzuto Construction Company has grown to over $350 million in annual revenue with more than 32,000 units valued in excess of $3 billion completed or under construction. With more than 2,000 employees company-wide, strong financials and substantial growth on the horizon, we are large enough to offer stable, highly successful career paths, yet flexible enough for you to make a remarkable difference, right from the start.

Expected Contributions:

  • Lead weekly subcontractor meetings, as well as all safety and progress meetings.
  • Develop/maintain construction schedules using CPM schedule program.
  • Ensure compliance with applicable code/safety regulations, and enforce safety policies.
  • Monitor material flow to jobsites and control field office general conditions costs.
  • Establish/maintain relationships with owners, inspection authorities, and other parties.
  • Organize project records including: subcontracts, change orders, permits, and drawings.



Required Experience:
  • Bachelor’s degree in construction management/related field; or similar practice/training.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Adobe Acrobat, Primavera P6, and Procore.
  • PMP and/or LEED accreditation desired.
  • 3-5 years construction management experience with multi-million dollar projects.
  • Well-versed in safety and government regulations (i.e., OSHA) as they relate to a jobsite.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of construction codes and ordnances.
  • Reasonable budgetary skills with experience in managing budgets and costs effectively.

Additional Requirements:

To perform the duties of this job, you will occasionally need to lift or move up to 50 pounds; you will be regularly exposed to adverse conditions (including, but not limited to bad weather, dust, and noise) and required to talk, hear, stand, and walk long distances; and you must be able to get around sites and buildings under construction, which includes climbing stairs and ladders.

Bozzuto's mission is to create the best possible living environment for our customers and to do so in a way that creates community and respects the world in which we live. From the very beginning, our success has been built around our four core values:

  1. Concern - for the communities we touch.
  2. Creativity - in everything we do.
  3. Passion - in our approach to business.
  4. Perfection - as a goal worth pursuing.

Supporting these values is a set of beliefs or practices that guide us in how we do business and conduct ourselves on a daily basis.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer EOE/M/F/D/V

jobs.title: Applications Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Human Longevity, Inc. is looking for an Application Support Engineer to work cross-functionally with DevOps, Software Quality and Data Engineering to manage, support and optimize the systems delivering big data for one of the largest whole genome sequencing facilities in the world.



Tasks and Responsibilities


The Application Support Engineer will be responsible for the support and enhancement of HLI’s core platform technology.  The candidate will interact not only with other team members in supporting and building different components of the system, but also with scientists, bioinformaticians and non-engineers.  The candidate must be conscientious, detail oriented and be dedicated to seeing tasks through to completion.  Above all the candidate must have a passion for learning and technology.

jobs.content:
Human Longevity, Inc. is looking for a Software Design Engineer in Test to ensure quality application systems development of HLI’s core platform technology supporting “omics” and bioinformatics analysis. 



Tasks and Responsibilities


The Software Design Engineer in Test candidate will work closely with the quality and engineering teams to develop automated tests, execute software test plans and procedures compliant with software testing ISO standards.  The ideal candidate will be knowledgeable in current test platforms and strategies including testing software in Cloud (AWS), Windows (C# .NET), Web (Node.js Angular.js) and Linux (C/C++/Python) environments.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Software Engineer at Agora (a subsidiary of Warner Bros.Interactive Entertainment), you will be working primarily on our online game services platform called "Hydra Studio”, in addition to some other internal technologies. You will be responsible for creating complex data processing and presentation tools that integrate tightly with some of the largest franchises in the games industry. You will work as part of a highly talented team of producers, engineers, and business specialists to expand our systems and add value to WB Games' catalogue of products.


We are looking for a candidate with the ability to quickly learn new platforms. We use many different technologies within Hydra, and while we don’t expect you to know them all coming in, we need a candidate who can quickly learn and be proficient with them!

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Agora (a subsidiary of Warner Bros.Interactive Entertainment), you will be working primarily on our online game services platform called "Hydra Studio”, in addition to some other internal technologies. You will be responsible for managing the infrastructure behind very complex data processing and presentation tools that integrate tightly with some of the industry's biggest game franchises. You will work as part of a highly talented team of producers, engineers, and business specialists to expand the Hydra platform, and ensure an efficient and stable environment for WB Games' catalogue of products.


We are looking for a candidate with the ability to quickly learn new platforms. We use many different technologies within Hydra, and while we don’t expect you to know them all coming in, we need a candidate who can quickly learn and be proficient with them!


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Own automation of the infrastructure platform

  • Work on incorporating Agora Games’ engineering practices into infrastructure operations

  • Write and review code, develop documentation and capacity plans, and debug problems, live, on very complex systems

  • Together with your engineering team, you will share an on-call rotation and be an escalation contact for service incidents

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Olo we develop an online food ordering platform used by many of the country’s largest restaurant chains, reaching millions of consumers. We take pride in a neat codebase with automated tests and continuous integration, and encourage constant refactoring.  We encourage new ideas and experimentation.  No part of the code base is off limits.



Olo is revolutionizing the customer experience at these restaurant chains, and we're looking for talented engineers to join our team and help achieve this vision. As part of the team you will play a significant and visible role in helping us scale one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the market. You will design and develop integrations to a variety of third party systems that make up the restaurant technology ecosystem. While primarily focused on our back-end, the position requires contributions throughout our stack.



You'll work with a smart, passionate team dedicated to delivering amazing products using modern tools and technologies such as .NET 4.6, ASP.NET MVC 5, TeamCity, GitHub, Octopus Deploy, and heavy use of OSS.



This is a full-time position. We are open to remote U.S. candidates.

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
We’re a software studio that happens to be at Capital One®. We’re turning this credit card company into a tech powerhouse. And we’re looking for techies like you that can change the course of the game.


We love open-source and working with latest technologies. Whether you’re a big Apple fan or an Android lover, prefer noSQL databases over anything else or like to hack away in the good old Java, you’ll fit in our team as long as you’re passionate about technology. We build digital solutions to simplify and humanize the world of credit cards for millions of Canadians.


Big challenges, casual workplace. Compensation and benefits are pretty good too!


Think it. Code it.


By that, we mean that you, as a member of one of our great Agile teams will be responsible for participating in the design, coding, testing and delivery of solutions that benefit our customers and Canadians in general.


How:



  • Craft awesome experiences for millions of users.

  • Do epic work with great cross-functional teams.

  • Own it. From your desktop to the Cloud.

  • Share what you know, learn from others.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ptiovHqhLA..


Responsibilities:



  • Work closely with the Product Owner and Engineering teams

  •  Strong coding abilities and experience with iOS SDK

  • Contribute best-in-class programming skills to develop highly innovative, consumer-facing mobile products

  • Drive the development of elegant solutions to complex problems.. Design and implement efficient algorithms and new approaches for use in banking systems

  • Experience in understanding large and complex code bases, including designing REST APIs

  • Familiar with tools in continuous integration and continuous development pipeline

  • Ability to balance out desire to ship code soon with responsibility to get it right

  • Learn by adapting quickly to an evolving market and emerging trends.. Mentor all levels of the team

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We dream to reinvent our industry. We dare to have a passion for technology. What do you dream of? Are you a technologist that desires to reinvent and dares to reinvigorate an entire industry? Are you excited to solve challenges using the best technologies and tools around, unfettered by long, bureaucratic, processes?


Capital One® is transforming itself and the very business we're in and we're looking for people with passion, excitement, and a desire to challenge and change the status quo.


We're a Fortune 150 company that takes an entrepreneurial, groundbreaking approach to everything we do. We're an agile shop working in cross-functional teams with the mandate and authority to change and build great experiences for our customers and we want to hire people that want to seize this incredible opportunity. You'll work with great people in an open, friendly, collaborative environment that is being built to provide you with engaging challenges and opportunities to build, learn, and grow.


Our Toronto Software Studio, located in North York, is the beating digital heart of Capital One®.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and scale real-time distributed systems to support millions of users.

  • Drive the development of elegant solutions to complex problems.- Design and implement efficient algorithms and new approaches for use in banking systems.

  • Develop brand new user-facing features from conception to execution.

  • Advance best practices with the engineering team through participation in design and code reviews.

  • Ability to balance out desire to ship code soon with responsibility to get it right.

jobs.title: Software Test Engineer
jobs.content:
(QA, Software Test Engineer):



We are currently seeking a Software Test Engineer with a strong manual testing background who has understanding of SQL and basic scripting knowledge to work closely with our Development and QA teams in Chicago or Naperville office. This person will sit in our Integration team and is responsible for testing the Fieldglass application in order to maintain product quality. The successful candidate will work closely with developers and other analysts and apply analytical and problem-solving skills to ensure that the code is working per specifications.

Responsibilities Include:


  • Write and maintain tests utilizing basic scripting techniques

  • Fluent in Excel pivot table, charting, and basic macro writing

  • Demonstrates understanding of the different browser idiosyncrasies and how they can affect application behavior.

  • Writes functional requirement documents to support new/changed functionality and works with stakeholders to obtain signoff.

  • Develops test plans and test strategies.

  • Manages defects and works with development team to provide resolutions.

  • Collaborates with offshore testing teams in India.

  • Complies with various process controls throughout the SDLC.

  • Supports business and call center teams in understanding system functionality.

  • Supports the production release process, which includes the ability to work late nights and extended hours approximately once a month.

  • Plays an integral role in the entire software development lifecycle including participation in design sessions, defining functional requirements, working with development teams, testing, and preparing code for production deployment

jobs.title: Entry Level Developer / DBA
jobs.content:
(Product Development, Entry Level Developer / DBA):


We are currently seeking an Entry Level Developer / DBA who will work in a team and with developers in system engineering, performance optimization, troubleshooting and database design. This is an on-site position and will be located in our Naperville office.


Responsibilities Include:



  • Collaborate with Developers on Database design and participate in database capacity planning.

  • Create T-SQL scripts to perform complex functions such as de-normalizing OLTP data into de-normalized reporting structures, archiving data, data slicing etc.

  • Collaborate with DBA team members to manage production and operation databases.

  • Physical SQL Server Installation for both stand-alone and clustered instances of SQL Server.

  • Support includes production, operations, staging and Disaster Recovery sites.

  • Create PowerShell scripts for task automation.

  • Identify performance issues and suggest resolutions. 

  • Evaluate and recommend database tools.

  • Take part in 24x7x365 DBA On-call rotation.

  • Review SQL code and recommend optimizations while enforcing best practices.

  • Support security initiatives including SQL auditing and audit evidence preparation.

  • Deploy database upgrade scripts to Production environments as dictated by the application release schedule and needs of the business.

  • Create and maintain documentation for processes and policies.

  • Provide ongoing database support/review in the production environment.

jobs.content:

We are currently seeking a UI Java Developer, to work within our growing Product Development team. The Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and delivering software modules and components of varying size and complexity related to the UI technologies. In this role, the candidate will collaborate and interface with Team Leads from different departments during all phases of the SDLC. The Developer will maintain and support product features in the Production, Pre-Production, and Operations environments. This position is located in our Naperville office.


 Responsibilities:



  • Create the design specifications for development from approved business cases.

  • Execute unit and system testing of the design once the solution has been developed, and work closely with other team members to successfully deploy the code to production.

  • Performs impact analyses of new features or changes to existing features within the Fieldglass application

  • Ensure accuracy and integrity of data and application through analysis, coding, writing clear documentation and problem resolution.

  • Analyze and translate functional specifications and change requests into technical specifications.

  • Develop, test and implement program logic.

jobs.title: Lead Mobile Engineer
jobs.content:
Top Hat is looking for iOS or Android developers to be part of a growing team building out our native mobile apps, used in class by students and professors all over the world. We're looking for someone highly technical who also understands the nuances of beautiful user experiences on mobile.


About the Gig:



  • Work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment

  • Maintain and improve the iOS or Android application used by over a million students

  • Implement new features in the Top Hat phone and tablet apps

  • Improve application performance and reliability

  • Provide solutions to exciting new problems

  • Work closely with our design and backend teams to help bring beautiful, usable, and fast mobile designs to life (Our backend is a REST API built with Django, with Node.js for realtime. Everything runs in a high-availability setup on AWS, with MySQL, memcached, autoscaling.)

  • Contribute ideas and participate in design and planning discussions with your team


About You:



  • You are very smart and able to learn quickly

  • You probably have a technical undergraduate degree (ie. computer science/engineering)

  • You have a few years of development experience on at least one of the iOS or Android platforms

  • You are able to architect robust, maintainable systems, not just hack together code for one-off projects

  • You want to work on an app that is positively influencing the education space


You should be comfortable with most of the following:



  • Current knowledge of iOS or Android development technologies and tools

  • Mobile network programming (client-server)

  • REST APIs

  • Git

  • Automated unit and integration testing


We think the best sign of a good developer is interesting projects they’ve done. Tell us your about the cool stuff you’ve built!

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a hardcore engineer to help build our cutting edge education platform that students all over the world use in class. Does doin’ your thing in Django take you to your happy place? Does coding in JavaScript feel better than Christmas morning? Read on, you Maniac Hack. Read on.


About You:




  • At least a few years of web development experience under your belt.




  • Be able to put together robust, maintainable systems. Hacking together code for one-off projects isn't going to cut it in this shop.




  • Degree in a technical field is preferred, but not essential.




  • Be super smart and get things done.




  • You understand the difference between smart shortcuts to take and a ugly hacks.




Our client side app is built on a fairly sophisticated JavaScript framework and makes use of jQuery, Backbone.js and all the usual suspects. The server-side is written in Python on Django, with a MySQL database. We use Node.js and SockJS for our real time components. Our systems all run on Amazon Web Services.


You will be will be working a variety of projects relating to our flagship web application. These will include front-end MVC application design and development, DOM optimization, and modular and extensible HTML/CSS . In terms of back-end development, you will be working on our Django application and creating lightning-fast REST APIs.


We like to hire developers who have solid full stack experience but definitely value, and accommodate, developers who choose to be more focused on either front-end and back-end development.


It’s a good sign if you’re comfortable with:




  • Semantic HTML5 concepts




  • CSS 3.0




  • JavaScript




  • Git




  • Automated unit and integration testing




  • HTTP




  • REST APIs




  • Databases (Hopefully including query performance and optimization)




We think a good developer should have interesting projects they've done on their own time. So please showcase any cool side projects, open source contributions, community involvement, and show us your GitHub profile if you have one.

jobs.title: UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
Since 1996, Electric Pulp has focused on developing cutting-edge interactive solutions. We’re looking for a designer who can help us continue to produce top-of-the-line digital experiences for fun and sometimes demanding clients. So if you're great at what you do, and what you do happens to be designing interfaces for the web and mobile, we want to hear from you.

We prefer that you are or could be local to Sioux Falls, SD, but don’t let your location stop you from making contact. We understand that the right fit might not live here.

About The Job

As a designer at Electric Pulp, you will be integral to the success of the project, working with designers, clients, project managers and developers to create elegant user interfaces and ensuring that they are carried successfully through to completion. You’ll need to know all about grids, responsive design, and mobile-specific requirements. We’ll expect to see some examples of such in your portfolio.

In general, we believe that design needs to solve problems and be beautiful at the same time. Your work should do both with gusto. We’re looking for pixel perfect, as well as purpose perfect.

While design is the core function of this role, there are a few other things that we'll be looking for:

  • Ability to work well with others
  • Ability to professionally communicate your design ideas to the client
  • Self-starter tendencies (especially important if you're out of the area)
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Dedication required to meet a deadline
  • Interest and proven history of learning/creating new methods and approaches
  • Ability to write effectively and without typos

This position is available now, and is already loaded with work, so you'll need to hit the ground running. As a result, it'd be best if you had some serious chops when you walk through the door on the first day. Skills and experience required are as follows:

  • 4+ years as an interactive designer
  • Experience working with clients
  • Experience using Sketch
  • Expertise in typography, composition and color theory
  • Expertise in using grids for layout
  • Knowledge of responsive design and all it entails
  • Knowledge of mobile design
  • Experience creating site architecture and navigation structures
  • Experience creating logos, icons and graphical elements
  • Firm understanding of HTML & CSS
  • Familiarity with Photoshop, Illustrator and Invision
  • Photo processing and color treatment experience a plus.

This is a full-time salaried position with benefits:

  • Paid time off for vacations or illness
  • SimpleIRA Retirement Account with matching
  • Robust Healthcare Coverage
  • Dental Plan
  • Optical Discounts
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Work Laptop provided
  • We use Slack
  • Bike Program
  • Competitive Ping Pong environment
  • Free pop (That’s soda, for you coastal types.)

We’re very serious about our work, but the team is cool, the projects are fulfilling and the Fridays allow for casual attire. As do the other days.


So if this sounds interesting to you, send us a note about why you want to join the team. Include your resumé, your portfolio and examples of your work in the wild. We'd also take a glance at interface work you've Dribbbled, if you're into that kind of thing. We look forward to hearing from you.

jobs.title: BlackRock Java Web Developer
jobs.content:
This position is for a Java Web Developer that will be responsible for the design and development of CRM Client Intelligence reporting and BI solutions. The Client Intelligence team empowers sales and client service teams to research, analyse and report their data to grow revenue and gain deeper operational insight. The individual must have a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle and extensive experience building multi-tier applications. The ideal candidate will thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem-solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication.             



  • Java Web Developer to build out custom reporting and BI with visualization solution for CRM 

  • Contribute to the delivery of high quality software solutions

  • Analyze, design, code, test and build scalable and multi-tier web applications

  • Provide ongoing support and maintenance of the current environment and user base

  • Employ industry best practices, such as unit testing and continuous integration

  • Proactively identify and suggest improvements to software designs

  • Demonstrate strong understanding of business purpose and key stakeholders of Client

jobs.title: IT Service Manager
jobs.content: Under the general direction of the EAIS Professional Services Manager, provide high level technical direction, management and oversight; strategic technology planning; and analytical support to departmental clients. Identify practical applications of new technology. Relate technical capabilities to business and program goals. Represent client needs to the campus on Information and Education Technology (IET) matters. Oversees all aspects of computing resources including planning, organizing, and directing of IT activities; systems administration, database administration, network administration, environmental monitoring and facility-wide security systems; help desk support services and technical support; and hardware and software purchasing.

jobs.title: Applications Development Programmer
jobs.content: Under the direction of the IET Application Development Managers, develop on teams such as middleware infrastructure, enterprise applications and web development in support of the UC Davis Campus, UCDHS and wider UC system. Work on projects that are complex, include mission-critical applications for students, faculty and staff. Provide analytical, development, testing, implementation, documentation, and maintenance support for applications and infrastructure.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
A Senior Full Stack Developer familiar with each layer of software development technology. Responsible for designing, developing and modifying website solutions and services. Own the quality of their work and enforcing code integrity throughout the team. In addition to writing amazing code, Senior Software Developers innovate and inspire by leading the charge, pursuing new technology, and executing at a high level.


Located in Palm Beach Gardens, Bankrate has a fresh, fun, and creative environment you won’t find anywhere else. If you have a strong will to learn and educate and are motivated by opportunity to help grow our team, then we'd love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Solutions Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Samasource provides sustainable pathways out of poverty to underprivileged youth throughout Africa and Asia. We're an award-winning nonprofit that works with major Silicon Valley companies to provide dignified online work across Kenya, Uganda, Haiti and India.


As our solutions engineer, you'll ensure the 2 million work submissions we receive each month are processed as quickly & efficiently as possible. You'll write & maintain Ruby code to quickly process client data, communicate with US & Kenyan staff to diagnose & debug our online software platform, and liaise directly with clients to clarify & resolve data delivery issues.


We write tested, continuously integrated, peer-reviewed Ruby/Rails/AngularJS code. We're vigilant about staying up to date with the latest releases of all our frameworks & tools. We run our platform on Heroku, store code in GitHub, continuously integrate with CircleCI, monitor with New Relic, and use Pivotal Tracker to keep our agile workflow flowing.


While we'd prefer applicants to work from our San Francisco office, we'll consider remote US applicants willing to work on the Pacific timezone. This position is ideal for a junior-to-intermediate developer who likes fast-paced programming environments, boasts solid written & spoken English skills, and wants to help alleviate poverty in underprivileged communities across the world.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
GameDuell is Germany`s largest game site and compares itself to the best game sites in the world. In order to meet these high standards, it is not only extremely important to implement new features, but it is also necessary to continuously optimize the platform.


As a Java Developer at GameDuell, you will find a high-traffic Internet platform with more than 500 million monthly page views. The IT architecture of GameDuell is based on Java EE and allows on the one hand horizontal scaling and on the other, a high availability and robust experience for customers.


Your tasks



  • Implementation new and the expansion of existing internationally competitive software

  • Develop the tournament and game logic

  • Create solutions for managing customer and money accounts and loyalty programs

  • Integrate our gaming experience on Facebook and mobile applications

jobs.title: PHP Web Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Web Developer with solid, professional experience as well as an aptitude for discovering and applying, the most-effective technologies available to complete development goals.


We are located in downtown Providence and we provide parking. No commute to Boston or 128!


What you'll be doing:



  • You will be responsible for full life-cycle development of multiple websites and modular web-based applications.

  • You will consult with other members of the team to design, build and manage the systems integrated to the website.

  • You will work in an Agile development environment.

  • You will have an active role in making decisions on overall development strategy and implimentation.


What's in it for you:



  • Work in a fast-paced development environment where you will see the results of your work immediately

  • Casual, relaxed atmosphere with a results- driven mentality

  • Competitive compensation structure

  • Comprehensive benefits package

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer - Open Source
jobs.content:
At Camunda we’ve already achieved building a profitable business based on our open source software. Our developer friendly product is used in mission critical scenarios by customers like Zalando, AT&T, Lufthansa and many more.


We are looking for developers who are eager to solve challenging problems using JavaScript. As a developer at Camunda you will be empowered to make your own decisions. At the same time of course, you can always rely on the help and input of teammates. 


Looking forward to getting to know you.


Please send your application to: jobs@camunda.com


Best,


Robert

jobs.title: Concepteur Développeur Expert Système / Yseop
jobs.content:
Au sein du groupe Société Générale, vous rejoignez la direction des systèmes d'information de Global Banking & investors Solution. Cette dernière a pour responsabilité, au plan mondial, de fournir aux lignes métiers de la banque de financement et aux fonctions support, l'ensemble des moyens informatiques et SI nécessaires à leur fonctionnement, à des conditions compétitives en termes de standards technologiques, de qualité de service et de coûts.

En tant que Développeur Expert "Yseop", vos activités seront de :
* Développer une expertise forte sur la solution « Yseop »
* Participer à la mise en place du centre de service autour de la technologie « Yseop », en assistance au Responsable du Centre d'Expertise Yseop
* Participer à la mis en place des normes et standards de conception, développement et test
* Contribuer à la conception technique et la modélisation des projets utilisant « Yseop »
* Réaliser les développements et tests unitaires, dans le respect des normes et standards de développements
* Mettre en place et maintenir des tests automatisés
* Assurer la revue et la recette des développements réalisés des prestataires externes

Les spécificités du poste seront précisées lors de l'entretien.

jobs.title: ADMINISTRATEUR DE BASE DE DONNÉES EXPERT H/F
jobs.content:
*Support/appui projet: installer et mettre à disposition les Bases de Données dans les environnements de développement, d'homologation et de production sur les serveurs diversifiés, fournir une expertise technique dans le cadre de projets pilotés par le client, définir et faire appliquer les politiques de recovery, tunning, sécurité et back -up...

*Ingénierie: mettre en oeuvre les processus définis par l'entité sur la base d'ITIL dans tous les domaines, organiser et piloter les projets internes de déploiement de solutions

* Mettre en oeuvre des solutions prédéfinies correspondant à des changements standards (demandes de service)

*Support -Expertise sur le diagnostic et la résolution d'incidents,dans le cadre de projets, dans la rédaction des procédures et documentations diverses

*Gestion des problèmes: piloter l'amélioration continue, Analyser et évaluer les incidents d'exploitation

*Participer aux tests de passage en « Secours »

*Architecture: concevoir/valider les solutions techniques à mettre en oeuvre dans l'infrastructure de production
et etudier la faisabilité technique des projets sous l'angle de l'infrastructure

*Elaborer le Capacity Planning (Description et dimensionnement des ressources nécessaires à la production des services)

*Veille technologique

*Pilotage de la prestation: gérer et contrôler les services fournis par les prestataires et faire le suivi des prestations et des relations avec les fournisseurs

*Reporting, métrologie, tableau de bord

*Gestion des assets, pricing/Billing/Costing/ gestion des contrats

jobs.title: CHEF DE PROJET SHAREPOINT H/F
jobs.content:
Au sein du périmètre WEB 2.0 du Business Solution Center, vous intervenez en tant que chef de projet au sein du centre de compétences collaboratif/SharePoint du Groupe Société Générale.Vous portez la responsabilité d'un projet de sa conception jusqu'à sa mise en uvre.


Les missions principales sont les suivantes:
* L'encadrement des projets qui lui seront confiés (budget, méthodologie, technologie, ressources humaines)
* L'accompagnement méthodologique de l'équipe et des partenaires métiers
* L'animation de cérémonies et ateliers créatifs de type « Innovation Games »
* Présentation du savoir-faire et des réalisations de l'équipe auprès des métiers
* Compréhension et l'analyse des besoins métier
* Proposition d'organisation projet et évaluation de la complexité avec l'aide des équipes de développement
* Participer au pilotage de l'équipe : revue des budgets, planification des projets, saisie des consommées, production de reporting

Les interlocuteurs au quotidien seront :
* Le responsable d'équipe
* L'équipe de développement (Onshore et OffShore)
* Les partenaires métiers de l'ensemble de la banque
* Les Assistance à maitrise d'ouvrage outil
* Les équipes transverses (architecture, sécurité, support)

Les spécificités du poste seront précisées lors de l'entretien.

jobs.title: Lead Ruby Web Developer
jobs.content:
As a lead web developer you should have solid leadership/mentoring skills, an unmatched passion for technology, excellent presentation skills, have contributed to open source projects, an obsession for quality, relevant industry experience of 10 years or more and preferably be a Ruby master.


We are looking for someone who can level up our team of top-notch quality driven Ruby on Rails developers. If you live and breath technology, regularly get invited to give talks at both deep-tech and business conferences, run a successful and popular tech-blog, contribute code to the open source projects that you've used regularly and you love mentoring and coaching more junior developers - you might be the one!


You must have a solution oriented mindset and are always looking for the absolute best solutions to solve problems, and are even more productive in a collaborative team environment. In this role it's essential to be a team player; we succeed because we catch and support each other in our work. In your day to day operations you must appreciate receiving feedback on your work because you know it’ll make you even better at your job and at the same time you will be comfortable assisting your teammates by doing the same in the form of code reviews, general feedback and structured sharing.


Your responsibilities will include leading, mentoring, hiring, retention, external branding (giving talks & volunteering your time) and motivation of the team along-side designing, architecting, developing and maintaining web applications. Designing, completing and maintaining complex 3rd part integrations and also troubleshooting existing web applications and integrations. Also auditing and upholding our strict quality standards across all platforms, teams and individuals. Our tech stack predominantly consists of Ruby on Rails, nginx, PostgreSQL, Redis with Linode as the host - production/professional experience with any of these technologies will be a big plus.


This position requires you to be physically located in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia and is not open to full time remote working.

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
Seeking an experienced Android Developer who can create and design mobile applications for Android platforms.


In addition to having excellent technical skills, you have a keen interest in the latest technologies and have a feel for user experience. You'll be responsible for building exciting applications and implementing flows and mock ups as provided by UX and Design teams. Apart from having the ability to write fast and clean code with great attention to detail and proper documentation,  you also come up with solutions and suggestions for improvement as you will be working closely with Product Development and Marketing teams. 


Being one of our talented developers, you'll have an opportunity to learn and grow, and be a key part of creating our products. Check out http://www.omvana.com and http://www.dormioapp.com/ for our latest releases. Omvana is One of the Top 20 Health and Fitness Apps in the USA Apple Store.

jobs.title: Manual Test Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for talented Manual Test Engineer (f/m) to join our challenging and international team.


Apply now to take your place in our IT team – your fellow coders are already waiting for you!


See our application stack on http://stackshare.io/simplesurance/simplesurance


About the job:



  • You take the ownership of the quality of our web sites, both frontend and backend

  • You care about the whole user experience, not only about the bugs

  • You are in charge of the creation and execution of test plans and test cases in multibrowser and multiplatforms

  • You will take part actively in design reviews, grooming, planning and stand-up meetings

  • You will be the guardian of the bridge between our product owners and developers

  • You won’t be a number: your ideas matter and you will make a real impact in the company

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Come help us build world class software that's fundamentally changing veterinary medicine.   Pet Partners, located in Saratoga Springs, NY, owns and operates veterinary hospitals across the United States and we’re growing fast!  We are looking for a Software Engineer with strong coding and SQL experience. Your responsibilities will include working on our RESTful API, flash reporting pipeline, enterprise integrations, and intranet site.   This position reports directly to the Chief Information Officer.


We support several different electronic medical records applications based on MS Windows and SQL Server for our practices and reporting.   In addition we rely on an open source, Linux-based stack for internal development that includes Elixir and Phoenix, Postgres, Docker, and continuous integration via Team City.  We have servers on premises, collocated, as well as on AWS.  The ideal candidate for this position is a great developer who is also comfortable writing and optimizing SQL.

jobs.title: Vice President of Product
jobs.content:
• Be our Yoda of product management, providing wisdom, vision and guidance to the team.

  • Serve as Mission Control to make sure all teams are working together and executing the same strategy.

  • Champion our customers’ needs. Drive continuous improvement and innovation.

  • Collaborate with the President, CTO, and Engineering team to bring our product to life.

  • Bring new tools and approaches to the company to keep our product development on the leading edge.

jobs.title: Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a


Big Data Engineer (m/f)


YOU will …



  • work on extending our Hadoop-based Big Data infrastructure into the Petabyte region.

  • extend our real-time stream-processing capabilities as new data comes in.

  • help make the enormous amounts of data accessible to our machine learning team for ad-hoc queries.

  • implement batch jobs from scratch and optimize existing ones.

  • always adopt the latest technologies from the Hadoop ecosystem.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a

                                  Software Engineer (Java/Scala) (m/f)



YOU will …



  • be part of our experienced and inspiring development team.

  • develop sophisticated solutions for our bidding stack that handles hundreds of thousands of requests per second.

  • drive your software from design through implementation into operations.

  • take responsibility for the stability and scalability of our platform.

  • work in direct cooperation with our CTO.

  • interact with our international technology Partners.

jobs.title: Junior Manager Supply Chain Integration
jobs.content:
YOUR CHALLENGES:
  • You will work cross-functionally with external and internal stakeholders on defined milestones to ensure the on-time handover of products to our forwarders
  • You will use the Operations KPI framework to identify external partners in need of extra training and support to ensure the highest level of service and partnership
  • You will set up a comprehensive exception monitoring and coordinate pro-actively with the involved teams in case of delays
  • You will initiate process improvements together with cross functional departments.
  • You will internally discuss with Product Teams to discuss internally about SCM Topics during regular meetings.
  • Finally you will track and trace defined launch articles from PO placement until warehouse availability




In this challenging position you will be responsible to provide transparency on the status of POs at source (in production, quality control, and export clearance) and to increase the predictability of our finished goods deliveries. It is your task to provide ad hoc status information on focus products.

YOUR PROFILE:
  • You are proud of a university degree in Business or Economics with a focus on logistics and Supply Chain Management
  • Alternatively, you have finished your apprenticeship with a main focus on business and logistics and gained 1-3 years of work experience in the field of Supply Chain Management
  • You possess strong analytical skills and are a proficient user of Microsoft Excel and ERP
  • You have a strong service mentality und you are solution orientated
  • You are proactive and react easily and quickly to changes
  • You work well in a team environment and have a precise working method
  • You are fluent in English


WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT:

Ours is one of the most spectacularly successful stories in e-commerce. But we mostly prefer to concentrate on writing the next chapter. When you join us, you can not only expect to become part of an extraordinary and ambitious team, but a whole lot more:
  • Zalando offers you a fast moving and agile working environment where you'll never face boredom
  • A highly motivated international team of colleagues who will both inspire and support you
  • Training and further development opportunities to expand your skills and help you on your way
  • Our corporate culture allows us to make judgments based on your work results, not on the way you look - our motto: wear sneakers, not ties
  • Attractive employee discounts in our online shop



Want to join us?

Then we'd be more than happy to receive your application!

Any further queries? Please do not hesitate to contact us via email // Jasmin Kmitta via:
