jobs.content: ThomasNet is hiring a Senior Graphic Designer in New York

jobs.title: Senior Front-end Javascript Developer
jobs.content:
Sqore has a young and ambitious IT team focusing on product development. We adopt cutting edge technologies and industry best practice working process. 


As a developer at Sqore you will be a part of building one of the most exciting products in Sweden, working closely with business owners, fellow developers and UX experts to plan and execute product release with the agile team. Everyone is expected to have a good understanding of the full stack and meanwhile being an expert in a specific area.

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Sqore has a young and ambitious IT team focusing on product development. We adopt cutting edge technologies and industry best practice working process. 


As a developer at Sqore you will be a part of building one of the most exciting products in Sweden, working closely with business owners, fellow developers and UX experts to plan and execute product release with the agile team. Everyone is expected to have a good understanding of the full stack and meanwhile being an expert in a specific area.

jobs.title: Quality Engineer
jobs.content:
Would you like to work for a high-tech company that...


… has a global reach and presence in 100+ countries?


… drives innovation in restaurants, shops and at the biggest airports in the world?


… enables ~550 million consumer transactions every single day?


… helped Alan Turing crack the Enigma code back in WW2?


Would you want … ?


… to turn restaurants into a place where you’re being served quickly, get exactly


what you ordered, get great service, be able to provide feedback and pay by using mobiles?



Then join our team and make it happen!


We are looking for experienced and entry level Quality Engineers.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - DevOps
jobs.content:
Title: Software Engineer - DevOps


Req: 0044664_P0049173


Location: Duluth, GA


Contact: scott.bracewell@ncr.com



About us


We are looking for talented DevOps engineers to join our expanding platform as a service team. Our platform as a service is responsible for providing the foundation for NCR cloud-based products, and includes a variety of features and services similar to those found on Google Cloud Platform and Amazon AWS as well features specific to retailers.



We work with some of the smartest, nicest people you'll meet. People who work here say the problems they work on are enormously challenging, and that the team culture is the most supportive they have seen.



Our primary customers are our fellow engineers, so we have easy access to feedback. We experience the impact our work is having, and we take pride in providing services with great availability and ease of use.  We are adding new features to our platform all the time and this means our services need to be accessible and easy to use.



What is working on this team is like?




    • We own everything about our services from concept through to operations.

    • We ship incrementally and often; once we merge code we normally want to ship it straight away.

    • We own our process and we're free to improve on it.

    • We emphasize quality above all else.

    • We automate everything.




How do you know if you're right for this job?




    • You thrive in a fast paced environment focused on delivering production code at a regular cadence using Agile techniques, tools and methodologies.

    • You have built automation tools and components to aide in installation and provisioning of cloud-based applications in AWS, Azure, or similar cloud providers.

    • You have helped to operationalize applications to ensure horizontal scalability and high fault tolerance.

    • You understand the value of continuous delivery and want to help teams release frequently and often to production, with high quality.

    • You have the ability to tackle problems both at the large scale (think hundred-node clusters) and the small scale (think individual atomic locks), and you have experience building high-volume production systems.

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer - build a next generation Open Science plaform
jobs.content:
Elsevier is in the midst of a transformation. Technology is simultaneously at the forefront and the driving force. Our innovative platforms and smart content solutions operate at the cutting edge of big data, semantic web and cloud technology, enabling faster and more effective critical decision-making daily across the globe. 


Our goal is to organize knowledge sharing amongst researchers in order to speed up discoveries through better access to Scientific Content and Research. We’re enabling researchers to share their experimental data in real-time and in a secure manner and so promoting collaboration between scientists globally.


This innovative service is based on a new acquisition to the Elsevier portfolio in Hivebench the powerful Laboratory Assistant within a cloud computing platform which ensures protection, ownership and controlled distribution of results.   Our ambition is to become a major player in the “Open Science” (Open Source for Science) and to provide tools with very high added value for our customers.


About us:



  • We are committed to building cohesive teams where communication, support and innovation thrive. Instead of taking a top-down approach to new ideas, all members of the team are empowered to contribute. Great ideas can come from anywhere!

  • We’re a truly global company. We are expanding our capabilities and offer a stimulating environment, enabling bright, passionate people to do their best work.

  • You will be working in a modern and spacious new building, constructed with the sole purpose of encouraging creativity and collaboration.

  • Computer Science degree

  • Extensive experience developing with Javascript

  • Experience building dynamic web-apps

  • Demonstrable experience designing and developing web applications including experience using Full Stack JavaScript

  • Experience working with both backend (Node.JS, Express.JS, MongoDB, etc.) and frontend (Angular.JS, Ember.JS, React.JS, etc.) or Meteor.JS

  • Broad industry knowledge - comfortable with concepts like REST, Behavior Driven Development (BDD) and tools like Heroku, and Amazon Web Services

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, especially the ability to explain complex technical subjects to a non-technical audience

  • Demonstrable experience to provide direction and leadership for a team of engineers

  • Preference to have experience with in-house app deployment (Docker, vagrant, virtual machine environment...)

  • Be an active contributor to Open Source projects on GitHub and/or Stackoverflow


About you:


You’re an expert and passionate about what you do!  You’ll use your extraordinary attention to detail to drive your projects to succeed at the highest level of quality and always look at improving your knowledge.  Things move quickly so you’ll be able to work under pressure and be comfortable with a fast-paced technical environment with changing priorities. You can deliver on short term objectives in an agile environment (Scrumban) without forgetting the bigger longer term goal.   


You will be joining a new Agile team in London where you will support the growth and development of a small and dedicated team and there is the potential in time for this role to take on lead responsibilities for this group to enable the evolution of Hivebench within the Elsevier portfolio.

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.content:
Odyssey is looking for data scientists to join our growing team.  Data scientists at Odyssey will have freedom to take on those tasks that they find most meaningful and think will have the largest impact on the product.  The organizational structure of the data science team  at Odyssey is designed so that you’ll always know what your goals are, but you won’t be bogged down with unnecessary overhead.  Essentially, we try to minimize meetings and deadlines, and maximize the time spent doing stuff that is fun and helpful.  Our stack is still being developed and will be influenced as much by the business demands as by the skills that each team member brings.


Our Stack



  • Programming languages:  Python (Anaconda)

  • Dev Environment: Linux inside of a Vagrant box



  • Data-layer: Azure Blob Storage, Azure Table Storage, SQL Server

  • Infrastructure: Azure Resource Manager


What we expect of you



  • A background in analysis, statistics, or machine learning.  Note that our current team includes a former biochemist, a former aerospace engineer, and a former astronomer.

  • Execute SQL queries

  • Solid familiarity with Python

  • Ability to communicate analyses in a way that an editor or sales account manager can understand


Bonus points if...



  • you’ve used natural language processing tool before (e.g NLTK).

  • you are interested or experienced in topic modeling

  • you enjoy using platforms such as Google Analytics and Facebook Graph API to watch for traffic patterns for our 30M+ unique monthly visitors.

  • you are familiar with Azure services

  • you’ve been involved with news, journalism, advertising, or social media.

  • have a professional portfolio to show us

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Odyssey is looking for talented software engineers to join our growing team. Projects focus on our redesigned website (theodysseyonline.com), and we are hiring for a wide variety of positions. Engineers have freedom to take on what tasks they find most meaningful and valuable. Development is focused on front-end web development, back-end APIs for data retrieval, tools for empowering writers in the editorial process, advertising, content personalization for readers, and any analytics that facilitate the product or our knowledge of the product. As a Software Engineer - Ads, you will work closely with the AdOps team to integrate  in-house and third party advertisements into our website to create the best user experience possible.


We operate in a pseudo-agile manner. And no, that doesn’t mean "waterfall" with stand-ups. It is more of a mix of Scrum and Kanban. Engineers work autonomously. The majority of your work will come from the product roadmap; however, we do empower engineers to allocate a portion of their time to work on what they think is best. We try to minimize meetings and deadlines, and maximize the time spent doing stuff that is fun.


Our Stack



  • Front-end: React, Redux, Webpack, ES6

  • Back-end: Node, Express

  • Data-layer: Azure Blob Storage, Azure Table Storage, SQL Server

  • Infrastructure: Azure Resource Manager, Linux (Ubuntu), a Raspberry Pi**


What we expect of you



  • Knowledge of at least one web MVC framework, preferably React.

  • Vanilla Javascript and ES5/ES6/ES7.

  • Interest or passion for integrating advertisements into websites that need to remain performant.

  • Great communication skills -- you will be working closely with AdOps every day!

  • Passion to learn as much as you can. You will need to be able to understand the inner workings of our React application and the GTM scripts and how they work together.


Bonus points if you...



  • Know your way around DoubleClick for Publishers, Google Publisher Tags, and Google Tag Manager.

  • Can do a little Python or have an interest in data science or machine learning. We value cross-functional team members who can lend a hand to our data scientists.

  • Have an interest in usability, accessibility, or design. We want engineers who can bring the UX team’s designs to life, with cool animations and performant design.

  • Enjoy optimizing developer experience or server infrastructure. Our DevOps guy doesn’t mind a little help, as long as you keep it simple and don’t break anything.

  • Like platforms such as Google Analytics, watching traffic patterns for our 30M+ unique monthly visitors.

  • Have touched Azure, Redis, Docker, Kubernetes, or been involved with news, journalism, advertising, or social media.

  • Know all the things. Or at least some of the things.

  • Prefer Vim over Emacs.***


** Disclaimer: A joke.


*** Disclaimer: Not a joke.

jobs.title: UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
Our design department is currently seeking an experienced UI/UX Designer to join our growing team. You will work closely with the design director, designers, developers, and project managers to lead the user experience and design of great products.

We are looking for an individual who has the desire to drive change and improve processes that help us solve problems. You will make a direct impact on a variety of interesting projects. We embrace big picture thinkers who also enjoy the finer details of day-to-day activities. You will be given the opportunity to apply your abilities to meaningful work. If you’re the type of person who says, “I have a better way to do this.” we want to hear it. Join our team and excel in a unique environment of talented people creating awesome things.

WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR IN YOUR ROLE...

  • Creation of user flows, site maps, content hierarchies, and detailed wireframes.
  • High fidelity screen designs for apps, products, and responsive (device agnostic) screen layouts for desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
  • Creation of supporting artifacts to facilitate communication including presentations, UI kits, style tiles, style guides, and supporting graphic assets for developers.

A SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL BE...

  • Perceptive, patient, and hardworking
  • Positive
  • Adaptive to progress
  • Open minded when listening to feedback
  • Interested in collaboration
  • Creative and skilled in their visual design abilities
  • Effective at implementing solutions to solve complex problems
  • Someone who thinks in systems and patterns
  • Confident when communicating to co-workers and clients
  • Self motivated and driven to motivate others
  • Productive within a fast paced environment
  • Proficient with design and wireframing tools
  • Mindful of organization, margins, spacing, and consistency in their work
  • Sensitive to long term project goals and business objectives
  • Considerate of budgets, timelines, deadlines, and external constraints

YOUR EXPERIENCE SHOULD INCLUDE...

  • 5+ years working as a UI/UX designer or similar role at an agency or in-house at a digital product company.
  • Process Knowledge - Understanding of design thinking and its usage to identify project goals. Familiarity with lean UX methodology.
  • UX Design - Examples that showcase your ability to solve complex problems and visually communicate your solutions through information architecture, wireframes, and prototyping.
  • UI Design -Industry leading visual design utilizing style guides, UI kits, and high fidelity screens for websites, mobile applications, and digital products.
  • Communication & Collaboration - Proven experience working successfully within a collaborative environment on challenging projects.
  • Development Familiarity - Effective launch of a responsive product and a firm grasp of how designs are implemented into content management systems like WordPress, Drupal, and Magento.

YOUR BENEFITS WILL INCLUDE...

  • Amazing office space in Fishtown, flex vacation time, paid trips to national and regional industry events and conferences, paid training, speaking opportunities, summer hours, company happy hours, casual office dress code, monthly one-to-one employee growth meetings, lunch and learns, sponsored networking events, employee referral program, company holidays and half-days, quiet rooms, annual holiday party, peer-to-peer recognition, annual non-profit participation, neighborhood outreach events, your own personal theme music, and more...
  • Medical coverage including vision, dental coverage, short term disability, long term disability, life insurance plan, 401k with company match

O3 specializes in digital product design and development, from conceptualization through implementation and support. We work with businesses as their strategic partner to provide long-term digital solutions through web, mobile, e-commerce, and application development. With offices in Philadelphia, we’ve emphasized a balanced approach to design, innovative technological solutions, and an award-winning agency culture.

We believe in a balanced environment, where positivity, hard work and happy hours coexist. While much of our time is spent at our desks, at whiteboards, or in meetings, we've created a culture that makes the outside world an integral part of our daily working routines. The challenging, progressive work we do keeps us energized and exhilarated, while our culture keeps us grounded, puts things in perspective, and makes us better at what we do. But most of all, it makes us a team.

Philly is a great place to live and work, and we may be able to assist with relocation expenses for the right candidate applying outside the city. However, you must be able to legally work in the US. Recruiters and staffing companies NEED NOT contact us.

Please submit a copy of your resume and relevant work samples that will help expand our understanding of your creative process. Links to your work and/or portfolio are required. Links to your LinkedIn, Twitter accounts, or anything else you feel will help us get to know you better are also appreciated.

O3 is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). We look forward to meeting with you.

jobs.title: Senior Web Engineer
jobs.content:
Who We Are


Our mission is to invent the future of farming. We're transforming the oldest and most important industry in the world from “gut instinct” to data science. Our platform already exposes critical operational data insights to over 1 in 3 U.S. farms and our users absolutely love us.


Who You Are


You have built and helped maintain large scale front-end web applications before. You don't just code, you conquer challenges. You understand how to work with other developers toward dissecting complex technical problems and quickly delivering elegant solutions. You've learned through experience that complex problems can have simple solutions. You understand and perform well in fast-paced, dynamic environments. The thought of being trapped in a big company where you can't make huge individual contributions terrifies you.


About the Role


As a critical member of our small but effective front-end team, you will be bringing fresh ideas to the table while also improving existing features that our users already love. We use modern single page web architecture and you'll be expected to keep up with much more than just html and jQuery.


Tasks You’ll Be Juggling



  • Wrangling the complexities of web architecture by architecting a robust, high performing, and maintainable codebase

  • Efficiently translating user design requirements into code that ships

  • Understanding how to build and help maintain large scale front-end applications

  • Your success in this role will be measured by FarmLogs' ability to achieve its strategic objectives, your ability to play a serious role in that success, and your fit within our fast-paced result-driven culture

jobs.title: Senior Interactive/ UX Designer
jobs.content: Lennar Corporation is hiring a Senior Interactive/ UX Designer in Houston, TX

jobs.title: Mid Level Java Developer
jobs.content:
Join a team that has shaped the web presence of high-profile initiatives for clients like the NFL, the U.S. Census Bureau, and the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.



Reingold, a full-service marketing and communications firm in the Del Ray neighborhood of Alexandria, Virginia, offers an outstanding opportunity for a creative and resourceful midlevel Java developer.



In this full-time position, the midlevel Java developer will be part of a team of web design and development, user experience (UX), information architecture (IA), and search engine optimization (SEO) professionals. The position will be integral to creating dynamic applications and websites for a variety of clients.



The successful candidate will demonstrate working knowledge of the Java development life cycle and will have proven experience designing, configuring, testing, implementing, and maintaining web-based applications, online portals, and internet marketing technologies. Our work demands a self-starter with the ability to hit the ground running.



Required qualifications and skills include:




  • Strong client-side development skills using JavaScript and jQuery

  • Experience building and integrating CMS-based websites in Java

  • Experience configuring and deploying Linux-based websites with Apache

  • Practical experience with Apache Struts

  • Strong knowledge of SQL and relational databases

  • Experience with one or more of the following: MySQL, MongoDB, or PostgreSQL



While not required, preferred skills include:




  • Experience programming and developing with Jive or a similar platform

  • Experience developing with Angular

  • Experience with Apache Sling



At Reingold, no one works in a box. We nurture and leverage individual talents and encourage our web developers and designers to continually learn and grow. We offer creative freedom, a collaborative and supportive (and fun!) work environment, and an infinite variety of challenging assignments. Each one of our gifted developers and designers contributes unique experience and fresh perspective to help fulfill our clients’ needs.



To apply, send a cover letter, resume with salary requirements, and online portfolio by email to hr@reingold.com or by fax to 703.299.2424. No phone calls, please. Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer; Veterans are encouraged to apply.

jobs.title: Sr. IBM Infosphere Developer
jobs.content:
Senior IBM Infosphere Developer


 Are you looking to launch your Information Technology career?  If so, then UPS is the place for you!


 UPS is now recognized as a technology company spending more than $1 billion a year on information technology. UPS provides its customers unparalleled capability in tracking and distribution intelligence.  This technological infrastructure also enables UPS to provide fully integrated Web-enabled, business-to-business solutions.


 UPS Information Services, a leader in information technology, is currently seeking career-minded individuals to join our team.  If you are highly motivated with a degree in Computer Science or related discipline, then UPS is a great place for you to advance your career.


 Job Description:


 The Senior Applications Developer provides input and support for, and performs full systems life cycle management activities (e.g., analyses, technical requirements, design, coding, testing, implementation of systems and applications software, etc.).  He/She participates in component and data architecture design, technology planning, and testing for Applications Development (AD) initiatives to meet business requirements. This position provides input to applications development project plans and integrations.  He/She collaborates with teams and supports emerging technologies to ensure effective communication and achievement of objectives. This position provides knowledge and support for applications development, integration, and maintenance. He/She provides input to department and project teams on decisions supporting projects.


 The Senior Applications Developer will implement and support the Master Data Management platform. This role will be instrumental in implementing solutions to reduce administrative time by enabling easier access to data, improve ease of use, enable better forecasting, and systematically support the optimized selling processes that lead to improved business results.


 Responsibilities:


Contributes to I.S. Projects



  • Conducts systems and requirements analyses to identify project action items.

  • Creates task lists and cost and time estimates to support project plan development.

  • Performs assigned functions and tasks to meet project plan and quality review requirements.

  • Records, updates, monitors, and determines solutions for project deviations to ensure effective resolutions.

  • Reviews project team accomplishments to assist with peer development and to provide project updates for management and customers.

  • Reviews and compiles project issues to support effective resolutions.

  • Monitors project activities to ensure I.S. governance, standards, and policies compliance.


Performs System Analysis and Design 



  • Participates in defining and developing technical specifications to meet systems’ requirements.

  • Analyzes and translates logical designs to create physical designs.

  • Assesses detailed designs and documentation to ensure alignment with business requirements.

  • Defines interfaces among systems components to ensure interoperability.

  • Creates and reviews interface agreements to ensure proper transfer of information between systems.

  • Evaluates vendor technologies to recommend potential products for use.

  • Leads peer reviews to ensure requirements are met.


Designs and Develops Moderate to Highly Complex Applications



  • Analyzes, designs, codes, tests, corrects, and documents moderate to highly complex programs to ensure optimal performance and compliance.

  • Reviews and understands specifications to achieve coding tasks.

  • Reviews, analyzes, and refines requirements and specifications to ensure quality.

  • Records and updates defects log to ensure thorough and accurate documentation.


Develops Application Documentation



  • Develops and maintains system documentation to ensure accuracy and consistency.

  • Creates unit test plans and reviews documented results to ensure requirements are met.

  • Creates technical documentation in compliance with UPS Software Development Lifecycle to communicate and update project teams and stakeholders.


Produces Integration Builds



  • Defines and produces integration builds to create applications.

  • Performs build processes to produce software and to prepare application for delivery.

  • Produces integration test specifications to conduct tests, record failures, and conduct fault diagnoses.


Performs Maintenance and Support



  • Defines and administers procedures to monitor systems performance and integrity.

  • Performs applications maintenance and support functions to support problem resolution.

  • Documents maintenance and support activities to ensure quality control.

  • Performs business continuity and disaster recovery activities to ensure availability requirements are met.

  • Provides maintenance and support modifications to developers, users, and external groups to communicate updates.

  • Observes and evaluates the systems usage by users to improve applications quality and effectiveness.

  • Records and updates defect logs to monitor system reliability.

  • Designs, creates, develops, customizes, and maintains training content to enhance quality of support.


Supports Emerging Technologies and Products



  • Monitors the industry to gain knowledge and understanding of emerging technologies.

  • Identifies new and emerging hardware and software technologies and products to maintain industry competitiveness.

  • Determines relevance and potential value of new technologies to support business objectives and strategyPerforms build processes to produce software and to prepare application for delivery.

  • Produces integration test specifications to conduct tests, record failures, and conduct fault diagnoses.


Education:



  • The desired Senior Applications Developer will possess a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field or the equivalent in education and work experience.  A degree is preferred.

jobs.title: Applications Architect
jobs.content:
Applications Architect

Are you looking to launch your Information Technology career?  If so, then UPS is the place for you!

UPS is now recognized as a technology company spending more than $1 billion a year on information technology. UPS provides its customers unparalleled capability in tracking and distribution intelligence.  This technological infrastructure also enables UPS to provide fully integrated Web-enabled, business-to-business solutions.

UPS Information Services, a leader in information technology, is currently seeking career-minded individuals to join our team.  If you are highly motivated with a degree in Computer Science or related discipline, then UPS is a great place for you to advance your career.

Job Description:


The Applications Architect influences the development and implementation of Information Services (I.S.) strategy, initiatives, and governing policies. He/She conceives solutions, builds consensus, and sells and executes solutions across business areas. This position assists in defining the direction for projects and solution architecture.


The Applications Architect supports I.S. leadership by planning and championing the execution of broad initiatives aimed at delivering value to internal and external stakeholders. He/She leverages data, technical, and business knowledge to drive the development of technical frameworks and solutions at portfolio and enterprise levels. This position is involved throughout the project life cycle with emphasis on the initiation, feasibility, and analysis phases. He/She must have foundation architecture knowledge, strategic thinking, strong written and oral communication skills. He/She must have be familiar with information analysis and solution generation. He/She must have knowledge of information security and solutions, and knowledge of emerging technology database design principles and of system hardware.


Responsibilities:


Provides Input to Architecture Strategy and Initiatives



  • Contributes to the development and review of the systems capability strategy to meet business requirements.

  • Provides guidance and information to support consistency of vision with business objectives.

  • Researches business capabilities to ensure effective incorporation of new technologies.

  • Develops and evaluates innovative ideas to assess value added, impact, risks, challenges, opportunities, and benefits for the organization.


Provides Leadership for Technical Initiatives



  • Leads complex technical project reviews to assess deliverables.

  • Assists in technical plan preparations to meet business needs.

  • Assists and collaborates with cross-functional teams to prepare technical resource plans.

  • Identifies, assesses, and manages risks to ensure successful achievement of project deliverables.

  • Evaluates requirements to perform impact analyses and to specify effective business processes.

  • Identifies alternative solutions, assesses feasibility, and recommends new approaches to ensure optimal performance and to meet business needs.


Guides Applications Architecture and Systems Design



  • Serves as the lead technical resource to provide strategic oversight and planning of strategic portfolio initiatives to ensure proper architectural aspects.

  • Manages the roadmaps for key portfolio assets to ensure systems will scale and evolve in meeting future business needs.

  • Reviews and recommends changes for systems to meet business needs and to align with enterprise architecture strategies.

  • Develops and reviews applications designs and technical approaches to ensure systems and processes align with I.S. strategy.

  • Provides guidance as a subject matter expert on application and integration architecture to support the development of complex systems.

  • Analyzes business processes and systems to rationalize the technical approach and to improve aspects of information systems.

  • Provides guidance on applications designs and integrations to ensure strategies, roadmaps, policies, standards, and practices are properly applied.

  • Leads development and adoption of core application building blocks and processing and integration patterns to increase productivity, improve customer service, and strengthen competitive advantage.


Provides Guidance for Architecture Solutions



  • Produces detailed component specifications to support systems designs.

  • Creates designs of candidate architecture to ensure accuracy and fulfillment of requirements.

  • Assists in preparing and implementing plans to execute business and technical initiatives.

  • Provides technical guidance to support systems development and integration and to enable the timely delivery of I.S. solutions.

  • Recommends technical strategies, roadmaps, policies, standards, and practices to ensure consistency and compliance.


Education:


The desired Applications Architect will possess Bachelors’ and Masters’ degrees in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field, or a current UPS employee with a minimum of three years of UPS experience.

jobs.title: I.T. Staff Auditor
jobs.content:
IT Staff Auditor II 


Are you looking to launch your Information Technology career? If so, then UPS is the place for you!

Once known as a trucking company. UPS is now recognized as a technology company with trucks and is poised for success. Spending more than $1 billion a year on information technology, UPS provides its customers unparalleled capability in tracking and distribution intelligence. This technological infrastructure also enables UPS to provide fully integrated Web-enabled, business-to-business solutions.

UPS Information Services, a leader in information technology, is currently seeking career-minded individuals to join our team. If you are highly motivated with a degree in Computer Science or related discipline, then UPS is a great place for you to start your career.

Job Description: 

Supports UPS’ strategic objectives through auditing, monitoring, documenting, and reporting on internal IT business processes, policies, and procedures to improve internal controls and minimize risk. 


Principal Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Tests General Computer Controls (e.g.., logical security and program change control for operating system, database, application and network environments, computer operations, and datacenter physical security), as well as business cycle controls and IT application testing. The testing is performed for Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) as well as risk based audits.

  • Develops audit test steps or programs to ensure control areas provide comprehensive coverage.

  • Schedule and conduct informational interviews with auditees for familiarization, process walkthrough, and key control identification purposes.

  • Gathers and analyzes test populations to validate the adequacy of information provided.

  • Selects and evaluates data sampling to ensure proper selection and statistical representation based on risk ratings.

  • Performs medium to high complexity audit testing to evaluate the effectiveness of IT, business, and regulatory control functions.

  • Completes audit administrative tasks and works on special requests to meet project objectives. 

  • Identifies IT control weaknesses, process gaps and non-compliance exceptions during audit testing.

  • Prepares comprehensive, well-written audit work papers documenting the test steps performed, audit results, and recommendations. 

  • Develops and communicates preliminary findings to provide information to Internal Audit Management and auditees prior to formal review and closing meetings.

  • Participates in the resolution of disputed audit findings.

  • Demonstrates effective communication skills (oral, report writing and presentation).

  • Collaborates and works in a team-oriented work environment.

  • Identifies and communicates potential areas for audit process improvements or innovation to ensure efficient auditing methods.

  • Independently complete audit work assignments with minimal supervisory oversight.

  • Recommends improvements in policies, procedures, processes, operations and systems across UPS.

  • Identifies technology and control risks within each area.


Education:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Information Technology, additional education a plus. Professional certification preferred (e.g., CISA, CIA, CISSP, CPA, CFE), additional certifications a plus.

jobs.title: NLP/Software Engineering Consultant
jobs.content: We are looking for an experienced NLP software engineer, ideally with background in medical NLP - SNOMED, UMLS, cTAKES, etc.  The goal of this 3-9 month contract position will be two-fold: to build a prototype NLP pipeline for transforming a document corpus into a meaning vector set, and to generalize this pipeline for repeat use.  Working remotely is ok, though we do have a slight preference for contractors in the general Boston area.

jobs.title: C# Full-Stack Developer @ CaptiveAire Systems
jobs.content:
The following job description is available in the following location:


Raleigh, NC  Corporate Headquarters

Relocation assistance can be provided.


This position is not available for telecommuting.


CaptiveAire values its software developers highly and offers them immense opportunities for freedom and creativity while not having overbearing management.  We value very highly our work environment and provide the absolute best in terms of equipment.  Our corporate offices are a developer's dream with private offices and modern, recently renovated spaces.


This position is for our hardware monitoring and control suite of applications and websites.  The suite of applications consists of more than one SPA web application as well as numerous Windows Services deployed across numerous servers.  Our main technology stack for this application is C# with RabbitMQ for messaging, MongoDB and SQL Server for data storage, Redis for caching and global application control and synchronization, as well as other tools such as Seq logging platform and a heavy internal NuGet environment.  This is a large platform that continues to evolve.


When interviewing, you should be comfortable and able to sit and have a casual conversation with other senior-level developers about topics such as Dependency Injection, class hierarchies including inheritance, polymorphic stacks, interfaces vs. abstract classes, basic and advanced questions concerning day-to-day use of Visual Studio, web-based technologies such as AngularJS, TypeScript, SignalR, and a host of others.  You will be expected to participate in whiteboard discussions and give code examples during the course of the interview.


For overall project management, we use an internally-hosted instance of YouTrack as well as Confluence for documentation efforts.  For Continuous Integration, we use TeamCity and internally-hosted NuGet packages to help better manage our software builds, dependencies, and deployments.  We are also using OctopusDeploy for most all software deployments to staging and production environments.  95% of our source code is hosted in an on-premise GitHub Enterprise instance.


A full-stack developer is desired for this position as workloads will vary from client-side browser development to server-side and database integrations to possible assistance with our new Azure services as well.


As a developer, you will also have an opportunity to contribute to CaptiveAire's growing list of open source projects hosted on Github.


https://github.com/CaptiveAire

jobs.title: Senior Middleware Application Developer - Java
jobs.content:
Business Overview: TS International Technology is a global technology organization that is responsible for the systems processing for international Treasury Services branches in EMEA, Asia & LATAM. The team is responsible for Low and High Value payments, DDA, and local clearing links for these branches as well as a number of global utilities, SWIFT and OFAC. The team is based in Bournemouth, Mumbai, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tampa and San Paulo.


CIB Technology - International Account Services (IAS) The IAS Technology group are responsible for developing and implementing banking software for the International Demand Deposit Accounting (iDDA) platform.  International DDA holds all cash accounts needed for banking products including core cash accounting, liquidity products and statement processing.   The application is developed on T24 banking software that provides Online Transaction Processing (OLTP) across 90+ branches across the globe.  The group has multi-phased software development programmes running concurrently throughout the year.   


The group are located in Bournemouth-UK, Bangalore-India and Mumbai-India.


Team Description The successful candidate will form part of a team comprising a mix of JPMorgan staff based in Bournemouth. The role will have a need to closely liaise with the Architecture, Project Delivery, Quality Assurance and Technology Infrastructure groups throughout the various stages of development and implementation lifecycle. Building a successful working relationship with key parties is crucial in this role. RAISe is a high performance real-time middleware platform implemented using Java and providing an integration layer for the tier 1 Demand Deposit Accounting application.


Key responsibilities: 



  • Applicants are sought for an Application Development role within the iDDA Middleware AD team. Application Delivery has ownership of infrastructure build, application design and development, system testing, change control, deployment and implementation of the final solution.

  • The role will encompass a multitude of activities ranging from design and development of the Java application, execution of system & performance testing, and support of subsequent testing lifecycles to implementation of packages.

  • Participation in the out-of-hours support callout rota, providing production support cover.

jobs.title: New Role! Business Data Developer / Engineer
jobs.content:

Job Description: The Business Data Developer is a critical new role designed to accelerate the impact our robust database and analytical infrastructure has on the Asset Management Team’s investment decision-making processes. This team member will work closely with the core of the Asset Management team in:



  • Streamlining data integration between databases and data warehouses, transforming data from external data providers, and development of custom data management tools for use by the Investment Analysts

  • Developing new and enhanced reporting and analytical capabilities for the Asset Management Team

  • Highly proficient with Microsoft SQL Server 2014, including data extraction, T-SQL, SSAS, SSRS, SSIS, stored procedures, performance tuning, and data warehousing 

  • Experience with Visual Basic for Applications , Bloomberg API, and other financial data interfaces

  • Expertise in web application development using Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 ASP.NET and C#, WCF and web services

  • Prior experience designing and building web application user interfaces leveraging HTML5 and CSS3

jobs.title: Full-stack Java Web Developer
jobs.content:
You are a full-stack web and Java developer, equally comfortable in server side Java as in your browser's developer tools.  You have a strong 'traditional' computer science and web development foundation, but are increasingly excited about the way the Web is evolving and the power that frameworks like Ember and React are bringing to client side development. You are looking for an opportunity be part of Web's transformation, and to be surrounded by people who are passionate about building fluid modern,, responsive (or adaptive!) and engaging user experiences for the browser!


This is an excellent opportunity that will provide you with a platform to really impact our business; you’ll make sure that best practices are followed and you’ll shape the strategy for delivering a major project for our client.


Key Experiences



  • A web developer at heart – excited about modern web development

  • Personable, enthusiastic, a strong communicator, and are detail oriented.

  • Computer Science degree or equivalent, with strong CS and development fundamentals, including OOP

  • Min. 3+ years Web Development experience

  • Min. 3+ years full-stack development experience

  • Single Page Applications such as Angular, Knockout and React

  • Experience with Web Content Management Systems(Hippo CMS preferred)

  • Experience as a consultant (working w. external clients) preferred

  • Nice to haves: experience in testing frameworks (Selenium, Cucumber, Sonar Qube), knowledge of Adobe Life Cycle and Adobe DRM, experience with MongoDB, familiarity with User Experience best practices

jobs.title: Sr. J2EE Developer
jobs.content:
Senior J2EE Applications Developer


Are you looking to advance your Information Technology career?  If so, then UPS is the place for you!


UPS is now recognized as a technology company spending more than $1 billion a year on information technology. UPS provides its customers unparalleled capability in tracking and distribution intelligence.  This technological infrastructure also enables UPS to provide fully integrated Web-enabled, business-to-business solutions.

UPS Information Services, a leader in information technology, is currently seeking career-minded individuals to join our team.  If you are highly motivated with a degree in Computer Science or related discipline, then UPS is a great place for you to advance your career.


Job Description:


The Senior Applications Developer provides input and support for, and performs full systems life cycle management activities (e.g., analyses, technical requirements, design, coding, testing, implementation of systems and applications software, etc.).  He/She participates in component and data architecture design, technology planning, and testing for Applications Development (AD) initiatives to meet business requirements. This position provides input to applications development project plans and integrations.  He/She collaborates with teams and supports emerging technologies to ensure effective communication and achievement of objectives. This position provides knowledge and support for applications development, integration, and maintenance. He/She provides input to department and project teams on decisions supporting projects.


This position requires server side UI development for a web based J2EE application. The application is based on a Spring framework with a SQL Server database hosted on a Weblogic application server. The candidate requires experience with J2EE development with JSP, Javascript and HTML web development, and experienced with EXT-JS. The candidate also requires experience with developing web services, use of messaging technologies and Hibernate for data storage and retrieval. The primary responsibilities include the creation of design documentation, software development and unit testing, integration testing with other developers. The candidate must have good verbal and written communication skills to be able to understand and convey technical solutions with other developers; the ability to plan and prioritize personal tasks to meet project deadlines; a working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and Powerpoint) and Visio.


Responsibilities:


Contributes to I.S. Projects



  • Conducts systems and requirements analyses to identify project action items.

  • Creates task lists and cost and time estimates to support project plan development.

  • Performs assigned functions and tasks to meet project plan and quality review requirements.

  • Records, updates, monitors, and determines solutions for project deviations to ensure effective resolutions.

  • Reviews project team accomplishments to assist with peer development and to provide project updates for management and customers.

  • Reviews and compiles project issues to support effective resolutions.

  • Monitors project activities to ensure I.S. governance, standards, and policies compliance.


Performs System Analysis and Design



  • Participates in defining and developing technical specifications to meet systems’ requirements.

  • Analyzes and translates logical designs to create physical designs.

  • Assesses detailed designs and documentation to ensure alignment with business requirements.

  • Defines interfaces among systems components to ensure interoperability.

  • Creates and reviews interface agreements to ensure proper transfer of information between systems.

  • Evaluates vendor technologies to recommend potential products for use.

  • Leads peer reviews to ensure requirements are met.


Designs and Develops Moderate to Highly Complex Applications



  • Analyzes, designs, codes, tests, corrects, and documents moderate to highly complex programs to ensure optimal performance and compliance.

  • Reviews and understands specifications to achieve coding tasks.

  • Reviews, analyzes, and refines requirements and specifications to ensure quality.

  • Records and updates defects log to ensure thorough and accurate documentation.


Develops Application Documentation



  • Develops and maintains system documentation to ensure accuracy and consistency.

  • Creates unit test plans and reviews documented results to ensure requirements are met.

  • Creates technical documentation in compliance with UPS Software Development Lifecycle to communicate and update project teams and stakeholders.


Produces Integration Builds



  • Defines and produces integration builds to create applications.

  • Performs build processes to produce software and to prepare application for delivery.

  • Produces integration test specifications to conduct tests, record failures, and conduct fault diagnoses.


Performs Maintenance and Support



  • Defines and administers procedures to monitor systems performance and integrity.

  • Performs applications maintenance and support functions to support problem resolution.

  • Documents maintenance and support activities to ensure quality control.

  • Performs business continuity and disaster recovery activities to ensure availability requirements are met.

  • Provides maintenance and support modifications to developers, users, and external groups to communicate updates.

  • Observes and evaluates the systems usage by users to improve applications quality and effectiveness.

  • Records and updates defect logs to monitor system reliability.

  • Designs, creates, develops, customizes, and maintains training content to enhance quality of support.


Supports Emerging Technologies and Products



  • Monitors the industry to gain knowledge and understanding of emerging technologies.

  • Identifies new and emerging hardware and software technologies and products to maintain industry competitiveness.

  • Determines relevance and potential value of new technologies to support business objectives and strategy.


Education:


The desired Senior Applications Developer will possess Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field or are you a current UPS employee with a minimum of three years of UPS experience.

jobs.title: Sr. UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
Senior UI/UX Designer


Are you looking to broaden your Information Technology career? If so, then UPS is the place for you!


UPS is now recognized as a technology company spending more than $1 billion a year on information technology. UPS provides its customers unparalleled capability in tracking and distribution intelligence. This technological infrastructure also enables UPS to provide fully integrated Web-enabled, business-to-business solutions.


UPS Information Services, a leader in information technology, is currently seeking career-minded individuals to join our team. If you are highly motivated with a degree in Computer Science or related discipline, then UPS is a great place for you to advance your career.


Job Description:


The Sr. UI/UX Designer will prepare the effort needed for the coming UI/UX workload assessed for the EDGE program, mainly to deliver CIPE exceptions and staffing release. We need a senior level designer who has the knowledge to drive the work and help to direct our UI/UX team. 


Details of Position: UI/UX research, analysis, design and usability testing Well-versed in UX Design Process with experience includes but not limited to contextual inquiries, affinity diagrams, survey design & analysis, wireframes, and usability testing. Highly proficient in the UX toolset adopted at UPS, plus others: Axure, and Balsamiq, plus Photoshop and Illustrator Familiar with HTML5 / CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery.


Job Duties:


Contributes to the Elicitation, Analysis, & Communication of UI/UX Needs



  • Participates in and contributes to usability studies and analysis, detailed usability testing, and the development of low and hi fidelity prototypes to ensure optimal user experience.

  • Conducts primary user research (e.g., interviews, surveys, contextual field observations, etc.) to identify issues, determine goals, and contribute to the development of UI/UX solutions.

  • Analyzes UI/UX requirements and customers’ expectations to identify and implement required tasks.

  • Elicits and analyzes moderately complex business problems and opportunities to drive optimal, cost-effective UI/UX solutions.

  • Facilitates collaboration (e.g., stakeholders, team members, customers, etc.) to address issues and ensure common understanding.

  • Works on presentations and documentation to convey UI/UX information to stakeholders and senior management to ensure consistent understanding of problems, opportunities, and solutions.

  • Assists in identifying, anticipating, and mitigating risks and potential issues to prevent project delays.

  • Elicits information and gains consensus from project stakeholders to ensure common goals are established and achieved.

  • Breaks down moderately complex concepts into smaller, comprehensible concepts for analysis to ensure appropriate level of communication and understanding for the project stakeholders.

  • Applies appropriate level of detail, based on the audience and stage of project life cycles, to ensure mapped solutions satisfy business problems and opportunities.


Contributes to User Interactive/User Experience Project Deliverables



  • Contributes to the creation and evaluation of interaction models, user/task flows, screen designs, and UI/UX details to promote ease of use and optimize the user experience.

  • Defines role-based user personas and user activity/communication-flow models to determine the needs and behaviors of various user types.

  • Conducts usability testing (onsite or remote) and socializes results with key stakeholders and developers to ensure usability objectives are based on business needs.

  • Participates in defining and prioritizing design schedules for multiple project initiatives to ensure deliverables to meet project plan requirements on a timely basis.

  • Designs intuitive, engaging design solutions to satisfy various user experiences including websites, product user interfaces and other digital initiatives, and all points in between (i.e., wireframes, flows, mockups and visual prototypes).

  • Identifies and assesses issues to communicate potential risks and impacts.

  • Collaborates with design, architecture and development teams to ensure integration of front-end design to back-end functionality.

  • Works effectively with cross-functional teams to ensure that designs are successfully created and implemented to achieve the user goals.

  • Contributes to task lists and cost and time estimates to support project plan development.

  • Performs assigned functions and tasks to meet project plan and quality review requirements.

  • Records, updates, monitors, and determines solutions for project deviations to ensure effective resolutions.

  • Monitors project activities to ensure I.S. governance, standards, and policies compliance.


Supports Emerging UI/UX Technologies, Techniques, and Trends



  • Monitors the industry to gain knowledge and understanding of emerging technologies.

  • Identifies new and emerging UI/UX design strategies, research techniques, and user trends to maintain industry competitiveness.

  • Determines relevance and potential value of new technologies to support business objectives and strategy.


Generates User Interactive/User Experiences Documentation



  • Creates documentation to communicate and update customers, project teams, and stakeholders during the project lifecycle.

  • Communicates and documents research, analysis, and test results to ensure consistency and accuracy.

  • Collaborates with stakeholders and customers to monitor assignment deviations, establish best practices, and document effective resolutions.

  • Documents newly created interaction models, user/task flows and screen designs to ensure consistency, reusability, and future optimization.


Supports and Maintains Stakeholder Relationships



  • Interacts with stakeholders to clarify project and business needs.

  • Provides customer service to end users to ensure value in products and services.

  • Facilitates collaboration among stakeholders to achieve project goals and objectives.

  • Establishes and maintains customer relationships to maximize products and services benefits.

  • Maintains relationships among stakeholders and technical groups to facilitate technical problem resolution.

  • Prepares reports to provide timely stakeholder updates.


Mentors and Guides Junior Team Members



  • Reviews project team accomplishments to assist with peer development and to provide project updates for management and customers.

  • Assists in identifying learning opportunities for individuals to facilitate skill development and increase knowledge level.

  • Identifies opportunities to involve others in new and challenging work assignments for increasing and advancing skills and capabilities.

  • Listens to employee concerns to understand the situation or issue and advises accordingly to ensure appropriate action is taken.

  • Provides an environment that is interactive, participatory, supportive, and regularly provides constructive feedback to help ensure employee engagement and performance management.


Education:


The desired Sr. UI\UX Designer will possess a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field, or a current UPS employee with a minimum of three years of UPS experience.

jobs.title: Full stack PHP developer
jobs.content:
Work from home, or wherever you like really


We love working remotely, so above all, you need to be comfortable in that environment or be willing to try something new. This means you get to choose where you work, providing you're suitably drenched in wi-fi and in reach of Trello/Slack. We're all about the output, and trust you to do a great job wherever you are.


That said, a lot of the team live in Leicester so you'll be within easy travelling distance of there (for instance, Leicester/Birmingham/Nottingham) as we meet up in person every week or two. We work closely with our customers, so it's likely you'll need to say hello to them in person a couple of times a year too.With great power, comes great responsibility


Attention to detail, clear written skills and the ability to work in a team are essential.


Since we're not usually all in the same room, you absolutely must be able to communicate well, and share progress often. That doesn't mean we interrupt/distract each other though, as we're firm believers in being approachable through asynchronous working.


We'll expect you to be constantly learning and developing your skills, and to be fully involved in sprint planning, retros and daily scrums along with all the developers and our project manager.

jobs.title: BI Developer
jobs.content:
As market leaders, we have high expectations of ourselves – quality, reliability, safety of our products – and strive for continuous improvement. We work with the best, to be the best, and the secret of our success is simple: we keep learning and exploring. We’ve set our eyes on the world – we want to offer our safety software globally, to complex businesses in many industries. Care to join us?


As an integral member of our product team, the Business Intelligence (BI) Developer is responsible for the entire development cycle of our mission-critical enterprise BI solution. Working with cross-functional teams, you will take responsibility not only for design and development of the platform but quality assurance and maintenance as well.


Using your skills and experience as a BI Developer, you will then shape the underlying architecture of our data warehouse according to business needs identified and projected by the Product Manager.


We are looking for BI Developers.


Accountabilities:


As a Business Intelligence Developer within eVision, your accountabilities will include (but not be limited to):



  • Participate in design and analysis of our solutions

  • Assist Product Manager with translating business requirements into product specifications

  • Implement and guard technology best practices, guidelines and development processes

  • Work closely with Chief Architect to ensure seamless integration with our core products

  • Streamline Quality Assurance by automating tests

  • Provide support to eVision Professional Services to ensure the availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal stakeholders

  • Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members and Professional Services teams

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Job Summary:


Design and build new features for our health and safety products


Member of a product development team, working in a very agile way


Own parts of the product, participate in creating vision and coordinate product evolution


Focus on code quality and continuously improve with every next release


You work with:


A product development team composed of software developers, QA engineers, UX Designer and a Product Manager


Professional Services associates who deliver projects to our customers


Your very own team lead, that helps you grow and be effective as a professional


Desired Background, Experience and Education:


2+ years of experience in software development


Good knowledge of, and proven experience with: C#, .NET Framework 4.0+, LINQ


Firm grasp of design patterns and of SOLID, and experience using them in a commercial application


Knowledge of Domain Driven Design, CQRS, Event Sourcing desirable


Good experience with code quality – unit testing, TDD, code review, automated testing concepts and defensive coding are essential


Strong knowledge of continuous integration and deployment;


Knowledge of HTTP and .NET HTTP frameworks – ASP.NET MVC


Knowledge of relational and non-relational data stores – MSSQL (preferred), RavenDB (optional)


Able to understand and write multi-threaded code


Good grasp of both technical and functional characteristics of software products, particularly in terms of scalability, performance, usability and quality


Knowledge of concepts of scripting and automation


Experiences with developing for mobile platforms (Android, iOS) is desirable and a plus


Good communication skills in English, both written and verbal


In possession of a valid European work permit.

jobs.title: Principal Visual Designer

We're seeking an exceptional individual to set and evolve the visual for our designs. A creative leader that can generate and express creative points from concepting all the way to launch. Due to the novelty of both the company and the role, this creative should be very comfortable venturing into the ambiguous and the unknown. As a principal visual designer you will be at the forefront of these efforts and be directly responsible for decisions to form all of our experiences.

Key responsibilities
• Designing unique car experiences
• Exploring and setting the visual language DNA for the car UI: color, iconography, typography, and others
• Leading the creation of a scalable design language
• Creating the correspondent design systems and libraries
• Being an integral part in helping build a world-class design team
• Advising and guiding the IC visual designers
• Not conforming to what has been done in the past
• Being a guardian for craft and taste
• Being a great partner to engineering and product management
• Guiding and supporting other designers
• Being a core member of the design community

Skills and qualifications
• Passionate about user interface design and about creating a profound change in the automotive industry
• Proactive and self-motivated, able to work as a part of a team in a fast-paced environment
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Communication/Interaction Design or similar field
• You have done this before and exceeded any expectation or you have unquestionable evidence you can do this
• Fluent in English - other languages are a plus
• Experience in the Chinese market is a strong benefit, particularly mobile and online consumer behaviours
• An expert in UI design methods such as wireframes, prototypes, scenarios and task flows
• Skilled with digital design tools such as Adobe CS, Sketch etc.
• Comfortable with design research techniques, storytelling and presentation skills as well as knowledgeable in digital lifestyle trends
• Equipped with an advanced graphic design sense for layout, colour and typography

This is what we offer
• Work in a dynamic and inspiring atmosphere among international, talented and driven colleagues
• Possibility to help set up and have an impact on the organization
• Innovation strength and flat hierarchies
• A competitive compensation and benefits package

jobs.title: Backend Developer - Help grow our company and change the world of Parking!
jobs.content:
ParkBee is changing the world of parking, and we need you to help make this change! We’re looking for a backend developer who is up to the challenge of innovating and expanding our technology. Our team is super talented and we are looking for that last piece of the "first generation" family to helplead ParkBee to an international success.  It starts with one of you, today!


ParkBee


Almost every major city is dealing with parking problems; Parking is extremely expensive and it’s very difficult to find a parking spot. However, there are sufficient vacant parking locations, only not accessible for the general use. Think of all the private parking garages of office buildings, right in the city centre that could join the sharing economy. ParkBee is a startup that has developed a smart technology to open up these parking locations to the public. Check us out at www.parkbee.com!


Job Description


The development team is essential to the technology that helps ParkBee stay ahead of the curve. As a backend developer, you will have a crucial role within ParkBee. Working closely with the technical director, you will be responsible for the software development of the ParkBee system.


ParkBee has been opening 5 to 10 new locations every month, adding many new customers every day and are now expanding internationally. As a result, ParkBee is growing and we are looking for someone to expand the development team. Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to, assuring the stable maintenance of the current platform, development of new functionalities and overseeing the future integration of new apps in new countries.


Responsibilities:


Change the world of parking.  You get to help implement strategy and innovation together with our co-founder.  We are growing and we need someone to help be a part of this growth!


Development



  • Work closely with lead developer to gather requirements, and build solutions

  • Plan and manage integration with external partners

  • Cooperate with marketing, operation and sales to develop internal analytic system


Project management



  • Plan development timeline

  • Manage/lead individual projects

  • Co-develop and manage offshore development team


Requirements:


Aside from some technical "chops" and .Net experience, we want awesome people.  This role really is the "once-in-a-lifetime opportunity" that we are offering just in time for growth expansion.  You  couldn't ask for a bigger opportunity and a chance to directly help our technical co-founder create something special!


The Perks:


ParkBee creates an environment with significant freedom and responsibility. Working for an innovative and growing startup can be challenging but extremely rewarding! You will have an important role in this crucial stage where ParkBee is expanding to new territories. At ParkBee we have the motivation to change the world’s parking industry in a climate-friendly way. We have the proven technology to do so, now it is up to great people to assure we will get this done.



  • Work in an entrepreneurial environment where collaboration is key and you will also get insight in other processes.

  • Opportunity to work closely with an experienced technical lead

  • Sharp, motivated and international team that continues to grow

  • On-site Chef every day for lunch to keep the ParkBee team healthy and happy

  • Friday afternoon drinks and crazy team events


Join us!


Start your journey with ParkBee by sending your CV and motivation to Scott Moran, s.moran@parkbee.com by no later than Friday, 19th of August.  Creativity is always encouraged!

jobs.title: System Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Systems Engineer to join our growing Netherlands Team. Our office in located in the heart of Amsterdam. The ideal candidate will be comfortable improving existing systems and establishing best practices for an evolving hybrid cloud/datacenter environment. Our stack includes Python, uWSGI, MySQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, Memcached, Nginx, Chef, and more. This position will require a love of deep diving into Linux issues and fanaticism about optimization and making data-driven decisions. As a member of a small team focused on specific software components, you will help develop and improve software services that power Discogs, as well as adjacent sites such as VinylHub.com, Gearogs.com, and others. This role will play a big part in supporting and growing our community of collectors, buyers, and sellers. Considering this will require working closely with other Discogs software teams, it is critical to exercise a strong sense of initiative and collaboration.


Responsibilities



  • Configure and maintain the Linux infrastructure that powers all of Discogs' services.

  • Investigate, diagnose, and resolve performance and reliability problems in a wide range of large-scale and high-traffic services.

  • Utilize configuration management software responsible for a variety of hosts.

  • Improve existing systems by adding automation and automated testing wherever possible.

  • Make continuous improvements to our monitoring, metrics, and logging systems.

  • Collaborate with other engineering teams to perform capacity planning, performance analysis, and system availability reviews.

  • Review events that impact availability, security, and performance and guide changes to increase the resilience of systems.

  • Commit to keeping up to date with emerging infrastructure technologies and best practices.

  • Participate in evening/night and weekend on call rotation.


Compensation, Benefits, and Perks



  • Competitive Compensation (Salary + Bonus)

  • Your choice of hardware (MacBook Pro is most commonly used by our Developers)

  • Commuter Benefit to offset the cost of your travel to and from the office, restrictions do apply

  • Paid holidays (Vacation and National Holidays)

  • Team Member Exchange Program (Our US office is located in Portland, OR USA)

  • Annual Continuing Education Allowance

  • Flexible work environment

  • Stocked Kitchen (hooray beer!)

  • Catered lunch on Fridays

  • Fun and Dynamic Culture

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
We are a fast paced team where developers are responsible for all aspects of feature design and development. Our ideal candidate would bring ideas to the table and be able to quickly iterate on them.


Our application, https://www.stream.me, is in a space where innovation and new technology is important; we expect team members to be able to explore novel tasks and pragmatically build out the features.


We are looking from someone with strong Front-End skills who has experience working with a full Javascript stack. We use React and Express to render views on both the front and back end (isomorphic/universal). Most of our components are built in house and we are often experimenting with new and unexplored technologies. We expect our developers to be able to use existing open source tools as well as judge when a custom component should be made.


All team members participate in code reviews, helping improve the work as well as knowledge of the code base. Our Senior team members should also help improve our best practices and help teach other team members. We release to production multiple times a day and developers are responsible for getting their features into production. Senior team members are also responsible for helping maintain the applications in production and debugging issues to help "put out fires".

jobs.title: Senior Researcher
jobs.content:
Insight offers a dynamic, energetic and highly collaborative environment. Our work is predominantly in healthcare, including medical device development, pharmaceutical delivery, and consumer health. Our researchers push to provide our clients with understanding and direction that lead to meaningful and actionable opportunities. We are part of a multi-disciplinary team involved in the design process, from helping define the strategic direction to prototyping and development.

Responsibilities:
• Develop and apply effective ways of collecting, analyzing, and synthesizing data to uncover and characterize new opportunities and product offerings
• Lead research programs to understand user/ stakeholder needs, goals, expectations, motivations, and experiences
• Deconstruct complex, scientific processes (surgical workflows, laboratory sciences, diagnostics, etc.)
• Lead iterative research touchpoints to evaluate concept value, utility, and usability
• Work closely and collaboratively with designers and engineers
• Lead and facilitate client presentations and workshops

Requirements:
• 4+ years of professional experience in design research, or related field
• Background in design preferred; will also consider social sciences, biomedical engineering and human factors
• Experience with qualitative research methods (in-context observation, interviewing, co-creation, etc.)
• Ability to plan and coordinate research efforts in an organized and detailed manner, while being able to adapt to changes in program schedule and scope
• Demonstrated ability to develop effective recommendations from research findings
• Proficiency in MS Office, Adobe Illustrator, and InDesign; familiarity with image and video processing and editing software (i.e. Photoshop, Final Cut) is a plus
• Excellent communication (verbal, written, and visual), analytical, and presentation abilities
• Strong, collaborative interpersonal work style

NOTE: you must be legally qualified to work in the US. Sorry, but we are unable to sponsor work visas at this time. You must be a US citizen or have permanent resident status to qualify.
