jobs.title: Lecturer in Design for Experience - Glasgow School of Art
jobs.content:
Lecturer in Design for Experience (Product & Service) (1.0 FTE)
School of Design
Grade 7, £36,672 – £46,414 per annum pro rata
Permanent

The School of Design and the Institute of Design Innovation at The Glasgow School of Art seek an experienced, dynamic and talented lecturer and researcher to join the Product Design & Design Innovation teaching team.

The post will require knowledge of contemporary approaches to design practice, in particular, an appreciation of the Design for Experience approach synonymous with GSA and its graduates.

The candidate will possess teaching experience, a research profile (or the capacity to develop such a profile) and a commitment to design practice as a mode of enquiry capable of exploring and evaluating the manner by which possible futures become preferable futures.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Academic / Educational
• Contribute to the academic team delivering curricular content within the Department of Product Design’s degree programmes and the Design Innovation masters’ “suite”.
• Participate within curriculum planning, timetabling, staffing and monitoring of programme delivery.
• Support student learning and staff delivery in the field of Product Design and Design Innovation
• Offer academic oversight and provision of pastoral responsibilities in respect of students
• Contribute to the marketing, publicity and recruitment strategies of the Department.
• Help to develop innovative approaches to programme delivery and ensure appropriate levels of attainment are achieved by the student body

Operational
• Develop a research and teaching profile in the area of Service Design aligned to departmental objectives
• Seek to develop further the Design for Experience approach to design practice and to advance the understanding of Service Design at GSA
• Work with colleagues to develop and deliver the curriculum at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels
• Aid in the development of international collaborations with a variety of Schools and organisations.
• Contribute to the Departmental recruitment and admissions processes across all relevant programmes.
• Contribute to and co-ordinate educational visits/trips, activities and exhibitions as directed by the Programme Leader
• Ensure all teaching materials and programme documentation – prospectus/handbooks/website, etc. – is updated in discussion with the Programme Leader
• Undertake Health and Safety duties and observe procedures within own area of responsibility in relation to all Staff, Students and Visitors, where appropriate

Strategic
• Play a significant role in the evolution of teaching, learning and assessment strategies across B.Des/MEDes in Product Design: Design for Experience, and the role of Service Design within the domain of Design Innovation.
• Contribute to development of student learning and curricular innovation in line with the design industry, external research criteria, professional developments and quality assurance/enhancement frameworks as directed by the Programme Leader
• Develop a research profile capable of submission in the Research Excellence Framework (REF) evaluation of 2020
• Contribute to development of the profile for GSA design programmes, including international profile, projects and partnerships, and enhance the School’s reputation as a leading centre for study in the creative disciplines

KEY CHALLENGES:
• Work with academic colleagues and support staff to develop and evolve the curriculum and so support and extend academic excellence in the field of Product Design, Design Innovation and Service Design.
• Develop an internationally recognised profile in the research and teaching of Service Design.
• Ensure scholarship - knowledge of developments in learning, teaching and research - underpins a reflective and critical view of contemporary design practice, profession and applications now and in the future
• Translate personal scholarship and research interests into curricular materials and innovative approaches to product and service design
• Demonstrate a willingness to help link the work of the studio to further curriculum development and innovative pedagogy across a variety situations and scenarios.
• Active engagement with sector wide enhancement initiatives and their institutional impact (ELIR/Periodic Review etc.)

REQUIREMENTS
Experience and knowledge
• Educated to degree level or beyond, ideally in the realm of product and service design. A Masters of PhD would be advantageous, alternatively, extensive industrial experience in an international context would be attractive.
• Significant teaching experience in a Higher Education Institute or comparable organisation, preferably a Design School or service design consultancy
• Capacity to contribute to discussions in teaching and learning approaches appropriate to undergraduate level and beyond
• Experience of current debates, trends and issues relating to the expanding field of Product/Service Design, especially the centrality of “thinking through making” and the challenges posed by designing in the “immaterial realm” of services and organisations.
• Willingness to engage in curriculum design, development and innovation to underpin enhancement/assurance in concert with the Programme team
• Desire to engage with both commercial and non-commercial organisations to broaden the scope of design practice and its application
• Some evidence of management/co-ordination activities within Higher Education

Skills
• Excellent design and visualisation skills, extensive evidence of design for experience/service design application, and a demonstrable aptitude for teamwork and collaboration
• High level of creative interpersonal skills for teaching in a studio environment
• An understanding of current debates and trends in undergraduate/postgraduate teaching
• Strong communication skills, verbal, visual and artefactual
• Passion for learning and creativity, strong personal commitment to teaching
• Awareness of, and sensitivity to, cultural diversity
• Commitment to equal opportunities and widening participation


Closing date for submission of completed applications: Sunday 28th August 2016
For full details and to apply online, please visit: www.gsa.ac.uk/jobs
The Glasgow School of Art is an equal opportunities employer.
Registered Charity Number SC012490
STRICTLY NO AGENCIES

jobs.title: Sr. Storage Engineer, VIPER Platform
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Are you passionate about digital media, entertainment, and software services? Do you like big challenges and working within a highly motivated team environment? Do you thrive on solving problems that lead to unblocking issues with a service and or technology?



As a Systems Engineer, you will be responsible for engineering, management, and operational oversight of all development lab server systems including virtualization, network, compute, and storage platforms. Responsibilities include oversight and development of infrastructure engineering projects, plans, and roadmaps including scope definition, budgeting, technical vendor management, and resource planning. Working with functional and business units on assessment of priorities and impact, this individual will facilitate upgrades to existing systems and deploy new infrastructure necessary to support required service levels, including high availability objectives. Additionally, this position is responsible for architectural and lifecycle asset planning, maintenance and patching events, and directing the timely resolution of lab system service disruptions.



This is a multi-faceted position that requires the ability to work effectively and efficiently in teams, independently create and maintain a variety of environments and architectures, adapt to and quickly learn new systems and technologies, and handle multiple priorities and tasks simultaneously with a high level of attention to detail and minimal oversight.



Who does the Systems Engineer work with?



Systems engineers are positioned as an integral part of the overall IP video engineering team and work very closely with all facets of the engineering organization. They work with core infrastructure development teams, quality assurance teams, service delivery teams and daily operations teams. Engineers work with network engineers, systems administrators, software engineers, and a pile of technically-adept-but-not-actually-technical product folks. The engineering team is a diverse collection of software engineers, systems administrators, network administrators, puppet developers, and quality assurance engineers from all walks of life. They are a group of experienced technical minds who are the last word when it comes to solving problems encountered by our engineering and operations teams.



What are some interesting problems you'll be working on?



In your role, you will bridge the gap between various application development teams and infrastructure management, deployment and operations teams. You will lead the architecture and design of cloud infrastructure components. As a Systems Engineer you will provide technical supervision and management of lab environments, providing recommendations to improve deployment velocity of systems components in the lab and production environments. You will lead the development of best practices to improve quality and reliability of the cloud infrastructure supporting IP video services, as well as leading reliability initiatives to better support development, integration engineering and QA teams by providing guidance to how best to test and certify various infrastructure components. Additionally, you will generate and validate documentation of systems architectures, systems solutions, configurations and troubleshooting guides for the VIPER cloud infrastructure.



Where can you make an impact?



You'll be working with the best and brightest minds in Comcast to roll out a large scale cloud based video delivery infrastructure that will power the next generation of television and video entertainment. Success in this role is characterized by a higher speed to market, with fewer customer-facing defects and outages.



Responsibilities:




  • Architect, design, recommend, develop, evaluate and implements technical systems infrastructure solutions to support development and deployment of advanced IP video technologies and services.

  • Support Platform CI/CD Development initiatives to assist in the deployment, research and augmentation of platform automation in order to remove manual operations.

  • Collaborates with and obtains buy-in from peers and leadership for technical standards and innovation.

  • Assume the role of an infrastructure subject matter expert within multiple cross-functional service teams.

  • Represents the platform infrastructure team on projects and performs the role of team resource and/or lead as appropriate.

  • Ability to convey advanced technical information to team members, along with the ability to communicate technical information in general terms that users can understand.

  • Develop and deliver self-service resource provisioning, providing a consistent user experience for VIPER IP video engineering and development teams.

  • Regularly creates and maintains system documentation, procedures, diagrams, and standards

  • Perform advanced systems engineering related designs, upgrades, conversions, and troubleshooting.

  • Lead configuration management for multiple infrastructure domains.

  • Standardization and execution of load, fault tolerance, longevity and stress testing of systems.

  • Certify new technologies for use in the lab and production environments.

  • Fulfill the role of Tier 3 and above for escalated production service support.

  • Willing to continuously learn and keep current on industry standards, emerging technologies, and services for the development of infrastructure roadmaps.



Here are some of the specific technologies you can expect to use within VIPER Platform Engineering:




  • Operating Systems & Applications

    • CentOS, CoreOS Linux

    • Apache

    • Git

    • Bootstrap

    • Jira & Confluence




  • Virtualization Platforms

    • VMware vSphere, vCenter, vCloud, vRA

    • OpenStack

    • Kubernetes & Docker




  • Compute & Storage Platforms

    • Cisco UCS

    • Generic Compute

    • Distributed Object Storage

    • Cleversafe Object Storage

    • NetApp storage solutions







Skills & Requirements




  • 8+ years of hands-on experience in systems administration and engineering.

  • Minimum 3+ years of experience in managing large scale distributed infrastructure and converged platforms.

  • Strong experience gathering requirements and supporting advanced software development teams in an agile environment.

  • Strong ability to collaborate with peers and stakeholders around system designs, capacity, road maps and resource allocation.

  • Quick grasp of strategic and tactical requirements with the ability to propose creative and effective solutions.

  • Experience with developing and enforcing standards and best practices in managing large scale cloud infrastructure.

  • Strong experience with infrastructure sizing and scaling dependent upon application load and demand.

  • Highly proficient in managing Linux based systems and cloud infrastructure.

  • Experience with a variety of Unix/Linux automation and scripting languages such as Python, BASH, Puppet.

  • High availability experience including clustering, load balancing (F5 LTM and GTM, IPVS).

  • Deep understanding of mid and high range storage solutions such as NetApp (7-mode and Cluster Mode).

  • Proficiency with the following:

    • VMware 5/6, CoreOS/Docker/Kubernetes

    • DNS, DHCP, PXE booting and Apache/HTTP

    • Blade server architectures, Generic Compute Platforms

    • NAS/NFS/Object storage technologies



  • Experience with distributed and scaled systems architectures.

  • Advanced networking experience including VLANs, LACP, vPC/MLAG, TCP/IP, Multicast, Unicast, spanning tree.

  • Experience with OpenStack Cloud Computing.

  • Experience with CI/CD methodologies.

  • Experience with large scale infrastructure automation.

  • Experience with distributed system architectures.

  • Knowledge of Hyper-converged and Immutable Infrastructure.

  • Strong communicator and able to clearly articulate complex issues and technologies.

  • Ability to propose systems design and configuration improvements.

  • Must be able to work independently, be self-motivated and handle multiple priorities.

  • Ability to plan, organize and document complex system designs.

  • High attention to detail and strong ability to problem solve systems issues.

  • Willing to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution for all escalations for systems infrastructure related issues.

  • Comfortable working in a fast paced agile environment. Requirements change quickly and our team needs to constantly adapt to moving targets.





About Comcast VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research)





VIPER(Video IP Engineering & Research), is a startup division within Comcast's Technology and Product Division and spun out from IP Video and online projects originated within Comcast Interactive Media is based in downtown Denver, CO. We are a cloud-based, IP video infrastructure that's been built to deliver a broad mix of on-demand video, live TV streams and an assortment of other digital media to an array of connected devices in the home.






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Director/Technical Platform Owner, VIPER
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Do you want to be part of the revolution that is reshaping television? Can you set the agenda for how leading-edge technology is applied and work with top-flight engineers to deliver innovation in digital media and entertainment services? Are you passionate, motivated, and energized by big challenges?





As a Technical Platform Owner (TPO) on the Alternate Content team at VIPER, you will develop and manage the roadmap that translates business needs into platform releases for a suite of components enabling Dynamic Ad Insertion (DAI), addressable advertising, and blackout in IP Linear, VOD, and Time-Shifted video services. The VIPER team is a new, small and nimble team of world-class experts who are innovating in end-to-end video delivery. Every day, we do things no one has done before, and we thrive on big challenges, results, quality, and agility.





Who does the Technical Platform Owner work with?



VIPER TPOs straddle the boundary between business and technology. We take business requirements from service owners for VIPER's Linear, VOD, and Time-Shifted video services and work with architects and engineering leads to define solutions and align them with our platform roadmap and priorities. Then we work with development leads and delivery owners to drive those solutions through engineering backlogs, sprint plans, QA testing, and release plans, seeing them through into production in collaboration with service delivery and operations engineers. We have overall responsibility for the roadmap, prioritization, and work queue for our platforms, and cradle-to-grave ownership of the components our platform teams produce. TPOs are a unique blend of business savvy and technical affinity, with strong executive, analytical, and organizational skills for planning, prioritizing, and communicating, and exceptional interpersonal skills for leading, influencing, and collaborating, all paired with the ability to comprehend complex technical problems and solutions.





What are some interesting problems you'll be working on?



In your role, you will develop, maintain, and publish a roadmap for the alternate content platform. You will balance how requests for new features and functionality, technical debt, and innovation are mapped into that roadmap. Collaborate with the platform team to translate functional scope to technical solutions for all roadmap items. Write technical requirements (stories) for those solutions. You will have solid knowledge and understanding of all initiatives within your platform whether in analysis, in flight, or in production. You will collaborate with other TPOs for platforms both upstream and downstream of yours to identify dependencies and assess impact of their initiatives on your roadmap, as well as impact of your roadmap on theirs.





Where can you make an impact?



You'll be working with the best and brightest minds in video delivery to create and deploy video services that will reset the bar for what people expect of television in accessibility, ease-of-use, feature richness, and quality. Success in this role is characterized by increased predictability of platform releases in terms of features, functionality, and timing, and increased cadence of releases / compressed release cycle times as a result of better planning, alignment, and execution against the roadmap.





Responsibilities:




  • Align and prioritize the alternate content platform roadmap with inputs from across the VIPER service roadmaps, in collaboration with service owners and service architects

  • Align functional scope for roadmap items with required technical solutions in collaboration with technical platform team

  • Own technical solutions across the alternate content technical platform group, to include:

    • Project scope

    • Production support

    • Technical debt, innovation, experimentation, and lessons learned activity



  • Accountable for supporting technical definition of work across the alternate content platform group, to include technical requirement definition and awareness of dependencies across development, testing, and deployment, and dependencies across other VIPER technical platform groups

  • Work with development leads/backlog managers as needed to prioritize and make decisions within specific component backlogs





Skills & Requirements




  • Experience:

    • 9+ years' experience in software product development, including:

      • Minimum 2 years' as a product owner in an Agile development setting

      • Minimum 2 years' as a software engineer or solution architect





  • Education:

    • BS in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field

    • MBA desirable



  • Skills:

    • Exceptional organizational skills ability to breakdown and track complex projects, to integrate input from multiple sources, and to identify and track dependencies across projects

    • Exceptional executive skills ability to set clear objectives and focus and motivate teams to drive execution, to prioritize issues and to discern level of urgency and triage appropriately when necessary

    • Exceptional communication skills ability to create clear and concise messages that are audience-appropriate in level of detail and tone, ability to create and maintain process artifacts as required

    • Exceptional collaboration skills ability to build and maintain relationships, to influence without direct authority

    • High level of accountability takes ownership of problems and sees them through to resolution

    • High energy thrives in fast-paced, high-rate-of-change setting



  • Tools and Technologies:

    • Subject matter expertise in advanced advertising and/or blackout technology

    • Detailed understanding of relevant industry standards including SCTE-130, SCTE-35, SCTE-224

    • Proficiency in Jira, Microsoft Office (especially PowerPoint)

    • Familiarity with software development comprehension of programming language paradigms, data structures, version control, networks and systems.

    • Relevant technologies include:

      • Go (golang)

      • Python 3

      • C

      • C++

      • Java 8

      • Linux (CentOS)

      • Git

      • Apache httpd and the Apache Portable Runtime

      • Redis

      • MongoDB

      • OpenStack









About Comcast VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research)



VIPER(Video IP Engineering & Research), is a startup division within Comcast's Technology and Product Division and spun out from IP Video and online projects originated within Comcast Interactive Media is based in downtown Denver, CO. We are a cloud-based, IP video infrastructure that's been built to deliver a broad mix of on-demand video, live TV streams and an assortment of other digital media to an array of connected devices in the home.








Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Technical Architect
jobs.content:
IRESS is seeking a Technical Architect to join our growing team responsible for building our award winning financial planning product – XPLAN. It's been rated the number one financial planning software for the ninth consecutive year, being used by 90% of the Australian market.



IRESS is a principal global supplier of share market and wealth management systems producing innovative, sophisticated solutions. We provide solutions that help with life's big decisions – from getting a mortgage approval, planning for retirement, to trading on the stock exchange – things that make a real difference to people's lives and financial wellbeing.



Role



As a Technical Architect, you'll be part of an Architecture Team responsible for XPLAN and associated products. This is a high impact role where you'll provide technical leadership, training and support across the XPLAN developer community. You'll champion technical innovation and encourage the use of best tools, frameworks and practices. You'll be part of a highly regarded team constantly solving highly complex technical challenges.



As a Technical Architect, you'll : -



  • Assist software developers in solving and implementing solutions for the most challenging problems

  • Hands-on development work for major architectural changes

  • Work with a varied tech stack including Python, JavaScript, HTML, React etc.

  • Provide product technical knowledge and support to other parts of the business such as pre-sales, operations, security, legal, and other product teams

  • Keep up to date with technical trends, tools and methodologies; undertake research as required

  • Collaborate with various teams including Product, Testing, Network and Security


About You



  • Demonstrable strong design, development and collaboration skills gained in designing architecture for and developing software product solutions

  • Previous experience in a similar role as a Technical Architect, Senior Software Developer, Software Engineer, Team Leader etc.

  • Developer cred: outstanding technical ability that will be respected across the developer community

  • Able to engage effectively in communication and discussion of complex ideas

  • Creativity, motivation and strong collaboration/teamwork

  • Tertiary Computer Science / Software Engineering or equivalent qualification

  • Be self-motivated and pro-active

  • Have a strong attention to detail

  • Have strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Have excellent trouble shooting, logical thinking and deductive skills

  • Able to encourage and inspire others


Culture and Perks


We recognise and reward hard work and celebrate our successes over a Friday afternoon drink and at various socials throughout the year. We don't sweat the small stuff either, our dress code is as relaxed as we are. As well as local charity events and initiatives, we hold global days and activities to make the most of our global strength and diversity. This includes a yearly global hackathon!



Perks include subsidised healthcare insurance, share scheme, community events, flexible working opportunities and access to various learning and development programs.

jobs.title: Ad Agency Junior Website Developer
jobs.content:
Our business is one of Perth’s most successful boutique creative agencies. Soon to turn twenty, we are looking to add a junior web developer looking for the opportunity to grow. Whilst you will be working under the guidance of a Senior Art Director and Mid-Weight Web Developer, the position requires a driven professional with the proven ability to self-manage and deal direct with clients of all shapes and sizes.


Ideally you will have at least 1-2 years experience with either an advertising agency or creative web company.

jobs.title: TEDx Licensing Associate
jobs.content:
The TEDx program has wide reach, enabling over 3,000 independently organized events per year in 170+ countries. These events range from highly produced gatherings in world capitals to small events in rural and marginalized communities. From frugal staging solutions to complicated theatrical performances, TEDx organizers are innovating with the use of the TED brand around the globe.

We need a highly organized, globally-minded individual to help us review events and their branding throughout this vast network for our licensing team.

The ideal candidate has a keen and inquisitive editorial eye, strong communication skills and advanced knowledge of social media platforms (Twitter, YouTube, Facebook, WeChat etc).

To be successful, the candidate must be curious, comfortable with high volume and be resilient (did we mention 3,000 events per year?), as well as be organized, detail-oriented, and a strong multi-tasker. If you’re fluent in more than one language or have experience living internationally, that’s a real advantage.

Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Being the first point of contact for the community regarding branding and license compliance issues
  • Proactively searching TEDx community social media for innovations with editorial potential
  • Performing brand reviews on TEDx event collateral for upcoming and past events
  • Interfacing directly with TEDx event organizers to explain program guidelines
  • Identifying trends and elevating these to the editorial team for coverage
  • Writing brief, articulate notes allowing the team to make quick decisions
  • Reviewing completion of post-event requirements
  • Reviewing and analyzing post-event survey data

Knowledge / skills:

  • Strong online research, writing, and communication skills
  • Strong journalistic sense of content that will thrive in a digital environment and best represent the TED brand and mission
  • Great verbal communicator
  • Highly developed organization skills and attention to detail
  • At least 3 years of post-graduation work experience in a relevant field
  • You’ll need to be a global soul to be effective in this role; fluency in other languages is preferred but not required

This is a full-time role.  Candidates should find joy in communicating with people from all areas of the world, be comfortable working in a startup-like environment, and execute their job with a sense of humor and an eye for detail. Speaking of detail, please explain in your cover letter why your experience is relevant to this specific role.

Also: we only hire extremely nice people.

Location: This position will be based in TED's downtown New York office.

Compensation: We offer a competitive package, including full benefits.

TED is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value diversity. We encourage applicants of any background to apply.

jobs.title: Senior eCommerce Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Developer with focus and experience in eCommerce projects. You should be able to work independently and as part of a team when required. As you will be working remotely to build cutting edge eCommerce applications you should be responsible and able to schedule your time effectively. In addition you must be a tinkerer by nature and able to improve existing software and even come up with improvements on software you have built yourself. You must be your own harshest critic and a focused, achievement oriented person.


Fun to work with, get to build actual products. A chance to change the world of software and build up equity as a direct result of your efforts.



If you prefer to work on a contract basis, that too is a possibility. We are flexible as long as you are dedicated and talented.


Equity options are a possibility as part of Performance-Linked pay.

jobs.title: Senior UX/Product Designer
jobs.content:
Recruiters and staffing companies NEED NOT contact us and DO NOT have permission to contact candidates on our behalf.

At Think Brownstone, our fundamental reason for being is to envision, design, and create experiences that enhance people’s lives. We want to join forces with others who share this purpose. You can read more about how we work and what we value and get a glimpse at what it’s like to work with us.

We’re currently looking for a skilled UX designer with a strong background in product definition and design. For us, this means someone who engages clients and internal team members in exploratory discussions, synthesizes and refines those discussions into well-considered design concepts, establishes the foundation for a complex system, and ensures those concepts are translated into beautiful high-fidelity prototypes.

Traits you bring:

  • A deep passion and proven ability to design useful digital experiences
  • An ability to consider both hardware and software interactions in product design
  • Evidence that you can create and execute a product design strategy
  • Knack for building and extending a coherent system of design patterns
  • A commitment to working as part of a collaborative team
  • Pride in communicating your design ideas and process clearly
  • A mastery of your design tools—apps and techniques alike
  • Comfort establishing and maintaining client relationships
  • A basic understanding of front-end development and technology
  • Additionally, any product design experience would be great to highlight if you’ve done it

What you’d do:

  • Work largely on-site with our client's product development team
  • Define problems and solve them using an evidence-based rationale
  • Collaborate closely with your project teams and clients to create bespoke design solutions
  • Craft pragmatic interfaces for complex systems that stand up to rigorous testing
  • Work closely with product owners and developers to ensure ideas can be brought to life
  • Serve as a valued consultant

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer: Rails / Fullstack
jobs.content:
Looking for a job at the Intersection of Big Data, Social Media and Finance?

Contix, a leading provider of social media sourced breaking news alerts and analytics for traders, is hiring a full-time Senior Rails Developer for its Honolulu or St. Louis (MO) office.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The position of Senior Rails Developer entails software architecture, implementation, development of best operational practices, testing and documentation of non-trivial systems with massive scalability requirements. As a startup we are looking for motivated individuals who do not require step-by-step directions and can work cohesively with our team.

Successful applicants will have a proven track record with non-trivial Ruby on Rails projects, understand web client frameworks such as React.js, be comfortable with agile development methodologies and have a solid grounding in OO software architecture / design patterns. Our interviews are rigorous, so only serious developers with the requisite skills need apply.

We provide a competitive startup compensation package with a generous equity component.

Send resumes, your GitHub repo and a brief paragraph describing why this position appeals to you to careers@contix.com.

REQUIREMENTS

  1. A solid grounding in OO software architecture / design patterns
  2. Experience designing and implementing successful non-trivial enterprise Ruby on Rails projects
  3. Experience with web client frameworks such as React.js
  4. Experience with agile development methodologies
  5. Deep knowledge of the Rails tech stack
  6. Firm grasp of data modeling
  7. A passion for software development

NICE TO HAVES

  1. Java or Groovy experience
  2. Expertise in search technologies
  3. Social media analytics
  4. Experience in the finance industry

WHY WORK FOR CONTIX?

  1. Work at a fast paced startup on the cutting edge of big data and social media
  2. Opportunities for rapid promotion and advancement within the organization for the right candidate
  3. Work with a driven, talented team of software developers that aims to create a truly disruptive technology platform for the finance industry
  4. Solving a huge and very valuable problem that will have a large-scale impact on finance and other markets

Notes: UNFORTUNATELY WE CURRENTLY CANNOT SPONSOR VISAS. WE AREN’T ACCEPTING RESUMES FROM RECRUITERS FOR THIS POSITION. We are looking for core team members in Honolulu. We aren’t looking for remote developers at this time.

ABOUT CONTIX

Contix, a leader in the social media analytics for finance space, finds differentiated news for traders by analyzing over half a billion social and traditional media posts per day and sending real-time alerts containing the earliest mentions of breaking financial news events via web, native desktop and mobile applications. We utilize proprietary technology to identify breaking news events relevant to financial markets before other news sources and determine if they are likely to be reputable.

Read more on Contix.com, Facebook and Twitter.

jobs.title: Security Analyst
jobs.content:
HackerOne is looking for security-minded, customer-service oriented individuals to help lead up the newly formed HackerOne managed service offering. You will be responsible for vetting security vulnerability reports from some of the world’s best hackers being submitted to Fortune 500 and other companies as part of their bug bounty programs. You will have the opportunity work with some of the best hackers in the world and the security teams behind some of the most competitive bug bounty programs, gaining hands-on experience with thousands of vulnerabilities unique to HackerOne’s customers.


This role requires that you have both excellent communication skills to serve as the glue between the hacker community and companies running bug bounty programs, as well as the technical capacity to ensure every bug report is reproducible and provides value to each customer.


About HackerOne


HackerOne connects companies and the hacker community to build a safer Internet. HackerOne powers the leading vulnerability coordination platform, tapping into the power of the hacker community to reveal live vulnerabilities that require a company’s immediate attention. Vulnerabilities surfaced by hackers help protect a company’s brand and its user’s information and data. With over 500 companies and more than 3,000 actively rewarded hackers, HackerOne has the world’s largest platform and community of its kind.


As a company, we believe in transparency, trust, collaboration and community. We work together to make our customers successful, and act with a sense of urgency in our work. We believe in the positive power of hackers.


The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, a problem solver, a great communicator, and detail oriented.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Java | AngularJS | MongoDB | AWS
jobs.content:
Infomedia Ltd is a publicly-listed company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX symbol "IFM"). We are the leading supplier of information solutions to the parts and service sector of the global automotive industry. Infomedia's business solutions are currently used each business day by over 150,000 dealership personnel. They are produced in more than 30 languages and at work in 186 countries. Their powerful search functions and intuitive, user-friendly interface helps boost efficiency, profitability and customer retention for OE Parts and Service Departments.

At Infomedia we do things differently. We develop niche, one-of-a-kind software solutions for the automotive industry but we also know that to stay unique and to continue to be the #1 in our industry we need unique and one-of-a-kind thought leaders and intelligent problem solvers who are always striving to take our products to the next level. We pride ourselves on our values of Integrity, Innovation, Togetherness, Care and on having a Global mindset in everything we do to ensure we are always thinking BIG!

This is where you come in……..

What are we looking for?

  • 7+ years of full-stack Java development
  • Solid experience in JavaScript development (Ideally AngularJS)
  • 30% leader, 70% hands on development excellence seeker
  • Experience with AWS, MongoDB, Lucene or MS SQL highly regarded
  • Background in SaaS product environment
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal and awesome attention to detail

That's the tangible stuff. Now the softer stuff.....

  • Of course we want the passion, the drive and and intelligence but that's a no brainer.
  • Analytical problem solver and intelligent thought leader.
  • Not shy of throwing out solutions to problems and jumping in at the deep end.
  • The person that will be the master of their own destiny - we will nurture, support and guide any of our team into whatever technology or business skill that the want to grow into, but you will be accountable for being the driving force behind that progression

In return you will be joining a company who doesn't just throw out an awesome marketing spiel to lure you in just for you to realize you have joined another humdrum dev shop. Our team works with some of the coolest technologies around, building some seriously innovative and interesting products and we have a culture of openness, honesty and creativity.

Some other key benefits:

  • Onsite gym facilities for staff
  • Food provided daily
  • Games area
  • Onsite parking
  • Fun, relaxed but very high performing environment!

Sound like you? Then hit the apply button and drop us over your profile – we want to chat with you.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Help companies design and build better software
jobs.content:
Your day-to-day


Most of the time, you will work in a small agile team along with the client(s), a product strategist, and a designer. You will typically focus on one project at a time. You will lead your project team to make and implement thoughtful technology decisions that support a great user experience and the client's objectives.


Usual activities include:



  • Evaluate and select appropriate tools and technologies for projects

  • Determine and implement appropriate automated testing solutions given the constraints of a project

  • Actively participate in the research and design of new applications

  • Setup and manage deployment environments (generally on Heroku, sometimes VPS)

  • Deliver working code that exceeds the expectations of the team

  • Iterate, iterate, iterate

  • Support colleagues through code review and pairing


What we're looking for



  • Proficiency building modern web applications and using Git

  • Versatility across the full stack

  • Strong awareness of the user experience

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

  • Insatiable desire to become a better developer

  • Comfortable in a fast-paced environment


What we value


Same Team


There is no “us” vs. “them." We are on the client’s team and vice versa. We teach them about good design and development and they teach us about their industry and customers. We rally around a shared goal and measure our success by theirs. Adopt the idea that if the project fails, it is your responsibility.


People Before Pixels


We make things for humans. Behind every business plan, software application, or digital art piece is a human motivation that we aim to satisfy. If you don't know what it is, talk to people. Always ask "why?"


:shipit:


Thought is cheap. Talk is cheap. Sketch files and localhost are cheap. We measure progress by what we put into the world and what we learn from doing so. Make small bets and test them outside of the building.


Make It Better


Creating great digital experiences is an iterative process. Our basic project approach is: Think. Make. Validate. Make it better. But what makes usbetter at making things better? Simple: we make ourselves better. We're constantly pushing the limits of our own knowledge and working to improve our skills and process.

jobs.title: Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you an expert of all-things-big-data? Do you thrive on building architecture that enables high-volume growth as well as the ability to scale and stay at the cutting-edge? StubHub is looking for an innovator who can guide our big data platform to new heights. To be successful in this role, you will need a combination of software engineering know-how and the ability to drive the development of a Hadoop based ecosystem to meet both online and offline use case challenges. We offer an innovative development environment that delivers a world-class online ticketing experience to fans across the US. If you’re passionate about big data architecture, enjoy solving complex data challenges related to functionality/scale and looking for a platform to springboard your career, StubHub wants to hear from you.



*For immediate and confidential consideration, please send your resume to kelcenko@ebay.com



Primary Responsibilities:




  • Build world class high-volume real-time data ingestion frameworks and automate ingesting various data sources into Hadoop

  • Research, develop, optimize and innovate frameworks and related components for enterprise scale data analysis and computations

  • Develop validation frameworks, proactive monitoring solutions to detect data ingestion failures in big data platform and take appropriate remedies

  • Develop Data Adapters to ingest large volume of Unstructured, Semi-Structured and Structured data from various data sources and types

  • Collaborate with people working on traditional Data Warehouse technologies and ensure consistency for the data exposed through these different channels

  • Own the end-to-end development life cycle with high quality of solution/code you develop and evangelize the test driven development approach

  • Follow a customer centric approach and ensure the solutions developed meet the customer requirements



Requirements:




  • 8+ years of experience with progressively increasing responsibilities in the areas of software analysis, design, development and architecture

  • Strong Object Oriented programming experience using Java required

  • Recent experience scaling and modifying Hadoop ecosystem—including: HDFS, Web HDFS, HBase, Spark, HIVE, PIG, MapReduce, ZooKeeper and Kafka

  • Strong knowledge and experience with NoSQL databases (HBase preferred)

  • Experience and the ability to lead development activities using Agile Scrum methodologies

  • Experience with RDBMS, O-R mapping and application of distributed caching technologies

  • Experience implementing high-volume web applications or large transactional client-server systems with an emphasis on scalability and performance highly preferred

  • API and REST based web services development a plus

  • Proponent of and ability to guide development activities using a TDD approach



About StubHub



At StubHub, our mission is simple: help fans find fun. We connect fans with their favorite teams, shows and artists and introduce them to the ones they’ll love next. As the world’s largest ticket marketplace, we enable fans to buy and sell tens of thousands of tickets, whenever they want, through our desktop and mobile experiences, including our StubHub and StubHub Music apps for iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch and Android. Offering a superior fan experience at its core, StubHub reinvented the ticket resale market in 2000 and continues to lead it through innovation. Our industry firsts include the introduction of the first ticketing application, the first interactive seat mapping tool and the first live entertainment rewards program, Fan Rewards™. Our business partners include more than 60 teams in MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS and NCAA, plus ESPN, NBC Digital, AEG and Spectra Ticketing & Fan Engagement. Throughout North America and the United Kingdom, StubHub provides the total end-to-end event going experience.



StubHub is an eBay company (NASDAQ: EBAY). For more information on StubHub, visit StubHub.com, StubHub Press Box.

jobs.title: Linux Systems Administrator
jobs.content:

Oversee, administer, and provide support for a network of GNU/Linux servers, and technical support for GNU/Linux desktop workstations, in multiple locations. Will be responsible for security updates, upgrades, general system health, anticipating problems, correcting problems, collecting statistics on system operation and health, maintaining security policies, building and installing systems (software side), and writing and maintaining code supporting the company's systems infrastructure.

Looking for mid-level, but will consider junior and senior level as well, as long as you eat sleep and breathe this stuff, have been doing it as a hobby for a long time (in the case of the former), and aren't stuck in your ways (in the case of the latter).


Full-time. Competitive compensation. Planning to hire by 1475294400.


No recruiters please.

jobs.title: Principal R&D Quality Engineer/Project Manager, Predictive Analytics
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

     

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Job Summary:

Identify innovation via predictive analytics for one of the largest Information System at Abbott Diagnostics. Responsible for working with a  cross-functional team to develop, prioritize and maintain a product roadmap. The responsibilities would also include converting the roadmap into an executable product backlog by providing functional and analytics specifications and design.

Primary Job Function:

Leads product development core team members responsible for producing quality engineering deliverables including specification development, risk management, process and test method characterization and control plan development.

Consistently, and on an ongoing basis, develops and applies advanced theories, methods, and research techniques to the investigation and solution of complex technical problems.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the quality system.

Analyzes, evaluates, and plans methods of approach to and organizes a means to achieve the solution of complex technical problems.

Conducts investigations of considerable complexity pertaining to the development of new designs, methods, materials, or processes, and investigates possible applications of the results.

May provide technical consultation to technical staff.

Applies the results of reviews of literature and current practices relevant to the business; uses results to determine strategic technical direction.

Position Accountability/Scope:

Establishes and defines the theoretical bases and principles which should apply, the empirical test procedures to be used, and the estimated time, expense, and manpower for completion.
Reviews project progress and evaluates results.
Reviews, generates, and approves related inputs such as FMEAs and specifications.
Evaluates vendor capabilities to provide required products or services.
Specifies equipment, materials, and supplies required for the completion and implementation of technical projects.
Plans and directs major technical phases of projects within a specific area.
Provides technical direction to and coordinates the efforts of engineers and technical support staff in the performance of assigned projects.
Provides input to the manager on staffing decisions and future strategies and goals.
Leads or enables project completion.
Interfaces with product team members, manufacturing quality and medical affairs, Development managers, operations and business unit managers.
Communicates with outside decision makers in a manner appropriate to the goals of the communication.

Minimum Education/Experience:

Bachelors degree in a science, statistics, engineering discipline or ASQ Quality Engineering certification with six to ten years work related development experience and 2 to 4 years of Quality Engineering specific experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

Expertise in Predictive Analytics, Big Data, Data Science, Mathematics and Statistics

Familiarity with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence technology

Experience in Product, Feature and Functionality grooming

Familiarity with one or more software programming language and databases. E.g. C++, C#, Java, Oracle, SQLServer...

jobs.title: Mobile App Developer
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

Contribute to the design and development of software applications, firmware and device drivers for embedded microprocessors under a disciplined product development process that meets FDA requirements. Works on software design, coding, and validating embedded software, supporting verification and validation testing, and ensuring that all product development conforms to design specifications and coding standards for medical devices Exercises judgment in coding following the software designs and conducting investigation activities following defined methods. Develops productive internal/external working relationships.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

1.Design and implement programs in current application and firmware programming languages (e.g., C-Sharp, Java, C, C, Assembly, etc). 2.Development of the test protocols for the purpose of design verification and validation of the system software. 3.Assist in the preparation of software design requirements and detailed design specifications for implementation of software designs per Abbott design development process. 4.Assist in the evaluation of selected designs through testing and full documentation of the results. Work on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Exercising judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.

Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and performing other duties as assigned by management

Note: This job description describes the principal and main elements of the job. It is a guide to the nature and main duties of the job as they currently exist, but is not intended as a wholly comprehensive or permanent representation.

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:

BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.MS degree ideal.

MINIMUM TRAINING & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

2 yrs experience in software engineering. Solid knowledge of software engineering principals. Knowledge of design controls and regulations for medical device development. Knowledge of the principles of quality software engineering as described by software lifecycle development processes that are consistent with ISO, IEEE, or other FDA recognized standards. Experience in design, engineering, and testing of software contained in medical devices developed under the FDAs regulations for 510(k) or PMA products is preferred. Technical experience in software engineering with excellent written and verbal communication skills is essential. Minimum of 2 years of structured software development and/or Object Modeling Design experience. Minimum of 2 years of solid programming experience using current programming languages (e.g., CSharp, Java, C, C, Assembly, etc). Experience with software development life cycle processes is highly preferable. Good troubleshooting skills is highly preferable Testing experience of software based systems is highly desirable Experience on multitasking in RTOS and/or Windows OS software design and development is highly preferable. Experience on Internet technologies (web development, application servers) and database design is a strong plus. Experience on device driver and low level device interface design and development is a plus. Knowledge and experience on RF software design, device driver configuration, and test is a plus. Experience in Com...

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Join a rapidly-growing startup, venture-funded by Andreesen Horowitz!


You'll be developing core components of our litigation infrastructure, an online platform for legal teams to review, analyze, and collaborate on millions of documents.


Tackling litigation with technology is a surprisingly deep challenge, and it requires a lot of computer science, including machine learning, data visualization, search, distributed systems, databases, real-time collaboration, nifty user interfaces, and more.


We're looking for generalists. We value great CS fundamentals, native ability, and humility, over experience with any particular platform, technology, or specialization. If you happen to have a specialty, we'll put that to use -- but we won't restrict you to that area.


We care a lot about finding the best engineers, writing correct software, using the right tools for the job, and avoiding dogma, and as a result we've been able to build quite a bit sophisticated technology with a small, talented team. It's the kind of culture where you'll own serious features, write great code, learn a huge amount, and have a lot of fun. Also, you'll get to participate in our plans for world domination -- always a nice bonus.


We code primarily in Java and Python but dabble in several other languages.

jobs.title: QA engineer with strong dev skills
jobs.content:
We need a QA Engineer with great dev skills


We’re a FinTech company that just raised more than $7MM to disrupt a $100Bn market.  Sorry if that’s  a little vague, but we’re sort of in stealth mode. We're running hard and working fast and need to be responsive and agile as all get-out. A key part of moving fast is making sure our product meets a high quality bar. (People get very nervous if the company to which they're entrusting their financial future can't make their own website work right.) We need a QA engineer who's comfortable at every part of the job: manual UI testing, black box acceptance testing, whitebox exploratory testing, test automation, and continuous integration. We've made a big investment in test automation, but we need to take that - and our quality bar in general - to the next level. Another way to put it: you need to be able to read and write code as well as you can write and execute test plans. 


If you're interested, reach out!

jobs.title: Senior Web developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Senior Web Developer to create new features. If you’re a web developer looking for a consumer focused team, an agile empowered team structure, and a direct way to tie your work to revenue, then this is the right team for you. You will be responsible for implementing new features, working with a partner to integrate code, and helping validate other team members features. You will be responsible for designing solution and implementing that solution using the latest web technologies and frameworks. 


Role Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):



  • Create features that meet the needs of a world-wide audience.

  • Ability to quickly come up to speed on new technologies and leverage past experience to solve new problems.

  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.

  • Be an advocate for a great end-to-end consumer experience. Understand how your features impact the overall end-to-end customer experience.


W2 only, no Corp to Corp. We are unable to sponsor H1B visas at this time.

jobs.title: Software Developer to work on absolute cutting edge tech on VR program
jobs.content:
Why do you want to work in this role?



  • Cool opportunity to work on absolute cutting edge tech on VR program; to be in on the ground floor engaging the world with this new technology.

  • Working to take holographic video to other outlets, get really high end creators such as MTV, Disney, Nike to make holograms for video application.


  • Qualifications:



    • This is a relatively self-driven role

    • We need someone that is used to dealing with real time hardware systems and gathering and integrating data from that and controlling a system like that.

    • Computer Science Degree is preferred

    • Disqualifiers: Too much JAVA is not good; database applications would be a red flag because the coding there is high level and not close enough to working with the hardware.

    • This person needs to have experience optimizing programs that work with hardware/components and paying attention to performance, they will need to be aware of the bottlenecks in the system

    • Best vs. Average: Somebody that has worked in a production studio, worked for capture systems and have been exposed to content production a video stage or motion capture stage.

    • Performance Measures: A successful performer will provide robust solutions and minimal revisions would be a high performer; understanding or ability to work with production clients that may not be technical at all, like a director listen to them and what they need and be able to interpret that and help them meet their need. There will be a social component to this and to the right candidate it will be very appealing, it would be a bad fit for a lot of engineers.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for talented, fast, and reliable manual testers (both part-time and full-time) who want to work for a young, unstructured, and exciting startup who happen to have amazing and awesome clients located all over the world.

Extra tags: qa, engineer, digital nomad

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Equate Media is looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the science of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX wireframes to working code to produce the visual elements of the application. You will work very closely with designers and back-end developers to bridge the gap between the aesthetic vision and the technical implementation.


Responsibilities

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Wanted


Exceptional professional with 2+ years of experience, solid programming skills, and a knowledge of database concepts to improve our existing technical systems.



Job Location


Rural Kenya



Duration


Minimum 2 years commitment, full-time job.



Job Description 


One Acre Fund relies on a home-grown Client Management Information System to help us manage our field program information. As we grow our organization, we need to continually improve this system and facilitate its integration with third party tools. Currently our Client Management Information System handles the enrollment of 180,000-300,000 smallholder farmers spread over multiple countries, records farm supply orders, manages the delivery of seed, fertilizer, and solar lights to clients, tracks millions of payment transactions, and creates a wide variety of business intelligence reports.



Given poor internet connectivity, our database uses a distributed client/server model where field offices can perform data entry and run reports offline while syncing with a central server as needed.  On the backend the technologies used are SQL server 2014 with merge replication to field offices, while on the front end we use MVC.Net, Breeze.js and Angular.js. As we are growing, we are looking to: 



  • Improve our existing tools to capture a wide variety of program configurations per country and provide functionality for a multitude of field product and process innovations  

  • Provide central management and reporting tools while maintaining a focus on field usability 

  • Build out efficient bulk data entry functionality with a heavy focus on data quality control, as well as field-facing mobile and tablet data entry, and reporting where appropriate 


The Developer will be based in Western Kenya. S/he will be responsible for the following: 



  • Field-facing mission-critical Program Management System: 

  • Participate in the continued development of our mission-critical custom database which impacts every aspect of operations 

  • Develop features which allow for flexibility in the way individual countries run their operations, while still focusing on reusability across countries 

  • Maintain a long-term perspective when faced with urgent operational demands 

  • Focus on simplicity and usability for our local staff 

  • Work together with our small team of developers 

  • Maintain coding standards and participate in peer code reviews 

  • Technology experimentation: Experiment with a variety of technologies to improve operations. Investigate appropriate solutions for deploying upgrades, database scaling and interacting with 3rd party software providers 

  • Operational insight: Become familiar with every aspect of our field operations and identify areas for improvement in the tools we develop to support the field. 

  • Other tasks: We are a young organization that is growing rapidly, which means all staffers pitch in to ensure we are providing the very best support and services to both our team and clients. 



Career Growth and Development 


One Acre Fund invests in building management and leadership skills. Your manager will invest significant time in your career development. We provide constant, actionable feedback delivered through mentorship and through regular management consulting-style career reviews. We also have regular one-on-one meetings, where we listen to and discuss career goals, and work collaboratively to craft roles that each person can be passionate about.  Because of our rapid growth, we constantly have new high-level roles opening up and opportunities in many functions. This results in fast career growth for our staff. 



Qualifications 


We are seeking exceptional professionals with 2+ years of work experience.  Candidates who fit the following criteria are strongly encouraged to apply: 



  • Solid programming skills. C#/MVC.Net/Breeze.js/Angular.js preferable, but not required 

  • Knowledge of database concepts and SQL/Linq 

  • Very strong self-manager. After an initial six-month period of heavy mentorship, supervision will consist of 1 weekly check-in. We need someone who is very well-organized and can manage their work independently 

  • Work or internship experience in a professional environment; ideally 2+ years of work experience 

  • Willingness to commit to the position for at least 2 years 

  • Experience living in a developing country desired, but not a requirement  

  • Humility. We are looking for passionate professionals who combine strong technical skills with good humor, patience, and a humble approach to service 

  • Language: English required, French is a plus 



Preferred Start Date 


Flexible 



Compensation 


Starts modest. However, this is a career-track role with fast raises for performance, paying a meaningful salary for long-term placement in developing nations. 



Benefits 


Health insurance, immunizations, flight, room and board. 



Sponsor International Candidates 


Yes 



East Africans Encouraged to Apply

jobs.title: Senior R&D Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We have a role in our TCAD Mesh Generation Group that would suit a talented software engineer/scientist looking to develop exciting applications used by international blue chip corporations, research institutions and universities worldwide.


The candidate will help the group develop new technologies in the Sentaurus product line. The responsibilities for this position include the design, development, troubleshooting and maintenance of medium to large software projects written in C++. This will also include maintaining structure generation code in Sentaurus Process and Process Explorer, as well as developing code for new applications.

jobs.title: Sr. Sales Engineer
jobs.content:
SYNOPSYS is revolutionizing the development of secure and reliable software. SYNOPSYS Sales Engineers pioneer with customers in such technology breakthroughs as the Curiosity Mars Rover and Large Hadron Collider.
As a SYNOPSYS Sales Engineer, you would lead customers to success in three key areas:

Technical sales support: You identify target requirements by building personal rapport with potential customers; you deliver presentations, demonstrations and proofs-of-concept for SYNOPSYS products, services and solutions to potential customers.
Technical account management: You maintain and improve customer satisfaction; you drive deployments of SYNOPSYS solutions to enterprise-wide adoption with customers.
Thought leadership: You represent SYNOPSYS at conferences and seminars; you discuss SYNOPSYS industry-leading technology with peers, prospects and customers.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Back End
jobs.content:
The Brightcove engineering culture is tailored to software professionals who enjoy solving challenging product development problems. The team you'll be joining is a small, self-organized Agile group. We use a light-weight development process that balances craftsmanship with execution.  We strive to build engaging products with features that will delight our customers.

Our team takes pride in achieving high uptimes and quality-of-service with low operational overhead.  Team-members double as experts in operating the systems that they build.  We are continuously shipping code -- several times a day.  Everyone is encouraged to contribute to meeting our operational goals through robust, scalable designs, software quality, customer-facing service metrics, and DevOps automation.


THE ROLE


We’re looking for a developer to help us transform the Video Cloud content management system into a scalable, cloud-based platform with rich, developer-friendly APIs.  The Brightcove CMS holds the central catalog of information for Brightcove’s flagship Video Cloud product.  This CMS is a high-performance metadata management repository with integrated search capabilities.  You’ll be on a team responsible for designing, developing, and operating a fault-tolerant, low-latency system that currently handles over 5M updates and nearly 200M reads each day, with peak rates of around 5k writes and 10k reads per second. Our throughput continues to grow, having nearly doubled year-over-year for the past few years.

We look for people people we can learn from; people who are creative, passionate, and curious; and people who know how to get things done.



ABOUT YOU



  • You have 3+ years of experience building large applications in multiple languages (We mostly use Java/Groovy, with some Ruby, Python, and Node.js sprinkled in).

  • You have experience developing and deploying software at high scale.

  • You understand the basics of scalable SaaS systems.

  • You are familiar with Linux, basic SaaS security, Amazon EC2, REST, and API design.

  • You understand the principles of software craftsmanship. You write clean code, even when working on extremely hard problems. You unit test everything

  • You’re familiar with different types of data stores for handling large volumes of data with high levels of traffic.  We’d love to talk to you about the tradeoffs between in-house and hosted Mongo solutions, Dynamo/Cassandra/Riak, and when and how to use different kinds of caching.


ABOUT US


We offer a fun work environment, regular hack weeks, competitive compensation, stock options, 401k matching, and tuition reimbursement.  Our offices are located downtown, right on Fort Point harbor, with a fully stocked kitchen, ping pong and foosball tables.  We also offer unlimited vacation — and expect you to use it.


We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Software Engineer- Golang
jobs.content:
We are looking for talented back end engineers who want a new challenge in the Online Video space. Video experience is not a necessity, but certainly will help.


You:



  • Want to build high throughput, high resilience media delivery systems against a tight deadline.

  • Have mastered at least one static language and one dynamic language. You want to learn go (golang), and you’ll be able to start producing high quality code in an aggressive timescale.

  • Work as part of a highly distributed team, out of an office in central London.

  • Have a deep understanding of building resilient HTTP based cloud applications, in particular on AWS: EC2, S3, DynamoDB, SQS, SNS.

  • Have mastered building RESTful APIs.

  • Love TDD and BDD.


The Project:



  • A greenfield distributed, microservice oriented approach to media packaging and delivery.

  • Uses cutting edge tools for deployment including Docker, CoreOS, and Fleet.


Us:



  • Industry leader in online video delivery.

  • Competitive pay and benefits package.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Engineer for an Outdoors Media Startup
jobs.content:
RootsRated is on a mission to power outdoor discovery.


We are looking for a dynamic and driven individual to join the software engineering team at a rapidly growing organization. As the fastest growing media property in the outdoors space, RootsRated is positioned to create the most comprehensive and trusted resource for outdoor recreation in the United States.


This role reports to the CTO. A successful Software Engineer at RootsRated is excited about the challenge of creating both consumer- and business-facing products. Recognizing the stage and trajectory of RootsRated, a successful candidate will thrive in ambiguous and resource-constrained environments (doing more with less).


We're a small team with huge ideas, and we're steadfast on holding to some core practices that help us deliver high impact products, including:



  • Taking on individual ownership over features and projects

  • Saying "no" to shiny objects

  • Using data to drive feature priority

  • Being cognizant of technical debt and diligent about test coverage

  • Shipping regularly to test hypotheses


What you'll be asked to do:



  • Contribute valuable expertise to a highly-motivated and agile team

  • Play a key role in all parts of the product lifecycle: brainstorming, design, prototyping, planning, implementation, testing, launch, and support

  • Demonstrate productivity in a variety of work environments: independently, under direction, and in paired-programming

  • Have a passion for growing your skills, but also lifting the skills and expertise of those around you

  • Exercise flexibility in achieving tasks and priorities across multiple codebases

  • Excel at both providing and receiving code reviews

  • Develop novel features for creating, organizing, distributing and analyzing content across multiple platforms

  • Build and refine RootsRated’s platforms to house and discover content beautifully and creatively


Benefits:



  • Unlimited Vacation

  • Health/Dental (50/50)

  • The equipment you need to be successful

  • Outdoor apparel and equipment Pro Deals

  • Amazing open workspace with outdoor firepit

jobs.title: Front End Developer - Media  / Technology - DC or Reston, VA
jobs.content:
The Washington Post is hiring a Developer for our site team (washingtonpost.com). On the Site Team, you’ll play an integral and varied role in the future of digital storytelling; from presenting our content and data to our users on the web to packaging our content across a variety of distribution channels.  Sample projects are:




  • Apple News

  • Progressive Web App

Responsibilities:




  • Spending 75% of the time writing code, and the other 25% getting feedback from customers, deciding which features to build and how, and sharing your great work
