  • To contribute to best practice for Java application development at the BBC

  • To write unit and integration tests, within automated test environments to ensure code quality

  • To assist in defining the team's technical strategy and advising on product roadmaps and migration plans to achieve strategic goals

  • To liaise with the principal engineers and technical architect

  • To automate the entire deployment process on all environments

jobs.title: Director of Software Development
jobs.content: Something Digital is seeking a Director of Software Development to oversee a staff, process, and P&L for an experienced software development practice, as part of a larger technology professional services firm. Candidates must be prepared to oversee the building of custom software in the Microsoft stack (.Net, SharePoint, Dynamics CRM), manage teams and processes, and support sales and marketing initiatives specific to their practice group. Role will report to the Principal and Founder.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re hiring senior back-end engineers for our Seattle office, who are passionate about technology and education, to help build out our online video platform (Arc) for interactive learning. Our product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together. We highly value innovation, so much so that we have quarterly Hackweeks. A week each quarter to work on relevant pet projects and features. Woohoo! Most of our work is open source, even our primary product (Canvas). Check us out on Github: www.github.com/instructure.


This position is based in Seattle, and is not a remote opportunity. Our Seattle office is located downtown in the Westlake Center, 1601 5th Avenue.

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Instructure was founded to define, develop, and deploy superior, easy-to-use software. (And that’s what we did / do / will keep on doing.) We are dedicated to the fight against iffy, mothbally, shoddy software. We make better, more usable tools for teaching and learning (you know, stuff people will actually use). A better connected and more open edtech ecosystem. And more effective ways for everyone everywhere to access education, make discoveries, share knowledge, be inspired, and do big things. We accomplish all this by giving smart, creative, passionate people opportunities to create awesome. So here’s your opportunity. We’re hiring engineers who are passionate about technology and education. The product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together. Most of our work is open source, even our primary product. We are also changing how teachers and students interact, whether in small groups or with tens of thousands of students in one course. Check out our online courses on Canvas Network. So…if you like front-end development, back-end development, or some combination of these, let's talk. There are lots of interesting, complex, and challenging problems that will leverage your skills; oh, and new things come up every day. There will be a technical interview with lots of white board action (but no silly puzzles or trick questions). We may even have you code up a simple app to demonstrate your abilities.


Join us at our downtown Chicago office. Address: 1 Prudential Plaza, 130 E. Randolph St. Suite 1800, Chicago, IL 60601


Remote option is only available for US authorized workers who currently reside in the US with proven success in working remotely.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Agile Java - Javascript - Web Developer
jobs.content:
Scoutahead is looking to add an agile Java developer to help change the way people get information.


Scoutahead’s engineering team is building a next-generation platform for anyone to get accurate information about what really matters to them. We take pride in our work and are focused on delivering a product that users will love. Our engineers are involved in every aspect of the product lifecycle from conception through design and execution. We care about the details because details separate merely good ideas from excellent and successful products. We believe in delivering innovative products that never compromise on privacy, security, or morality.

jobs.title: Expert Android Developer
jobs.content:
The COBI Software Team is looking for a smart & experienced Android Developer who is hungry to take on responsibility at our rapidly growing start-up. Our team of top notch experts works full-stack across embedded, mobile (iOS & Android) and the cloud to ensure a seamless interplay. The candidate lives & breathes Android and will work closely not just with developers in the Software team, but also with our conceptual- and visual designers to meet the highest levels of quality and polish for the Android app that is only enabled by deep collaboration.


What connects us is a passion for cycling, digital technology and good design as well as the desire to try out new things and always question the status quo. We want to make a difference and put ourselves at the forefront of a new movement.


COBI has established a brand new market segment, of which we are the leader. Our partners value this and want to take advantage of this. All of our marketing activities are aimed at making COBI touchable and tangible. We scrutinize every action to ensure that it delivers the COBI experience – whether by trying it out, listening to experiences from others or from a trusted partner. The user, rather than technology, is our key priority.


The ideal candidate will have a great passion for COBI and execute all activities with respect to the COBI brand strategy.


COBI is based in Frankfurt am Main/Germany.




PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Participate in the planning process for new app features and explore Android-specific opportunities to improve the COBI experience on Android (e.g. Android Wear).

  • Plan, build and test features according to existing API- and User Interface designs.

  • Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Participate in the COBI App (Google Play Store) and COBI SDK (Github) architecture, release and deployment lifecycle.



REQUIREMENTS:



  • BS/BA in Computer Science or Software Engineering, or equivalent experience.

  • 3 years of experience with developing and debugging apps on the Android platform.

  • Experience with building adaptive layouts and fluid UI animations

  • Experience with WebService communication, clean application architectures and Android / Unit Tests

  • Must be motivated, organized, and able to communicate effectively and handle several tasks at one time.

  • Must have the ability to communicate complicated or difficult information clearly and diplomatically. With all levels of employees; written and verbal communications must be polished and diplomatic.

  • Must have ability to adapt, to change and be open to new ideas and taking on new responsibilities.

  • Must be adept at handling pressure and uncertainty and adjusting work plans to meet changing company/department needs.



If you do awesome work and are awesome to work with, please find out more about us on www.cobi.bike and get in touch with Jana Wardag (jobs@cobi.bike).

jobs.title: Software Dev/Tech Lead
jobs.content:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for a full stack Software Developer / Technical Lead with an interest in building dynamic, data-driven products to join a growing developer team for one of the globe’s most trusted brands.  For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions.  While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.


The developers at U.S. News have a great deal of independence and a minimum of overhead. This individual will get to experiment with interesting technology and see their work enter production regularly.


The key things we’re looking for in a new hire are excellent problem solving abilities as well as the technical skills to work with relational databases such as PostgreSQL, write legible code, familiarity with languages such as Python or Java, and strong oral and written communication skills.


We have a diverse environment, with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X machines living side-by-side.  The majority of our work is in developing and maintaining applications on Python web frameworks, specifically Pylons and Pyramid, although we also maintain some applications in Java and PHP.


Our applications support just about every aspect of company operations, including content management for the usnews.comwebsite, iPad/tablet apps, data ranking products such as Best Colleges/Grad schools and Best Hospitals, and other business applications.  Developers typically see applications through from beginning to end, working directly with project owners to gather business requirements, front-end engineers to make sure the UI is functional and fast, and the systems team to ensure stress-free deployments.


We offer a casual work environment.  Our offices are in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington, D.C.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for a full-time DevOps Engineer to streamline our Continuous Integration/Delivery processes and tools to help deliver dynamic, data-driven products for one of the globe’s most trusted brands.


As a DevOps Engineer, your role will be to bridge the Web Systems/Operations & Development teams to improve our build, integration & deployment procedures, automated build pipeline and CI/CD systems.


About US News


For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions.  While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.


We have a diverse environment, with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X machines living side-by-side.  The majority of our development effort involves building & maintaining web applications on Python & Java.


Our applications support just about every aspect of company operations, including content management for the usnews.com website, data ranking products such as Best Colleges/Grad schools and Best Hospitals, and other business applications. 


We offer a casual work environment.  Our offices are in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington, D.C.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for a junior/mid-level, front-end developer with significant full-stack ability to join our growing developer team building data-driven products for one of the globe’s most trusted brands. For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions. While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.

This position requires expert knowledge of front-end development and web standards as well as comfort working with backend technologies. The successful candidate will become an influential member of a passionate and friendly team that creates web applications that reach millions of visitors monthly.

Duties include:
• Working with editors, web producers, graphic artists, and programmers to create innovative online features and interactive tools.
• Developing web-based applications, components, and visualizations from conceptual page plans in Photoshop.
• Crafting flexible templates for custom Python and Java-based applications.
• Integrating and troubleshooting code from third-party content and e-commerce partners.
• Applicants will be required to provide code demonstrating a clear separation of content, presentation, and behavior.

Required skills and experience for this position:
• Expert knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
• A good eye for layout and typography; you won’t be designing, but you will be tweaking.
• Strong oral and written communications skills.
• Experience with one or more server-side languages such as Python or Java.

Strongly preferred but not required:
• Experience with responsive or mobile optimized website development.
• Experience working in a Unix/Linux environment.
• Experience with one or more rich-client frameworks, such as Backbone, Ember, Knockout, etc.
• Experience with client-side benchmarking and performance tuning.
• Server-side templating languages like TAL, JSTL, Jinja, Velocity, Twig, etc.
• Postgres/MySQL or other open source database experience.
• Version control/source control systems such as Git.

This is a full-time, regular position. Work will be done onsite at our offices in the Georgetown area of Washington, DC, using state-of-the-art Macintosh desktops with Adobe Creative Suite and your favorite editor. Occasional night and weekend work required.

The USNews.com tech team is a made up of very skilled individuals who are passionate about Web development. Successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on a large, public site for a widely known and respected brand. An ideal candidate will be able to contribute immediately and will both learn from us and teach us a few new things.

Applicants must submit a resume to be considered, a cover letter is appreciated.

We are offering a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package that includes healthcare, dental, and 401(k) plan.

EOE
M/F/D/V

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for a full stack Software Developer with an interest in building dynamic, data-driven products to join a growing developer team for one of the globe’s most trusted brands. For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions. While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.

The developers at U.S. News have a great deal of independence and a minimum of overhead. You'll get to experiment with interesting technology and see your work enter production regularly.

The key things we’re looking for in a new hire are excellent problem solving abilities as well as the technical skills to work with relational databases such as PostgreSQL, write legible code, familiarity with languages such as Python or Java, and strong oral and written communication skills.

We have a diverse environment, with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X machines living side-by-side. The majority of our work is in developing and maintaining applications on Python web frameworks, specifically Pyramid, although we also maintain some applications in Java.

Our applications support just about every aspect of company operations, including content management for the usnews.com website, iPad/tablet apps, data ranking products such as Best Colleges/Grad schools and Best Hospitals, and other business applications. Developers typically see applications through from beginning to end, working directly with project owners to gather business requirements, front-end engineers to make sure the UI is functional and fast, and the systems team to ensure stress-free deployments.

We offer a casual work environment. Our offices are in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington, D.C.

Qualifications:
Applicants should be familiar with:
• Relational databases, such as PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL, or MS SQL Server.
• Dynamic languages, such as Python, Perl, or Ruby.
• Unix-based operating systems, such as Linux or Mac OS X, along with the shells and command-line tools available in those environments.

• Applicants should have strong oral and written communications skills.
• A 4-year degree is a plus.
• Experience with Python web frameworks, such as Django or Pyramid is a plus.
• Experience with source control systems, such as Git or Subversion, is a plus.
• Experience developing against and/or creating JSON based APIs is a plus.
• AJAX experience is a plus.

Applicants must submit a resume to be considered, a cover letter is appreciated.

We are offering a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package that includes healthcare, dental, and 401(k) plan.

EOE
M/F/D/V

jobs.title: Web Designer, Branded Content
jobs.content:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for a talented and imaginative Web Designer. He or she will primarily focus on designing concepts for branded content, but will also work on other custom ad formats, from display units, to interactives. In this position, this designer will work closely with the sales, marketing and dev teams to create beautiful, practical and functional content and ad experiences. Our new designer must have a keen, evolving eye for design, coupled with sensitivity to user needs and behaviors. Strong organizational and communication skills, plus attention to detail are imperative. Those who thrive with deadlines and multitasking are welcome. This person will report to the managing editor of branded content at U.S. News.

Duties Include:
• Work hand-in-hand with the managing editor of branded content on compelling storytelling concepts from a visual perspective.
• Develop concepts for data visualization, infographics, art or motion graphics and assist in bringing them to life.
• Work with engineering counterparts as needed to clarify requirements and solve design challenges
• Create wireframes, high-fidelity mock-ups, specifications and other UI design documents
• Work with sales and marketing to create banner ads, microsites and other sales collateral

Qualifications:
• Excellent graphic design skills (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign)
• Proficient with HTML and CSS
• Experience with Javascript, SCSS is a plus
• An online portfolio of your work

Why you want this job...
• Your work matters. The design work you do here will have a direct impact on our bottom line and your opinions will help shape content and products used by those making crucial life choices every day.
• Variety. No two days working on sales materials are the same, and the opportunities to be creative, innovative and forward-thinking are legion.
• Great work environment. You will have talented co-workers to learn from and laugh with, you’ll keep sane hours and have interesting projects to work on.
Work will be done on-site at either our Georgetown-area offices of Washington, DC, or in the New York office near Wall Street.
• Compensation based on experience.
• We are offering a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package that includes healthcare, dental, vision and 401(k) plan.

Please submit a resume, cover letter and your portfolio to be considered.

EOE

M/F/D/V

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for a Full Stack Software Developer for our content management development team.
You would be responsible for helping build the next generation of content & data driven web products ranging from Best Colleges to our Doctor Finder.

For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions. While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.

The key things we’re looking for in a new hire are excellent problem solving abilities as well as the technical skills to work with relational databases such as PostgreSQL, write legible code, familiarity with languages such as Java or Python, and strong oral and written communication skills.

We have a diverse environment, with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X machines living side-by-side.
Our applications support just about every aspect of company operations, including content management for the usnews.com website, iPad/tablet apps, data ranking products such as Best Colleges/Grad schools and Best Hospitals. Developers typically see applications through from beginning to end, working directly with project owners to gather business requirements, front-end engineers to make sure the UI is functional and fast, and the systems team to ensure stress-free deployments.

jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.content:
Account Manager Position
We’re Strand, a high tech B2B marketing agency, who are growing and looking for a marketing communications professional to join our dynamic team. As an Account Manager at Strand you’ll work as part of a fast-paced client services team and will be responsible for managing project work, while attaining the campaign goals for each client. The skills we’re looking for include marcom coordination, project management, some technical knowledge, PR and social media creation/execution, and inbound campaign coordination. Familiarity with HubSpot, marketing automation, Google Analytics, Adwords are a plus, and experience with B2B technology will get you on the short list.

We’re looking for someone who has an entrepreneurial spirit and has a passion for learning our client’s technology. If you are looking to be part of a collaborative team, work for a company where your input is valued, and play a part in the company’s growth strategy we may be your next move.

Responsibilities:
• Client relations
• Project management
• Writing and/or coordinating press releases and blogs
• Developing media and social connections
• Maintaining content roadmaps
• Managing clients social channels
• Documenting and tracking editorial success
• Pitching client editorial ideas to journalists
• Compiling monthly client status reports and evaluate against targeted goals

Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Public Relations, or Business Administration
• 2 or more years of experience in related field, preferably in an agency environment
• High social media and PR competency
• HubSpot experience or other marketing automation software
• Knowledge and understanding of Google Analytics and AdWords
• Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), well organized, detail oriented and able to understand direction and follow through on deliverables.

Sound like a job for you? Please send your resume to kbstrand@strandmarketing.com

We look forward to hearing from you.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you a senior UI engineer looking to make a big impact on a high profile project?


Ai is a leading interactive strategy, design, and development agency. We are looking for driven, self-motivated coders that are able to understand business problems and translate these into technical solutions. Ideal candidates should have concept-to-launch experience building scalable and secure transactional web applications. 


As a senior UI engineer you will be leading the design and construction of the interface interactivity of our clients’ sites through the masterful use of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and other related front-end technologies. You will own the technical front-end direction and collaborate with backend developers, information architects, business analysts and visual designers. 


Our typical engagement size and the size of our teams makes it possible for all team members to craft and shape the experiences we produce, with the full support of the leads and directors. The flexibility of our process makes for happy clients and the unusual ability to produce exactly the work you envision. If you want to make a real difference on a project, this is your dream role.


Off projects, you will be expected to teach your colleagues something they didn’t know in an area you are excited about. Is mobile app development your fantasy? How about responsive markup or rich, cross-browser compliant animations? Show us what you’ve got.

jobs.name: Boston Business Journal's Best Place to Work 2016

jobs.title: Director of Infrastructure
jobs.company: Boston Business Journal's Best Place to Work 2016
jobs.content:
At Motus, we are passionate about leveraging technology to make work-life better for mobile workers and their managers. Our cloud-based mobile technology streamlines administrative tasks, provides fair and accurate reimbursements, mitigates risk, and offers actionable data insights—all designed to allow the mobile workforce the freedom to allocate their time in ways that make them happiest.


The Motus Technology team is looking for an experienced, creative Director of Infrastructure to manage our application systems and tools. In this role, you will report directly to our VP of Technology, manage our DevOps engineers, and work closely with the Development and QA teams. You will be responsible for continuing to improve the reliability, security, and productivity of our production and staging, and development systems.


We run our systems on a cutting edge platform using AWS, Apache Mesos, Mesosphere Marathon and Chronos, and Docker.  We use Puppet, Terraform, and Ansible to manage our platform.  Experience with some or all of these technologies is extremely valuable in this position.


What You'll Do:



  • Build, develop, and manage a high-performing infrastructure and DevOps team to meet the needs of a rapidly growing and changing business in an even more rapidly changing technology landscape.

  • Architect and implement a security environment to manage sensitive information across the organization.

  • Enhance automation and processes to enable teams to deploy, manage, configure and scale their applications internally and at AWS, including SLA's, 24x7 monitoring, alerting and incident response.

  • Continuously improve our visibility into our systems and applications with advanced monitoring, metrics and log analytics.

  • Actively participate in high-level team activities such as suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements and conducting tool evaluations.

  • Design, implement, and facilitate an annual infrastructure plan.

  • Manage infrastructure projects on and to budget.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Burberry’s IT teams cover diverse strategic and innovative specialisms, from media production and broadcasting to in-house software development, information analytics and enterprise software (SAP) implementation and support.  The teams collaborate in seamless partnership to build, deliver and enable pioneering mobile and socially-enabled user-centric solutions. Each team engages with all areas of the business in a highly agile and fast-paced environment to both drive and respond to continuous change and consistently blend the boundaries between the physical and the digital.


THE OPPORTUNITY:


The IT Solutions team deliver internal and consumer facing web applications for use on the web, mobile and in-store.  Burberry constantly looks to deliver innovative user experiences, creating a consistent flow of interesting and challenging work for our developers.


We are looking for strong Front End Developers to join our growing team to deliver large scale web applications. You will join a culture that fosters innovative thinking, enabling the development and delivery of internal tooling and components used in the delivery of projects. The team are focused on streamlining common project tasks to allow prioritisation of new and interesting challenges.


With a curiosity and openness to use new and relevant cutting edge technology, we offer a rewarding working environment for those looking to develop in an entrepreneurial and innovative environment.


THE TEAM:



  • Build applications using backbone.js + internal packages

  • Use node.js for internal tools and are looking at isomorphic architectures for future projects

  • Deliver Hybrid Applications using Cordova

  • Use PaaS (Heroku, Google App Engine, Docker) and IaaS (AWS)

  • Have a strong peer review culture  aiding code quality and enabling knowledge share

  • Move Developers across multiple projects contributing common components 

  • Focus on testing.  They unit test using jasmine and have a dedicated test team that functionally test the applications using our internal device lab.

jobs.title: iOS Developer - freelance
jobs.content:
Adaptive Lab is a digital product and service design agency. We’re looking for an iOS Developer to join one of our projects 22nd August until the end of October, on-site here in our office in Old Street, London, with an extension likely. It’s working with a startup client of ours, iterating on a live product within the contacts management space. The team comprises of a lead Product Manager, 2 PHP Developers, and support from our Lead Technologist.



Day rate around £450-550/day depending on experience. 




Since 2009 we’ve been partnering with ambitious leaders at companies experiencing disruption, helping them to compete innovate and grow. We across a range of sectors (finance, telco, retail, media to name a few) with companies ranging from leading global corporations, to startups.



For us, speed, consistency, quality, focus and user-centricity are the main attributes we think about when trying to improve as software developers and get things done. We care about code quality, code style, test coverage, readability, maintainability, robustness, delivering on time and delivering the right thing. You can read more about technology at Adaptive Lab here: http://tech.adaptivelab.com/#our-culture.



Interview process: a couple of conversations (at least one in person) with the team, and a look at some of your previous code.

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer who can support a small team of engineers and develop automated tests that we can rely on to ensure our new code is safe to release.


Do you take joy in spotting what others miss? We are looking for someone who understands how frustrating it is when things don’t work right; who feels it is their duty to protect the world from bad code.


We want an engineer who understands how to build automated tests that are reliable and easy to maintain.


Responsibilities:



  • Support a team of engineers, acting as gatekeeper for their changes

  • Build and maintain automated test suites for multiple web based products

  • Identify areas of risk and develop appropriate test plans

  • Perform investigation of escalated issues

  • “Fight for the user”


Minimal Requirements:



  • 3 Years of QA or Support Engineering

  • 1 Year QA Automation Engineering

  • Incredible attention to detail

  • Clear communication skills

  • Experience with Scrum a plus


Preferred Skills:



  • Watir

  • Selenium

  • Ruby

  • Web Console

  • CSS

  • Javascript

  • Git


About our Engineering Department


All of our developers are full-stack and work closely with Product, Design and QA teams to deliver features to about 45-55k users per day. Here is some of what you can expect working here:



  • Autonomy. Developers are organized into autonomous teams of 2-4 developers and have a lot of control over how they collaborate, communicate, and generally work.

  • Agility. Teams practice scrum, work in sprints, calculate velocity, do code reviews and rely on Continuous Integration.

  • Diversity. Women make up roughly a third of our team, and we have people from all over the world on our team. It’s part of what makes our culture great.

  • Craftsmanship. We have excellent engineers spanning all skill levels, and we all are committed to becoming better at our craft. We practice Lunch & Learns and mentorship.

  • Stewardship. We are big proponents of open source, use it a lot, and give back to the community wherever we can.


Perks


We truly care about our people, and as such are strong believers in having fun at work, continuing education and work/life/family balance. We demonstrate that in the followings ways:




  • Competitive Pay. We hire excellent people and reward them accordingly.




  • Flexible Work Hours. If you work better evenings than mornings, that’s fine by us!




  • One Paid Conference per year (includes hotel and airfare).




  • DashCon. An internal yearly conference showcasing our engineering culture.




  • 10% time per week to invest in open source or self-education.




  • Great benefits. Health, dental, vision, 401k, and more.




  • Parties! We can fly you out for our company-wide get-togethers.




  • Good times guarantee. Board game nights and Bad-joke Wednesdays, our favorite perk ;-)

jobs.title: Rails Platform Lead Developer
jobs.content:
Surkus is a rapidly growing, well-funded, mobile-first platform where anyone can cast amazing people for events, parties, product launches, and a wide variety of exciting experiences. Surkus transcends traditional entertainment and on-demand staffing applications to allow clients nearly instant to talented, amazing people for real-world events.

We are experiencing tremendous growth and driving significant technology innovation in our space.

Ensuring continuous improvement in platform performance, reliability and scalability is critical to our continued success. You will be working with a team of top-notch developers with advanced skills in a variety of technologies to make major platform enhancements to achieve these objectives.

Experience with our core stack is helpful: Heroku, AWS, Postgres, Elasticsearch, React

We currently have offices in Hollywood and Santa Monica.


Benefits


  • Health insurance
  • Stock options

jobs.title: Senior Java Developers
jobs.content:
We are looking for developers who are proud of their code and who are willing to stand behind it every time. People who want to make Test Driven Development and metrics a part of their everyday development process with a focus on quality, elegant code, and superior standards. We want people who take an active interest in the technical community as a whole and who have a passion for what they do.


As a Senior Java Developer you will be developing a cutting edge API based web application, you will be provided with a working environment that is stimulating, challenging and rewarding.  Our focus is very much on constantly improving our development processes using agile development methodologies where developers are encouraged to design and develop systems in regularly delivered iterations and unnecessary documentation is minimized.


 If you want to influence, have the talent and ability to innovate with the best and the courage to stand up for quality then we want to talk to you.


Key responsibilities:



  • Develop, test and deliver highly performant and secure API based services

  • Working in a cross-functional agile team you will be developing features end-to-end across the software stack and responsible for all non-functional capabilities.

  • You will be expected to write elegant, simple code that lends itself to low cost maintenance, extensibility, testability and performance.

  • You will validate proposed approaches and explore new concepts using proof-of-concepts, wire frames and early experience prototypes.

  • Work within a Scrum with team members based in Ireland & India.

jobs.title: Woodworking & Cabinetmaking, Part-time Adjunct Pool
jobs.content:
Woodworking & Cabinetmaking, Part-time Adjunct Pool
Kern Community College District
Position Number: 01433
Open Until Filled: Yes
Rate: $60.00 per hour/ Instructional
College/Site: Bakersfield College
Location: BC-Main Campus

Benefits:
• Sick leave only.
• Not eligible for health benefits.

BASIC FUNCTION:
• This is an adjunct position assigned to the Bakersfield Community College Main Campus.
• The successful applicant will be expected to provide instruction in a full range of woodworking and cabinetmaking courses.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS :
• Any bachelor’s degree and two years of professional experience OR
• Any associate degree and six years of professional experience OR
• Possession of a valid credential which authorizes full-time teaching of woodworking at the California Community College level OR
• The equivalent. Certain combinations of education, experience, and other accomplishments in the field may be judged as equal to the stated minimum qualifications for these positions.
• A demonstrated sensitivity to students with diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural and ethnic backgrounds and students with disabilities.

**Candidates who feel they possess such equivalent qualifications must request and submit an http://www.kccd.edu/Human%20Resources/Employment%20Opportunities/Applications/HR%20Application%20for%20Equivalence%20WEB.pdf form.
Supporting documents must be included with the completed form.


KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES :
The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate that they are broadly prepared and have a depth of knowledge in the discipline. In addition, the successful applicant will be able to demonstrate the following knowledge and abilities:

• Ability to work effectively and harmoniously with colleagues in an environment that promotes innovation, teaching, learning and service to a diverse student population;
• Ability to effectively work with students with a wide range of skills, motivations, academic, and vocational goals;
• Ability to develop curriculum, including curriculum delivered via different modalities;
• Ability to participate in recruitment and articulation activities with local schools, colleges and universities;
• Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing;
• Demonstrated ability to maintain subject matter currency;
• Ability to assess student learning outcomes;
• Knowledge of computers and willingness to explore new technologies that would benefit the program;
• Knowledge of and commitment to the California community college mission;

Desirable Qualifications:
• Industrial and/or high school agriculture experience.
• Ability to provide leadership within the discipline and college initiatives to improve student learning.
• Ability and willingness to work effectively with college committees and other organizations and to be involved in co-curricular and extra-curricular activities


Completed application packet must include:
• Completed Online Application for Employment form
• Current resume
• Copies of legible transcripts
• List of six (6) professional references – Listed on application form

ADDITIONAL NOTES:
• Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to participate in the selection process should contact Human Resources to make the necessary arrangements.
The District does not provide sponsorship for authorization to work in the United States. Work authorization should be established at the time of application submission.
All applicants must apply online at http://apptrkr.com/858545. Emails will not be accepted.
• Degrees and credits must be from accredited institutions (Title V Section 53406).
Any degree from a country other than the United States, including Canada and Great Britain, must be evaluated by an evaluation service.
• The screening of candidates will be conducted by a screening committee. The screening committee reserves the right to limit the number of interviews granted. Meeting the minimum qualifications for a position does not assure the applicant of an interview.

As an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer, the Kern Community College District encourages candidates with diverse backgrounds to apply.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
You have already solid experience as a DevOps Engineer and would like to tackle a new challenge in an different environment? This is your chance!


Support our development and operations team in making our infrastructure even more robust and flexible. Help us to manage our mobile device cloud by enhancing the existing monitoring solution and automating as many administration tasks as possible.


Your responsibilities as Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f):



  • Design, setup and maintain our mobile device infrastructure

  • Drive the adoption of latest cloud hosting technologies

  • Consult us in making the TestObject cloud more scalable

  • Contribute to open source tools and frameworks we use on a daily base


Your Benefits:



  • An exciting and challenging job: You contribute to serious production grade software together with an experienced, friendly, agile team of developers and operations.

  • Benefits: You will be fully responsible for your projects and will receive a competitive salary alongside having the opportunity to directly impact our company’s success.

  • Team spirit: We are open-minded people and are happy to integrate new colleagues into our team. Team lunches, team events, after work … included.

  • Getting started: New in Germany or Berlin? We want you to feel at home here. We assist you with finding accommodation, obtaining a visa, learning German, and to establish your network in the Berlin Tech community.

jobs.title: Front End Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
The iCentris team is dedicated to developing beautiful, usable, and practical web applications for our clients. We’re highly collaborative fast paced environment utilizing a combination of agile and waterfall project management methodologies. We believe in customer validation early in the process, verifying solutions with real data, and running with our industry expertise. The team includes UI/UX design, Ruby on Rails developers, DBA’s and project/product management where everyone on the team is responsible for the success of our products and ensures we’re leading the MLM industry in technology.


We're seeking a Ruby on Rails developer with strong analytical and problem solving skills who can identify solutions a task level as well as at a product level. Candidates must be highly skilled with developing in HTML/CSS/JavaScript technologies.  The ideal profile combines deep experience in web design and strong understanding of implementing markup. You must be able to demonstrate prior experience on web sites you’re proud to show off for their functionality and polished UI, appropriate use of JavaScript and standard CSS best practices.

jobs.title: Senior C# Software Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Mapleton, Utah
URL: http://sourcecodepartners.com/

DESCRIPTION

Source Code Partners specializes in building business information systems for a variety of industries.  Our custom built systems range from stock market trading platforms to back office production management solutions. Our mission is to help companies gain a competitive advantage through cutting edge technology and information systems.

REQUIREMENTS

We are hiring a US based senior developer for our team.  The position will require maintaining and enhancing existing systems for our existing clients, as well as building new systems for new clients. 

As a senior developer, we expect:

  • Solid experience and understanding of our core technologies.
  • Projects be completed independently and in a timely fashion according to our development standards.
  • Ability to organize, lead, and mentor other team members.

The right candidate will have excellent communication skills to communicate with team members and clients.  Schedule flexibility for after-hours system deployment, on occasion, will be required. 

CORE TECHNOLOGIES WE USE
 
ASP.NET MVC
Razor View Engine
C#
Visual Studio
NUnit
RavenDB
HTML
CSS
Javascript
Git

BENEFITS

Flexible hours
Paid holidays and vacation
Competitive wages

To apply: Send cover letter and resume to tiffany@sourcecodepartners.com.

jobs.title: Lead programmer | Leading Gamestudio | VR and AR games
jobs.content:
We are looking for a talented Lead Programmer who is passionate about creating groundbreaking, state of the art VR and AR games and entertainment.


The lead programmer manages the tech team and all aspects of a project’s technical design, including engine, middleware and game systems. He or she works closely with the technical director and other stakeholders to define a project’s technical approach.


Key responsibilities



  • Define the technical design for the main elements of a project together with team members

  • Identify and help tackle the main risk area’s for a project

  • Co-operate in setting up the main technical systems for a project together with the team

  • Mentor, inspire and motivate the team to meet project quality levels and deadlines

  • Co-operate in the overall planning of a project. Be proficient and proactive in organizing and planning

  • Closely work with the leads of the other disciplines (Art & Design) and with the producer of the project

jobs.title: Junior Frontend-Developer
jobs.content:
You love developing web-apps and you are a die-hard frontend-nerd? You seek a position where you can learn how to build an innovative tech product? We can offer you a stellar team setting, the chance to quickly improve your skills, the newest technologies, 30 days of vacation and much more.


Requirements



  • You have have strong JavaScript skills

  • You have heard of React, redux and ES2015 (or willing to learn them)

  • You are familiar with HTTP, REST and web application development

  • You are up to date with and interested in the latest topics in frontend programming

  • You have worked with git and github before

  • You are interested in building dynamic and beautiful user interfaces


Your benefits


We value fairness and commitment and offer you space for your ideas. At the same time, transparency and constructive discussions are quite self-evident for us. As a fast growing successful start up we offer you full-time work, flexible working hours and a fair salary. Additional you will have young, international colleagues and an well located office in Berlin Kreuzberg. And on top anytime a friendly beer with the team.


About Civey


Civey is developing the first technology worldwide which allows everybody to start their own representative opinion poll. In real time and for free. We aim to provide every citizen, institution and company for the first time with high-quality opinion research data.


You’re curious and want to apply? We’re looking forward to your application including a complete CV and salary expectations.

jobs.title: Software Engineer  Data Integration
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Our Leipzig Software Engineering team is looking for a Software Engineer to help develop our data integration processes and data pipelines from ideation to realization.


Your responsibilities:



  • Design, implement and support data models and ETL processes in a big data architecture stack.

  • Continuously develop our big data architecture stack to ensure we stay ahead of the pack.

  • Write and document tests on your own code changes.

  • Monitor and fix issues in multiple environments and communicate with your team to ensure they are informed of any issues that occur.


Essential requirements:



  • 2-3 years’ experience in software engineering or data engineering.

  • 1-2 years’ experience working with big data.

  • An excellent understanding of MySQL.

  • The ability to work well independently, comfortable in your technical understanding of the problems you will be dealing with.

  • You can find patterns in, and draw valuable findings from, large amounts of data.

  • Good communication skills: you will keep all relevant stakeholders well informed of current progress.

  • You speak English (our company language) fluently.


Preferred requirements:



  • Some working knowledge of Pentaho Data Integration Platform, Hadoop and Spark.

  • German language skills.


Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Being an active member of our PHP, JavaScript, UI and data engineering guids.

  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.


Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: Senior System Administrator  Microsoft Exchange / Skype for Business
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Do you get a real kick from good server practices? Do you know Microsoft Exchange and Skype for Business as well as you know your own family? We’re looking for an expert System Administrator who can take responsibility for our internal communication tools to make sure that our 1,000 plus employees stay connected.





What you'll do:



  • Plan, design, implement and maintain Microsoft Exchange and Skype for Business solutions in our head office in Düsseldorf and our other branches all over the world to ensure that they’re working well 24/7.

  • Plan, design, implement and maintain our Asterisk servers which provide the connection between our internal Skype for Business systems and SIP providers.

  • Troubleshoot problems related to our Exchange and Skype for Business servers in our complex technical environment.

  • Stay up-to-date on industry updates to ensure that we stay ahead of the curve and suggest new projects we can develop to push our infrastructure forward.

  • Act as the in-house technical expert on all Exchange and Skype for Business issues, providing assistance to others in your team should they need it.



What you'll definitely need:



  • Around 5 years’ experience installing, monitoring and troubleshooting servers for Windows Server and Client System 2008R2/2012/7/8/10, Skype for Business/Lync and Microsoft Exchange 2013-2016.

  • Considerable experience working with Active Directory, scripting and networking.

  • A good understanding of best practices for private cloud security.

  • Good knowledge of SIP, RTP, etc.

  • Flexibility and adaptability: in the rare chance of a serious issue occurring outside of office hours, it may be necessary for you come into the office to resolve it.

  • A bachelor’s degree in an IT-related field (only necessary for non-EU applicants).



What we'd love you to have:



  • MCSE certifications in Communication and Messaging.

  • German language skills or the enthusiasm to learn the language.




Start date:



  • As soon as possible.




Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • Working at our head office in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.



Additional information:



  • Applicants from outside the EU must hold a bachelor’s degree in order to be considered for this position.

  • Please note that only online applications will be considered. Any paper applications that we receive will not be processed or returned.

  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: Software Engineer  Java Backend
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

trivago is looking for Software Engineers who are passionate about their craft, versatile and ambitious to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward!

We offer an international, results-driven, fun and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice!

Our engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users search for their ideal hotel at the best rate. Our ambitions reach far beyond just searching for hotels. Our product needs to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from a lot of different areas of computer science, including information retrieval, data processing, data storage, distributed computing, large-scale system design and many more; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a Software Engineer, you work on a small team and on many different projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves.
You will be a leader in the design, implementation and ownership of major modules and sub-systems. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, maintain and enhance software solutions.



Your responsibilities:



  • Build and maintain Java backend applications. Play a leading role in designing and implement new functionality and platform enhancements as needed.

  • Work closely together with members/stakeholders from other teams (BI, Product, etc.).

  • Be creative, challenge yourself and spread the word: contribute to one of our lovely open source projects.



Essential requirements:



  • Sc. in Computer Science or a related technical field.

  • 5+ years' experience in designing and developing large scale web applications.

  • You have demonstrated the ability to master object oriented development in (Core) Java (especially Java Concurrency). JEE experience is not relevant.

  • Extensive knowledge in software architecture, data structures and modern design patterns.

  • Extensive knowledge in building high performance, highly scalable, and fault-tolerant web applications.

  • Experience in using NoSQL technologies (Redis, Cassandra, etc.)

  • Analytical and problem solving skills.

  • Excellent communication skills and you speak English (our company language) fluently.



Preferred requirements:



  • A master's degree or PhD in Computer Science.



Life at trivago is...



  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.

  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hoursbased on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Living in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of lifein the world for expats.



Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.content:
Are you passionate about coding?

If Activities, Content Providers, Intents and Services sweeten your Marshmallow and you like to have a Lollipop with your coffee, send us an email with links to any of your published projects in the Play Store or Github repositories. Ideally, you have also gained experienced over time in some of the following fields: JSON, REST Webservices, NodeJS, unit testing and test automation, continuous integration, Git and Jenkins.

In this role your creativity and ambition is required, whether you apply it to smartphones, tablets or Google Wearables. Develop new concepts for our technologically sophisticated business applications! Contribute to the apps for DriveNow or Sixt, our internationally successful rent-a-car app!

You will get to interact with like-minded mobile experts in our own mobile development blog and on regular hacking days, giving you the chance to expand your knowledge of other platforms and technologies. We will provide you with a great working environment that of course includes lots of great coffee, Club Mate and foosball.


For our IT, software and web development departments in Pullach and Munich, we are currently looking to hire a highly motivated Android Engineer (m/f).


Your job – performs as smoothly as our cars:



  • You develop the Sixt rent-a-car, DriveNow and myDriver apps.

  • You have high standards in regard to quality, which is reflected in your Clean Code and efficient architecture.

  • You collaborate closely with product management and design teams in a proactive and fast-paced environment with flat hierarchies.

  • You evaluate new technologies and create new features based on your findings.

  • You communicate fluently in English and appreciate cultural diversity.



Your profile – your willingness to accelerate:



  • You are already a passionate Android developer?

  • You have extensive experience with Java and want to become an Android developer?

  • You completed a university degree, a relevant vocational education or have related work experience?

  • You have experience with Webservices, Persistence and Material Design?

  • You even know Retrofit, Picasso, Eventbus and ButterKnife?


Your perspectives – move your career to the fast lane:



  • We have a very diversified job for you!

  • We offer you great degrees of freedom!

  • We offer you international career development opportunities!

  • We work in a very dynamic working environment!

jobs.title: UI/UX Product Designer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Completely Remote
URL: http://meetedgar.com

Full time remote position, 40 hrs/week

We want to grow our product team by adding an accomplished visual designer with skills in both interface and user-experience design. (We wanted to grow our product team by sprinkling it with plant food, but that only upset people, so now we’re trying this.)

About You

First and foremost, you’re a problem solver - whether you’re identifying user goals, designing and redesigning an interface to perfection, or building a really complicated IKEA armoire, you love a good challenge. When you’re confronted with ideas as devilishly complex and messy as a big ball of Christmas lights, you know how to untangle them to create something straightforward, simple, and only a moderate fire hazard.

When it comes to our app, that means crafting an interface that makes the user experience as simple, enjoyable, and rewarding as possible, one iteration at a time. (Because nothing is ever perfect - except, maybe, Helvetica.) Like Tony Robbins speaking into a mirror, you’re self-motivated - you proudly take ownership of your work, but still love close collaboration with a team-tastic team. And while you can articulate your design rationale, you also aren’t afraid to be wrong sometimes - in fact, you thrive on feedback like a beautiful flower thrives on the delicious UV rays of Earth’s golden sun. (Ahhh, so inspirational!)

The sort of projects you’ll work on include:
  • Plotting the user onboarding experience
  • Designing a drag-and-drop queue interface
  • Polishing the subscription cancel flow
  • A/B testing features
  • Designing inline editing in the content library

Like the tenacious fire ant, our product team is small but mighty, and frequently ruins picnics. You’ll be joining them as our first full-time designer dedicated exclusively to MeetEdgar’s interface, working directly with our full-stack developers to breathe sweet life into your ingenious concepts.

In other words? You’ll have a major hand in defining the look and feel of a product used by thousands of small-business customers, with a significant sense of independence and ownership to go with it. As we keep on growing, you’ll find plenty of new opportunities to help us take our app to the next level both visually and functionally - heck, if we didn’t already work here, we know that’s what WE would want to be doing!

Job Deets Cheat Sheet

Your experience:
  • 4+ years designing web applications, shipped to production and enjoyed by zillions of happy users (or at least HALF a zillion)
  • Thorough understanding of the technical trade-offs and limitations of designing for the web
  • Masterful vector and raster design skills using the standard cadre of professional tools
  • Familiarity creating work at multiple fidelities, from high level wireframes down to pixel-perfect mockups and prototypes
  • A mind-blowing portfolio of well-reasoned design solutions
  • Ability to roll up your sleeves and translate your designs into production-worthy markup and styles using modern front-end dev tools and techniques (you can leave your sleeves unrolled if that’s more comfortable)

Minimum technical skills and important-sounding acronyms:
  • Modern HTML/CSS
  • Vanilla JS and jQuery
  • Some CSS preprocessor (Sass, Less, etc.)
  • Some version control
  • And some templating language (Haml, ERB, JSX, etc.)
  • Ability to deliver fully coded static mockups

Extra special bonus points for any of the following:
  • Deeper technical skills within our stack: React, Rails, Haml, ES6, Sass, and Github flow
  • Qualitative user research experience
  • Illustration skillz
  • Etch-a-Sketch expertise (demonstrate a perfect circle)

About Us

We’re a small team of 16-ish people, all working remotely across the US & Canada. We do a lot of collaborating and meme-swapping on Slack, along with virtual team meetings and super-futuristic video calls. We also do a twice-annual meetup week where we work together on cool projects all day and rock the karaoke mic all night.

We’re proudly bootstrapped and profitable, which means we get to turn down VC money a lot and keep doing things the way we like. We’re pretty serious about building and maintaining an awesome, positive company culture, so, you know, no jerks.

We'll probably get along if you’re someone who wants to be creative, have a pretty-serious-but-not-inhuman amount of responsibility, and work with people who make going to work not suck. (And be one of those people yourself. We like those people.)

You can find out more at http://meetedgar.com/careers/ and by watching this video (please watch it, it was mad expensive): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XvU3P43b0rQ

Benefits

(REMOTE POSITION. Applicants must be able to show documentation of eligibility to work in the USA.)

  • 4 weeks paid vacation (Shazam! And yes, everyone actually uses all 4 weeks)
  • Monthly cleaning service for your home - not that we don't have total faith in you
  • Paid home Internet service or coworking space/coffee shop working expenses
  • 75% of costs covered for health, dental, and vision for you and your fam
  • 401k with employer matching
  • An extra paid day off per quarter so you can volunteer in your community (awww)
  • New Mac laptop (#blessed)

To apply: Apply at https://docs.google.com/a/meetedgar.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScI9MNHqCEWP_fA0NLYMxDxVjMzruBjGgY2aNMUORH3wHjbIg/viewform?fbzx=9082129526503285000

Developer would be trained and mentored until comfortable with tasks. Platform interfaces with MS SQL databases, so working with SQL is essential, as well as Entity Framework and Linq to SQL.
