Programmer can expect to work on one to three projects at any given time. HTML and JS will be provided to them along with a functional and technical spec, a dedicated Project Manager and a senior developer for guidance. The programmer will generally lead the project from beginning to end

jobs.title: (Senior) Data Engineer f/m
jobs.content:
Smaato is expanding its product portfolio due to growth and demand within our industry. This is an opportunity to work for a world-class company providing an innovative platform product that could change the way the next generation understands advertising!

For our new SaaS platform, we are looking for an experienced Senior Data Engineer, who is passionate about processing large amounts of data. Currently, our cutting edge platform is processing an average of 3 billion inbound advertising queries per day. Each incoming request generates multiple outbound requests to our partners.

The Data Engineer is a technologist and innovator who brings passionate inquisitiveness, primary research, and forward thinking to every assignment. Daily activities will include developing solutions to User Story based requirements, mentoring more junior developers, engaging positively with the Scrum Team, building software to pass automated acceptance tests, and delivery of Sprint commitments. The Data Engineer will share responsibility for all team deliverables, and will favor informal communications with Product Owners and with other stakeholders within our company.

jobs.title: Sr. Security Engineer
jobs.content:
CloudPassage is all about securing private, public or hybrid cloud data and applications for our enterprise customers. They rely on our software-defined security platform to detect a wide range of vulnerabilities in near real time, protect their virtual systems by helping them react quickly to intrusions and deliver complete audit trails for compliance. Our platform is comprehensive, battle tested and super fast to implement since it’s delivered in a SaaS model.

What You Will Be Doing?

As a Security Engineer at CloudPassage you love to interact with customers, both current and potential.  You will provide direct support to our customers so you will quickly become very familiar with our products. You have excellent communication skills that demonstrate your personal professionalism and knowledge of software security.

Who are you?

You are mission-focused, highly team-oriented, have leadership skills and are able to help us build a strong customer service team. You love to work in a fast-pace and agile environment, love the entrepreneurial spirit and want to be part of ground-breaking new company.

Our customers use our product to deploy host-based network security, vulnerability management, compliance monitoring, system access management and intrusion detection on a variety of cloud provider environments. Our customers will look to you for authoritative guidance and answers as they adapt to cloud-based security management and migrate their technology and businesses to cloud hosting models.

The Details

Customer Management & Project Management

  • Manage the engagement operations which include, but is not limited to: project activities, status reporting, issue escalation, run rates and utilization tracking
  • Proactively identify and work to remove roadblocks that impact customer adoption of Halo
  • Drive the cadence for weekly, monthly and quarterly meetings with customer and CloudPassage key stakeholders.
  • Lead projects, training, meetings and working sessions as needed on each customer engagement
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with customers, key stakeholders, etc.
  • Brief customers on upcoming features and new capabilities of Halo.
  • Partner with internal teams (Customer Success, Product, DevOps, Engineering, QA, etc.) to provide CloudPassage’s full capabilities to customer
  • Track customer projects that involve Halo and identify new projects where Halo will enhance the customer efficiency in security operations

Technical Delivery

  • Be a technical subject matter expert on our solution and guide the customer to properly deploy, configure and maximize the use of our solution
  • Perform current state assessment and provide recommendations/best practices that address short and long-term goals utilizing Halo
  • Assist customers in applying Halo capabilities to their critical security control systems on a large scale and across a variety of environments.
  • Design and help develop methods for large scale installation and operational integration to customers’ security operations.
  • Assist customers in the on-boarding process, automating installation using popular orchestration tools like Chef for Puppet.
  • Coordinate resolution to customer requests, issues, questions, etc. in a timely manner.
  • Assist with developing technical content and policies for best practices.
  • Assist customers with REST API integrations between our product and security operation tools or products used by customers

What You Need For This Position

  • Strong background in managing Information Security projects to successful completion
  • Customer-oriented focus with a strong interest in client satisfaction
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills. Must be able to communicate technical details in a clear, understandable manner to multiple levels of an organization.
  • Understanding and experience with Information Security technologies such as:  Firewalls, IDS/IPS, Vulnerability Management, File Integrity Monitoring, etc.
  • Demonstrated ability to learn new technology or concepts very quickly
  • Good knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or Ruby
  • Good knowledge of orchestration automation tools like Chef or Puppet
  • 5+ years of demonstrable experience assessing, designing and implementing security for Linux and Windows operating systems and their hosted application stacks
  • Experience working in cloud environments (AWS,  Rackspace, etc)

Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field or equivalent experience
  • CISSP certification or equivalent experience
  • Prior Big 4 consulting experience is a plus

About CloudPassage

At CloudPassage, we are all about making cloud computing more secure and agile for leading global enterprise companies by resolving the number one inhibitor to cloud adoption: security. This challenge requires smart, passionate, and creative people.

We invented agile security for modern infrastructure. Our platform protects the most critical business assets. Staying in front of the cloud security landscape is a huge challenge that requires expertise, creativity, hard work and intense collaboration.

Leading enterprises like Citrix, Salesforce.com and Adobe use CloudPassage to enhance their security and compliance posture, while remaining agile. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, CloudPassage is backed by Benchmark Capital, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Meritech Capital Partners, Tenaya Capital, Shasta Ventures, Musea Ventures and other leading investors.

Top Reasons to Work With Us

  • CloudPassage is a growing, well funded company that is making a difference
  • At the bleeding edge of security and technology
  • There are a lot of smart people to work with!
  • Great pay, benefits, and stock options
  • Rapid career advancement (plenty of opportunity to take on additional responsibility with a fast growing company!)
  • Opportunity to work with some of the biggest names for customers
  • Opportunity to make an impact on customer's security issues
  • Opportunity to work with “the best security tool” in the industry
  • We get stuff done!

jobs.title: Junior / Mid-Level Designer
jobs.content:
*CURRENTLY LOOKING FOR CANDIDATES BASED IN NYC*

WHO WE ARE:
Frank Collective was established with the goal of finding new and innovative ways to use storytelling and digital media to provide engagement between brands and their audience. As a team, we develop create, and produce across all media platforms in an integrated, symbiotic, and, hopefully, unexpected way. As a digital content and creative shop, the work we do runs the gamut of rebranding and providing campaigns for existing companies to creating a new brand from the ground up (naming, identity, website, app, packaging, video, and photo shoots). Since we offer in-house production, we have all the benefits of working as a creative agency and a production company under one roof. Soup to nuts creative development and production through launch. Our niche is innovative digital design and production for startups, new products, and brand refreshes for entertainment, lifestyle, action sport, epicurean, luxury, B-to-B and tech brands. Some of our past and current clients include American Express, Blue Apron, Jameson, Condé Nast, TRESemmé, RocNation, Mini, Tourneau, and Google.

WHAT WE DO:
We partner with agencies, production companies and direct to client to create apps, websites, web content, video, identities, packaging, collateral and brand campaigns.

WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR:
We are looking for freelance candidates for our Brooklyn office. Candidates would need to be able to work onsite at our DUMBO location. Candidates should also have the ability to work from home, if necessary. A great sense of humor, passionate work ethic, and ability to concept widely initially and iterate when the project narrows in focus. Check out our work, and if you feel like your aesthetic is in line with ours we’d welcome the opportunity to work with you.

GRAPHIC DESIGNER (JR. MID- LEVEL FREELANCERS)
• Summary: Assist with creation of visual design, typography, visual concept, logos, icons for interactive platforms, print, video, and other multimedia.

• Requirements: Must know Photoshop, Indesign, and Illustrator CS5+. (After Effects, Final Cut X, HTML, Javascript, CSS, and Flash recommended but not required.)

• Looking for Junior and Mid-Level candidates, 1 to 4 years professional experience required.

• Great organizational + communication skills

• HTML, Javascript, CSS, Flash, and other web platforms a plus

• Adobe After Effects, Premiere, or Final Cut X, a plus

· Looking for candidates already based in NYC. Not interested in out of state candidates looking to relocate.

* Position is freelance.
**No headhunters/recruiters

Please only contact us regarding the position listed.
Please do not contact the office directly. We will contact you if we are interested.
Due to the number of applicants we are only able to notify those being considered.
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States.

jobs.title: Sr Android Developer
jobs.content:
Atlassian is looking for a few passionate Android Engineers (mid and Sr level) to join our Mobile Team! This is a new team that will be housed in a brand new office in the heart of downtown Mountain View. The key responsibilities of the team are:



  • Research and prototyping with newest mobile technology

  • Development of both reusable software components and libraries as well as consumer facing mobile applications

  • Setting the standards and best practices

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
Team and Projects
Our agile team of seven developers works in dev-ops environment. Joining our team you will be in charge of:



  • Developing an application for monitoring hundreds of thousands of transactions daily (example features waiting for coding: margin requirement calculator, P&L calculation and charts).



  • Designing and developing a new application for processing over 1TB data daily for analysis of automated trading system’s logs (example features: dynamic views and content aware data processing).



  • Designing and developing IDE for trading algorithms (e.g. custom versioning management, code completion, debug tool).


Technologies
We are using JPA, RabbitMQ, OSGi, Eclipse RCP, Xtext, Quick Fix and other frameworks. Software built by us uses such
services as CME Drop Copy, ICE Trade Capture and connects directly to the exchanges over FIX Protocol.


Our offer
We pay exceptional compensation for exceptional job. Our compensation package includes high base salary and discretionary bonus. You will work with a great team in a vibrant atmosphere on unique and challenging projects related to financial markets. Our office is located in the very heart of Kazimierz. We guarantee hard work, great projects and a lot of fun. You will also get a private healthcare and sports package.

jobs.title: Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Our customer base is growing quickly, and we want your combination of sharp technical and warm people skills to help our customers solve problems and get the most out of their databases at Compose. We operate a fleet of various databases, so there is something for everyone: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, RethinkDB, and likely many more!


If you are a developer, DevOps/SRE magician, or database junkie and know how to help developers with technical questions, we want to talk to you. You will be most effective if you have an inquisitive nature, are technically-inclined and love to learn. We are not just looking to fight fires, we are looking to prevent them. We pride ourselves in providing top-notch support and guidance, so being able to communicate effectively with empathy and compassion is a must.


This is the perfect position for a motivated learner who wants to gain experience within a vibrant team focused on building an intuitive and customer-focused product. Spending time with our customers and product will let you interact with all sorts of interesting characters and will help you grow into a high-end distributed systems engineering position (we need those too, so if you start on support and do a great job, there is a huge amount of room for growth).


We're a distributed team and we work across many different time zones. If you're a night owl, an early riser, or somewhere in between, we're happy to accommodate untraditional work schedules -- our worldwide customers often need help at odd hours!


Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.


At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.


We look forward to meeting you!


Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.

jobs.title: Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Developing software appeals to those who love to solve puzzles and apply their creative energy -- and also to those, in our experience, who like working from home in their pyjamas. It is often said that one of the trickiest accomplishments in the development world is imagining, building and maintaining a complex and interconnected mental model of your entire infrastructure within your working memory. If you have experience applying this mental feat within some type of Software-as-a-Service and want to grow into something new, we have a tremendous challenge for you and a terrific team willing and able to support you through it.


We need crafty humans to help expand the Compose vision. Compose has grown into a vibrant work environment where folks can feel comfortable being themselves, living a balanced life. We welcome you to enjoy comfort when taking risks, collaborate with spirited peers, and to unleash your creative personality.


Think you're a match?


Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.


At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.


We look forward to meeting you!


Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.

jobs.title: Application Developer
jobs.content:
In the present world of application development it's difficult to determine where the front-end stops and the back-end begins. While we don't feel wise enough to define where this point may be, we feel the right candidate will be adventurous enough to focus more on how to provide the strongest and cleanest user experience. We're seeking someone familiar with Rails and JavaScript who is interested in creating beautiful and functional work. Compose will lead you to opportunities to learn and grow, while providing excellent conventions (like our internal framework Megatron) to comfortably work within.

As an Application Developer with Compose, you'll make major contributions to the design, function and user experience of our product. You will join a talented and supportive team in a self-managing and open organization. We're remote first and have a diverse group of friendly people located all over the world. We'll give you the respect, freedom, and trust to contribute your talents in a way that you envision.

With great respect/freedom/trust comes great responsibility, and as such it will be crucial that you have the right intrinsic motivators to work with little direction and oversight but still collaborate and seek alternative view-points. If you love making beautiful and functional things and want to have some fun, we'd love to see what you can cook up for us.

__Technical things we hope you're good at (or can become excellent at):__

* Rails and JavaScript: Fluent in Rails/JavaScript. We use a lot of Go within our infrastructure, but this role doesn't require it. An idiomatic and structured approach to your work is appreciated.
* Utility: You'll run into bugs. A handy stable of useful tools and a keen eye for broken things is essential.
* API: A pragmatic and thorough understanding of API as a database-like source of data.
* Testing: Able to write tests and specs for new features and offer insight to improve existing specs.
* Databases: We provide Databases-as-a-Service; a solid fundamental understanding of good practices and various management systems would be helpful.
* Security: Awareness of security vulnerabilities and protection techniques.

__We're excited to see what sort of character will wind up in this role... a few helpful traits include:__

* Imagination: Inject your character, vision, and perhaps even whimsy into our product.
* Self Starter: We're an organization filled with people who self-manage. You get the respect and responsibility to operate with minimal supervision and management. Loose structure is not for everyone.
* Detail Oriented: You'll need to work with precision... and enjoy a nice and tricky edge case.

__Company Benefits__

Compose is a close-knit, family-like team. We're proud of what we create. Here are some of the perks that you'll receive joining our team:

* Competitive salary and excellent benefits
* Flexible hours
* Vacation when you need it
* Amazing benefits
* Talented and relaxed peers
* Remote first
* Fair and objective hiring

__Office Locations__

Our two main offices are located in San Francisco, California and Birmingham, Alabama, with remote employees in South Africa, Canada, London and many places in between.

jobs.title: Teamwork Projects Software Developer
jobs.content:
Our Technical Stack


Don't be deterred if you are not familiar with everything in our tech stack or if you feel as though you are stronger in one area than another. We believe that a passionate and talented developer can learn new practices and technologies. Similarly, we don't place a lot of importance on educational background - as a developer your experience, portfolio, and abilities are key, not your grades :). We do need to see some experience of working in web development and creating or contributing to web applications. 



  • HTML

  • CSS

  • LESS

  • JavaScript

  • CoffeeScript

  • Knockout.js

  • Gulp

  • Git

  • Require.js

  • Bower

  • Go

  • ColdFusion

  • MySQL

  • Redis

  • Vagrant/Docker


Our entire team works daily with HTML, CSS/LESS, JavaScript (particularly Knockout.js),RESTful APIs, and integrations, and so, experience in full stack web development is important. However, if you are particularly skilled in front-end developent or you are a highly experienced back-end developer, we'd love to hear from you.


More Info


Teamwork Projects is our flagship product and is used by many of the world's biggest companies, with over 370,000 installations, two million daily users and more than three million unique projects. Despite the vast array of features available in Teamwork Projects, it has been built entirely by a small team of talented developers. We pride ourselves on giving our users what they need and are constantly working on new features and improvements for our customers.


By joining our team, you can be assured not only that your work will be seen and enjoyed by millions of users worldwide, but that you will learn and grow continuously, in a friendly, open environment.


We care about all our teams, and they care about when their teammates will be online, what their timezone is and where they will be working from. When you apply we will ask you about where you intend to work from. We will also ask you whether or not you are open to considering spending some time in our Irish office, if you would like to work remotely, if you would like to relocate or if you're already here and ready to start work at Teamwork HQ in Cork, Ireland.

jobs.content:
We are the next generation Website-as-a-Service Company. To manage and create our websites very efficiently, we developed our amazing CRM and CMS called “James” – our digital butler. Now we want to take the next step and become the leading full service website provider.


Therefore we’re looking for a Senior Developer who wants to work on something new instead of finishing another developers work. So here are some questions we’re thinking about:



  • How can we automatize different tasks – even creative ones?

…and there is more - especially with your ideas!

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer-Broadcast IT
jobs.content:
Part of the NBC Sports Group family, Golf Channel is a multimedia, golf entertainment and services company based in Orlando, Fla. In addition to its high-quality news, instruction and original programming, Golf Channel is home to more live golf than all other networks combined. Our coverage includes PGA TOUR, LPGA Tour, NCAA National Championships, The Open, Olympics and a slate of other worldwide tours and events. Golf Channel continues to connect the world to golf through a wide array of digital and lifestyle services including: Golf Channel Digital platforms, GolfNow, GolfAdvisor.com, Golf Channel Academy instructional facilities and Golf Channel Amateur Tour.

The Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for software and database development. In collaboration with Engineering and IT teams, the Senior Engineer will recalibrate/create workflows and processes to be implemented throughout a fast paced, sports broadcast environment

Job Duties
  • Design, code and debug applications in various software languages
  • Engage with manufactures and vendors to create and implement workflow designs.
  • Plan, lead and manage development projects
  • Mentor junior engineers and review code
  • Analyze business requirements for system infrastructure
  • Integrate new and antiquated software with existing system's design and development
  • Telnet network programming and computer security
  • Integrate systems and networking for device control and function
  • Utilize API's and proprietary programs to streamline work processes & establish needs assessments
  • Integrate and develop new and existing systems using various software languages
  • Implement hardware and software system upgrades to existing servers
  • Support, maintain and document software functionality
  • Implement localization or globalization of software
  • Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation


Any and all other duties as assigned

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent field
  • 4 years of software/code development or related experience
  • Experience in application development using Visual Studio, C# and ASP.NET.
  • Experience in SQL Server Administration and deployment.
  • Intermediate to advanced skill level in reverse engineering, testing and troubleshooting
  • Knowledgeable in Java, .NETJSP, JavaScript, Web services, SOAP, XML, MySQL, UNIX, Linux, AJAX, Windows, Apple ,MVC and HTML
  • Willing to work weekends, holidays, and shift work as necessary


Additional Job Requirements
  • Interested candidate must submit a resume/CV through www.nbcunicareers.com to be considered
  • Must be willing to work in Orlando

jobs.title: Software Engineer I
jobs.content:
GolfNow, a division of Golf Channel is the internet's largest online tee time reservation service, trusted by more than 1.5 million golfers. Using leading-edge technology, GolfNow provides more ways for golfers to stay connected to their favorite golf courses and tee times through the web, e-mail and mobile applications. As a partner to golf courses, GolfNow provides turnkey solutions to their operations (www.golfnowsolutions.com) with the main areas of focus on:
  • Online marketing and distribution of tee times
  • Web hosting, development and customer management solutions
  • Revenue optimization, database expansion and other course products




Software Test Automation Engineer I is responsible for the design and creation of Automation frameworks and Automation scripts for various GolfNow applications and subsystems.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Create and Automate tests using available and open-source tools and technologies.

* Create Automation and Code in standard Object Oriented languages like Java

* Understand and script using standard scripting languages like Perl, Shell, JavaScript.

* Learn and employ automation tools like Selenium, Ruby.

* Perform software quality assurance, including black box testing, white box testing, user acceptance testing, and maintenance regression testing

* Evaluate testing and inspection plans for projects of varying technology, complexity, and size

* Develop and document test scripts, test cases, defect tracking and reports

* Create and maintain manual and/or automated test scripts, test data, and other deliverables related to the software quality assurance (SQA) process

* Review log files and other run-time documentation for defects and issues

* Analyze the results of software tests and provide results for use in development code inspections and group reviews of project deliverables

* Detect, document, and track system defects throughout the SQA process

* Under direction of product management, participate in user acceptance testing

* Perform maintenance regression testing

* Work with development teams to support and implement applications

* Other duties as assigned

Minimum requirements:
* 1 year of experience as a QA Engineer or related position in a collaborative, team-driven software engineering environment or 4 years CS or related Bachelors degree.

* 1 year of experience automating or extending a test frameworks at work or school.

* 1 year coding experience with standard Object Oriented languages like Java.

* Familiarity and/or programming experience with .NET and web-based technologies

* Excellent SQL and data skills

* Experience maintaining test environments, automated testing tools, and other resources in support of SQA process

* Strong written and verbal communication skills

* Team player with strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills

* Ability to work under tight deadlines

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
GolfNow, a division of Golf Channel is the internet's largest online tee time reservation service, trusted by more than 1.5 million golfers. Using leading-edge technology, GolfNow provides more ways for golfers to stay connected to their favorite golf courses and tee times through the web, e-mail and mobile applications. As a partner to golf courses, GolfNow provides turnkey solutions to their operations (www.golfnowsolutions.com) with the main areas of focus on:
  • Online marketing and distribution of tee times
  • Web hosting, development and customer management solutions
  • Revenue optimization, database expansion and other course products


The Lead Software Engineer takes the primary engineering responsibility and ownership for key areas of the GolfNow e-commerce platform.

Job Duties
  • Directly responsible for design and implementation of various modules of the GolfNow platform
  • Lead the consolidation of acquired golf commerce platforms into the GolfNow platform
  • Provide knowledge leadership in key areas of the GolfNow platform
  • Lead and mentor other engineers
  • Deliver software on time and to specification, with minimal supervision
  • Work directly with business and technology leadership to manage end user expectations and gain user acceptance of all project deliverables
  • Participate in code walkthroughs as needed to ensure quality and security
  • Write uses cases, requirement specifications, system documentation, and other project deliverables
  • Build software prototypes and develop highly scalable and secure web services and applications to support business requirements
  • Create automated unit test cases and test data
  • Test and debug code
  • Build trust and cooperation between IT, internal clients, and external vendors
  • Other duties as assigned





Basic Qualifications
  • 5 years of technical expertise including recent experience architecting, designing and developing a high-performance e-commerce platforms using .NET (C#), ASP, ASP.NET and Windows stack.
  • 3 years of experience with MS SQL Server.
  • 2 years experience gathering requirements using OO analysis techniques and tools
  • Deep understanding of service oriented architectures
  • Experience in modern Agile Methodologies (SCRUM and or Extreme) is a plus.
  • Experience tuning and optimizing web services that are consumed by diverse technologies
  • Deep experience with technologies and patterns such as REST,SOAP,WCF,etc
  • Understanding of data modeling and SQL
  • Experience in a collaborative, team-driven software engineering environment.
  • Team player with strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
  • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science





Additional Job Requirements
  • Interested candidate must submit a resume/CV through www.nbcunicareers.com to be considered
  • Must be willing to work in Orlando, FL
  • Willingness to travel and work overtime, and on weekends





Desired Qualifications
  • Experience in large scale, million users+ systems
  • Understanding of micro-service architectures and related patterns
  • Knowledge of e-commerce business models
  • Passion for Golf

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer  Tel Aviv

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
We at engage are looking to expand our team! We are seeking an experience senior developer to help develop .

Engage Works is a world-leading interactive technology group. 
Through our network of closely linked companies, we create connected experiences for some of the biggest brands in the world. 

=Creating what exactly?


The type of projects we want you to successfully deliver – usually more than one at a time are:



  • Multitouch interactive tables/walls with dynamic content and integrated environmental controls

  • Many touchscreen applications, ranging from kiosks, 10K video walls, collaborative working environments, marketing suites and retail applications.

  • Corporate Experience centre with 270 degree projection projecting a 5K realtime rendered globe, business productivity suites, social RFID linked media displays, numerous touch screen applications

  • Immersive experiences that enthral crowds at major events to evoke brand-related stimuli through personalised interactions using sensations, feelings, cognitions, and behavioural responses

  • green screen studios for a major broadcast company that gives a unique learning experience for schools to make their very own television report on subjects they’re studying at school


And the list grows every day. A lot comes through our door on a daily basis, and we are looking for people with the experience and the willingness to try to help us achieve things that we’ve not done before.


One thing we can assure you, we do not build websites, all we do is interactive development on bespoke hardware systems.


Varied work. Never dull.

Qualities we are looking for:



  • a strong problem solver and a good team worker

  • enthusiastic about user experience, ui design

  • Architecture and development experience

  • Strong C#, UWP, WPF experience

  • Able to coach team members on delivery techniques such as estimation, planning, as well as technicalskills such as code quality

  • Enabling creativity within the restrictions of budget and schedule


Why work for engage?

We offer:



  • 25 days holiday

  • friendly working environment

  • diverse projects to deliver

  • office studio in east London

  • coffee machine – a proper one

  • a fruit bowl, and beers on Wednesdays


How to apply:


Please email some samples of relevant work you are proud of (e.g. Interactive experiences, personal projects, screen-based ui/multitouch apps, ios apps), and a cv to recruitment@engageworks.com


Please note you must have the right to work in the UK to apply for this position.


NO AGENCIES PLEASE

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer
jobs.content:
What you'll do:





Billtrust is seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer to work with our Agile team to ensure quality deliverables for our software-as-a-service (SaaS) Cash App platform. You will create detailed and well-structured test plans and test cases then coordinate testing activities. You will ensure quality issues and defects are appropriately identified, documented, tracked and resolved. You will collaborate with dev, product and other cross-functional groups to deliver high-quality products.



  • Work with an experienced team leveraging SCRUM techniques to deliver high-quality releases

  • Create test plans, test data, test cases and automated scripts to ensure quality for web client & server applications and mobile application.

  • Perform web, API, UI, functional, regression, smoke, black box, load, performance and end-to-end testing

  • Develop automated tests using Selenium Webdriver (C#), nUnit, SQL, and other scripts

  • Write and/or modify SQL queries to perform database validations

  • Document test cases, write and reproduce accurate software problem reports, and implement process improvements

  • Identify, document, and track all software defects to closure

  • Work with functional teams in reducing error rates and perform root cause analysis of errors/trends

jobs.title: Full-Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Some things to know before you apply:



  • We have big plans to disrupt the traditional grocery retail market and become a $Billion+ company in the next few years

  • Everything we do is focused on empowering our customers

  • We work really hard

  • We have a lot of fun!

  • Try this coding challenge, and we'll look at you resume before others. Alternatively, If you wish to challenge yourself with a more difficult coding puzzle give this coding challenge a try.


At RedMart software engineers use technology to delight our customers. They innovate to make our customers’ lives better. And since RedMart does e-commerce from the online storefront all the way to home delivery, there are lots of areas to make an impact with technology. Can we improve warehouse efficiency to get the orders delivered faster? Can we reduce delivery costs so we can save our customers money? Can we make it easier for them to find the products they need and checkout?


As a Software Engineer you will:



  • Translating application storyboards and use cases into functional applications

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Java code

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems

  • Help maintain code quality, organisation, and automatisation

  • Working in highly collaborative teams and building quality code

  • Understanding the business domain deeply and working closely with business stakeholders


Our Tech Stack:


Microservices written in Java or Scala using Play Framework, and occasionally NodeJS.
React or AngularJs for web apps.
MongoDB, Postgres or Cassandra for storage.
AWS infrastructure, with HAProxy, Nginx, Redis. Chef deployments.
GitHub, Travis CI and Trello for development tools.
Testing with JUnit, ScalaTest, FrisbyJS, Calabash and Selenium.
Kafka, Spark and AWS Redshift for our data infrastructure.

jobs.title: Senior Applications Developer
jobs.content:

jobs.title: Quality Engineer
jobs.content:
Wirecard is a globally operating and leading provider of technology for electronic payments in all distribution channels: Online, mobile and at the point-of-sale

As a software and IT service provider listed on the TecDAX of the Deutsche Börse, Wirecard AG, based in Aschheim near Munich, is one of the globally leading independent providers of outsourcing and white label solutions for payment innovations.

The companies belonging to the Wirecard Group develop intelligent solutions to assist mail-order merchants, tourism and haulage companies as well as providers of digital goods and services with electronic payment transactions. 


We are looking for a System Administrator Linux (m/f)  to join our team at Wirecard Technologies GmbH, a subsidiary in Aschheim/Munich.


Your Duties



  • Operating and planning of an enterprise server environment

  • Support of development, QA and production systems

  • Install, upgrade and support of infrastructure services

  • Development and maintainance of different administrative applications and scripts

  • Enterprise-level Troubleshooting and Analyzing

Your Profile



  • Planning, design, specification and development of test plans and development of test cases for our web and backend applications

  • Automation of test cases covering front end and backend applications

  • Working together with the Scrum team to add value to user stories

  • Develop and work together with the entire Scrum team on User Stories during Sprint Planning and User Story Workshops

  • Documentation and presentation of test results including release recommendations at the Sprint Demo

  • Active participation in defect tracking and root cause analysis


What we offer



  • Challenging and diverse tasks with scope for introducing your own ideas and experience

  • An excellent working atmosphere in a highly-motivated and successful team with an international company culture

  • Further professional and personal development at one of the world's leading providers of payment processing

  • An attractive salary as well as long-term prospects and a chance for promotion in a successful company that is growing strongly

  • A modern workplace with additional company benefits such as a canteen, fitness area, incentives and staff events


Become part of our success story. Become part of a highly qualified team, united by a vision: to make payment happen. For any questions please contact: Mr. Benedikt Bossert Human Resources Manager benedikt.bossert@wirecard.com +49 89 4424 1323

jobs.title: DevOps Architect
jobs.content:
Become a part of Wirecard


Would you like to work for an international FinTech company and play an active role in shaping the future of payment?


In that case, we look forward to you joining our team as we are constantly on the lookout for dedicated, talented people who share our vision.


As a software and IT service provider listed on the TecDAX of the Deutsche Börse, Wirecard AG, based in Aschheim near Munich, is one of the globally leading independent providers of outsourcing and white label solutions for payment innovations.


Wirecard Technologies GmbH unites the technologies behind all our products and solutions. Employees of Wirecard Technologies GmbH develop and promote our software of the future to meet the needs of paying customers worldwide and to fulfil our product lines as well as develop the overall IT infrastructure.


To strengthen our team in Aschheim/Munich we are seeking to recruit an


DevOps Architect (m/f)


Division Issuing


Your Duties



  • Building systems processing high-transaction volumes

  • Contribution and review project level architecture for complex IT projects

  • Leading the implementation and introduction of new infrastructural technologies (such as Messaging, ELK, Infrastructure-as-Code)

  • Working collaboratively with technical staff with varying expertise and exposure to DevOps

  • Optimizing our value flow by speeding up white-board to production deliveries

  • Maintaining running infrastructure


What we offer



  • Challenging and diverse tasks with scope for introducing your own ideas and experience

  • An excellent working atmosphere in a highly-motivated and successful team with an international company culture

  • Further professional and personal development at one of the world's leading providers of payment processing

  • An attractive salary as well as long-term prospects and a chance for promotion in a successful company that is growing strongly

  • A modern workplace with additional company benefits such as a canteen, fitness area, incentives and staff events  


Your contact:


Mr. Andreas Dürbeck            


andreas.duerbeck@wirecard.com                                                           


Phone: +49 / 89 / 4424-1358


Einsteinring 35


85609 Aschheim         


www.wirecard.com

jobs.title: Wanted: Data Scientists for our Data Driven Analytics Products, Nuremberg
jobs.content:
GfK is one of the biggest global insights providers, with an incredible data landscape: Sales data, purchase insights, global trends, consumer profiles, cross-media exposure, Social Media buzz – all these sources contributing to a holistic, integrated understanding of markets, preferences, and behaviors.


We are convinced that by bringing this data landscape together with the best Data Scientists and consultants, we can create data products and services of tremendous value. For this reason, we have founded our new global DDA (Data-Driven Analytics) unit that leverages our data landscape, our technical solutions, and our expertise in order to develop and launch a new premium analytics offering for our clients.


Are you interested in taking this journey with us? Join our team!


For our DDA unit, which will combine agile start-up atmosphere with the advantages of a Global Player, we are looking for exceptional (Senior) Data Scientists who want to become part of an interdisciplinary and international team and contribute to an important global initiative: Leave your footprint and make an impact on GfK’s position in the analytics market!


Concrete tasks will include



  • contributing to the refinement and ramp-up of the DDA technology and (Big) Data analytics stack (which includes e.g., testing new tools, defining processes and blueprints, developing recommendations on how to handle specific data challenges),

  • developing scalable, cloud-based analytics “as a service” software products that leverage GfK’s data landscape for answering important business questions of our clients,

  • driving successful, data-agnostic analytics projects, by

    • supporting our DDA “Analytics Services” teams in consulting our clients with regard to data-related business challenges,

    • translating the client challenges into analytic designs and data requirements,

    • carrying out the analyses using suitable Data Science tools and our Big Data integration platform

    • presenting the results convincingly, or developing interactive data products.





Requirements


We are looking for team players with a hands-on approach, who appreciate the opportunity to work in an international environment on product developments and projects of strategic importance. A close collaboration with both our consulting/business experts and our technology experts should be appreciated – we are all part of one new, integrated team and work towards the same objective!



Developing scalable data products will be at the core of our DDA unit. Therefore, experience in turning Data Science algorithms and approaches into products will be very beneficial. A thorough understanding of how to address marketing challenges (such as pricing, product launch forecasting, etc.) analytically will be helpful, too.



Individuals who want to have direct client contact will get the possibility through challenging ad hoc projects. While our aim for solutions and data products of extraordinary quality requires research-driven individuals, a strong commercial focus and a very good understanding of how to address real-world business challenges with analytics solutions are equally important.



We are convinced that Data Science works best in teams – nobody knows everything. Hence, we look for a variety of profiles with complementary skills, such as:




  • Expert statistical modeling skills (e.g, predictive models)

  • Expert knowledge of analytic programming languages (R is required, but knowledge of further languages, such as Python or Julia is a plus)

  • Experience with using cloud-based analytics platforms, such as Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services

  • (Expert) skills with regard to developing data products and transforming algorithms into scalable software

  • (Expert) skills with regard to performance optimized programming (e.g., parallelization, code optimization, C++ integration in R)

  • (Expert) data visualization/visual analytics skills, also using standard tools, such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau

  • (Expert) knowledge of optimization, data integration, data mining, and machine learning algorithms

  • Experience with handling and integrating data from different sources – structured and unstructured, small or big.

  • (Expert) skills with regard to working in Big Data environments (e.g., Hadoop, Map/Reduce, Pig, Hive)

  • (Expert) skills with regard to sourcing of open data (e.g., from Web APIs)

  • Solid to good understanding of Big Data Architectures

  • (Expert) skills with regard to database handling, in particular SQL

  • Ability to think creatively in addressing real-world business problems analytically, while maintaining the balance between “art & science”

  • Ability to translate sophisticated analytical information into understandable recommendations

  • Strong business understanding – ideally with in-depth experience in a certain industry (e.g., Technology, Media, FMCG,…)

  • Proven project management skills

  • Proven communication, presentation and client facing skills

  • Ability to confidently and clearly communicate in an English business environment (required!)

jobs.title: Full-stack developer
jobs.content:
At Mendix, we practice what we preach. We develop our feedback and collaboration platform using the Mendix Modeler. The modeler is part of an extensive technology stack that combines the best of breed tools to create and shape a great user experience for our customers.


We enjoy working on a range of applications throughout their lifecycle, from initial design to maintaining and improving them while in production. We believe that if you build it, you should run it. We’re persistent and we like to get to the bottom of things.



For our next team member, these are the things we're looking for:



  • A fan of agile, if not an evangelist

  • Someone who likes to share ideas (and who can communicate them in English)

  • An innate urge to improve the status quo, whether it's product or process

  • Clean code makes you happy, but satisfied customers make you happier

  • For you, work is also about having fun and playing the occasional game of foosball

  • We can check out your skills on Github or StackOverflow

  • Unix commands don't scare you



There are many reasons why we like to be part of Mendix in general, but some stand out:



  • Everyone is appreciated for their skills and ideas, regardless of mother tongue, ability to grow a beard, or crazy hobbies

  • Monthly crafting days allow us to explore side projects or try out cool new technologies, and share our experiences with the rest of the organization

  • Teams are autonomous and responsible for coming up with innovative ideas that contribute towards the bigger picture

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Mendix is a visual, model based IDE to create web apps. Our team is responsible for editing the pages in the (Web) Modeler and visualizing them on all browsers / devices. 


Why we like it here:



  • We’re building something new, making stuff up as we go along.

  • We’re working on a platform and we’re in it for the long haul. Thousands of developers and end users across the globe rely on your work and each commit could make them all very happy (or incredibly sad).

  • We’re stubborn and like to get to the bottom of things; clear answers are more important than deadlines.

  • We dabble in all sorts of technologies when it takes our fancy. Although we focus on JavaScript / Typescript & C# we often branch out into HTML5, CSS3, Scala / Java. Other libraries we use include React, Webpack, Node, Jasmine & Karma.

jobs.title: DevOps
jobs.content:
• Modellieren und implementieren von Schnittstellen, Workflows und Services auf Basis von Apache Camel, Apache ActiveMQ und Apache Karaf (ESB)

  • Sicherstellen der Verfügbarkeit unserer Apache ServiceMix-Infrastruktur (ESB)

  • Sicherstellen der Verfügbarkeit unseres Sonic/Progress-ESB und Migration nach Apache ServiceMix (ESB)

  • Aufbau und Betrieb (Provisioning, Customization, Rollout, Monitoring, Troubleshooting) von Glassfish/Payara Application Servern (Application Server)

  • JVM-Analysen und –Tuning, sowie Application Performance Monitoring (Application Server)

  • Weiterentwickeln von Skripten und Tools, z.B. für das Monitoring der Systeme oder die Automatisierung von wiederkehrenden Tasks (ESB & Application Server)

jobs.title: Application Engineer
jobs.content:
This is going to be the most exciting and most challenging career you will ever have. You will not have time to be bored and you may incur some wrinkles. But in the end, it will be worth it.


And this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity may only come to you once. 


Does joining an awesome company with a can-do, teamwork-makes-the-dream-work, and family-oriented culture give you the chills? Are you dying to solve the world’s problems and make it a better place? Do you dream of joining a team with extraordinary passion to resolve diverse/complex technology challenges every day? If so, you are at the right place and Mechdyne is the team that you have been looking for!


We are one of the world’s best and most innovative providers of visualization hardware/software, audio, visual, and information technologies. But of course you already knew that. What you may not know is that we serve many Fortune 500 companies, leading university and research centers as well as elite government agencies and the US Military who keep coming back to us to help them solve their everyday problems by providing customized solutions created by people like you!


As an Application Engineer, you will:



  • Play with, test, and evaluate the latest cutting-edge Virtual Reality, visualization, advanced audiovisual and IT technology to make sure they work as advertised. We enjoy being the test dummies for new technology! 

  • Design and develop intuitive user interfaces (UIs) and system control applications that people are not intimidated by or afraid to use

  • Write control system code that is robust, bug-free, and readable by other humans (programmers included)

  • Combine UIs and control system code to deliver a top-notch user experience for our clients. Let’s be honest, our goal is to make our clients smile when they use their brand-new, high-tech toys every day.

  • Verify and validate overall system functionality by performing QC processes and code reviews. We know it sounds boring, but it’s not. Plus it has the added benefit of being totally necessary. No one writes perfect code the first time and we enjoy helping each other out. 

  • Travel with your teammates to various locations around the globe to personally hand-deliver the systems to our clients

jobs.title: Developers for healthcare software platform
jobs.content:
Note: this job is open to US Residents only.  Foreign nationals can apply but only if you live within the US.


-


What we do actually matters. CareEvolution's HIEBus platform creates better patient outcomes.


Simply stated, we make web and mobile applications for healthcare. Under the covers, though, a lot more is going on - we have developed a robust software platform that ingresses data, programmatically links that data across institutions on a per-patient basis, and supplies APIs to consume, project, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and useful ways.  Please read our company page for a more detailed explanation of what we do and who we are.


We are looking for software people to help us build out the platform, write data adapters (drivers) to automatically ingress data from hundreds of data sources - in realtime, and to create the next generation of healthcare apps.


At CareEvolution, we don't tell you what to do. Part of the work at CareEvolution is determining what to do. We've designed our organization specifically to promote creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the most difficult problems in healthcare.


Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us (resume@careevolution.com) - and we'll explain what CareEvolution is all about.

jobs.title: Mid-Senior Java Developer
jobs.content: Are you passionate about software development and love Java programming and the art of software design? Do you have experience and the willingness to participate in entire life cycle of the product as a key contributor in the development of an exciting project? Then you may be the right one for us!

jobs.title: Product Manager - Bi & Big Data - Solve intriguing data problems!!
jobs.content:
This is a genuinely fantastic opportunity to join potentially world changing business working in an exciting space. The Product Manager will work with product and platform colleagues to solve varied data driven problems, by enhancing existing products, working to prototype creative solutions and explore new capability.


There will be a need to work across a number of different vertical Markets in a team of both internal/ external resources as you work within a team with global footprint.


The role will be responsible for delivering analytical solutions, research, and product enhancement, to achieve innovation in the Big Data arena in line with company vision and values. The successful candidate must be able to balance theoretical data science solutions with pragmatic real world solutions, without over complication and ensuring successful delivery.


The role will act as a global expert in understanding of datasets, and will work with analytics, product, and platform teams as a champion of knowledge.



  • Understanding the analytical features of Smart Steps and other portfolio products, demonstrating these to prospect clients to support the Sales teams with the development of new business opportunities.

  • Be a key part of a world class product development team, actively contributing to the development of new products.

  • Manage enhancements to the existing suite of products.

  • Come up with solutions to solve problems, working with new datasets and technologies.

  • Extract information from data through analysis, and prepare storylines that will bring forward the most relevant insights to different industry verticals;

  • Work proactively to understand new technologies and their relationship with existing capability. Understanding strengths and weakness of these technologies, and measuring quality there-in.

  • Act as a knowledge expert for analytical colleagues working in an array of verticals (from transport planners to retail modellers)

  • Produce compelling reports, presentations and storylines to demonstrate insights and solutions to problems explored.

  • Explore data visualisation options to best demonstrate insights to internal and external clients

jobs.title: Senior JavaScript Engineer
jobs.content:
Your Role
We are building a world-class engineering team that will revolutionize how people communicate on the Web. We’re also building a highly scalable platform with public APIs, which will enable developers all over the world to integrate video communications into their Web application.


Your role will be to design and implement the next generation Cloud API. As part of the team you’ll need to solve super interesting use-cases on the web and provide a rich set of APIs for online video communications.


Responsibilities



  • Play a key role in designing and building the new OpenTok platform

  • Design, architect and implement, rich Server/Client APIs

  • Implement the next generation browser-based video communications SDK

  • Work with other engineers to define, drive and complete the technology strategy

  • Be a part of a next-generation cloud based streaming Infrastructure

  • Evangelize the platform and use a feedback-driven methodology to drive enhancements

  • Work in rapid 1-2 week development cycles

  • Collaborate closely with our teams located around the world (San Francisco, London, Barcelona)

jobs.title: C++ Developer
jobs.content: You will join our engineering team and contribute to the build-out of our proprietary options market-making trading platform infrastructure. You will be building and optimizing our automated trading systems and connections to the exchanges. You will be working collaboratively with other top-class developers as well as researching and integrating new technologies into our systems as the opportunities arise. You will focus on analysis, design, implementation, testing and delivery of key trading system technology using the latest technologies. A pragmatic approach to technology solutions, using the latest open source software will be required.

jobs.title: Mobile Developers - "Most exciting place to work" 2014, 2015 & 2016
jobs.content:
The future is heading towards Mobile First and we’re not late to latch on! With a lot of exciting mobile projects starting in the autumn, we’re looking for skillful developers within Android and iOS who can tackle our clients need for user-friendly, smart and sustainable mobile solutions. Do you want in?


We are an IT consulting company that works in every part of the connected world - digitalization, security, Internet of Things, cloud solutions, test and strategic business advisory - to mention some. Our lead words when developing is simplicity, sustainability, secure and user-friendly.


Anyone can dream big and talk about business opportunities, but few have the skills to turn these ideas into reality. With business savviness, hard work and technology expertise we turn opportunities into tangible digital solutions that are made to be continuously improved. We call ourselves makers of tomorrow.


What’s in it for me?


You'll be working as a consultant where you'll be constantly challenged with new projects, technologies and clients. We have a large client base with some of the most interesting companies in the region, where you'll be working in both in-house project and at our clients' offices.


We are a company where we like to have a nice time together – both at work and after. We have a lot of happenings, for example game nights, training sessions, beer club, after works, running competitions and of course the mandatory “fika”.


We care about everyone on the Cybercom-team and therefore we have great benefits (for example generous healthcare contributions, good pension schemes and flexible working hours) and a union agreement contract – so you can be sure to have solid and safe employee agreements.


To be able to stay ahead of the game and be the entrepreneurs that change tomorrow, we’re adding full focus on our consultant’s development. Therefore every employee has an individual competence plan, and have regularly one-to-ones with your closest manager (who by the way have the same technical skills as you!).


Please check in our client portfolio at http://www.cybercom.com/Cases-and-clients/ or check out how it’s like working here at http://career.cybercom.com/.
You can also read more about our "Most exciting company" reward at http://www.karriarforetagen.se/company/cybercom.


Who would like it at Cybercom?


A person who is down to earth, have a genuine love for technologies and a passion to deliver solutions with value. We are a team, and therefore we’re seeking team players who like to discuss, collaborate, compromise and help your team mates. The team’s success should be your success.


We also believe that you have experience within mobile developing, with specialist competence within Android or iOS – or both!


The recruitment process


There will be roles as developers, senior developers, tech lead and team lead (with personnel responsibility) available.


We recruit with the same agile approach that we work in – therefore we’ll start interviewing as the applications are sent in. If you don’t have a written CV you can apply with your LinkedIn-profile or via video.


Feel free to contact us if you have any questions about working here or the recruitment process.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Fullstack developer (.Net and HTML, CSS + JavaScript)


This is an exciting opportunity for a .Fullstack developer to work on easyJet.com, Europe's 4th busiest e-Commerce site, working in a highly skilled, close-knit team.

The Fullstack Developer will play an active role in the Scrum team, delivering new features for the easyJet.com booking portal, in line with easyJet's design guidelines and architecture principles.

At easyJet, our goal is to inspire a whole generation of travellers to say "yes" to new experiences and opportunities. As Europe's leading airline, we fly on more of Europe's top 100 routes than any other airline and last year we connected over 60 million people across more than 30 countries.

Our people are at the heart of our success and we think it's important that we share the benefits of our success with them. You'd expect us to offer great travel benefits, but in addition to being able to climb on-board our flights at heavily reduced rates, you'll also benefit from discounted rates on holidays, car hire, hotels and even get a free easyJet Plus! card.

Across our network we've offers and benefits specific to the countries we operate in and beyond these you'll be joining a vibrant, fast paced and forward thinking environment.

We require 3+ years' experience of the following technologies and tools:

· ASP.NET MVC, C#, HTML, JavaScript
· Agile development using Scrum
· TDD, BDD
· Source control preferably Git
· CI tools preferably TeamCity
· SQL Server
· Strong knowledge of Microsoft development tools and frameworks
· Strong understanding of SOLID principles and management of code complexity and maintainability
· Ability to drive improvement in software architecture, performance and scalability
· Interest in key technology developments and standards relevant to web development
· Knowledge of web related techniques in e.g. SEO, CMS, Usability, Analytics
· Awareness of cloud platforms, preferably Azure

jobs.title: SENIOR WEBDEVELOPER .NET
jobs.content:
About Emakina.NL
With offices in Amsterdam, Brussels, Geneva and Paris, Emakina Group is one of the leading full service digital agencies in Europe. We have an awesome portfolio that we are very proud of, with several (inter)national clients, including Unilever Global, Greenpeace, Coolcat, Rituals, HEMA, WE Fashion and Floris van Bommel. We build complex e-commerce platforms, innovative applications and exciting activation campaigns. In addition, we are a Certified Implementation Partner of Demandware. Although part of a large international group Emakina.NL is an informal and non-hierarchical organization with a friendly, openminded atmosphere and around 100 employees in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.

What do we offer you:
We offer an interesting job at a highly innovative company, where everything is developed in-house. The working environment is informal yet professional. There is plenty of room for initiatives and personal development. Besides a good salary we offer you the opportunity to be part of an enthusiastic team in an international environment. Since there is more in life than hard work, we regularly organize activities such as barbecues, beach parties, pop quizzes, soccer tournaments and the annual ski trip.

jobs.title: Senior Application Developer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Developer, you will be responsible for maintaining and expanding the tools our company uses every day.  Additionally, you will assist in the improvement of the department as a whole, extending influence beyond individual programming tasks.  This includes assisting more junior developers with their projects, guiding them toward better programming solutions; assisting department leadership in setting and achieving department goals; reviewing complicated or mission-critical designs, code, and tests; and seeking and documenting ways to improve our current codebase and system processes.


We value developers who write simple, efficient, maintainable code; possess good communication skills; seek to thoroughly understand the needs of the business; and are able to get things done.  Our team growing: if you possess these qualities, we would love for you to apply!

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for Software Engineers to lead our Agile Scrum development teams in building products to support Merkle’s Identity Recognition vision.  Your team will develop code all day, every day, on a full stack cloud platform using Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure, leveraging test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery.  Your team will work in a highly structured, paired programming environment to enable learning and maximize productivity.  You will partner with Product Managers at Merkle to translate our product strategy into highly functional, modular, and high-performance code.  This is a tremendous opportunity to lead the creation of next-generation technologies, capabilities, and products to set us apart from the competition.


About You



  • You love to code and you’re willing to fail fast and iterate to success.

  • You’re an experienced team lead or senior software engineer ready to step into a lead role

  • You’re someone who enjoys educating less experienced developers

  • You’re ready to judge your success by the success of your team and the happiness of your customers.

  • You play well with others and have well developed communications skills.

  • You have experience with Test Driven Development (TDD) and agile methodologies. If you are not interested in truly living in this world, it’s not going to work out.

  • You are proficient in several programming languages. You will be pairing with developers and need to be able to understand code well enough to ask/answer good questions.

  • You have a clear understanding of cloud services, deployment models and distributed systems.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer For The Visual Computing
jobs.content:
Did you always dream of developing the way do the future? Than you should join our visual computing tools team! We invite you to be a part of intel`s Software Group and join us in the development of top of the art tools for the computer vision domain, with an emphasis on deep learning and convolution neural networks. Your Mission:


You will develop cutting edge technologies and tools for deep learning and convolution neural networks across different Intel architectures. The tools you will develop will support varied open source frameworks such as Caffe, Torch and more, while enabling leading academic topologies and optimizations.


You will develop tools that will utilize programing API's (such as: OpenCL, OpenVX and more...) to optimize the networks to Intel platforms.


Your development environment will be mostly C/C++ on top of multiple OS's including windows and Linux.

jobs.title: Director Software Engineering
jobs.content:
At Rocket, no two days are the same. As Director Software Engineering at Rocket Internet, you will guide technical teams building systems and products that may be used by tens of millions of people around the world every day from our headquarters in Berlin.


You will manage one or more cross-functional teams, taking them from concept to production, while remaining involved from a hands-on technical standpoint.


Your responsibilities will include:



  • Growth; ensuring every hire is better than the last by remaining an active partner in the hiring and interview processes.

  • Team management; ensuring your team are happy and productive, while empowering their careers at Rocket.

  • Speed; implementing and improving the agile processes that enable our teams to deliver high quality products on time.

  • Communication; managing expectations with business and product owners.

  • Designing systems and organizations that are scalable and maintainable.

jobs.title: IT System Administrator
jobs.content:
movingimage is in a process of fast growth and therefore looking for qualified tech specialist for its newly formed teams. We are hiring talented engineers with a broad and deep understanding of technology, visionary, yet very pragmatic engineers, who can envision and implement next generation software innovations.


You will be working with our multinational team on designing and implementing enterprise software solutions. And there's a lot more to learn about us, for example from our video: http://www.movingimage24.com/de/ueber-uns/jobs/


Interested?


Then you're in the right place, because we are currently looking for an experienced:


IT System Administrator (m/f)


Would you like to…



  • take a leading role in the planning, installation, integration, operation, optimization and continuous development of our IT-infrastructure?

  • be a competent point of contact for the implementation of individual video management solutions for our customers?

  • provide and maintain a reliable infrastructure for our software development process?

  • administer Linux- or BSD-based systems?

  • contribute new creative ideas for the further development and enhancement of our network operation system?

  • manage complex networks, and uphold and implement the highest safety requirements?

  • help to professionalize our classical help-desk-services (Windows, Linux, Mac)

  • prove your team skills as a member of an agile team?

  • experience, how the principles of the Agile Methodology are implemented and lived within the whole organization?


Are you able to…



  • show us your experience in the administration of Linux-systems?

  • administrate web services (Apache, Nginx), database- and cluster-systems (MySQL, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Zookeeper)?

  • understand infrastructure- and network-systems deep and profound?

  • prove us your experience with virtual machines (VMware, LXC, OpenVZ)?

  • handle firewalls, load balancers, DNS, Web caches, monitoring systems, scripting?

  • demonstrate us your experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery?

  • understand and ideally code in object-oriented programming languages such as PHP, Java, Perl or Python?

  • deal with GIT/SVN and CDN-technologies?

  • communicate in German and English in a professional way?

  • present at least a bachelor’s degree in computer sciences (or some other significant degree) and relevant work experience of minimum three years?


 Do you feel addressed? We should get to know each other!


 We offer…



  • an exciting perspective, a wide range of tasks, constantly new challenges and a desire for thinking out-of-the-box as part of our corporal culture

  • an open working environment that is characterised by teamwork and cross-functional cooperation and in which heart and humour are key figures

  • freedom to introduce your own ideas and to take responsibility


Even more interested?


Apply now!


Submit your meaningful application documents noting your earliest available starting date through our online portal at the following link: https://www.movingimage24.com/de/jobs/it-system-administrator-mw/


Your contact:


Christoph Hauser | HR Manager


MovingIMAGE24 GmbH


Stralauer Allee 7 | 10245 Berlin


You will find more about us on our website:


www.movingimage.com

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
movingimage is in a process of fast growth and therefore looking for qualified senior software engineers for its newly formed teams. We are hiring talented engineers with a broad and deep understanding of technology, visionary, yet very pragmatic developers, who can envision and implement next generation software innovations.


You will be working with our multinational team on designing and implementing enterprise software solutions. And there's a lot more to learn about us, for example from our video: http://www.movingimage24.com/de/ueber-uns/jobs/


Interested?


Then you're in the right place, because we are currently looking for an experienced:


Senior Software Engineer (m/f)


Would you like to…



  • be an important part of our multinational agile software development team?

  • implement the new version of our APIs using technologies like GRPC, Spring, HATEOAS, Akka, Mongo DB, RabbitMQ and Kafka?

  • implement high-quality and scalable video asset management and video streaming solutions for enterprise customers?

  • deliver a rich, engaging and unmatched user experience?

  • write well-structured and documented “clean” code?

  • continuously update and expand the existing product?

  • experience how the principles of the Agile Methodology are implemented and lived within the whole organization?


Are you able to…



  • present at least a bachelor’s degree in computer sciences (or some other significant degree) and relevant work experience in building high traffic web applications using J2EE, Spring, Scala or Golang of at least 6 years?

  • demonstrate that you are a language agnostic with core understanding of mainstream programming languages and proven programming experience in either Java or C++?

  • demonstrate that you are a native user of linux systems (preferably Debian-based distribution)?

  • be hands-on in designing software and solving complexity by using OOP design patterns and SOLID principles?

  • prove that you are experienced in building Domain Driven Design (DDD) applications and web services?

  • show that you are familiar with asynchronous and event-driven programming using frameworks like Vert.x, Reactor and Netty?

  • show strong knowledge of NoSQL databases (especially MongoDB and ElasticSearch) and MySQL?

  • ideally also prove previous experience in implementing RESTful APIs for mobile and web applications?

This delivers transparency and control over every conversation, so companies can optimize lead generation, map the full path to conversion, and increase sales conversions.


Thanks to smartphones, consumers are calling businesses to engage in conversations at record rates throughout every stage of the customer journey, and at DialogTech we are changing the world of voice communications for our customers.  We enable our customers to better attribute, route, personalize, and handle their voice interactions at each stage of the marketing and sales processes.

This role will work closely with Product Managers, Developers, QA and Operations teams. This role will have ownership of the technical solution from end to end, helping us build a highly scalable application using multiple services within AWS.

jobs.content:

You will take ownership for hands-on fixing of performance problems in Java and JavaScript (AngularJS), in addition to defining best practices for the implementation (coding, configuration, instrumentation, metrics) and monitoring of high-performance Web applications including SOA REST services for mobile applications.

You will also be responsible for the performance testing of Web applications, including response time, scalability (load tests) and network bandwith requirements etc.


As the successful Java Performance Engineer, you will be working within a highly capable team of Software Engineers and Business Analysts within the Edinburgh Development Centre.  You will be instrumental in improving team performance across design, development, testing and consulting, to help to avoid customer escalations and meet and exceed industry standard response times.
