jobs.title: Backend/Full-stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Interested in cracking rare genetic diseases through computation? Help us grow our engineering team of two. We're an 18-person startup funded by private investments and public grants, such as a $1.5M NIH Grant for Rare Disease Drug Discovery, and an upcoming multi-million series A.


As engineers, we extract and present biological data efficiently and reliably. Our other team members include biologists, who run cell experiments in a wet lab, and data scientists, who build descriptive models from experimental data.


We're looking for strong back-end engineers, and full-stack engineers. We use Go, JavaScript, and some Python, on a myriad of cloud services from AWS and GCE.


Here are some past and upcoming projects:



  • Distribute computations that extract geometric features from cell images on EC2, every day. Computations are docker-ized, and run on up to 10,000 cores at a time.

  • Web-app to view super-imposed cell segmentation boundaries on raw cell images, with zoom, contrast, and composite functions.

  • Sync terabytes of high-resolution cellular images daily from our high-content microscope to S3.

  • Web-app to view thumbnails across related experiments using the HTML5 Canvas and AngularJS.

  • Color-composite and generate thumbnails of cellular images on AWS Lambda in real-time. We run millions of GB*sec of λ computations monthly.

  • Automatically detect contamination in experiments through image recognition.

  • Develop an in-house laboratory information management system (LIMS) that pulls IoT data from complex biological machines.

  • Build a responsive front-end for the LIMS that biologists can actually use in a lab -- a great UX challenge.

  • Write the cluster infrastructure for our deep-learning experiments.


If you're interested in coding for a meaningful purpose and building distributed systems, web apps and tools for biologists, or just have a knack for back-end coding, let us know -- you don't need a biology background.


We offer competitive compensation and our hiring process is fast.

jobs.title: Integration Engineer
jobs.content:
Internet.org is a global initiative dedicated to making affordable Internet access available to the two thirds of the world not yet connected. Making the Internet available to every person on earth is a goal too large and too important for any one company, group, or government to solve alone. Internet.org’s partners have come together to meet this challenge because they believe in the power of a connected world. This role is an opportunity to be part of this initiative by working with Network Infrastructure Companies and Internet Service Providers, delivering affordable Internet service to the unconnected in rural areas. As a Partner Engineer you will handle the technical relationship with Internet Service Providers based in rural areas worldwide, and work closely with the Facebook account managers to draft the partnership roadmap to provide affordable and reliable Internet access. This position is full time and is based in London.


Responsibilities





  • Deeply understand the various Facebook platforms and underlying implementation


  • Be a technical expert on integrating Wi-Fi network solutions, Facebook software and internet.org core features with ISPs’ infrastructure


  • Help our partners to launch the internet.org service in their networks


  • Manage the technical relationship with the ISP partners, provide technical support and handle service outages


  • Drive partner requirements, bugs and feature requests with Product and Engineering


  • Write documentation, samples, and other materials to share with the broader Facebook developer community

jobs.title: Production Engineer
jobs.content:
Production Engineers at Facebook are hybrid software/systems engineers who ensure that Facebook's services run smoothly and have the capacity for future growth. They are embedded in every one of Facebook's product and infrastructure teams, and are core participants in every significant engineering effort underway in the company. Our team is comprised of varying levels of experience and backgrounds, from new grads to industry veterans. Relevant industry experience is important, but ultimately less so than your demonstrated abilities and attitude. We sail into uncharted waters every day at Facebook in Production Engineering, and we are always learning. This position is full-time and located in our Tel Aviv office.



Responsibilities





  • Own back-end services like our Hadoop data warehouses, front-end services like Chat and Newsfeed, infrastructure components like our Memcache infrastructure, and everything in between


  • Write and review code, develop documentation and capacity plans, and debug the hardest problems, live, on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world


  • Together with your engineering team, you will share an on-call rotation


  • Partnered alongside the best engineers in the industry on the coolest stuff around, the code and systems you work on will be in production and used by millions of users all around the world

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer

  • Works with other software engineers and management to develop new tools or enhance current systems for customer requirements, defects and integration with other systems.

jobs.title: Front-end Developer
jobs.content:
Een front-end developer met passie voor javascript, zeer technisch onderlegd en een echte teamplayer. Je werkt aan en denkt mee over de architectuur van complexe javascript applicaties en API’s voor vooruitstrevende producten in de onderwijs sector.


Wat ga je doen?


Topicus .Education werkt in de volledige onderwijssector aan innovatieve oplossingen voor scholen, docenten, ouders en leerlingen. Het bereik van onze producten is dan ook zeer groot. Je draait mee in een van de agile teams om te werken aan de front-ends van grote en kleine applicaties. Daarnaast krijg je een belangrijke rol in de opzet en architectuur van onze single page javascript applicaties. Een van de applicaties waar je zeker aan gaat werken is ons eigen analytics platform waarbij configureerbare, zeer dynamische dashboards aan onze gebruikers gepresenteerd worden.

jobs.title: Software Engineer .NET
jobs.content:
Voor zowel onze divisie Finance (Deventer, Utrecht en Zwolle) als Zorg (Deventer) zijn wij op zoek naar eigenwijze .NET software ontwikkelaars.


Wat ga je doen?


Als software ontwikkelaar ben je een actief lid van een projectteam, het team bestaat uit een gezonde mix van junior, medior en senior collega’s. Jouw eigen ideeën en kennis van techniek krijgen alle kans om in de praktijk te worden toegepast.


Bij Topicus is software ontwikkelen meer dan programmeren alleen. Dankzij onze op Agile en SCRUM gebaseerde projectaanpak zijn we in staat snel en doelgericht applicaties te realiseren. We werken graag met de nieuwste frameworks en technieken van Microsoft. Zo gebruiken we .Net 4.5, SQL Server 2012, het Microsoft MVC framework en de Razor engine. Hiermee kunnen we op een makkelijke en robuuste manier webapplicaties ontwikkelen. Daarnaast maken we gebruik van HTML5 en jQuery, wat standaard wordt meegeleverd in het MVC framework. We zijn druk bezig met mobile-first design. Dit zorgt ervoor dat we goed nadenken over hoe we onze applicaties ontwerpen. Wanneer we de uitbreiding maken naar de klassieke browsers dan zorgen we dat onze webapplicaties meeschalen naar de grootte van het scherm. Zo kunnen we één applicatie ontwikkelen voor zowel de mobiele telefoon, tablet als desktop.

jobs.title: Software Engineer Java
jobs.content:
Topicus heeft altijd plek voor Java ontwikkelaars met originele ideeën en veel eigen initiatief. Je werkt aan en denkt mee over innovatieve oplossingen voor uitdagende, complexe ICT-vraagstukken in Deventer, Enschede, Zwolle of Nijmegen.


Wat ga je doen?


Als Software Engineer ben je een actief lid van een projectteam. Een team bestaat uit een gezonde mix van junior, medior en senior collega’s. Jouw eigen ideeën en kennis van techniek krijgen alle kans om in de praktijk te worden toegepast.


Bij Topicus is software ontwikkelen namelijk meer dan programmeren alleen. Dankzij onze op Agile en SCRUM gebaseerde projectaanpak zijn we in staat snel en doelgericht applicaties te realiseren. We zijn druk bezig met de transitie van de (nu al) traditionele webapplicaties naar een multidevice wereld waar onze gebruikers naast webbrowsers steeds meer gebruik gaan maken van tablets en mobiele telefoons om de informatie te vergaren. Al deze devices moeten uiteraard naadloos op elkaar aansluiten en hiervoor worden diverse technologieën gebruikt, bijvoorbeeld Java 7, Apache Wicket, JAX-RS, Hibernate, CDI en JQuery voor de ontsluiting via het web. Daarnaast worden de native apps ontwikkeld in onder andere iOS en Android waarbij er een geavanceerde integratie met onze web applicaties is. Aan welke projecten je gaat werken, dat hangt vooral van jou af. Als jij je voorkeuren en affiniteit aangeeft, vinden wij daar een passend project bij.

Wij hebben Java teams in zowel Deventer (Zorg & Onderwijs) als Enschede (Onderwijs & Overheid) als Zwolle (Finance) en zijn op zoek naar zowel ervaren als onervaren Java collega's.

jobs.title: Application Security Architect
jobs.content:
A Day in the Life of an Application Security Architect: 



The Application Security Architect secures enterprise information by determining security requirements, planning, implementing, testing security systems, preparing security standards, policies, and procedures.



Responsibilities: 




  • Assist software and network engineers, system and database administrators, and product managers with assessing security threats, identifying and tailoring security requirements and integrating security controls into the Product / Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)

  • Ensure the implementation of a secure build integration process; secure source code repositories practices and code escrow process

  • Ensure WAF protection and implementation are in place and responsible for maintaining rules, monitoring alerts and ensuring appropriate actions are taken.

  • Determine security requirements by evaluating business strategies and requirements; researching information security standards; conducting system security and vulnerability analyses and risk assessments; studying architecture/platform; identifying integration issues; preparing cost estimates

  • Plans security systems by evaluating network and security technologies; developing requirements for local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), virtual private networks (VPNs), routers, firewalls, and related security and network devices; designs public key infrastructures (PKIs), including use of certification authorities (CAs) and digital signatures as well as hardware and software; adhering to industry standards

  • Verifies security systems by developing and implementing test scripts

  • Maintain security by monitoring and ensuring compliance to standards, policies, and procedures; conducting incident response analyses; developing and conducting training programs

  • Upgrade security systems by monitoring security environment; identifying security gaps; evaluating and implementing enhancements

  • Serves as the security architecture expert for the security functional areas across the organization and with 3rd-parties

  • Performs architecture risk analysis for existing systems, new acquisitions, identifies gaps and provides feedback for advancing enterprise security capabilities

  • Integrates security activities into projects or programs development lifecycle, ensures security activities are aligned with schedules and understands how to make win-win decisions between security and functionality

  • Lead the Security development effort to build secure applications to ensure key business and regulatory requirements are delivered.  Staying abreast of current and emerging technologies, and applying security best practices and technical expertise to create best-in-class Secure System Architecture

  • Drive secure application delivery through automated and manual application security testing

  • Implements security systems by specifying intrusion detection methodologies and equipment; directing equipment and software installation and calibration; preparing preventive and reactive measures; creating, transmitting, and maintaining keys; providing technical support; completing documentation

  • Leads or participates in setting the System Architectural strategy and defining the architecture roadmap

  • Leads or participates in the creation of application solution designs

  • Reviews work of other team members and mentor junior analysts as needed

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Software Engineer at Ormsby Street, you will:



  • Work across the team and with end users and partners to create and improve software product innovations for market testing and deployment including QA and testing.

  • Contribute to the strategy, structure and objectives of the organisation and own the strategy and execution, team, tools and processes of the engineering team.

  • Manage detailed relationships with technical counterparts at partner organisations.

  • Work across the team to develop and evaluate product feature ideas, integrations, data sources and product versions.

  • Develop code to company standards across multiple devices.

  • Generate product insights and feature requirements from performance analytics.

jobs.title: PHP backend developer / full-stack developer
jobs.content:
Our Software as a Service (SaaS) solution is a framework which empowers companies of all lines of business to sell their services and products online.
This includes, but is not limited to searching, publishing, paying, real-time communication and collaboration in addition to analytical monitoring and tracking. We are funded by Deutsche Telekom (T-Ventures) and IBB as well as select individual investors and were incorporated in 2012. Our main focus is to build customized B2B solutions based on our framework mainly in the banking, insurance, e-Learning and tele-medicine/healthcare sectors.


Since our Sales-Team is more and more recognized as the gods of acquiring new projects, we are currently seeking to hire a PHP backend developer (f/m) for our team.


We are working in a very modern office in the heart of Berlin with a perfect infrastructure (hub:raum, Deutsche Telekom AG) and have built an inspiring but challenging environment with creative, dynamic and multi-cultural colleagues. Take your chance to shape a truly innovative software as a service solution and to get insights in a large variety of businesses as well as the challenging task to build a digital communication channel to support different business-models.


Your responsibilities that directly impacts the future of the company:


As a member of our growing team you will have a mandate to take part in all stages of the development life cycle. Your key daily tasks include:



  • Develop, implement and maintain our code with PHP, MySQL

  • Develop a continues integration process and environment for our increasing number of projects

  • Develop a smart, uniform testing environment that automatically tests our projects and helps us reducing the workload of Quality Assurance

  • Improve the quality of our current modules and help us staying a provider of cutting edge communication solutions


Perform code verification and help to create a code-review process that is driven not by controlling but by the desire to learn from each other and that is open to innovation

jobs.content: BigRep is looking for an experienced Systems Administrator to help manage and expand our internal and external networks and server capability.

jobs.title: Web Developer with a bit of Node.js 100%
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about cross-platform applications for the IoT field and love to work in an international start-up?

Our product development staff is looking for a software ace with a talent for finding elegant solutions in concert with a small team of peers in a comfortable, non-bureaucratic environment. The place of work is at our new offices at the Albulastrasse 57 in 8048 Zurich.

Your Task's will be:



  • You develop workflows and web frontend's for automation devices.

  • You test and improve the integration of third party hardware.

  • You develop custom solutions for customers or events.

  • Supporting and improving existing Node.js API.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Broad Institute's Cancer Program Data Science (CPDS) group is seeking an exceptional software developer to accelerate our efforts. The CPDS sits at the nexus of cancer research and data science, where our interdisciplinary team helps map the landscape of cancer vulnerabilities and discover how to utilize those vulnerabilities in patient populations. Utilizing our respective specialties in machine learning, computation, biological expertise and leveraging novel datasets being generated at the Broad, we are advancing knowledge through our collective efforts.


We are looking for a highly motivated software developer to join this team. Embedding within this agile team is ideal for a developer interested in machine learning and biology. You will collaborate with scientists in a collegial work environment characterized by informality and intellectual rigor. You will enable members of the team by removing barriers to data and computation and accelerating discovery. Your efforts and skills are necessary to tackle the increasingly ambitious questions in the face of ever growing datasets and complexity.


The Broad Institute provides a vibrant research environment with close links to top academic institutions across the Boston area and provides the potential for your contributions to be used and recognized worldwide.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Develop and maintain tools for visualization and dissemination of results to streamline communication across projects.

  • Develop infrastructure to empower computational biologists to use elastic resources such as cloud compute and storage.

  • Creation of public facing websites for exploration of datasets for the global scientific community.

  • Interacting with scientists and computational biologists to understand needs and identify pain points in existing processes.

  • Employ robust engineering practices to manage complexity as projects and datasets grow.

jobs.title: Travel Planner
jobs.content:
Travel Planner  
Remote Year is a program for global professionals, during which we travel for a year with interesting people while working remotely (12 cities, 12 months). With a massive shift toward cloud / remote productivity, and a millennial passion for experiences and travel, Remote Year delivers a year-long work and travel experience.  
  
Role Description 
The Remote Year Travel Team owns all group travel across all Remote Year groups. This includes all flights, ground transport, and sea transport. This role supports the Travel Director with the administration of all travel execution (booking travel, managing details, etc.).  This role can be based anywhere, though occasional travel to our operating sites may be required.  
  
Responsibilities: 
Travel administration:  
* Assist the execution of all Remote Year travel bookings (air, land, sea)  
* Track all deviation requests  
* Assist in monthly communication of travel plans  
* Manage and reply to all relevant travel change requests from Remotes directly  
  
Qualifications:
2+ years of administration support experience.  
  
Qualities: 
* Organization skills â great time management skills, ability to multitask  
* Communications skills - ability to handle multiple, constant communication channels; ability to effectively communicate with program teams and with customers directly

To apply: Please complete our online application for the Travel Planner role at http://remote-year.breezy.hr/.

jobs.title: Professional Programming Lead
jobs.content: **Remote Year Business Description** Remote Year is a program for global professionals, during which we travel for a year with interesting people while working remotely (12 cities, 12 months). With a massive shift toward cloud / remote productivity, and a millennial passion for experiences and travel, Remote Year delivers a year-long work and travel experience. **Role Description** The Professional Programming Lead helps our Remotes (customers) and teams develop professionally by leveraging local speakers, companies, and experts for world-class professional development. Working closely with our local operations teams and program leadership, this role will contribute to the identification, creation and expansion of professional programming for all of our year-long experiences. The goal is provide opportunities for Remotes of different backgrounds and interests to grow and develop. While the focus of this role is around programming, this role is not intended to be an event manager. Rather, this is a strategic role in the organization meant to drive best in class programming throughout all our programs, sites, and teams. **Responsibilities** * Develop and implement a portfolio of replicable yet local experiences with an emphasis in professional programming including but not limited to service, volunteering, mentoring and fundraising. * Source global partnerships with organizations that can aid in Remote Yearâs programming efforts. * Determine goal-setting and goal-tracking process for Remotes to maintain focus throughout the experience. * Utilizing available data and collecting other needed inputs, evaluate program success and make recommendations for improvements for future iterations. * Actively seek participant (Remote) and staff feedback, emphasizing clear communication and a bias for action. **Qualifications** * Bachelorâs degree in a related field, including education, service learning, program management or adult learning. Masterâs degree in relevant discipline a plus * Demonstrated experience in implementing professional programming required * Experience managing complex projects * Excellent communication skills and organizational skills * Ability to work with minimal guidance and be comfortable operating in ambiguity **Qualities** * Ownership â we are looking for someone that will own this and crush it * Passion for travel â role will require frequent presence on Remote Year programs * Organization skills â great time management skills, ability to multitask * Interpersonal skills - while the role is more strategic in nature, each member of our team touches Remotes (customers) in one way or another

jobs.title: Director of Customer Excellence
jobs.content:
**Remote Year Business Description**  
Remote Year is a platform for global professionals, during which we travel for a year with interesting people while working remotely (12 cities, 12 months). With a massive shift toward cloud / remote productivity, and a millennial passion for experiences and travel, Remote Year delivers a year-long work and travel experience.
  
  
**Role Description**  
At Remote Year, we believe that our success comes from our engaged, highly satisfied customers we call Remotes.  We need an ambitious, smart, natural people person to come shape our customer service experience and scale it throughout our company.  The Director of Customer Experience will own all aspects of customer service at Remote Year.  You and the team you build over time will be expected to provide the best service possible while also educating other Remote Year employees on the ins and outs of the leading customer service culture you will help establish.  
  
**Responsibilities**  
* Design and develop the Remote Year customer experience philosophy, and educate all other Dreamers on how best to serve our Remotes.

* Ensure appropriate steps are taken to resolve Remotesâ inquiries and needs.  
* Establish a recordkeeping strategy for all customer interactions, and use this data to provide recommendations for improvements for the Remote Year platform.  
* Establish framework for empowering the team to make decisions based on customer issues, as well as an escalation process.  
* Establish a culture and process for celebrating successes within the team.  
* Provide your insights and expertise to the Remote Year team in other ways that arise, and be willing to pitch in and help however you can.  
  
  
**Qualifications**

* 3+ years experience in customer service or related roles  
* 1+ years leading a Customer Service team, preferably in a hospitality environment  
* Experience working with people of different cultures and backgrounds  
  
**Qualities**  
* Ownership â we are looking for someone that will own this and crush it

* Organization skills â great time management skills, ability to multitask  
* Interpersonal skills - while the role is more strategic in nature, each member of our team touches Remotes (customers) in one way or another

jobs.title: Fullstack Engineer
jobs.content:
Engineering is a core part of who we are. We work hard to have a best of breed engineering culture. You will work with a carefully selected team of ex-Google, VMware, ThoughtWorks, and Atlassian engineers. The engineering team takes pride in its focus on engineering fundamentals. The team strives to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand, and to strike a measured balance between getting things done and long term maintainability. The team is tight, with no big egos, and welcomes self-driven engineers to come and join in on the adventure. Frequently engineers host sessions where a new idea or software engineering practice is discussed – this ensures that everyone in the team is constantly learning. 


The Canva code base was setup to scale; from day one. This has allowed for a unique environment where engineers spend most of their time optimising performance and releasing new features rather than fixing legacy code. This also ensures that it’s just more fun working on the code base. We also have a flat structure where engineers are invited to comment on the direction their peers are taking and are paired for pair-reviewing to occur. This ensures that knowledge around the code base is shared and speed of release occurs. You can find more about our engineering practices in this blog article (https://engineering.canva.com/2015/08/25/how-we-get-things-done/).


Your role:



  • Work with product designers and founders to build a next-generation web application with a focus on an exceptional client-side experience

  • Build efficient and reusable front end abstractions and systems

  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks

  • Participate in design and code reviews

  • Communicate with other team members to determine the best solutions to difficult problems

  • Identify and communicate best practices for front end engineering

  • Interact with our back end systems

  • Use a spacer.gif in our email templates every now and then

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer(AngularJS)
jobs.content:
Are you are looking for innovation? Do you seek to work with passionate and talented individuals? Then join the Kisura family and help us create the game changer in online fashion!


Launched in May 2013, Kisura is the first personal shopping platform for women. By combining tradition and innovation, we offer our customers a first-class shopping experience. Working with a complex user and product database we are able to offer our customers handpicked outfits.


Well-known investors and e-commerce experts back us. We have a strong network of suppliers and partners.


As a frontend developer at Kisura you will be working on frontend tasks, extending and maintaining our platform to the next level. You should be comfortable in a fluid start-up environment and bring an energetic, fun and creative approach to your work.

jobs.title: Sofware Architect
jobs.content:
Zype is the video distribution service for OTT 


We are dedicated to making it easy for content owners to connect directly with their audiences on every screen.


With Zype, enterprise content owners and brands can own and accelerate all aspects of their video distribution pipeline.


The Zype cloud service provides publishing, monetization, streaming, audience management, and analytics software that is integrated into hundreds of web, mobile, and OTT apps and engaged by million of viewers every month.


Learn more about Zype >> http://www.zype.com/company



Software Architect in New York City


Zype is hiring a Software Architect, an individual contributor role, in our New York City office on West 28th and 7th Avenue. This position will be in our Engineering group, which is responsible for building, improving, and maintaining our multi-tenant cloud based video services.



Requirements:



  • Software design expertise, specifically multi-tenant cloud based services, APIs, and dashboards

  • Over 5 years experience in software development

  • A demonstrable history of shipping production code

  • Ruby and Ruby on Rails expertise (senior level)

  • MongoDB and SQL expertise

  • AWS-based infrastrcture expertise - must have

  • Willingness to work on and deliver a take home project

  • 4 Year Degree in CS or equivalent

  • Advanced Degree preferred

  • Experience with microservice design a plus

  • Experience with Docker and ECS a plus


Responsibilities:



  • Report to Product Manager on day to day sprint and long term roadmap planning

  • Design cloud infrastructure, microservices, databases, applications, and front-ends for cloud video services

  • Lead development efforts for new development projects

  • Provide mentorship and support to junior developers

  • Write specifications and detailed technical designs and documentation before, during, and after projects are build and shipped

  • Work with local and remote development and DevOps teams

  • Communicate with 3rd party vendors and partners and collaborate with their engineering teams on integrations



Learn more about How We Hire >>  http://www.zype.com/how-we-hire

jobs.title: ScrumMaster
jobs.content:
Key responsibilities


You will manage one or more agile projects, typically to deliver a specific product or transformation via a multi-disciplinary, highly skilled team. You’ll be adept at delivering complex projects, breaking down barriers for your team, and both planning at a higher level and getting into the detail to make things happen when needed. You will be core to decisions that build high performing teams, where people are excited about the work they are undertaking.


The responsibilities of the post are:



  • Deliver projects and products using the appropriate agile project management methodology, learning & iterating frequently

  • Work with the product owners to define the roadmap for any given product and translate this into user stories

  • Organize and/or facilitate all sprint ceremonies

  • Support Product Owners to prioritise the work that needs to be done against the capacity and capability of the team

  • Ensure all products are built to an appropriate level of quality for the stage (alpha/beta/production)

  • Actively participate in the agile / ScrumMaster community. Share and re-apply skills and knowledge and bring in best practices

  • Ensure impediments are removed so that the teams can run efficiently

  • Provide coaching in the team in agile concepts, principles and values. Ultimately lead teams to higher levels of performance and productivity

  • Socialise agile concepts throughout the organization and provide training and coaching in agile frameworks, processes, principles, vales and techniques.

  • Be an agent of change and establish a culture of continuous improvement.

  • Implement a process to measure the capacity of the agile teams

  • Understand the value of metrics and radiating information and measure and provide feedback on sprint velocity and team performance

  • Assist the technical teams with estimation

  • Document the appropriate aspects of design and development processes

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Our engineering teams architect, develop and test our social network. As a Senior Frontend Developer, you will be responsible for building awesome frontends, assuring their quality and running them in a production environment in an interdisciplinary team of different specialists.


As a Senior Frontend Developer at InterNations, you will:



  • implement and architect web applications in HTML, CSS and JavaScript in a Scrum team

  • identify and communicate front-end best practices

  • build efficient and reusable front-end systems and abstractions

  • test your code with automated tests

  • take part in expanding, documenting and implementing our UX pattern library

  • work with Product Management on the feasibility of upcoming changes


You meet the following requirements:



  • expert-level knowledge of JavaScript: you understand prototypal inheritance, scoping, and closures

  • familiarity beyond ES5 (e.g. ES6, TypeScript, CoffeeScript) 

  • you care about consistency of design and dislike having ten different buttons on a single page

  • you like fast web applications and know how to optimize them

  • experience in JavaScript frameworks, especially React and Backbone is a plus but deep JavaScript knowledge is way more important

  • you want to learn new things: technology, practices, user interactions

  • you have an interest in coordinating cross-team efforts and initiatives

  • a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience as a frontend developer

  • familiarity with automated testing, be it unit-, functional- and/or acceptance testing


We offer:



  • top notch MacBook, 27” display, keyboard layout of choice

  • a fast-growing, dynamic company with international scope

  • a friendly work atmosphere and the space you need to pursue your own ideas

  • weekly team breakfasts, fresh fruit & regular team events

  • a central location in a wonderful cosmopolitan city with beautiful natural surroundings

  • support with visa and work permit application

  • we only need to support IE 10+


Sound interesting?


Then start the conversation by sending in your application today (CV, cover letter, start date, salary expectation) c/o Lars Strojny to:jobs@internations.org

Please include in your cover letter a list of projects you contributed to and are proud of. We also like to hear about what kind of work environment you aspire for and what technologies you find interesting right now.

jobs.title: Tester
jobs.content:
Tester

“If it compiles, ship it”. Niet mee eens? Mooi! Dan zou jij wel eens onze nieuwe junior tester kunnen zijn.

Is dit weer zo’n mooiweerverhaal?
De financiële wereld is absoluut saai en muf. Gelukkig doen wij het op onze eigen manier. Brand New Day is geen onderdeel van een andere bank of verzekeraar… de helft van het bedrijf is nog steeds in handen van het personeel. Geloof je ons niet? Kom eens op gesprek!

Wat doe je als tester?
Je snapt dat 100.000 klanten de boel al erg complex maken. Cruciaal dat jij onze systemen continu test op veiligheid, kwaliteit en de langetermijnplanning. Minstens zo belangrijk is dat je als test engineer niet alleen de ruimte krijgt om zelf met oplossingen te komen. Dat verwachten we ook van je. Wijzigt bijvoorbeeld ons beleggingsbeleid? Dan ga je aan de slag: van unittesten met ontwikkelaars tot en met functionele acceptatietests met eindgebruikers. Ook maak je zelf testtaken aan op de backlog die je

jobs.title: Software Developer  Python
jobs.content:
Sainsbury’s, one of the UK’s largest retailers is investing heavily in digital innovation - its aim being to build a centre of excellence where digital output is crafted using industry leading best practice frameworks and methodologies to produce the world class apps and services.


We are looking for Python Developers to help build great apps and services in the Sainsbury’s Digital Team. You will work across multiple platforms and technologies to create a beautiful application ecosystem that is consistent, highly usable, reliable and performant.


We’re looking for developers who:



  • Write well structured, well-commented, maintainable code

  • See unit testing as part of the process

  • Are able to assist in architecting systems and applications

  • Care about their craft, are aware of new technologies and be keen to use them when appropriate


As a Software Developer you will:



  • Be exposed to platform architecture and learn why we practice DevOps

  • Contribute to our growing ecosystem of microservices

  • Be an active, contributing part of an agile team

  • Use tracking tools to optimize workflow

  • Define your career path and be given the opportunity to grow and learn

jobs.title: PHP Software Developer With Focus On Backend
jobs.content:
In the Software Development Department of Wikimedia Deutschland e.V., we are building open source software that impacts the world. One of the main projects of the department is Wikidata, a free and open knowledge base containing general-purpose data about the world. Wikidata is Wikimedia’s central data repository. It is the building block of Wikimedia’s and Wikipedia’s future. WIkidata’s community and development team are working every day to give more people more access to more knowledge.


As a PHP Software Developer, you will work on programming and maintaining backend functionality of Wikidata and other services. You will be responsible for devising, implementing and testing new features in line with the product plan.


Our engineering teams are cross-functional, self-organizing and highly autonomous. You’ll be working directly with the Product Owner and be able to interact with various stakeholders in the community.


Among other things, testing, refactoring and pair programming are encouraged. We’re constantly trying to improve the way we work.


We are offering you



  • joining internal presentations by our developers on topics they are enthusiastic about,

  • attending local user groups during work time and we regularly go to conferences, both as attendees and participants,

  • will have a noticeable impact one of the top four visited websites in the world.


We are looking for someone to join our teams working in our office in the heart of Berlin. We are also offering working remote.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
The software development team at Nortech is focused on building a platform to enable a low-carbon next-generation power grid. We are looking for passionate, skilled software developers to join our team and deliver the software solutions that make this a reality. You will be in a position to help shape the future of a platform used by energy utilities across the globe.


We have a broad technology stack, using HTML5, TypeScript to build a rich UI on the frontend, APIs/services written in C# on the backend and MySQL for data storage. We use the best developer tools available including version control (Git), continuous integration (TeamCity), bug tracking (FogBugz) and monitoring (InfluxDB/Grafana). We are looking for developers who are keen to work across the full tech stack.


We have a culture where we promote every team member generating new ideas. Every team member is encouraged to take full ownership of the features they are adding. We use the right tools for the job and encourage developers to stay open to new technologies.


Requirements:



  • Experience using one or more general purpose programming languages (C#, TypeScript would be ideal)

  • Understanding of software development best practices

  • Interest and ability to learn new technologies as needed

  • Experience working in a team using source control (Git, Mercurial, SVN)


You must be eligible to work in the UK to apply for this position.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Senior Frontend Developer


Do you get excited from front-end development, but getting bored with HTML, CSS and jQuery? Are you able to build client-side apps on the blazing APIs which you have developed with our backenders? Yes? Then you are the person we are looking for!  


your role


As a leading digital agency in the Netherlands, we always thrive to use the best, fastest and most elegant online solutions for our customers. Always challenging our developers to find the most appropriate technologies to achieve the smoothest results.


Our developers work closely together so frontend, backend and design are connected to create a product that excels in quality, speed and scalability. You’ll work in an internationally oriented team in Rotterdam and Amsterdam where you will work in one or more scrum teams with other top notch developers and designers.


If you have the ambition, you are welcome to manage Junior and Medior Developers and make sure quality and knowledge is passed on.


As a Senior you are also expected to help set the application architecture with our architects and API developers. Between projects you optimize our automation tools, build new Angular directives or dig in the latest on technologies.

jobs.title: Software that defines future tech: EUV Source Software Designer
jobs.content:
Introduction


Do you feel excited creating robust software facilities? Enabling groundbreaking science to be implemented and translated into practical software? And do you have several years of software development experience in a high tech environment? This might be the job for you!


Job Mission & Description


Within ASML the next generation of lithography machines is being developed in the EUV (Extreme Ultra Violet) program. In the program a new light source (the "Source") is introduced which creates EUV light. 


We are looking for a Software Engineer in our EUV Source Facilities department. Here, we provide and deploy industrial strength software facilities that form the software backbone of a mature Source product line. These facilities include support for e.g. data management, interface construction, system diagnosis, product variability management, system control, etc. These facilities are used throughout the EUV Source software.



You will work in a team reporting to your team lead. This team uses Scrum/Kanban during development. You will have close collaboration with your architect and peers. To come to the right solutions, you are also required to discuss requirements with our stakeholders. For this you need to be pro-active and be able to find your way in the organization. In addition to creating new functionalities, a large part of our work consists of updating and troubleshooting existing (legacy) software.

We are proud of our team. We hire talented, motivated people and give them responsibility and the autonomy to innovate. We like people with a ‘can-do’ attitude and we want people who are inquisitive, hungry and eager to grow with us.

Summary of main responsibilities


- Develop and maintain software using C/C++/Python


- Perform Software Impact Analysis for proposed changes


- Write / update required documentation (design, test, ...)


- Implement and test accepted changes

jobs.title: Sr. Mobile iOS and/or Android Developer
jobs.content:
Your role


We are looking forward to welcome an experienced, full-time (40h) mobile developer iOS/Android. You are part of a professional development team. You develop mobile applications within an Agile Scrum-environment. You are (partially) responsible for the look-and-feel and interaction of perfectly functional applications. You make the best judgments on performance and technical implementation of the interaction interface related to budget and costs.

jobs.title: Agil softwareudvikler
jobs.content:
Vil du være en del af et ambitiøst og innovativt kontor i SKAT, hvor du bliver udfordret på de seneste teknologier? Det sidste halvår har vi arbejdet med teknologier, metoder og frameworks som:  

• Git/GitHub
• Travis CI   • Docker  
• HTML5 // JS; Angular, Gulp, Bower // CSS; Bootstrap  
• Ionic/Cordova  
• Java, Groovy, PHP Laravel, C#  
• JUNIT, PHPUnit, Spock, Cucumber  
• Elastic Search  
• RESTful API’s  
• MySQL, Oracle DB, Reddis, Azure, Web Logic  
• Continuous Integration og Delivery  
• Agile (Scrum, Kanban, ScrumBan)  

Vi vælger værktøj efter opgavens behov og kompleksitet, og du udfordrer os gerne på de tekniske valg. Du vil komme ind i et fagligt stærkt og passioneret udviklingsmiljø, hvor vi tror på en konstruktiv og uformel dialog, og hvor vi løfter opgaven som et team, hvor alle har en stemme. Vi sætter vores slutbrugere i fokus, og i tæt samarbejde med vores interaktionsdesignere vil du være involveret fra prototype til færdig løsning, og hvor vi ikke er bange for at ’fail fast’ efter moderne udviklingsprincipper. 

Vi skelner ikke så meget mellem, om du er den dygtigste frontender eller backender, men vi løser opgaven sammen og lærer af hinandens stærke og svage sider – og på den måde kommer vi i mål med opgaven. Du skal derfor være åben for at lære nye ting og bidrage i hele applikationsstacken. Vi holder jævnlig workshops sammen og udforsker nye teknologier, ligesom vi sætter tid af til at deltage i relevante faglige netværk og møder for faglig inspiration.

jobs.title: System Engineer
jobs.content:
We are a small company based in Tokyo that provides online translation services. Currently, our development team is looking for a junior to mid-level candidate who possesses both software development and system administration experience. The engineer would be responsible for the following:



  • Developing the databases and processes underlying our translation software

  • Developing QA software (primarily system observation tools)

  • Maintaining server hardware/software

  • Contributing to research and data mining for enhancement of system AI


Japanese resumes are given priority, so if you have one or can make one, please do so!

jobs.title: Backend product developer
jobs.content:
The opportunity: 


Working closely with our Technical Lead you'll work in two areas, split 50/50 between continuous development of our flagship product, Twine, and custom products for our clients such as British Airways, Government Digital Service (GDS) and Shell International.


You’ll be taking exciting concepts from prototype to go-live, growing ideas and shaping future design and development decisions.


Expect to be working in an environment where the user comes first and colleagues are always striving to improve the development process. You will contribute to the planning, implementation, and development of ideas that change the way people work.

You’ll be inspired, learn and develop your skill set by within our collaborative, cross-functional team.


Above everything, you’ll be encouraged to experiment, learn and develop your skill set within our friendly Shoreditch offices (where we finish the week at 4:00pm on Fridays).

Lastly, you’ll get to enjoy our legendary office socials.


Who we’re looking for: 


Your deep technical experience will play a key part in guiding the development of our own product, Twine, and the products of our clients.


You’re comfortable using the latest tools and frameworks (listed below), and ensuring the team pick the right tools for the job. Making confident technical decisions with an open mind to future development will be critical to the success of a product.


You should be comfortable making technical recommendations both to internal team members and clients.

You enjoy chatting about your ideas and concepts just as much as you like to build them. Perhaps your entrepreneurial spirit has led you to build a few personal web products of your own?

jobs.title: Sr. Automated Test Engineer - Help Your Career Take Off In The Airport Industry
jobs.content:
The role


Reporting to the Release Process Manager, you will be responsible for working as part of an agile test team testing items completed during a sprint. Joining as a senior member of the team, you will also have responsibility for mentoring more junior members of the team with the ability to react quickly and confidently to urgent situations. 


What sort of products will you work on? How about a baggage system, an airport management system or an airport performance system that gets deployed into places such as New York, Panama, Zurich or Geneva. These are critical systems for airlines, airports and passengers which are often deployed in time for such events as the Olympics and a football world cup! You can make a difference to not only your own travel experience but also that of many other millions of passengers daily.


What is it like to work here? Well there is a great learning and developing environment at Ultra within our software development teams. This is helped by our online subscriptions to training packages and also our cross team collaborations. 

Main Duties and Responsibilities 



  • Creating automated tests using a variety of third party testing tools

  • Creating and maintaining automated regression tests

  • Executing automated, functional, and performance tests

  • Following up on automated test results, documenting and, or tracking issues and explaining them to other members of the development team

  • Develop, maintain and or upgrade the QA test automation framework so that the value the tests bring can be understood by the team

  • Mentoring less experienced automation testers and providing technical expertise as required

  • Working closely with the development team to collaborate and influence new development

  • Participating in daily scrum stand-up meetings and explaining progress and issues encountered

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer - Help Your Career Take Off In The Airport Industry
jobs.content:
The Role


You will join the Scrum team working on development of a new web application suite. You will work across the full stack, implementing user stories and focussing on delivering units of value into the software, at all times implementing best-practice. You’ll have the chance to work alongside highly skilled and technical people allowing you to grow your own skills and develop into a fully-fledged technical genius as quickly as you want. We are looking for someone who is bright, enthusiastic, technical and prepared to learn and work hard with us to develop great things and support your development.


Our Products are used at hundreds of airports across the globe, including the majority of the top 10 busiest airports and so this role provides a fantastic opportunity to work on projects around the world and to experience many different cultures. Due to this, you need to have a willingness and ability to travel and work overseas for potentially protracted periods (multiple weeks) in addition to the ability to pass a Criminal Records Check for an airport airside pass.


What sort of products will you work on? How about a baggage system, an airport management system or an airport performance system that gets deployed into places such as New York, Panama, Zurich or Geneva. These are critical systems for airlines, airports and passengers which are often deployed in time for such events as the Olympics and a football world cup! You can make a difference to not only your own travel experience but also that of many other millions of passengers daily.


What is it like to work here? Well there is a great learning and developing environment at Ultra within our software development teams. This is helped by our online subscriptions to training packages and also our cross team collaborations. 


Main Duties and Responsibilities



  • Designing and developing solutions

  • Designing, coding and unit testing web applications

  • The capture of requirements, estimations, functional specifications, test approach and planning

  • Delivery of solutions to company standards and time scales

  • Full development life cycle contribution

  • Keep up to date with latest technologies

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Who we are


Geckoboard is a successful and growing 33-person B2B SaaS startup based in East London. Our elegant, real-time dashboards solve a difficult but valuable problem for thousands of paying subscribers, by taking the complexity out of connecting to their data and making that data simple for anyone to interpret at a glance. As a result, our customers unlock data they didn't know they had, connect people and join up projects, and make better decisions faster.


We have a lot of exciting work ahead and are looking for curious and creative problem solvers to help develop our product and take it to even more customers. You'll be joining a friendly team with great people (see "Who you are") in an environment with empowered developers, flexible working conditions, and a focus on skill development (see "Life at Geckoboard").


Who you are


We are looking for a full-time front-end engineer with experience building single page applications. You'll be passionate about working as part of a team, and learning from others through pair programming and peer review. You'll be comfortable liaising with our product designer on design and implementation. You’ll relish the opportunity to continually improve an existing product through refactoring and the removal/addition of features.


More than anything, we value candidates who are excited about picking up new skills and sharing what they’ve learned with the rest of the team - for example, none of us knew Go or React.js a short time ago, but now both are key parts of our stack. We love people with a keen attention to detail and the willingness to apply it in shaping all aspects of our product.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer Architekt
jobs.content:
Aktuell suchen wir für die Starfinanz in Hamburg einen Senior Java Developer.


Wir möchten Dir gerne mehr Informationen zu der Starfinanz GmbH und der vakanten Stelle geben und Dich darauf hinweisen, dass wir hier direkt mit den Entscheidern sprechen. Was wird Dich dort erwarten?


Du arbeiten dort in einem dynamischen 4-köpfigem Team, welches nach Features aufgeteilt ist und agil entwickelt. Es geht um ein sehr spannendes FinTech Projekt.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
• Design and implement infrastructure for our financial services

  • Translate scalability, security and reliability requirements into infrastructure

  • Work closely with engineering teams to ensure that best practices are shared and applications are built according to operational standards and guidelines

  • Develop and enforce security policies and mentor the entire team on security best practices

  • Keep our platform up and running 24/7 and participate in incident response

  • Follow agile process, stick to commitments and respect definition of agreed principles

jobs.title: ALGORITHM DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
The role


We’re looking for an expert in designing and coding algorithms, with a strong interest in applying these within an ecommerce setting. You’ll be fueling rapid business growth in an industry leader by producing new analytic insights and developing tools to assist with price optimization, forecasting, recommender engines, etc.   As you work closely with colleagues from a broad spectrum of business units, both technical and non-technical, you will develop a deep expertise not only technically but also in marketing, finance and product development, growing a comprehensive understanding of ecommerce in general and the vacation rentals industry in particular.


The position will be based in the Amsterdam office, with some travel required to the Eindhoven office.


Tasks and responsibilities



  • Develop a strong understanding of our internal data, particularly within the SQL Server data warehouse and developing big data systems.   Be able to pull the data and process it in preparation for analysis using tools such as (variants of) SQL, python, R, etc.

  • Design and implement basic and advanced algorithms for use in descriptive and proscriptive analysis (pricing, forecasting, strategic decisions, online recommendations, etc), working closely with both technology and business units

jobs.title: Frontend Developer - shape the future of the real estate market!
jobs.content:
Join our team at McMakler – the future of the real estate market! We are looking for frontend developers who would like to further their knowledge about cutting-edge technologies and be involved in the creation of our product. Our multidimensional product will soon rely heavily on a Single Page Application (SPA) powered by AngularJS, various cutting-edge services and front-end technologies. We widely use Git in development, and Scrum + Kanban to manage our projects. We are currently working on integrating test driven development principles to all layers of our landscape.


As McMakler we offer:



  • You will become part of a highly motivated and international team of development, user experience, marketing and operations experts

  • You gain the unique opportunity to experience and shape the setup of a recently founded company

  • You will work with the latest technologies and have influence over technological decisions

  • You can grow with a high degree of freedom

  •  You will work at a modern office in the heart of Berlin

  • Free choice of equipment and operating system

  • Experience and shape a communicative, creative and stimulating working environment

  • Fun team events! (Laser tag, go karting, drinks, food and more)

  • Free cold and warm drinks


As a front-end developer, you will:



  • Play an active role in developing complex and performant Single Page Application(s)

  •  Demonstrate expertise in JavaScript, HTML, CSS and/or other front-end technologies, as well as web frameworks and front-end or web application development 

  • Implement new features in a highly collaborative work environment alongside Product, Design and API developers, as well as other front-end engineers

  • Contribute to a future-ready, high quality and performant code base

  • Share technical solutions, product ideas and front-end best-practices through code review and technical discussions

  • Demonstrate initiative, self-motivation, creative problem-solving and effective interpersonal/communication skills that support the process of building a collaborative team

  • Attention to detail and identify potential performance weak spots

  • Demonstrate flexibility and strong teamwork skills


Kudos for:



  • Experience with AngularJS (1.5.x - 2.x) is preferred

  • Experience with React.js, Node.js, TypeScript , ES6 is a plus

  • Working knowledge of Wordpress, Twig, Bootstrap and Material Design is optional

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a motivated software engineer to help us build the world's best rehabiliation robots.


Yes, we build robots! You will be responsible for writing the application software for them, including the GUI, database backend and multiple services in between. You will work on the global architecture of our sensor based-products, to make them work cross-platform and across our devices.


You will work closely together with teams who are writing the control algorithms and the games, to make it all work fluently, and according to the requirements and regulations needed for medical devices.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
We don`t have jobs. We have a mission!


Since its establishment in 2002, Spreadshirt has become one of Germany's most successful start-up companies, Europe's leading social e-commerce platform and the third biggest print-on-demand company in the USA. We cater to the needs of over half a million sales partners as well as millions of customers in 20 countries and 12 languages. With immediate effect, we are looking for reinforcement to lead our Create-Your-Own/Check-Out Teams as a...


(Senior) Front End Developer (m/f)


You will encounter exciting challenges in your position as a Front End Developer in Spreadshirt's Software Development Department. Spreadshirt's platform is an extraordinary and diverse system that continually poses varied challenges in all areas of software development. Some of the most aspiring projects are:



  • Turning Spreadshirt's platform into a scalable micro services architecture

  • Furthering Spreadshirt's API

  • Technological modernisation of existing applications


Your Tasks



  • You are part of an agile, cross-functional development team (PO, UX, Front End and Back End, QA) concerned with the T-Shirt Designer and the check out, contributing to their improved functionality and usability

  • You and your team create web applications, including migration strategies to facilitate a smooth and trouble-free supersession of the system in place

jobs.title: Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Q-Sensei is an innovation leader in the search and analysis space. We offer a platform for interactive search, with RESTful API, and intuitive search interfaces that makes it easy for developers to build, use and maintain powerful data apps. Our goal is to let users interact directly with data on their terms.


We use React, Redux, Node.js, HTML 5, CSS3, Babel, and Webpack to build out our modular UI, and are looking for an ambitious, top-talent individual who is ready to make an impact and help push the product and industry forward.


Responsibilities



  • Participate in defining and reviewing software requirements

  • Develop interactive front-ends and contribute to our UI framework

  • Ensure code quality, device cross-browser compatibility, and standard compliancy

  • Work collaboratively with our sales reps and back-end developers

  • Help direct our front-end strategy and technology stack

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an highly experienced Java developer that is eager to tackle complex topics.


What we offer


So what’s the team like? What started as a university project has grown organically over the last seven years into a distinctly international crew. We keep things open, agile and communicative, with pair programming widely practiced and encouraged. It is all based on trust – no micromanaging, no distributed teams, no nearshoring, no offshoring – face to face communication is premium. That is why the whole development team is located together in one office in beautiful Berlin!


We are constantly evolving and looking to integrate new technologies in our technology stack. We currently:



  • Version with Git

  • Build with Gradle and Webpack

  • Write Java 8 and ECMAScript 6 code

  • Manage with NPM

  • Test with TestNG, Selenium, Mocha and Karma

  • Automate with Jenkins

  • Utilize React and Redux

  • Organize with Scrum and Kanban


You are free to use the OS and IDE of your choice, the tooling you are comfortable with and setup your workspace the way you like it.


Our engineers are self-organized within their teams, working on components and independent projects together and closely with product managers and UX designers. We value your thoughts and ideas and will give you the freedom to push and implement them.


We get that balancing a family and work can be a challenge, so everyone (family or no family) gets flexible work hours. Work when you work best.


We support personal growth, both in and outside of the company. You will gain – and share – knowledge during recurring learning lunches, jours fixes, pizza sessions and our annual code camp.


How you contribute


We are looking for a Java guru to strengthen our development team in Berlin. You will help to continue to develop and improve our leading cloud-based business process modeling, decision modeling and workflow software.


Specifically you will:



  • Take a major role in the development of complex software components

  • Design and implement new features to our backend

  • Introduce new technologies and concepts by leading major refactoring initiatives

  • Improve existing components

  • Implement automated tests

  • Work closely together with you frontend engineer teammates on API specifications

  • Review the work of your teammates

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:

What we offer


So what’s the team like? What started as a university project has grown organically over the last seven years into a distinctly international crew. We keep things open, agile and communicative, with pair programming practiced and encouraged. It is all based on trust – no micromanaging, no distributed teams, no nearshoring, no offshoring – face to face communication is premium. That is why the development team is located together in our new office in Berlin.


We are constantly evolving and looking to integrate new technologies in our technology stack. We currently:



  • Code on Babel stage 0

  • Build with Gradle and Webpack

  • Manage with NPM

  • Test with Mocha, Enzyme, Chai

  • Use React and Redux

  • Version with Git

  • Organize with Scrum and Kanban


Choose your own laptop, OS and IDE. Work with the tooling you are comfortable with and set up your workspace the way you like it.


Our engineers are self-organized within their teams, working on components and independent projects together and closely with product managers and UX designers. We value your thoughts and ideas and will give you the freedom to push and implement them. Concretely, you have the opportunity to contribute to open source projects and attend conferences.


We get that balancing a family and work can be a challenge, so everyone (family or no family) gets flexible work hours. Work when you work best.


We support personal growth, both in and outside of the company. You will gain – and share – knowledge during recurring learning lunches, jours fixes, pizza sessions and our annual code camp.


How you contribute


We are looking for a JavaScript guru to strengthen our development team in Berlin. You will help to continue to develop and improve our leading cloud-based business process modeling, decision modeling and workflow software.


Specifically you will:

  • Create UI concepts and mockups

  • Review the work of your teammates

  • Improve our technology stack

jobs.title: TECHNICAL LEADER - DATAWAREHOUSE H/F
jobs.content:
Dans ce contexte, vous avez pour missions de :

- Assurer le leadership technique sur la partie (Unix, Informatica, Teradata). Garant de la cohérence technique des différents projets, vous serez un relai technique auprès des développeurs et prendrez la conception technique des évolutions les plus complexes.
- Etre un appui fort aux chefs de projets en mettant en place des solutions innovantes sur les sujets d'ergonomie, d'optimisation et de performance applicative. Vous serez garant de la cohérence de ces technologies critiques dans la sécurisation des enjeux règlementaires de la banque.

En partenariat avec des équipes nearshore (Madrid) et offshore (Bangalore), les projets seront développés en Agile intégrant des processus innovants autour du continuous delivery et du testing automatisé.


Par vos aptitudes et votre implication sur tous les enjeux de l'application, vous pourrez accompagner les chefs de projets et aurez l'opportunité de devenir progressivement responsable de l'ensemble d'un périmètre applicatif ou d'un projet.

Cet environnement technique et fonctionnel en profonde évolution sera une excellente opportunité pour développer vos compétences au sein du groupe Société Générale.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
As Trendyol Group, we are looking for high potential, talented .NET Developers who will be a part of a dynamic, future-oriented, fast-growing and technology enthusiast company.

As Senior Software Developer, you will…



  • be part of a successful and large scale e-commerce company in Turkey which has 10M+ members and 12M+ daily page views,

  • build and develop well designed infrastructures by collaboration with other development teams, architecture team and business owners,

  • take part in technically challenging, high performing projects, share and thrive your technical skills in an Agile environment.



Responsibilities:



  • As a SCRUM team member, technically analyzing and developing business and web applications,

  • Continuously improving and applying technical skills on various platforms,

  • Being a part of code review and pair programming activities.

jobs.title: Diversity Program Lead, Recruiting
jobs.content:
Team Description 
On our People Team, we use an analytical, data-driven approach to solve problems, build programs, and help Dropboxers constantly improve upon how they work. The mission of the People Team is to delight and develop Dropbox. We believe people do their best work when they’re happy, so we work to make Dropbox a place where everyone can thrive. 
 
Role Description
In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing all Diversity Recruiting efforts at Dropbox. You will oversee the design and reporting on our Diversity hiring across various functions: Engineering, Business, G&A, and University. You will also work closely with sourcers, recruiters, and event teams to broaden our Diverse pipeline. You will also work closely with our Analytics team to regularly report to Dropbox leaders our progress towards our hiring goals all Diversity Hiring Reporting 
 
We are looking for someone with expertise in Diversity recruiting, project management expertise and the aptitude to drive rigor and critical thinking into Diversity Recruiting at Dropbox. You must have the capacity to design a plan, influence internal partners, use data to tell a story, and possess excellent communication skills that can be tailored to cross-functional audiences at every level. You will work in partnership with People team functions, including: All Functional Recruiting Teams and Sourcers, Technology and Operations, Events and People Analytics. 
 
We are a fast growing team and company, and you will have the opportunity to roll-up your sleeves and help the company determine how to recruit the best talent.
 
Responsibilities 
  • Prepare the strategy to recruit diverse candidates across various channels, and then help build operational plans to execute against these opportunities across recruiting
  • Work in partnership with the various recruiting team and the People leadership team to identify key diversity recruiting programs, and then help build operational plans to execute against these opportunities
  • Work closely with the Employee Resource Groups to define the strategy and partner for outreach and execution
  • Ensure consistent project mgmt and reporting of our Diversity Recruiting efforts and results
  • Prepare presentations and dashboards on a monthly and quarterly for executive-level audiences 
 
Requirements
  • 8–10 years experience in recruiting, diversity, and human resources role at a tech company; experience with a rapidly scaling business is a plus
  • Proven track record of designing and implementing Diversity Recruiting Programs. 
  • Excellent project management skills
  • Strong knowledge of PowerPoint and Excel 
  • Excellence as a writer and communicator
  • Must be a self-starter and proactively drive projects
  • Highly analytical, comfortable with large data sets, and able to extract business insights from analysis; strong financial modeling or statistical analysis skills are a plus
  • Practical business sense with the ability to translate between strategic business decisions and their operational implications
  • Comfort with ambiguity, uncertainty, and a rapidly evolving business landscape
  • Humble attitude with a willingness to shift from high-level strategic thinking to stepping in and helping to drive implementation alongside functional teams
  • Bachelor’s degree with strong academic performance

jobs.title: Python Developer - Quantitative Equities
jobs.content:
Who we are:
The Equity and Alternatives team within Challenger Life Company uses systematic strategies to deliver superior risk-adjusted returns across a range of asset classes including equities, rates, commodities and currencies. We deal with large amounts of complex (and often messy) data to test hypothetical strategies and then implement these in a robust and systematic manner.


Who you are:
You are a talented developer who lives and breathes code and is excited about writing fast and efficient code to solve problems. You like to make complex things simple. You have a design aesthetic and have worked on projects where you have taken large amounts of data and transformed it into an easily consumable format for users. You enjoy engaging with the users of your products and are talented at taking business requirements and turning them into technical designs. You enjoy working in a team and would prefer to collaborate rather than work in isolation. You are quant and finance curious.


What you will do:
You will be working on developing our quantitative infrastructure to take large amounts of data from a range of sources and make it easily and quickly query-able via an API. This infrastructure will implement our existing strategies and accelerate the research of new strategies. Further down the road you will oversee the implementation of a GUI to rapidly visualise the data we work with; carry on continuous monitoring of our existing strategies; and for rapid prototyping of new strategies.


Apply:
If you are interested in the role please complete the short (15 mins) questionnaire at the following link: http://goo.gl/forms/8g24ObCw6dBmGhIF3
