jobs.title: Cloud Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
Req ID: 111320

Cloud Solution Architect

Ericsson Overview

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators and enterprises. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help craft a more sustainable world.

Demonstrating its presence in mobile networking and IOT, Ericsson recently launched a new cloud portfolio pursuing all layers of the stack enabling cloud operators to effectively challenge with the mega providers and enterprises to build their own secure private cloud with public cloud functionality and economics. We need cloud guides to grow our business.

We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & a creative & engaging environment where employees improve their potential every single day. Our employees live our vision, core values & guiding principles. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.

We welcome the opportunity to meet you!

Job Summary:

Your responsibility will include providing superior subject matter expertise in cloud technologies in support of the Ericsson Cloud System (ECS) in North America. ECS consists of a complete cloud stack solution including the HDS 8000 Hyperscale Server System, Ericsson’s OpenStack Distribution, Secure Storage, Object Storage, Platform as a Service, and Data Integrity. You will target Cloud Service Providers, Channel Partners, Telecom companies in a targeted manner pursuing qualified opportunities and “losing fast” when needed to stay passionate about the right opportunities where Ericsson can win.

You will work across Ericsson utilizing teams in Consulting and Systems Integration, Business Unit Cloud, Ericsson Customer Units and other Ericsson Engagement practices. You may be an individual contributor, at times you may lead cross-function, and organizationally matrixed teams, and/or lead develop teams depending on the evolution of the business. You will be working the sales teams and meeting with customers, with frequent domestic and occasional global travel. Travel is expected to fluctuate throughout the year, be about 50% on average, and might peak at 75% during significant customer pursuits.

You will have experience in multiple cloud business models and cloud technologies including service providers, technology providers, and in several cloud service models such as IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.

Responsibilities & Tasks

  • Provide expertise on cloud technologies and cloud services delivery models for qualified sales pursuits
  • Conduct in-depth business focused discussions with the customer and sales teams & analyze customer business environments, requirements, plans & issues - understand requirements and influence customer technology roadmaps and cloud architecture
  • Be accountable for specific customers, specific opportunities, and/or incepting, cultivating and closing new business opportunities committing to top and bottom line growth towards the group’s and Ericsson’s business objectives
  • Strong ability to lead engagements providing structure, clear directions and objectives for engagement teams - lead direct and indirect, virtual/cross-functional teams, seeking assistance within a large, complex organization on proposals, offer development, demos, proofs of concepts, strategy development, 3rd party solutions, etc.
  • Be a subject matter authority in Cloud, SDN/NFV and Orchestration solutions, including Ericsson and third party partner products - Perform solution validation
  • Be a dynamic, motivational, and positive evangelist and change agent within Ericsson and within Customer organizations
  • Read and respond to RFxs, develop solution architectures, customer offerings and presentation collateral, author white papers, marketing editorials, host solution webinars and participate and speak in industry events
  • Become an inspiring leader within Ericsson by building relationships in your Product Area, Cloud Product Development Unit and by attending at industry events.
  • Maintain the necessary technical certifications in your technologies.
  • Participate and represent Ericsson at industry forums such as the Openstack, OPNFV, and engage in media and analyst interviews and social media marketing efforts internally and externally

Qualifications & Experience Requirements:

  • Minimum of 10 years’ experience in cloud business models including public, private, hybrid clouds and virtualization in a pre-sales technical role
  • Thorough knowledge of SPI Model
  • Knowledge of Hyperscale datacenter architecture
  • Knowledge of server architectures including OCP
  • Strong communication, project management and presentation skills
  • Ability to prioritize activities and make objective decisions based on facts
  • Knows how to quickly qualify opportunities and to “lose fast” if needed
  • Thinks and acts like an owner of their own business
  • Basic enterprise WAN architecture knowledge
  • Basic carrier networking technologies knowledge
  • Bachelor’s Degree

Additional Requirements:

  • Frequent domestic travel to customer locations and some international travel is required.

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

jobs.content:
We are seeking a senior developer with experience in 3D geometry construction, manipulation, and visualization to work with the computer scientists and engineers in our Advanced Modeling & Simulation Systems group. You will be working in a collaborative environment developing software that allows our users to accurately model real-world structures in 3D and to simulate various physical weapon effects against that model (such as blast modeling, structural damage, collapse, and equipment response). If you have expertise in areas such as scientific visualization, mesh topology, constructive solid geometry, real-time rendering systems, and multi-threaded algorithm design, then we can offer you a challenging position whose work will directly assist our nation's warfighters, first responders, and R&D analysts.


For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please visit our website at http://www.ara.com.

jobs.title: Technical Architect
jobs.content:
WHAT IS COOL ABOUT THIS JOB


WP Engine powers amazing digital experiences built on WordPress. With over 36 million visitors a day across more than 300,000 WordPress sites, our content management platform elevates WordPress into a really easy to use, secure and scalable solution. Our services reach everyone from the individual blogger to a large enterprise marketer. We are a disruptive force in the WordPress platform sector because we combine this robust, easy-to-use open source technology with enterprise grade tools, applications and expertise.


At WP Engine, we believe building great software begins by building great culture. Our engineering team is focused on:



  • Solving the hard problems of operating a fast growing, high scale platform.

  • Practicing steadfast craftsmanship. We build for the long term, not just for quick wins.

  • Growing a passionate, collaborative team focused on challenging each other to be better.

  • Being responsible stewards of our customers' livelihoods.


THE DAY TO DAY


With both strategic and tactical responsibilities, you will play a key leadership role in the overall Research and Development organization. Whether solving problems or developing new software, you should regularly focus on the customer and take the initiative to do the right thing. You must be able to thrive in fast-paced company where collaboration is at the heart of everyone’s success.



  • You will help ensure we keep the talent bar high, and grow the skills and capabilities of your team as our engineering organization grows.

  • You will provide hands-on leadership for software engineers, designing, building and enhancing our platform and applications in a service-oriented, highly scalable environment.

  • You will leverage your extensive experience to improve, refine, and redefine our service offering.

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Developer
jobs.content:
Wrangler of Mobile Bits - Senior Mobile Dev Position @ LifeTales


What we want to see in you:



  • You’re fluent with modern mobile development technologies and techniques and are willing and able to learn more. You want to build products that solve problems and make a positive impact.

  • Fluent in Agile and believe in the process. You are constantly striving to improve best practices.

  • You’re an innovative developer that can take instructions and find effective ways to work with our UX team to consistently deliver high quality code that is well tested using TDD (automatic integration - CircleCI, xcodebuild).

  • You bring a problem solving attitude and approach to development. You’re self-driven, quality focused, goal oriented and pursue learning as a lifelong achievement.

  • You have strong mathematical skills and are skilled at turning abstract concepts into algorithms.

  • With your research skills, you can find the latest advances on a given topic, and can quickly incorporate the key learnings into your work.

  • Have a GitHub profile with public repos and will provide the link in your application.


A little bit about us:



  • We want to create a profitable business while contributing to the overall important social well-being of our customers. We care about our members and put their needs first.

  • Our vision is to enable people everywhere to preserve their life experiences for themselves, their close friends and their descendants, in a fun way and with little effort nor planning.

  • We appreciate new and emerging technologies and considers how they can transform people's lives.

  • We are looking for a developer who has the desire to do not only do great work but also do social good.


What we can do together…



  • Build a culture that considers the wider impacts of it's decisions and focuses on the greater good.

  • We will push technology limits, learn lots, have fun, and build a great tech company headquartered here in Toronto.

  • Work collaboratively in a small, high performing, cross-functional team.

  • Regularly deliver completed stories using Scrum methodology including regular Standup and Retrospectives.

jobs.title: Data Warehouse / Business Intelligence
jobs.content:
We are currently seeking an experienced Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence engineer who will work with our analytics team on constructing, populating, and supporting the data warehouse/marts leveraging ETL, data access, monitoring, and modeling tools to join our team for a contract opportunity. In addition, you will play a key role in designing and developing Vibes’ next-generation MDM and reporting and analytics approach while defining development strategy and framework for consistent report development standards.



In this role you will collaborate with analysts, product managers, and key business contacts. Our environment is innovative, intellectually challenging, and fast-paced. Advanced development and programming skills, a collaborative work ethic, strong analytical skills and a drive to succeed are the best fit. This position is located at our office in downtown Chicago at 300 W. Adams.



Responsibilities:



  • Gather, analyze and validate business requirements from non-technical functional users and subject matter experts and transform them into system requirements and technical specifications

  • Design and implement data integration, database schema and dimensional data modeling components to support business requirements, query performance tuning and optimization, and reporting/visualization

  • Collaborate with other stakeholders in the design of the entire technology stack for next-generation BI platform

  • Design and build optimal ETL processes and frameworks considering efficiency, data integrity, scalability and maintainability

  • Demonstrate good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions

  • Analyze and determine the impact of technology capabilities and limitations

  • Perform effort estimation for various Data Warehouse activities

  • Develop rapid prototypes and proofs of concept to help assess strategic opportunities and future BI capabilities

jobs.content:
Strategic Business Systems, Inc. is the PRIME on a government contract here in the Washington DC Metro are and we are looking to add a Senior Software Engineer to our team. An ACTIVE Top Secret/SCI w/ POLY is required for the position.

Description:

The ideal candidate will have a Top Secret/SCI w/ Poly clearance, 5+ years of experience with full life-cycle software development (analysis, design, development, test, deployment, maintenance). Use of industry-proven design patterns and open source tools is encouraged. This position requires a combination of new application development tasks and enhancements to existing capabilities on a small team in an agile development environment.

jobs.title: Ingénieur DevOps
jobs.content:
Capable de mettre au service de l’automatisation de fonctions opérationnelles une vraie culture de génie logiciel, votre attention pour les détails et votre soif d’apprendre vous permettront de contribuer à l’évolution et à l’industrialisation de l’infrastructure IT d’AdaCore.


Supportée par une ferme de production et de test d’une centaine de machines, localisées dans nos data centers de Paris (France), New York et Lexington (Etats-Unis) celle-ci comprend, autour d’un noyau de machines GNU/Linux, la diversité d’environnements physiques ou virtualisés (Windows, UNIX propriétaires, RTOS comme VxWorks, LynxOS, PikeOS, Android, boards...) nécessaires au support de nos produits.  


Votre rôle sera d’augmenter le degré d’automatisation de cette infrastructure dans une perspective d’industrialisation des process. Vous interviendrez aussi dans la mise en place de  plan de continuité d'activité et de plan de reprise d’activité afin de renforcer la disponibilité des services IT d’AdaCore.


Plus concrètement, vos tâches pourront notamment inclure :



  • La conception et développement de nouvelles fonctionnalités dans l’infrastructure de construction et de validation des produits logiciels (fermes de build, continuous builders, serveurs de test …) ;

  • L’amélioration de l’outillage de gestion de l’infrastructure IT existant (monitoring, alerte, gestion à distance ...) ;

  • La conception et l’implémentation de nouvelles fonctionnalités de déploiement automatique ;

  • La surveillance opérationnelle des systèmes IT ;

  • La gestion de l’infrastructure IT (recherche des besoins des utilisateurs, interactions avec les achats, provisionnement, déploiement et gestion du cycle de vie des éléments de l’infrastructure ...).


Vous serez un membre de l’équipe IT, qui comprend une quinzaine de personnes situées à Paris, New York et Boston. Votre poste sera situé à Paris.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer II
jobs.content:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Engineer II


Location: Portland, OR


Reports To: Senior Manager, Quality Assurance


JOB FUNCTION


The Quality Assurance Analyst will conduct thorough product testing and maintain agreed upon quality standards in order to provide the highest quality software products to both external and internal customers. The QA Analyst will work to understand the business requirements and objectives relative to the desired functionality of products and applications. Additionally this role will evaluate and test new or modified software to determine that software meets user requirements and established quality standards.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Writes and executes detailed test cases; performs complex manual, integration, and regression tests

  • Documents software issues and enhancement requests and assists development with concise and detailed steps for duplication of the problems found while performing manual functional, integration, and regression tests

  • Verifies resolved Jira issues and maintains accurate status for Jira issues entered and assigned

  • Assists fellow team members and customers with problem reporting and resolution and maintaining appropriate follow-up communications throughout the resolution process

  • Creates master test plans with clearly defined test objectives

  • Contributes towards QA estimation and scheduling process

jobs.title: Back End Software Developer
jobs.content:
The Literacy Design Collaborative (LDC) is hiring a Software Developer to scale web based literacy tools that help teachers develop skills to help their students master literacy skills. In this role, you will be designing and developing cross-enterprise tools and services. You will be responsible for understanding teacher needs and developing tools that help improve literacy instruction primarily in 6th through 12th grade language arts, science and social studies classes.



Our team is looking for a Web Developer with the knowledge and skills to build highly interactive software interfaces and interoperable solutions.  You should be a  talented and experienced back-end developer with expertise in creating APIs for interactive web based applications.  You should have a solid background and understanding of best practices in the fundamentals of software development. You should enjoy adding value to a very talented team that includes a designer, developers, expert teachers, and business partners.  You should be passionate about building teacher friendly, engaging websites and highly scalable distributed systems.

jobs.title: Android Engineer
jobs.content:
About Poq, the app commerce company

We are a Software-as-a-Service startup that powers the iOS and Android shopping apps of international retailers like House of Fraser, Radley, boohoo and Missguided. Were relentless at seeking out the most advanced technology and our software is constantly improving. This means that our clients are always at the forefront of innovation.

We have collaborated with many clients and integrated with lots of partners to launch apps with cutting-edge features including: augmented reality, product merchandising, tailored push notifications and app marketing. The Poq platform drives millions of revenue for our customers every month, and facilitates thousands of transactions every day.

Poq was founded in 2011 by Oyvind, CEO, Michael, COO, Jun, CIO, and Mike, CCO. We have built an amazing team of diverse and brilliant minds.


About the role

We're now seeing explosive demand for our services. We need to scale our startup. Fast. And this is where you come in. Were looking for an experienced Android Developer to work within our highly experienced team to expand our SaaS platform in an innovative and fast-paced Agile environment.

You will be responsible for using cutting-edge technologies to deliver key product features that a million monthly active shoppers use.

The consumer shift to apps is happening right now. Be part of the app revolution in retail.


What youll be doing

You'll add new cool functionality and improvements to the app platform, and hook it up to the cloud via the Developer Centre and CMS. You'll collaborate with clients and designers to deliver amazing apps for top retailers. And you'll work on a platform written in pure Swift.

The ideal candidate for this role has an eye for design and is passionate about building apps that act fast, don't crash and look beautiful.


Benefits


  • We are a small but growing team. We work hard and celebrate successes together.
  • Bike to work scheme.
  • Free organic fruit, snacks, tea and coffee throughout the week.
  • Team drinks every Friday.
  • Quarterly team events (weve done BBQs, whitewater rafting, a circus workshop, and more).
  • Pool table.


We love spending time together as a team, check us out on Instagram.

You can see more about our team here.

jobs.title: Technical Project Manager
jobs.content:
Für unser Team in München suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt in Festanstellung einen



TECHNICAL PROJECT MANAGER DIGITAL (M/W)


AUFGABEN:                                                                                                                                                                                  


Du schaffst gerne Verknüpfungen – in allen Bereichen.


Bei der technischen Steuerung komplexer Web-, Mobile- und Digital-Projekte bildest du die Brücke zwischen dem Kunden, externen Supplier und der Digital-Unit der Avantgarde. Du schaffst es durch engen Kontakt und kompetenter Beratung das Vertrauen des Kunden zu gewinnen und begleitest ihn so durch das Projekt hindurch. Zwischen Realismus und Idealismus verstehst du es den Kunden für deine Idee zu begeistern, ihm diese auf anschauliche Art und Weise zu präsentieren und in Anwenderworkshops näher zu bringen. Du behältst hierbei Termin-, Ressourcen- und Budgetplanung stets überlegt im Blick und revidierst getroffene Schätzungen, Kalkulationen und erhaltene Angebote. Du koordinierst und steuerst die involvierten Units auf das gemeinsame Ziel und dokumentierst Anwendungen unter anderem nach Kanban.



WIR:


Bieten zugleich Innovationskraft und Sicherheit in einem sich beständig wandelnden Umfeld. In unseren Büros im Herzen von München erwarten dich ein äußerst kollegiales Umfeld, spannende Projekte für internationale, namenhafte Unternehmen sowie eine attraktive Vergütung und flexible Arbeitszeiten. Zudem profitierst du von unserer langjährigen Erfahrung und unserem großen Netzwerk um deine persönliche Karriere voranzutreiben.



DU:


Verfügst über mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Digital-Bereich sowie im Anforderungsmanagement. Einerseits Analytiker mit dem Bedürfnis nach strukturierten Arbeitsabläufen, blühst du andererseits darin auf deine Ideen zu Papier zu bringen und konzeptionell zu arbeiten. Technisches Know-How bringst du aus den Bereichen Web-Applikation und Datenbankdesign mit. Der Kunde findet sich in jeder deiner Präsentationen wieder. Durch dein souveränes Auftreten und deine kommunikativen Stärken gewinnst du neue Fans.



INTERESSIERT?
Dann bewirb’ dich mit deinen vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Anschreiben, CV, Schulabschluss-, Ausbildungs- und Arbeitszeugnisse) bei uns!
Auf deine Bewerbung freut sich Michaela

jobs.title: Web Systems Developer
jobs.content:
As our web systems developer at Wellframe you'll be responsible for building, maintaining, and running systems for our corporate web presence, authoring of clinical program content, client electronic communications and online education. We're looking for an experienced developer with multiple talents to work alongside our designer to build out engaging online experiences and assets to support our company vision of mobile health care delivery.


Example projects you'll work on:



  • Build and enhance publishing integration between authoring system and content distribution network for performant delivery of daily care program articles and videos to Wellframe mobile apps.

  • Develop tools to facilitate upload of partner content and appropriately control and manage copyright and propriety information rights.

  • Extend and manage online training environment used for clients and partners, integrating online classes with demo version of Wellframe care management platform.

  • Devise and implement approach to derivative content personalization to allow posts to easily be customized / branded for specific clients. Integrate product web APIs into online content for purposes of usage data collection and content personalization.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Home24 is Europe’s largest online destination for home furniture and decor. Being a dynamic, fast-growing market leader, our goal is to consistently provide our customers with the best service and assortment. Backed by well-known investors, we are among the top 20 of Europe’s fastest growing e-commerce companies and with a valuation of USD 1 bn one of the most attractive and highly valued opportunities in tech.

Home24 is currently active in 8 countries in Europe and Latin America. We employ more than 1,000 people worldwide and are looking to expand our team with dedicated top talents and experts who are ready to grow with us. Our dynamic and international team works with great passion and enthusiasm towards a great goal: To revolutionize the Home & Living market.


Senior Front-End Engineer (f/m)


Do you feel like the work you do makes a difference and moves the business in a meaningful way? Are you interested in building software used by millions of customers? Do you like writing performant, high quality code at a rapid pace? If you answered yes to these questions, you could be just the person we’re looking for to join our team at Home24.

We are looking for a  great Senior Frontend Engineer who is passionate about developing customer-facing front end solutions that will deliver a great user experience - whether you’re on your smartphone, tablet or home computer. In joining our team you will get the opportunity to work on some of the most interesting and challenging problems we can offer. This position is full-time and based in our cool office in Berlin.


Responsibilities



  • Build beautiful, fast,efficient and reusable front-end solutions

  • Build prototypes and proof of concepts to demonstrate emerging technologies

  • Working with product managers and UX designers to implement the next generation of the Home24 e-commerce experience

  • Use RESTful APIs for communication with our backend services

  • Work in a small agile team collaborating with designers and other engineers

  • Identify and adopt best practices for software and front-end engineering

  • Make demos for the whole company to share achievements


What we can offer you



  • Opportunity to use state of the art front end development tools

  • Become a part of a highly motivated world class team of technology professionals

  • An open culture to learn, share new ideas, solve hard problems and opportunity to demonstrate your creativity to make a real difference

  • Opportunities for advancement, independence and the autonomy to take on responsibility

  • Benefits including relocation support, employee discount, team events, free fruit, drinks and much more

  • If you are interested in being a part of an exciting success story, get in touch. Send us a copy of your resume and relevant credentials (including a copy of your diploma, etc.), a code sample as well as your expected salary and possible start date.



Home24 AG | Greifswalder Straße 212-213 | 10405 Berlin | Contact: Sophie Fahning

jobs.title: Full-Stack Java/Scala Engineer
jobs.content:
Overview:
hatch is currently working with an exciting VC funded energy analytics startup, Aquicore, headquartered in our nation’s capital (Northwest, DC), founded in 2013.  Aquicore is looking to build out their innovative platform that offers energy analytics and automation solutions for commercial real-estate customers.  They just received a 'Series A' round of funding to help them build out their engineering team and are targeting a Full-Stack Engineer interested in greenfield development. You would be primarily responsible for developing the back-end architecture (Java/Scala/Play) of their software, this allows customers to collect/analyze millions of points of data from live sensors in their commercial buildings.  You would also be looked at to help across the entire platform, so some exposure to modern JavaScript frameworks is required.  The team currently consists of 5 other engineers that also work across the full-stack (Angular/Java/Scala/Play/AWS).


Does This Describe You?



  • Love developing clean code with cutting-edge technologies (Scala & Play)

  • Working with API’s & Open-Source Software excites you

  • Working with a true tech startup gets your entrepreneurial juices flowing

  • You’re passionate about clean-energy and playing a part in protecting our earth


If you are interested in learning more about this company or any Startups/Small Businesses in the area, please contact us!! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

Above and beyond creating features for a cutting edge messaging application, our engineers design and implement utilizing open source stacks (e.g. hbase, kafka, solr), extreme scaling within the cloud, encryption in transit/at rest, and a deep list of technical challenges to sink our teeth into every day. jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Why contract at Hays?

Hays is the UK's leading technology recruiter that places thousands of contractors into some of the most exciting assignments across the sector. We have been recognised by users of contractoruk.com as the 'best recruitment agency to contract with' for three consecutive years.

Our recruiting experts are vastly knowledgeable and focused on specific skill-sets, allowing us to better understand the needs of our clients. This insight is then transferred into helping our candidates, placing you in the best position when applying for contract developer jobs.

With an extensive network of specialist offices across the UK, we pay our contractors weekly and have an unrivalled range of contract developer opportunities available.

You will be working as a consultant, hired by Hayes at a large blue chip organisation working within the insurance sector as a DevOps Engineer in the digital engineering team within the digital part of the organisation.

Your responsibilities will include the implementation and management of continuous delivery systems and methodologies along with supporting applications and defining and deploying monitoring systems on AWS.

In order to meet the strategic requirements of the business you will need to contribute to the development of solutions, applications and identify improvement opportunities.

What you'll need to succeed

Professional experience of Linux, Puppet and Amazon Web Services will put you in a great position to succeed in this contract opportunity along with having experience of working within a scrum and agile environment.

The role will see you developing high quality web applications so knowledge of C# MVC, HTML5 and JavaScript are required.

What you'll get in return

A daily rate of £450 per day and all the tools to help you get the job done to the best of your ability.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

Hays EA is a trading division of Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited and acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

jobs.title: Junior Designer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Cambridge, UK
URL: https://okfn.org/

The Organisation

Open Knowledge International is a worldwide non-profit network of people passionate about openness, using advocacy, technology and training to unlock information and enable people to work with it to create and share knowledge.

The wide range of projects we work on all aim to give people access to data, the knowledge to understand it, and the power to use it in our everyday lives.

The Position

We are looking for a visual designer to work closely with our senior designer to support the wider organisation and project teams. You will work on the production of a range of materials including websites, web applications and printed promotional items.

OKI are a 100% virtual team based all over the world so expereince or strong understanding of what is required working in highly transparent remote teams is a distinct advantage.

We offer flexible working conditions but as role will involve close collaboration with specific teams, it is a requirement that you are based within UTC -1 and +4

Typical activities

  • Producing wireframes / sketches of ideas
  • Producing designs in appropriate formats, including vector, raster and HTML/CSS
  • Communicating with senior team members to receive feedback
  • Supporting the team throughout the execution of projects (for example, with the production of graphical elements).
  • Offering input to team meetings

Required Skills

  • Excellent written and communication skills in English
  • Comfortable with a range of design software packages (ideally including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign)
  • Experience in writing HTML and CSS
  • An attention to detail
  • Enjoy problem solving
  • Motivated to maintain and improve standard of work
  • Willingness to listen to, and act upon feedback
  • Open to new ideas, methods and techniques

Desirable Skills

  • Familiarity with version control, preferably Git
  • Experience with Javascript
  • A background of working as part of a production team
  • Experience working with user stories
  • Experience with CSS preprocessors, such as SASS
  • Understanding of web standards and best practices
  • Experience with open data and/or open source software

Compensation

Competitive based on required skills and experience. Please indicate your expectations when applying.

To apply: If you’d like to apply, please email jobs@okfn.org stating 'Junior designer' in the subject line. Include your CV, a link to your portfolio and a cover letter explaining your reasons for applying.

jobs.title: SENIOR FRONT END DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Manama, Bahrain
URL: http://www.artobrand.com

JOB SUMMARY
We are working on the next generation of online experience for a major internationally recognised brand. We are looking for a strong Front End Developer to help steer development of the site across platform for mobile, tablet and desktop. 

You will be working with a stellar team of UX experts, developers, designers and data scientists to create new and exciting applications and experiences. We’re looking for people interested in creating rich web experiences on a massive scale, and doing so in a fast-moving, collaborative environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES
As part part of the team you will be expected to work with a cross functional team to help develop a new online experience and steer the direction of the site’s front-end code.
Write and organise lots of HTML, CSS.
Developing framework for a large site.
Implement features with designers and other developers.
Develop custom features.  
Working in a highly iterative environment and help create an experience that will soar.
Build highly visual and dynamic web pages for a variety of form factors.
Help with development needs by our mobile team.
Writing code with multiple breakpoints that performs well across responsive site and on low bandwidth.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years experience writing HTML, CSS
Ability to write fast, well performing client-side code.
Write clean and well documented code.
3+ years experience with SCSS as well as CSS frameworks such as SASS and LESS.
3+ years experience with HTML frameworks such as Foundation and Bootstrap.
3+ years experience writing JavaScript
Extensive developing features to enhance performance such as lazy-loading images
Strong design focus and history of working with product designers and managers.
Strong experience working with accessibility needs, security.
Familiarity with continuous integration and deployment.
Worked on consumer products in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Dealt with restructuring an existing large, application code base as well as greenfield development. .
Experience working with and developing asynchronous content.
Extensive experience with accessibility needs, security.
Familiarity with JSON and options to update content in regular intervals.
Basic knowledge of and experience working with data stores like SQL, MySQL, etc
Experience working with CMS such as Wordpress and creating templates from scratch.
Extensive experience with accessibility needs, security.
 
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience working with PHP.
Experience working with and deploying content to CDNs.
Experience with OO languages
3+ years experience working with Node.js
 
BENEFITS
Rate commensurate to experience.
Opportunity to help shape online experience of an internationally recognised brand and market leader in their field.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Rails, React
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Washington, DC
URL: https://govpredict.com

About Us

We are GovPredict, an exponentially growing, Y Combinator-backed startup in Washington, DC. Our software+data product helps companies predict what the US government will do. We work with Fortune 500 publicly-traded companies, Ivy-League universities, and United States House and Senate offices.

Our culture is "build fast and ask questions later." But we value rigor and best-practices too. Our team of powerful engineers is building the software that no government has ever seen before.

Our team of top-tier software developers is in Moldova and Romania and our sales + business development is in the USA. Our primary language is English, but most of our team also speaks Russian and Romanian.

About the Job

As a senior developer at GovPredict, you will be responsible for architecting software, providing technical leadership, writing smart+scalable code, and helping grow our team. You will be a team leader working with data nobody has ever worked with before.

You will work on frontend and backend features. Our product pulls in data from structured APIs or from unstructured sources with our python scrapers. We then manipulate, organize, and display it in never before seen ways to our customers.

Our Stack

  • Ruby on Rails backend
  • ReactJS front end
  • Python scrapers
  • AWS
  • If you’re a strong engineer but haven’t used these technologies, we may still interview you!

Other facts

  • Remote work
  • Full time
  • Competitive pay
  • NOT an agency or outsourcing company -- you will work only on one product

Requirements

  • Strong engineering background
  • 4+ years software development experience or equivalently skilled
  • Comfortable with automated software testing (such as RSpec)
  • Desire to work with Ruby, Javascript, and Python
  • Can take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance
  • Ability to mentor and guide fellow team members constructively
  • Able to communicate effectively in writing and orally in English (other team members speak Russian, Romanian, Spanish, and Portuguese in addition)
  • Eager to learn new things and apply them quickly
  • Willing to work full-time with some overlap on US business hours (8am to 6pm EST)

To apply: Fill out the form here: https://govpredict.typeform.com/to/ae0cXa If you need anything else, email us at: careers@govpredict.com (Do not apply through email!)

jobs.name: I Will Teach You To Be Rich

jobs.title: Growth Designer
jobs.company: I Will Teach You To Be Rich
jobs.content:
Headquarters: United States
URL: http://www.iwillteachyoutoberich.com/careers/growth-designer/

The Giant Hairy Problem You’ll Be Solving

We've got a pretty big vision for what we want to accomplish. We're building multiple premium brands, have an audience of millions of people, and what to push the quality of our design for every touch point with our users. Our work should set the benchmark for everyone else.

We're building a mission-based team with designers, engineers, and marketers all working together to a make this vision a reality. It's a small, tight-knit team that moves fast and has a lot of autonomy to make an impact. We've got an opening for a designer on this team. That’s where you come in.

You’re not just another body that makes things “pretty”. We need a much larger commitment from you. You’ll be responsible for the UX of the Growth team. For every campaign, app, and test, you’ll push to give our users a world-class experience that delights them at every step. The hard part? We need to delight users while driving measurable growth across the business. You'll find the sweet-spot between giving people an amazing experience while driving measurable growth.

And this is your giant hairy problem. How do we meet the goals of the business while over-delivering on value to our users? You’ll tackle this head-on and find the perfect blend between the two. You’ll push the limits of your design craft to meet the needs of our users and the business.

You’ll Learn More In 3 Months Than You Did All Of Last Year

We’re not here to follow mediocre best practices. We want to deeply understand what drives a business forward. Which variables matter? How do we persuade people to take action? Which levers and projects drive the most value for the business?

We have a simple goal on the Growth team: learn faster than anyone else in the industry. The faster we learn, the faster we grow the company. You'll be in the middle of everything. You'll see how the entire business works and it'll be your ideas that help us make it even more effective. You'll learn exactly how to build a world-class growth machine.

We reach this depth of understanding by operating at an incredibly high tempo. Our iteration and feedback loops happen at a blistering pace. Testing combined with an intense tempo means you’ll learn faster than any of your peers.

You’ll work on projects like:
  • Variants for A/B testing across every step of our funnels.
  • Launching new landing pages for campaigns.
  • Working with our engineers to build light-weight freemium tools for our audience.
  • Improving our student apps to show them the value of living a Rich Life.
  • Building new funnels and signup flows.
  • Other marketing odds and ends (social profiles, PPC ads, email designs, etc).

What We're Looking For:
  • Design skills that drive conversions and actions. This is not a branding team, this is an acquisition team.
  • Can start with just an idea, turn it into a polished design, and handle most of the front-end. We have engineers that can handle the heavy lifting and back-end but the closer you can get your work ready for production, the more projects we'll ship, and the larger your impact will be.
  • This is not an entry-level design position, you'll need to know how to drive projects and hold our team to a high design standard.
  • Growth projects are HIGHLY iterative. Many ideas won’t work. This means you’ll put your heart and soul into projects which will flop on a regular basis. That’s the nature of the work. But you need to be able to tackle the next iteration with as much gusto and passion as you did the first time. The magic doesn’t happen on launch day, it happens in the countless iterations that follow.
  • You should love design but you should love results more.
  • Our team moves at an exceptionally high tempo, you'll be shipping weekly if not daily. You'll need to find that perfect balance between high quality design and getting a project shipped.
  • Comfortable de-scoping to meet deadlines. Short deadlines and a high tempo mean we can't do everything. You'll need to instantly see the most valuable piece of any project, make it as lean as possible, and find a way to get it shipped so we can see if it had any impact.
  • Must be based in the US.
  • This is a 100% remote position, work from anywhere you like.

To apply: http://www.iwillteachyoutoberich.com/careers/growth-designer/

jobs.title: Product Developer
jobs.company: I Will Teach You To Be Rich
jobs.content:
The Opportunity
At IWT, we take pride in creating some of the best online programs in the world, from Zero to Launch, to Find Your Dream Job, to Earn1K, and many more. And weâre just getting started. As a Product Developer, you will take ideas and transform them into finished products that make a huge impact on thousands of students around the world. Youâll be working with a world-class product development team and will learn more about human psychology in 3 months than you have in your entire career. Weâll teach you proprietary product development techniques that you wonât learn anywhere else. Most importantly, youâll see first hand how your work helps thousands of people live better, richer lives.

You will own the entire product development lifecycle, from initial research, to content creation, to user experience and seeing it through to product launch. Some of your day to day work will include the following:
Product Ideas
You will collaborate with your product development peers and brainstorm big product ideas to pursue. Youâll be an integral part in deciding which ideas have the potential to impact thousands of students.

Research
Youâll not only be performing market and competitive research, youâll also talk to our students and learn how we dig deep to discover their deepest hopes, fears and dreams.

Scoping & Positioning
Working closely with the team, youâll develop a product vision, define what our product is/is not, and work with designers and marketers to create the product name & logo.

Content Creation
Each product will bear the mark of your creativity and dedication. Youâll own the creation of the program including developing course outline, video scripts, presentations, case studies and customer emails that are read by hundreds of thousands of students.

Product Improvement
We are constantly updating our material to make sure we only deliver the best to our students. You will analyze customer feedback and make corresponding product improvement recommendations.

What We're Looking For
Product Development Experience

  • You are an exceptional copywriter. When it comes to copywriting, youâre second to none. You have a proven track record of taking on the appropriate voice and style to write compelling content, scripts and pitch copy. You understand that this is a very writing-intensive role and you are thrilled about it.
  • You have prior and relevant product development experience and know what it takes to bring a product from concept to market. Youâre no noob to the product development lifecycle. You LOVE digging deep and are passionate about researching your customers. You have an impressive portfolio demonstrating your expertise, understanding of your customers, and products youâve brought to life.
  • You have deep experience, interest and knowledge of IWT material. Preference will be given to those who have signed up for several IWT courses and know them inside and out.
Empathetic, Detail-Oriented and Passionate

  • You are highly empathetic. You understand people inside out and know how to get inside a customerâs head.
  • You are obsessed with getting it right. Youâre known as the perfectionist and are willing to try something 100 different ways just to get it right.
  • You are a great teacher and communicator. Not only are you a master at breaking down complex topics into simple concepts, and communicate them in a way that beginners can understand, but you also do it in a way thatâs 100X more valuable than whatâs already out there.
  • You are passionate about online business. You may even have direct experience in online sales and conversion optimization (huge plus!).
This is a full-time, 100% remote position.
If youâre excited about this, weâd love to talk to you. Use the âApply Nowâ button below to get in touch with us.

To apply: http://www.iwillteachyoutoberich.com/careers/product-developer/

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Web Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: New York, NY
URL: www.apartmenttherapy.com

At Apartment Therapy Media, our mission is to help people make their homes more beautiful, organized and healthy. As a Senior Front-End Web Engineer, you'll join our Product team in shipping software that delivers an excellent experience to our 29+ million monthly readers on Apartment Therapy and Kitchn. We have a wonderful, supportive team and you can read more about our process, culture, and tech stack on our team README.

This position fills a seat in our recently-formed Learning Squad, whose mission is to perform small experiments that directly impact our company goals. As we build our data-driven product strategy, this squad will work with A/B testing, feature toggles, and other tools and processes that will be incorporated into the company's workflow.

Our ideal candidate is excited to step into a new codebase and hit the ground running. With plenty of support, you're comfortable proposing high-level code decisions with solid reasoning to back them up. The fundamentals of the client-side web (JavaScript, CSS, HTML) are second nature and you're hard-wired to consider the long-term maintainability and scalability of your work. You've shipped a variety of projects into a production environment and have a deep understanding of how modern web applications live in the wild.

Leadership is practiced at all levels of the company, and we look to our Senior members to help drive decisions while keeping a holistic view of our projects and processes in mind. We value learning on our mixed-experience team and you'll share knowledge and mentor others through thoughtful code reviews, pair programming, and the example you set.

Our team (and much of the company) works remotely. We all wear many hats and maintain a collaborative and encouraging environment. You may work remotely or in our New York City office, however you must be able to work effectively with a remote team and coworkers. Excellent communication skills and self-direction are critical for success.

Additional "nice to haves":

  • Experience working with a distributed team
  • Experience in data-driven development
  • Familiarity with React and Ruby/Rails
  • Experience in small team (startup/lean/agile) environments
  • Experience mentoring less-experienced engineers
  • Interest in home design, cooking and other lifestyle areas our publications cover
Here's what current Product team members say about the job:

  • "Smart, action-oriented people; everyone always willing to jump in to help; flat team culture"
  • "Working from home is obviously great"
  • "I feel like our priorities stay pretty solid once they're defined and on the roadmap; I've definitely worked places where they shift so much nobody ever knows what's going on — definitely a bad thing about other places"
  • "Diverse team is really cool too — everyone comes from a very interesting background"
  • "Coming into this team I was used to using what was easy. Seems like the whole team here jumps on board with what makes the most and best sense."
  • "We've also hired people who have a 'bias for action.' Like get your hands dirty from day 1 and shine."
To apply, email hr@apartmenttherapy.com. In addition to a cover letter, résumé and links to relevant additional work (portfolios, blog, GitHub profile, Twitter account, etc), please include:

  • something you dislike about your favorite web framework
  • a link to a post from one of our sites you find compelling, stating briefly why
  • any questions you have for us
Extra credit: UBJpyrire!GRYYhfUBJlbhQRPBQRQguvf
US based applicants only. No recruiters or agencies.

To apply: hr@apartmenttherapy.com

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Platforms
jobs.content:
With over 50 million users, Runkeeper processes 10s of thousands of requests a second to its backend APIs. These APIs power everything from GPS stats to personalized goal recommendations. We are looking for an experienced software engineer to both optimize our existing backend APIs, and develop new APIs that will power future features in personalized training, social interaction, commerce, and communications.

A great candidate for this role enjoys technical problem solving with a great deal of autonomy and leeway to determine the right course of action, as well as teaching others and engaging with product and business partners to find innovative solutions to user needs. You will get to touch a wide variety of topics from overseeing the design of algorithms for scalable features to assisting with database architecture.

Here's what the role entails:

  • Maintaining critical systems, including purchase path and GPS trip save
  • Identifying areas of technical debt and weigh user impact and level of effort to address
  • Propose and oversee architectural improvements
  • Support the Platforms team in reaching application health goals
  • Document internal APIs and consult with product teams on their usage
  • Mentor other engineers through code reviews and pair programming

Requirements:

  • 5+ years experience building and maintaining APIs
  • Experience with Apache Tomcat, as well as AWS services such as S3 and Cloudfront
  • Experience or strong familiarity with functional programming concepts and Lambda architecture
  • Comfort with multiple languages/programming paradigms (our primary codebase is Java)
  • Ability to clearly communicate technical issues to business leaders
  • Expertise in one or more of the following: automated integration testing, performance testing, system monitoring and incident response, security and privacy

jobs.title: Manager of Mobile App Development, Android- Digital Ventures
jobs.content:
About Starbucks Digital Ventures At Starbucks, digital products are transforming our customers’ experience in incredible ways. With tens of millions of active users, over 25% of transactions (US) done using our mobile apps, and billions of dollars in revenue generated through our digital platform today, the opportunities to innovate at a global scale are huge. Our Digital Ventures organization leads the planning, design, development, and support of our industry-leading mobile, web, and emerging tech products.

Job Summary and Mission The Starbucks Android application is used every day by hundreds of thousands of Starbucks customers, and the Android development team within Starbucks Digital Ventures is growing and innovating fast to deliver the best possible experience to each one of them. We are seeking a full-time Android Application Development Manager to join the team. In this role, you will manage and oversee our Android application development projects to ensure that programs are well-planned and delivered on-time and within budget. You will develop and champion great software engineering practices and processes, be a leader and mentor to your team of talented engineers, and be a model for Starbucks' core guiding principles.

Summary of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:

Leadership - Setting development and product goals for the Android engineering team, developing effective workflows, and modeling how the team will work together: Identifies and communicates key responsibilities and practices to ensure the immediate team of direct reports promotes a successful attitude, confidence in leadership, and teamwork to achieve business results Supports the implementation of company programs to ensure the success of the Company.

Technical Guidance - Choosing the processes, platforms, and technologies that enable innovation and quality in our Android products: Develop and champion the development processes, coding style guidelines, and architectural designs necessary to innovate and maintain great product quality Understand and evangelize best practices for development and user experience on the Android platform Plan and manage processes and practices to ensure that development is aligned with company business goals and objectives.

Business Requirements - Providing functional expertise and executing functional responsibilities: Understand the business processes, priorities and roadmap. Work closely with our product and design teams to further the Starbucks experience on the Android platform Ensure that the Android mobile projects align with business goals and overall IT infrastructure Assist in guiding the overall technology strategy of the Company Negotiate and manage small-to-medium vendor contracts, ensuring successful resolution of issues.

Partner Development & Team Building - Providing partners with coaching, feedback, and developmental opportunities and building effective teams: Challenges and inspires team members to achieve business results and constant innovation. Conducts and ensure the completion of performance reviews. Ensure partners adhere to legal and operational compliance requirements. Oversee training and development of partners and make effective staffing decisions.

Summary of Experience Systems development, mobile application development and integration Experience managing systems or application development projects of all sizes and complexities, including large systems
Systems analysis Leading or managing small technical team(s)

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities Ability to handle multiple tasks Ability to provide technical oversight and guidance to partners for projects on the Android platform Strong coding abilities and experience with Java and Android SDK Ability to work in a fast-paced and changing environment Strong analytical skills Strong project management skills Ability to act as a business partner in support of business units Ability to build relationships Effective management and supervisory skills, including planning, organizing, developing, and monitoring partner performance

Starbucks is an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, veterans & individuals with disabilities. Starbucks will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local ordinances.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Infrastructure
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer - Infrastructure

FiveStars is the rewards program for small businesses that’s proven to bring customers back more often. Through unique rewards and personalized service, FiveStars helps everybody be a VIP. Founded in 2011 and based in San Francisco, our mission is to help businesses and communities thrive by turning every transaction into a relationship. In 2015, FiveStars drove 35 million in-store visits across over 10,000 local businesses in the U.S. and Canada. Over 10 million consumers use FiveStars to have exceptional experiences with local businesses. To-date FiveStars has raised $105 million from top-tier investors including HarbourVest, Menlo Ventures, Lightspeed, DCM, and Y-Combinator. If our mission and product resonate with you, you’re interested in joining a collaborative, motivated and close-knit team who want to help small businesses thrive, then join us!

We are looking for an Infrastructure Engineer to help ensure that FiveStars has a reliable and scalable backend system. Help us transition some of our legacy systems to a clean, elegant Service Oriented Architecture. During our time of growth, you will be helping us to deliver highly scalable and reliable systems which drive the experience of thousands of businesses and millions of consumers.

Responsibilities:

Work on the platform upon which all of our web products and mobile APIs are built Proactively identify site scaling issues and help redesign systems to address them Maintain a high level of quality in our infrastructure systems through sound development practices including code reviews, monitoring and alerting systems, and architecture reviews Ability to design, develop, and stand up new services based on new product needs Continually improve our internal infrastructure and tools Invest in FiveStars and our culture - our values are something we live and breathe every day

Requirements:

B.S. or greater in Computer Science or a related field (math, physics, engineering) and strong CS fundamentals Expertise building large-scale, distributed, high-volume systems Enjoy playing with tech like nginx, haproxy, postgres, AWS, ansible, docker, nagios, or graphite Be a strong team player Work with small, tightly knit product teams that function cohesively to move as quickly as possible Determination to provide reliable and fault tolerant systems to the application developers that consume them

Preferred:

Deep working knowledge of Linux servers and networked environments Thorough understanding of distributed systems and the protocols they use, including TCP/IP, RESTful APIs, SQL, NoSQL Experience in managing and sharding a relational database

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mobile (Android or iOS)
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer - Mobile (Android or iOS)

FiveStars is the rewards program for small businesses that’s proven to bring customers back more often. Through unique rewards and personalized service, FiveStars helps everybody be a VIP. Founded in 2011 and based in San Francisco, our mission is to help businesses and communities thrive by turning every transaction into a relationship. In 2015, FiveStars drove 35 million in-store visits across over 10,000 local businesses in the U.S. and Canada. Over 10 million consumers use FiveStars to have exceptional experiences with local businesses. To-date FiveStars has raised $105 million from top-tier investors including HarbourVest, Menlo Ventures, Lightspeed, DCM, and Y-Combinator.

FiveStars is searching for Android and iOS engineers who are thoughtful, responsible, and passionate builders who want to be part of a highly collaborative team that is creating the best user experience in mobile. We are looking for someone who is skilled in Android or iOS development, values good design, and is not afraid to get their hands dirty in backend code. We are in a position to shape how some of the newest trends in tech (BLE, NFC, among others) improve how local commerce is done, and we would love to have you help us create that future!

Responsibilities:

Work in a multi-disciplined scrum team to plan, design, and implement new features for our consumer Android application or native FiveStars iOS application Evaluate application designs in regards to technical feasibility and approximate development time Write high-quality code (in Java using Android Studio or Objective-C and Swift using Xcode) and design and implement RESTful APIs in our Django stack Maintain a high level of quality in our code bases through well-written automated tests and good architecture and code review practices Invest in FiveStars and its culture - our values are something we live and breathe every day

Requirements:

B.S. or greater in Computer Science or a related field (math, physics, engineering) and strong CS fundamentals 3+ years of software development experience, with at least 3 years in Android or iOS Strong team player - we work in small product teams that work very closely together and are constantly collaborating in order to move as fast as possible Have shipped either an Android application and is proficient in Java or an iOS application and proficient in Objective-C or Swift Experience using Android Studio, or Eclipse with ADT Has an understanding of mobile test strategies and frameworks

Preferred:

Experience with continuous integration Familiarity with Python, Django and Git

jobs.title: Senior Manual QA Test Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you the QA engineer to help us implement a robust manual QA process for our open source platforms developed for non profit organisations?


We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… and sometimes it breaks! So we’re looking for a confident and ambitious Senior Manual QA Test Engineer to join our distributed team.


We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and real team mentality. Our work covers web design, CRM, app development and branding for Charities and non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but also companies, trade associations and government bodies.


We are also developing several open source products that are used by non profit organsiations worldwide and the role will be uniquely rewarding as you will have the opportunity to influence and support these valuable projects.


The ideal candidate will be an experienced QA engineer who has worked on many complex web applications in the past.


The role will involve a mixture of writing and executing manual test scripts, feeding back to developers on bugs or issues noted. There may also be some future work on automation testing although the primary focus for this role will be manual testing. The ideal candidate would have some existing CRM and CMS experience (ideally Drupal), be an expert in developing comprehensive test plans, have expert SQL knowledge and be comfortable setting up a basic development environment and working with Git.


What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and loves picking holes in (other people’s!) logic. In short, we’re a team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right, and we’re looking for someone who thinks and acts like us to join our growing team.


If you are interested in the role, please send your CV through to us with a short covering letter explaining what caught your interest and why you think you would fit in.


(Please note that this is a remote position)

jobs.title: Junior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: London, United Kingdom
URL: https://pixelcab.in

Junior Full Stack Developer (Remote, UK preferred)

About Pixelcabin
Pixelcabin is an agile web development agency, focusing on ecommerce solutions for a wide range of companies. We work closely with Shopify building polished front-end experiences for our clients, and expanding the native Shopify functionality with bespoke Rails apps that leverage Shopify’s extensive API. We are a core Partner of Shopify, with advance access to upcoming APIs and features, allowing our projects to deliver cutting-edge solutions.

Our team is small and fully distributed, and working remotely has been part of our DNA since Day 1, meaning you’ll find a great remote working environment focused around making your day-to-day enjoyable and efficient, using tools like Slack for communication, Github for code, Rubymine IDE, Pivotal Tracker for project management, amongst many others. As part of a remote team, we encourage finding a setup that provides both the work productivity and lifestyle that suits everyone, even if that is something completely different for each person. Without geographic constraints, time and location can be flexible to fit around each team member’s needs.

As our clients are also remote, we occasionally travel to spend time embedded with them, and this can also provide us as a team time to come together. Outside of these trips, we also organise an annual meetup to bring everyone together for a few days to get away from our desks, bridge the remote-working gap, and plan for the future direction of the company - our last meetup involved converging on a beach in Miami for a weekend!

The company has evolved around a few core principles: quality over quantity, under promise and over deliver, and taking pride in your work. We take on projects that will present new problems for us to solve, and get excited about elegant solutions to complex problems. Most importantly, we want to invest in our team - we encourage continuous learning and development and aim for a high degree of code-review as part of the day-to-day experience.

About you
We are seeking a Junior Full Stack developer to help us grow our team. You will be exposed to a variety of different apps, and given ownership of some upcoming projects currently in the planning stage.

An ideal candidate will be highly self-motivated, able to take initiative in solving problems, and someone that can take ownership of projects, without needing to be micromanaged. Working as part of a remote team has many great advantages, however you will be expected to be able to communicate clearly with the team over a variety of different mediums, take a task through to completion, while being comfortable in raising issues or questions along the way.

As a remote team across time zones, we have a flexible approach to work schedule, however we would usually expect you to cross at least 5 hours of 9am - 5pm Monday to Friday UK time during your first year of working with us.

We favour a strong CS background over any specific language or technology skills, but as part of this we would expect a foundational understanding in Rails, JS, CSS, the modern web and Git.

Required knowledge and experience
  • Some familiarity with Ruby
  • Some experience working with JavaScript & CSS
  • Strong verbal and written communication in English
  • A passion for exceeding client expectations
  • Naturally organized and self-directed

Desirable knowledge and experience
  • Computer Science degree
  • Contributions to open-source projects
  • Some experience with Rails

Salaries and Perks
  • You can work from anywhere in Europe
  • Starting salary £25k - £32k
  • Flexible workspace allowance
  • Professional Development allowance
  • Tickets/Travel to Shopify's annual Unite conference

Application Deadline
The application deadline for this is end of Monday 29th August 2016. We will start to reply to applications after this date.

To apply: Please send all applications to jobs@pixelcab.in, including your Github, LinkedIn, and any other relevant links. No agencies please.

jobs.title: AgentFire.com is looking for a killer Senior Designer with extensive WordPress experience and great communication ability!
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Anytown, USA
URL: https://agentfire.com/now-hiring/

Our growing organization is looking for someone extremely proficient with WordPress Theme Customization / HTML / CSS, IDEALLY with experience in X-Theme & Cornerstone Visual Editor - or anything similar, like DIVI - will be considered big bonus points! If you don't have experience with these frameworks but are a killer designer, we encourage you to still apply for the position!!!

Here's a basic snapshot of the process
Client signs up for a new site and will complete a number of 'client questionnaires' that will include all of the information that needs to make it's way into the site (so all of their contact information, their logo, personal photo, photos to use in image slider, social networks etc

We will clone an existing 'template' site which will many of the defaults already set, and then it's up to you to basically work with the responses in the questionnaire to build out the 'first draft' of their site. We use the 'x-theme' framework for WordPress, and most of the design will be done in Cornerstone (an advanced front-end visual editor, again very similar to Divi or Visual Composer)

We are looking for some with above average skill as our sites are amazing! (check agentfire.com/our-portfolio/ for recent examples) - we're also looking for a great communicator - as you'll be managing jr. designers and speaking directly with clients and giving 1 on 1 demo's (more on that below)

Required Skills
- Must have expert level knowledge of CSS, HTML
- Must have expert level knowledge of Responsive Design
- Must have expert level knowledge of WordPress
- Must have expert level knowledge of working with and configuring WordPress plugins
-Must have a portfolio of existing websites demonstrating these abilities (please include a link to your previous work if applying for this position)
- Must be able to learn new skills quickly
- Proficient with Photoshop / Illustrator
- Must be fluent in English
- Work hours are somewhat flexible, but expect start time to be roughly 10am EST, end time to be 6pm EST daily
- Must be able to work well within a team dynamic
- Be able to communicate back and forth with clients

Bonus Skills
These are huge bonus skills, so if you have these, as well as the above, you'll be a front-runner for this position.

- Have experience with real estate websites
- Experience with X-Theme Framework
- Have experience with Cornerstone/Visual Composer/Divi or some other front end visual editor for WordPress
- Knowledge of Javascript

Compensation
$15-25 hourly depending on skill level and experience PLUS commissions on successful demo conversions - demo's are 1 on 1 conversations with interested parties and our current close rate is ABOVE 50% (these are not sales calls, you'll be speaking to very interested parties and your objective during the demo is to evaluate the prospective clients needs and how we can accommodate into an AgentFire website) - each successful demo conversion is +$75 plus your hourly rate, and we'll give you 6-10 demo's per week (or more if you're doing a great job with them) - you will also be lead designer on any successful demo conversions. 

Also to note - we will be raising our prices soon and will be raising our commissions - again we are GROWING and we'd love you to grow with us :) 

There will be anywhere from 40-50 hrs per week of work (so lots of opportunity for additional income) - also lots of opportunity for career advancement - we have gone from from 4 to 24+ fulltime employees over the last year alone and you can read our employee reviews here: https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/AgentFire-Reviews-E1258957.htm - also we have a great work environment (group chat via Slack) and have lots of fun here. Seriously, every one of our employees loves working with us. 

We are looking to hire ASAP!

Important Note
In your application, please also let us know your favorite color so we know you've actually read this :) 

To apply: Please visit https://agentfire.com/now-hiring/ to apply for the position!

jobs.title: Digital Product Designer UX/UI (f/m)
