jobs.title: Technology Lead
jobs.content:
Here at the Office for National Statistics (ONS) we provide the data that shapes our nation. And the ever-advancing world of digital opens up exciting opportunities for us. It enables us to better engage with and inform our customers, to develop more relevant and targeted products and increase our audience reach and their understanding of what we do. All this ensures we provide the most up-to-date information about the nation. Information that will help our nation make better decisions.

As Technology Lead, you’ll work collaboratively within a multi-disciplinary team to design, build, support and improve new and existing digital products and platforms. A technology specialist, you’ll work with our IT Architects to coordinate solutions between multiple development team and products, ensuring knowledge is shared between them. You’re an inspirational leader and will instil a culture of collaboration, communication and creativity as you coach and mentor your team members, particularly when it comes to best practice and setting standards both for software and infrastructure. You’ll also work alongside Delivery and Product Managers in understanding and communicating technical concepts, viability of plans and the associated risks to wider stakeholders. Taking a leadership role in the wider community, you’ll share your experiences as Technology Lead through tech talks at conferences as well as blog posts. Surrounded by like-minded individuals, this is an excellent opportunity to work with state-of-the-art technology.

First and foremost, you’re a tech expert. You live and breathe technology and love finding a solution to technology challenges. It goes without saying that you’ve a strong technology-focused background and experience working with a wide range of products, languages and technologies in multiple areas, including software design and development, architecture, infrastructure and different hosting options, including Cloud. You’re a pioneer of new approaches and enjoy sharing your findings with others. Motivated, forward-thinking and enthusiastic, you’re a great leader, someone people listen to and believe in, someone who gets the best out of others.

The Office for National Statistics shapes the nation, informing debate and improving decision making across the country – from businesses to government agencies. As the largest producer of official statistics, we compile and analyse a vast amount of data that has an impact on nearly every aspect of our lives.

Please note the closing date for this role is the 16th of Aug 2016.

jobs.title: Senior Front End React.js Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Philadelphia, PA
URL: life.io

Life.io is looking for a passionate and articulate front-end React.js developer to join our team. This role will support Life.io's growing user experience footprint as we build out new mobile applications and enhance our web platform. We're looking for someone with attention to detail, a dedication to patterns and style, and an appreciation for the frameworks we're embracing.

Required Skills/Qualifications
  • Solid experience building Javascript applications in React, React Native, Flux/Redux, and ES6/ES7.
  • Great at writing responsive and user-friendly markup using HTML5 and SCSS (Bourbon Neat experience a huge plus).
  • Experience with build tools like Gulp, Webpack, Babel, npm, etc.
  • Comfortable consuming and transmitting data to and from a restful JSON API.
  • Good understanding of Git flow and basic version control with a team.
  • Comfortable planning, reviewing and implementing complex UI and interactions.

Nice to Haves
  • Experience with Ruby on Rails / Rails APIs
  • Background in animation or illustration
  • UX Design experience

Things About You
  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of a remote team.
  • Enjoy helping people: curious, empathetic, collaborative, and happy to help problem solve with the team.
  • Enjoy learning about new products and how things work.
  • Ability to switch gears while keeping in mind the bigger vision.
  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events.

About Life.io
Life.io is a well-funded, venture-backed startup that's changing lives. Our wellness platform, which is offered globally through insurers and employers, provides motivation and education, and rewards people for making meaningful improvements to their health and lives.
With expertise in epidemiology and behavioral sciences and an Advisory Board that includes leading faculty in the area of diagnostics and behavioral economics, our team utilizes an evidence-based approach that is flexible, accessible, rewarding, and entirely HIPAA compliant.

Culture
We are a small company with 5 full-time developers. Though we work remotely, we also work collaboratively, taking advantage of Slack, Jira/Confluence, Screenhero, and Google Hangouts to connect with each other throughout the day. As a small team, each person's contribution is meaningful, impactful, and valued, both in terms of the actual work, but also in terms of planning, making suggestions, having opinions, and offering new insights / knowledge to the team. We embrace and want to know more about any of your unique skills and passions. Above all, we treat each other with respect, acknowledge and make accommodations for each other's needs both at work and at home, and do all we can to make Life.io the best possible place to work.

Perks
  • Full-time remote work
  • Possible stock options
  • Comprehensive health insurance including dental and vision
  • Life insurance
  • Excellent work/life balance
  • Generous vacation time (mandatory minimum of 2 weeks)

To apply: Send us an email to jobs+react@life.io with your resume, a bit about yourself, and some previous projects you're proud of.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are a software development agency based in Melbourne, Australia that builds web applications and cross-platform mobile apps for a wide range of clients big and small.


We are seeking a full stack web developer with several years experience in delivering successful customer projects. We are after someone who is a great communicator, self-motivated and can contribute in a team environment.


The technology stack we are seeking experience in consists of:

Front End:
* AngularJS
* Bootstrap
* jQuery
* LESS/SASS


Back End:
* ASP.NET Web API (C#)
* NHibernate/Entity Framework
* MS SQL Server/MYSQL Database
* Redis


You will be working directly with our clients and would have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of different projects for different industries. You will also have the opportunity to help guide the technologies we use and our best practices.


Requirements:
* Similar timezone to Melbourne, Australia or willing to work some overlapping hours with us.
* 5+ Years experience as a full stack web developer
* Significant experience with C# and AngularJS
* Strong experience with SQL and databases
* Familiar with Visual Studio
*  Git / SourceTree
* Attention to detail, reliable, curious and passionate

Extra tags: angularjs, fullstack, web development, .net, c#, web api, asp.net, bootstrap

jobs.title: Back End Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced Back End Software Engineer to join our small, dynamic, fast-moving team. You will be focused on our image processing platform, which is responsible for generating maps and 3D-models of data all around the world. As an early stage contributor, you'll have the opportunity to take ownership of key parts of the software and drive them forward.

Where You Can Make an Impact

  • Develop and release new features on Map Engine.
  • Effectively and timely debug new issues within the production system.
  • Develop high quality, reliable, tested software.
  • Inspire innovation and cultivate an environment of continuous improvement.
  • Advocate for modernizing team practices and tools. Continuously educate yourself and others on the newest technical advancements.
  • Ensure your technical decisions support our goals of quality, performance, scalability, reliability, availability, and security.
  • Write clear, maintainable and high-performance code.
  • Diagnose problems and improve performance in a container infrastructure.
  • Influence the back-end and other teams with best practices and experience.
  • Work cross functionally with infrastructure and front-end teams.

Your Experience

  • Bachelor’s, Master’s degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • You have excellent Python development skills.
  • Familiarity with Linux environment specifically Ubuntu.
  • Demonstrated experience building and delivering high-quality software.
  • Comfortable troubleshooting new systems and environments.
  • Comfortable with AWS technologies like S3, SQS and EC2.
  • Available to work within our San Francisco office.

Bonus Points

  • Experience with image processing, OpenCV, GIS programming, Docker.
  • Experience with NoSQL databases, like MongoDB.
  • Familiarity with computer vision, photogrammetry or structure-from-motion a plus.
  • A consistent track record of taking initiative and ownership of problems.

Why You Should Choose Team DroneDeploy?

DroneDeploy is the leading cloud software platform for commercial drones, making the power of aerial data accessible and productive for everyone. Trusted by businesses and individuals in over 80 countries worldwide, we are transforming the way drone users collect, manage and digest impactful data in a variety of industries, including agriculture, real estate, mining and construction. Simple by design and easy to use, DroneDeploy builds revolutionary software compatible with any drone. If you’re excited about drones and want to help us create a simple and seamless experience for drone users across the world, we’d love to hear from you!

Life at DroneDeploy

We’re a team of star wars loving, hot sauce eating, tech enthusiasts with inspirational talents. Everyone is empowered to explore and implement new ideas and improvements. We enjoy our collaborative office environment and encourage each other to push boundaries. We host weekly Friday night BBQs on our rooftop deck, offer great salaries, generous equity,100% employee health coverage, unlimited vacation and delicious catered meals among other perks.

DroneDeploy is an equal opportunity employer.

jobs.title: Employee #1 at Laravel
jobs.content:
Hi, I'm Taylor Otwell, the creator of the Laravel framework, Forge, Envoyer, and Spark. Laravel has grown faster than I could ever imagine in the last five years. With the continued growth of Forge and Envoyer, the time has come to find someone to join me on this adventure!

I am looking for someone with a deep knowledge of the Laravel framework, JavaScript, HTML, and Bash scripting to help maintain Forge, Envoyer, Spark, Laravel. Who knows, we may even tackle a few new projects! ;)

This position is fully remote and is open to anyone in the world!

Job Responsibilities

  • Lead developer role on Forge and Envoyer
  • Adding new features to Forge and Envoyer
  • Maintaining existing features on Forge and Envoyer
  • Assisting with Laravel Spark development
  • Assisting with customer support for all Laravel products
  • Assisting with Laravel open source development, issue management, and pull requests

jobs.title: Director of Customer Support and Hand-holding
jobs.content:
About CoachAccountable
CoachAccountable is a platform for coaches to structure and support coaching work done with their clients (think business coaching, fitness programs, life coaching and so on).

It's going well, and after 4 years my days of doing this as a one-man shop are numbered as business continues to grow.  I'm looking for an independent, sharp and personable individual to join me as CA's first hire and gradually take over the customer support side of things.  Think startup-like freedom but with the stability of an established company.

There are 3 pillars to the position:

I. Fielding Customer Support Issues
Currently relatively low volume, I can usuallyknock it out in a morning an evening session of 30-45 minutes each. Answering questions, directing attention to how to do this or that, andoften pointing out a given article or tutorial video which wouldanswer the specific question but also teach other related goodies. Loads of opportunity to be more awesome by pointing out related things theymight be looking for, and thereby educating users further on how to best use thesystem.

II. Developing the Inline Support Knowledge Base
We're building an inline help system, a collection of interconnected articles based onvarious sections and features within the system. Much of thematerial already exists scattered about in the blog, manuals, etc. It is to be recompiled with updated screen shots, and 2 or 3 versionswritten for each topic: one as an internal reference for support staff, one for coaches, and one for clients (for client-facing features). There isalso much to be written from scratch to flesh out the content tocompletely represent all the system does (as a one-man shop I indeed haven't kept things fully up to date!).

III. Customer Hand holding and Concierge Service
SO often folks benefit massively from just beingshown around the system, helping them get acquainted with whicheverfeatures would serve a given coaching style or program. CA iswickedly powerful but it takes something for folks to find andrealize the benefit of that power, and so often folks left to theirown devices just wonât bother, either under utilizing the system orjust walking away from it. CoachAccountable is very much in thebusiness of teaching coaches to be better coaches, and someonereaching out proactively to offer that sort of guidance holds greatpotential to grow the business. Itâs the sort of support thatbleeds into being a sales role.

Succeeding in this looks like...
Being a clear writer and a patient, personable teacher are key to this.  Being technically sharp and able to quickly learn a software system is nice, but if you're not a whiz at this sort of thing already it's fine because you'll learn and get fluent with how the system works through experience soon enough.

I'm looking for someone who is keen to grow and evolve with this role over the long haul, someone who really learns the system and excels at teaching coaches how to be better and get great value out of the platform will become more and more valuable over time.  Because it's an early stage company there is a LOT of room to innovate and make yourself massively valuable, while enjoying a wide variety of (hopefully!) intellectually stimulating and satisfying work.  I know what I need today, and together we can co-create your role as we continue to build the team and infrastructure to make a fabulous machine of customer support and on boarding.  Doing webinars and making screen casts for example are two directions in which you might branch out within this role.

Structure of the job
Structurally, the role will begin with an emphasis on you learning the system and easing in to fielding support emails as you learn (i.e. Pillar I above).  Once you get the hang of that you'll add in Pillar II and begin flexing your copy writing chops to write informative and illustrating articles on how the system works.  Finally once your fluency with the system is comprehensive enough you'll be able to move on to Pillar III outreach and hand-holding to compliment your other duties.

Hourly contract basis to start, $30/hour.  If you're awesome and twist my arm I'm willing to consider starting higher.  Again, I view this role as having greatpotential to grow the business and so the right person, one who's able excel from the start and grow over time, is worth a lot.  I imagine the role to commence part time and grow into a full 40 hours a week within a month or two as you get up to speed and are ready to take on more responsibility.  When we're both clear this is a great fit and love working with each other we can make your position a full time salaried one.

Speaking of loving working together, it is my intention that whomever takes this position LOVES their role, and I'll do whatever is in my power to make that happen.  I'll be relating to you as a competent, responsible adult and give you as much freedom as possible (within the needs of the role) to do your thing independently, where and whenever works best for you.  I want this work to be interesting and life giving to you, varied and purposeful from the interactions you have.  For this to work you have to have at least a baseline love for doing customer support, for being a guide over the phone, and for doing writing that teaches.

Application Instructions
In any application here is what I'd like to see:

  • A brief introduction of yourself and your experience with customer support and/or teaching in general
  • Your thoughts on how you would ideally like to spend your time among the 3 pillars of the position and why
  • Answers to these two common support questions, so that I can get a sense for your writing style:
      1. I couldn't find CoachAccountable in the app store, is there one?
       2. How can I have the system send out a worksheet for my clients to fill out before our sessions together?

(Everything you'll need to know to answer these questions can be found at http://blog.coachaccountable.com/2015/09/introducing-ca-mobile/ and http://blog.coachaccountable.com/2014/04/appointment-worksheets/)

To apply: Keen to hop on board as employee number 2 in a successful and growing venture? Great. To be considered for the role, send me an email to john@coachaccountable.com. In it please include the items listed in the instructions above. Finally please include your own candid assessment of how likely you are to love this role and why. Having whomever takes this role be blissing their brains out as often as possible is one of my top priorities. :)

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Elixir, React, Rails
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Philadelphia, PA
URL: https://curadora.workable.com/jobs/308843

Curadora is on a mission to create new, innovative tools for people to plan for an event - from music festivals to sporting events and more, and we’re in need of the smartest developers.
We're committed to attracting the best talent possible, which means we want to offer this opportunity to those that live beyond the Philadelphia area. If you’re eager to get your hands on the newest technologies to create amazing digital experiences, then read on!

Your new day-to-day

You’ll have the opportunity to contribute from design, to code, to test, to deployment. That includes working collaboratively with like-minded teammates to plan development cycles, break down feature requests into a series of tasks, and remove blocks. You’ll be integrating with multiple third parties to build a robust and scalable web application for consumers. As a senior developer, you’ll play a critical role in the direction of our product by prioritizing needs, analyzing usage data and researching new technologies. You’ll need to face complex problems and turn them into sophisticated solutions.

Technology you will work with

  • Elixir with Phoenix
  • React with Redux
  • APIs/XML
  • Redis and Elasticsearch
  • Ruby on Rails
  • SQL databases
  • CSS / SASS
  • Node.JS
Who you are

You’re someone who is talented, organized, and motivated to get things done. You like the idea of working in an entrepreneurial, startup environment because you have a ton of ideas and are interested in making a noticeable impact on a product. You thrive in an environment that moves fast, and you’re always thinking ahead – about user experience, testability, security loopholes, caching, database optimization, and even code organization. You’re constantly thinking “how can we do this better, faster, and more efficiently?” Success for you means users LOVE the products you build because they deliver the best online experience.

What you bring to the table

You’re someone who has experience designing and implementing small or medium-sized software systems. You have a proven track record of successfully designing and implementing multiple software components and systems. You can communicate that design and implementation to fellow developers, and articulate strengths/weaknesses and rationale to business stakeholders.

You’re also someone who can solve concurrent challenging technical problems in a fast-paced environment. That means you have an acute attention to orient with good task estimation and prioritization skills.

If you have experience with online travel agencies, that would be really nice too.

Where you’ll be working
We're committed to attracting the best talent possible, which means we are also accepting applications for this opportunity to those who wish to work from a remote location.

Benefits for you
  • Competitive salary
  • Healthcare insurance
  • Healthcare & dependent care flexible spending account
  • Mass transit / commuter benefit program
  • 401K match
  • Generous vacation and personal day policy
  • Start-up experience in an energetic environment
  • Bagel Tuesdays!
  • Being a part of an all-star team

To apply: Apply at Workable or browse all our career opportunities at www.careers.curadora.com. For additional details, please visit open_in_new https://curadora.workable.com/jobs/308843.

jobs.title: Senior UX Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Summary

Avalara is seeking an expert level UX engineer with a proven ability to solve complex problems and make it easy for customers. Join us in building delightful user experiences that make “sales tax less taxing” for Avalara customers.

You are passionate about developing ambitious web apps that are simple and clear to use. You delight in solving complex UX engineering problems using clean, performant code. You know that architecture is important, that no developer stands alone, and that effective, supportive, and collaborative team processes produce the best solutions. You have a strong grasp of software development fundamentals and are able to apply those concepts in your prolific contributions.

Job Duties

  • Writes readable, maintainable, and test-covered code, setting high standards for the team
  • Investigates and fixes bugs, taking primary responsibility for software quality problems observed in the project and especially on owned features
  • Contributes to architectural design of new features and improvement of existing features
  • Helps improve team processes and expertise by participating in designs and code reviews, and by suggesting new processes and tools. Enjoys mentoring others and taking feedback in order to improve.
  • Owns expertise in specific technology areas relevant to the project
  • Actively engages with developing industry tools and practices in order to remain current

Qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
  • Minimum of 5 years experience building customer-facing UX
  • Expert knowledge of Javascript, including ES6
  • Expert knowledge of HTML and CSS/Sass
  • Experience with recent versions of client-side UX technologies such as Ember, React, and/or Angular
  • Proficiency with supplemental tech such as Git, Bash, Team City, and JIRA

Preferred Qualification

  • Experience and comfort with continuous integration and automated build-check processes
  • Experience developing and maintaining tooling for UX
  • Experience designing and developing software services and APIs

About Avalara

Avalara helps businesses of all sizes achieve compliance with sales and excise tax, VAT, and other transactional tax requirements by delivering comprehensive, automated, cloud-based solutions that are fast, accurate, and easy to use. Avalara’s end-to-end suite of solutions is designed to effectively manage complicated and burdensome tax compliance obligations imposed by state, local, and other taxing authorities in the United States and internationally.

Avalara offers hundreds of pre-built connectors into leading accounting, ERP, ecommerce and other business applications. The company processes millions of tax transactions for customers and free users every day, files hundreds of thousands of transactional tax returns per year, and manages millions of exemption certificates and other compliance related documents.

A privately held company, Avalara’s venture capital investors include Sageview Capital, Battery Ventures, Warburg Pincus, Technology Crossover Ventures, Arthur Ventures, and other institutional and individual investors. Avalara employs more than 1000 people at its headquarters in Seattle, WA and in offices across the U.S. and in London, England and Pune, India. More information at: www.avalara.com

jobs.title: Maker of software
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Chicago, IL
URL: https://highrisehq.com/

Highrise is looking for a full-time person who makes nice software.

You might consider yourself a designer, but you don’t let that stop you from building something awesome yourself. You know your way around a Ruby on Rails application and have no problem developing new views for it. You’re handy with Javascript.

Sure, you love working with smart backend engineers and other people with great design ideas. But by yourself or with a team you find a way to get your ideas out into the world.

Highrise is a fairly typical Ruby and Rails web app, created by the people who created Ruby on Rails :) — but there are a ton of opportunities to use Rails/Ruby/Javascript/Go/React/whatever the right tool for the job is as we scale and improve.

We need people with diverse skillsets who are interested in a variety of challenges, from rethinking things we take for granted in software apps, to creating marketing sites, from developing novel onboarding experiences to nailing small details on new color pallets. You’ll have an opportunity to do it all.

And most importantly, there’s going to be a lot of people using your stuff.

Please get in touch and let’s get to know each other.

MORE ABOUT US:
Highrise is a super simple CRM tool, built by 37signals/Basecamp and launched on March 20, 2007. It’s grown to become a multi-million dollar business with a strong, loyal customer base. In August 2014, Highrise left the nest, and was spun-off as its own company — a very welcome change for Highrise users, as our users now have their own dedicated development and support team.

@highrise — Loving the new iPhone app. Nice work!!-@DarrenSproats

Very impressed with all the activity out of @Highrise lately.-@DUQE

Highrise, in many ways, feels like a startup. We have a brand new team exploring new ideas with freedom to build the things we think are best. Except, we also already have significant revenue and users eager for the things we’re working on. There is no “runway”. No risk of not getting our next round of venture funding. It’s a profitable business, and all we care about is making better products.

OUR CURRENT TEAM:

Nathan Kontny, CEO 
Software engineer and designer for 15 years. Began an entrepreneurial career with two Y Combinator backed startups: Inkling (http://inklingmarkets.com) in 2005 and Draft (http://draftin.com) in 2011. Also was an engineer on President Obama’s re-election campaign. One of the best ways to get to know me is my writing on Medium and Ninjas and Robots

Michael Dwan, CTO 
Michael is a Y Combinator alum and the engineer behind creating an awesome photo application called Snapjoy. Snapjoy was quickly acquired by Dropbox, and you’ll see his handiwork all over what Dropbox has done with Carousel and photo storage.

Chris Gallo, Head of Customer Support 
You’ll likely hear from Chris if you need help with Highrise. Chris knows how to communicate and how to help. He’s been an incredible asset to Highrise.

Lynette Kontny, COO 
You’ll see Lynette’s work all over Highrise. She makes sure we’re all on the same page and getting the right things done quickly.

Jon Phenow, Software Engineer 
Jon is a big reason Highrise continues to improve at a rapid pace. He juggles multiple projects at a time and makes Highrise more useful every day.

Alison Groves, Customer Support 
Alison is our newest addition. She comes to us via Zapier and Raven Tools, loves to chat with customers, and has a ton of insight on the world outside of support as well as in it.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:
We are furiously improving an already well-used application. We believe in the power of momentum and want small, impactful projects out quickly. A lot of people are going to see and use your work. You can see how fast we develop by the number of things we’ve gotten done since we’ve taken over:

http://blog.highrisehq.com/

Not only will you have your hand in improving an app a lot of people use, we have a ton of new projects on deck: new iOS/Android apps, new business ideas, things being rewritten. Highrise is a big sandbox to play in with employees and users who would love your help.

WHERE?
Anywhere in the US. Highrise is headquartered in Chicago, but we all work remotely. Work from wherever you are comfortable

-Nathan Kontny 
CEO, Highrise

To apply: Write makers@highrisehq.com with the subject: I love making things. Please send along your GitHub & Twitter profiles, website, resume, references and anything you think would help introduce yourself: where you blog, anything open source you’ve developed, your 3 favorite books I should read, businesses you’ve started (even if they haven’t worked) etc. Looking forward to meeting you!

jobs.title: Ruby On Rails Developer
jobs.content:
N2 Publishing is seeking a skilled web developer with an awesome personality to join our technology team. The successful candidate is welcome to work remotely from home or relocate to our headquarters city to work in the office. Please note, the remote teammate should be prepared to travel to our home office location about 3-4 times a year. But, weâre situated in the beautiful coastal town of Wilmington, NC, so neither relocating nor traveling to our home office location is a bad gig!


But enough about the logistics. As a talented web developer with an equally impressive personality, you have lots of job options. We know that. So we'd like to give you a breather and put the company in the interview seat for a change.


Why N2 Publishing:
â¢	The ability to work with cutting-edge technology and interesting publication applications
â¢	People-first company culture (we've actually won awards for this -- check them out here)
â¢	Flexible schedule with a company focus on work-life balance (Fortune recently named us one of the "Best Workplaces for Flexibility")
â¢	The opportunity to grow professionally and potentially lead a technical team
â¢	Laid back company atmosphere
â¢	Office location 15 minutes from the beach, though the position could be 100% remote if desired
â¢	Generous paid time off, plus company-wide two weeks off at the end of the year
â¢	Benefits including medical, dental, vision, short-term and long-term disability, and life insurance
â¢	401(k) retirement plan with employer match
â¢	Two Lunch & Learns each month
â¢	Monthly company socials
â¢	Daily on-site fitness classes


Interested? Here's what youâll do:
â¢	Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices
â¢	Create site layout/user interface by using standard HTML/CSS practices
â¢	Integrate data from various back-end services and databases
â¢	Provide input, options, and recommendations on software features and system enhancements
â¢	Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
â¢	Provide recommendations into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities


Sound like you? Here's what you'll need:
â¢	4-year degree in a computer science-related discipline or relevant degree
â¢	Expert knowledge of Ruby on Rails, as well as in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS and Javascript
â¢	In-depth understanding of how web applications work including security, session management and best development practices
â¢	Full working knowledge of MVC application architecture
â¢	In-depth knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming and web application development
â¢	Experience using Agile Methodologies and Test Driven Development
â¢	Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly, and master diverse web technologies and techniques
â¢	Team player attitude with a desire to be part of an organization that is making a difference in peopleâs lives
â¢	Proven experience leading a technical development team is not required, but is a plus
We provide a drama-free culture built on trust, respect, and humility. People are promoted based on consistent performance and cultural fit; we intentionally develop our talent so that we can promote from within the organization. We are emotionally healthy people who genuinely enjoy working with each other. So brilliant jerks need not apply.


Think youâre the one for us? Apply now.



N2 Publishing is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, N2 Publishing complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
At Mattel, our vision is "Creating the Future of Play". We strive to achieve this vision primarily through our creative and enthusiastic employees who DARE to be innovative, and THRIVE in a friendly and fast-paced environment. Mattel is committed to developing employees and supporting their career goals, helping them GROW with a host of meaningful experiences and learning opportunities. And by promoting a culture of BALANCE that emphasizes working passionately and taking time to play often, we are proud of how our employees LEAD by example in all that they do!

Sproutling, A Mattel Company, is looking for a senior backend engineer to help us develop the services and API that form the foundation of a variety products that are part of our Nursery of the Future vision. It is an opportunity to work with the latest connected devices and hardware as well as with a sophisticated platform that will process large amounts of data per second. If you are looking to work with the latest technology and create an uncompromising user experience that guides them through challenges of a connected platform then this will be a rewarding opportunity.

Responsibilities

  • Design REST interfaces to hardware components with data structures that support optimal data transfer
  • Build web services in the appropriate language that are performant and inherently secure
  • Instrument Docker to build sustainable and portable environments that are easily deployed
  • Design and use SQL and NoSQL databases to support both relational and nonrelational storage requirements
  • Write testing code according to Test Driven Development best practices
  • Document web services and jobs for clarity and ease of use including outside 3rd parties
  • Ensure that all services have appropriate logging and are instrumented for monitoring and alerting
  • Leverage Kubernetes to deploy and manage a scalable infrastructure that supports high thoughput
  • Respond to system level issues as necessary to provide the best overall customer experience

Qualifications

  • Experience with the Linux operating system and the Bash shell
  • Several years of professional experience developing REST based services that support millions of users or devices
  • Ability to develop in multiple languages including Java, Ruby, Python, GO, Objective C,Swift, C or C++
  • Understanding of how to leverage, build, deploy and tune the JVM and Java based systems
  • Understanding of Continuous Integration/Deployment and tools like Jenkins
  • Excellent written and communication skills

Nice to Have

  • Past experience converting scientific or data algorithms to higher performance languages like Scala and C/C++
  • Familiarity with either websockets or MQTT as communication protocols
  • Experience using Docker for development and deployment to production environments
  • Experience with multiple cloud based infrastructures with preference given to AWS

Location

Sproutling is located in the beautiful Embarcadero part of the Financial District in downtown San Francisco. The office is steps away from the Embarcadero Bart Station and the Ferry Building. Restaurants, shops, hotels, banks and wonderful views of the bay are within a short walk of our sunny, open floor plan office.

ABOUT US

Mattel, Inc. (Nasdaq: MAT) is the worldwide leader in the design, manufacture and marketing of toys and family products. The Mattel family is comprised of such best-selling brands as Barbie®, the most popular fashion doll ever produced, Hot Wheels®, Monster High®, American Girl®, Thomas & Friends® and Fisher-Price® brands, including Little People® and Power Wheels®, as well as a wide array of entertainment-inspired toy lines. In 2013, Mattel was named as one of the "World's Most Ethical Companies" by Ethisphere Magazine. Mattel also is ranked No. 2 on Corporate Responsibility Magazine's "100 Best Corporate Citizens" list. With worldwide headquarters in El Segundo, Calif., Mattel employs nearly 40,000 people in 40 countries and territories and sells products in more than 150 nations. At Mattel, we are Creating the Future of Play! Visit us at www.mattel.com/careers, www.facebook.com/mattel or www.twitter.com/mattel or www.youtube.com/MattelRecruiter

Mattel is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer

jobs.title: Freelance Graphic Designer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Palo Alto
URL: www.konsus.com

http://konsus.interviewed.com/?source=wwremotely
JOB DESCRIPTION:

  • We are looking for highly creative graphic designers interested in becoming part of the ever-expanding Konsus community.
  • As part of the graphic design team, you will receive projects ranging from logo design to corporate branding.
  • These tasks are expected back in a timely manner, while maintaining high quality results.
  • We offer a steady stream of projects with the freedom to choose when, where and how much you work. Freelancers always have the option to decline a project if they are unavailable.
ABOUT KONSUS:

Konsus provides on-demand freelancers for business. We are always looking for great freelancers to help with our growing client base and increasing work load. As a freelancer working for Konsus you can work where you want, when you want and how much you want.

Companies around the world send us office tasks and we instantly assign them to pre-vetted freelancers (that would be you) based on skill and availability. We launched in August of 2015, and already have 500+ customers with some very large international clients. We work with interesting and exciting tasks in a modern way, and our mission is to create the future shape of how to do business around a new and connected globe.

ADVANTAGES OF WORKING WITH KONSUS

  • Work when you want and where you want, full flexibility
  • Receive a steady flow of work- no more searching for jobs!
  • You always get paid on time. If clients don’t pay, that’s our problem
  • Our project managers handle the clients, you do what you do best
  • We treat people in a fair and friendly manner
  • We are building a community in which we work, learn and grow together
REQUIREMENTS

  • Past graphic design experience.
  • High personal standards for quality and dependability.
  • Excellent communication skills - You will need to be fluent in English with the ability to effectively explain your thought processes and perspectives behind each decision in both written and verbal communication.
  • Include your graphic design portfolio / work samples in your application
GENERAL TERMS

  • Time is logged hourly and paid out once per month.
  • We work using Slack.
  • When on a project, you must be available until completion.
If you think Konsus is the place for you, we would love to hear from you! Please note that we receive many applications for this position and reply times will therefore vary, but we screen applications on a rolling basis and will reach out to you if you look to be a great fit for Konsus.

To apply: Please apply via http://konsus.interviewed.com/?source=wwremotely

jobs.title: IT Team Leader - OBIEE
jobs.content:
Job Summary: Under limited supervision, oversees the installation, configuration, and support to a local area network, wide area network, internet system, computers, desktops and/or mobile devices. Recommends equipment improvement or replacement. Serves as highest advanced level subject matter expert, providing authoritative guidance for professional staff. May also serve in a lead role.

Job Specific Duties: Under limited supervision, manages the daily operations, personnel of the IT Enterprise Reporting Team within the Office of IT Applications. This position is responsible for maintaining the Enterprise and Ad Hoc reports using Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) for the Department; Managing customer requests for report revisions, or development of new reports; overseeing the development, testing and quality assurance processes of Enterprise Reporting Group; migrating reporting dependencies for new versions of IT Applications or new development projects,; Monitors and optimizes system performance, Controlling and monitoring user access to secure reports; Coordinating the development of data views or other data warehouse tables to support reporting. Provides customer support and systems administration; performs upgrades and enhances system. Provides team leadership and project management.

THIS IS AN UNCLASSIFIED POSITION.

THE SELECTED APPLICANT FOR THE POSITION WILL BE SUBJECT TO A REFERENCE AND CRIMINAL BACKGROUND CHECK.

PLEASE INCLUDE ALL RELEVANT JOB INFORMATION ON THE APPLICATION FOR CONSIDERATION.

Entry Qualification: Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Five years of related experience OR Associate’s degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Seven years of related experience OR Nine years of related experience OR Two years of experience at the lower level Systems Administrator 3 (ITP042) or position equivalent.

Agency Specific Qualification:

  • Extensive professional experience managing complex IT related projects or professional level IT personnel
  • Experience in one of the following areas: Business Intelligence, Report/Analytics Development, Project Management, Application Development, Data/Database Development/Administration or Software Engineering
  • Data management and data quality analysis skills
  • Uses imagination to develop new ideas, solutions, or methods.
  • Ability to identify problems and create the best-suited solutions/alternatives.
  • Ability to make sound, well-informed decisions.
  • Strong management skills.
  • Works well with others in achieving team projects.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Committed to providing quality customer service.
  • Possesses strong written and oral communication skills and expresses ideas and facts to groups and individuals effectively.
  • Ability to work after hours as needed for system maintenance/deployments etc.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Four-year degree in an IT related field
  • Two or more years of work experience in using Oracle BI Publisher, OBIEE, SAP (BO/WI), Crystal reports, or Microsoft (SSRS),
  • Completion of OBIEE training or Oracle/SQL Server certifications
  • Work experience in designing, developing, and configuration of enterprise analytics/reports within OBIEE RPD, BI Publisher
  • Experience with Oracle Exalytics/Exadata
  • Demonstrated experience managing IT professionals, specifically reporting or data developers
  • Demonstrated experience providing Enterprise Systems support.
  • Completion of a graduate or advanced degree in business administration, information technology, management information systems or related field from an accredited college or university.
  • Demonstrated experience working in the Transportation industry, private or government framework.

Salary:

$70,000 per year

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

jobs.title: IT Team Leader – GIS
jobs.content:
Job Summary: Under limited supervision, oversees the installation, configuration, and support to a local area network, wide area network, internet system, computers, desktops and/or mobile devices. Recommends equipment improvement or replacement. Serves as highest advanced level subject matter expert, providing authoritative guidance for professional staff. May also serve in a lead role. Job Specific Duties: Leads the enterprise geographic information system (GIS) team. Serves as IT technical lead and geospatial team leader. Develops, coaches, and trains team members. Responsible for managing Esri ArcGIS Server and geodatabase day-to-day operations. Provides system backup, recovery, and restoration of Department GIS. Provides end user and IT architect/developer customer support. Manages team assigned work tasks, reviews work products to meet IT specifications/standards, and delivers results on-time. Develops and upgrades GIS applications, Esri software/geodatabases. Ensures system jobs complete successfully. Performs geospatial data loading, migration, and integration with enterprise systems. Enforces geodatabase and application security. Maintains GIS architecture, licensing, business continuity/disaster recovery plans, completes patching/upgrades, monitors system performance, usage, and growth.

THIS IS AN UNCLASSIFIED POSITION.

THE SELECTED APPLICANT FOR THE POSITION WILL BE SUBJECT TO A REFERENCE AND CRIMINAL BACKGROUND CHECK.

PLEASE INCLUDE ALL RELEVANT JOB INFORMATION ON THE APPLICATION FOR CONSIDERATION.

  • 5+ years of ArcGIS Server administration
  • 3+ years of ArcGIS (SDE) geodatabase development/administration within multi-user versioned environment
  • 3+ years of Python scripting or similar scripting experience
  • 3+ years of software programming/development experience
  • PL/SQL, SQL Plus query skills
  • Experience with supporting ArcGIS Server editing and publication services

  • Knowledge of Esri Roads and Highways, linear referencing, dynamic segmentation, geospatial and mapping concepts such as spatial analysis, map projections, etc.

  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and teamwork skills
  • Accountable and results oriented
  • Comfortable in a fast-paced environment

  • Improving team productivity/efficiency to meet agency goals/objectives
  • Demonstrated ability to train, direct and evaluate team members; able to manage a diverse workforce, provide feedback, coach staff, and implement corrective action.
  • Is accountable for the operation, performance, and quality of the agency GIS
  • Exercises judgment in decision making and experienced in developing viable solutions within constraints
  • Ability to work on-call, after hours, or on weekends as required for system deployments, maintenance, or upgrades

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of ArcGIS (SDE) geodatabase development/administration within multi-user versioned environment
  • 3+ years Esri ArcGIS Server Javascript API development experience with HTML5 and SharePoint 2010/2013
  • Hands on work experience in installing, configuring, or supporting Esri Roads and Highways

jobs.title: Mobile Application Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a cross platform/Android developer to help us bring our open source geospatial platform to mobile users. 



The world is seeing an explosion in the amount and variety of location-based information. At the same time, open source software is making better analytical tools more widely available.



Boundless is at the intersection: we develop open source platforms that make it easier to manage and share geospatial data.



This is a great opportunity to join a growing business, solve interesting technical problems, and wear the mantle of Android ambassador in our fantastic team.



Responsibilities




  • Develop mobile components and applications that leverage the OpenGeo Suite

  • Work with customers to gather requirements and propose solutions

  • Participate in robust open source communities that reward great engineering

  • Create documentation and provide technical support, helping users get more out of Boundless software



You Offer




  • Outstanding engineering talent proven by great results and significant open source contributions

  • 3+ years of Android development experience, and in-depth understanding of the Android SDK and its apps development ecosystem, including subtle differences between OS versions and manufacturer implementations.

  • Ability to contribute in multiple languages. 

  • A working knowledge of SQLite

  • Hands-on experience developing and supporting reusable Android components. You write well-abstracted, reusable and efficient code.

  • Interest in teaching and training others on technical topics.



Nice to Have




  • Knowledge of GIS/geospatial software, particularly PostGIS, GeoServer, and/or OpenLayers

  • A familiarity with React/React Native

  • A knowledge of functional reactive programming (RxJS, RxJava, Reactive Cocoa)

  • Building low latency real time systems

  • A knowledge Objective-C, Swift, Java, Javascript with ES6, Clojure



We Offer



Competitive salaries, top-notch benefits (stock options, 3 weeks of vacation, medical/dental/vision, 401k with match), and fantastic colleagues. Our casual-yet-focused environment is a uniquely satisfying place for high performers. Most importantly, we offer the opportunity to help us build an innovative company that spreads and supports open source software and principles.



About Boundless



Boundless is a small but growing organization focused on bringing the best enterprise open source geospatial software to organizations and governments around the world. Our team is distributed from Austria to Argentina, with offices in Washington DC, New Orleans, St Louis, and Victoria, BC. For this position we will work with candidates near our office and remote.

jobs.title: Fullstack Developer / CTO
jobs.content:
PrintPeter brings companies and students together. With more than 1.5 million printed pages, 15.000 sign ups within the first month, and brands such as Microsoft, Lieferando or Amorelie, Printpeter has established itself as the leading platform for sponsoring students’ documents. Our service is a win-win, as it reduces student expenditures and gives brands a unique advertising possibility to a highly desired target group. Our system was developed over the course of 2 months by 2 freelance developers. Our product is BOTH digital & print, as our system connects both to a hybrid advertising space. Now we are looking for someone, who will take over the development in-house and continue the development journey of PrintPeter.

We are looking for a

Senior Backend / Frontend Developer (m/f)

Your tasks:

  • You will take over the full development of the System behind PrintPeter and will nurture and improve it
  • You will create new add-ons and integrate tools into our system in order to expand our functionalities
  • You will manage, organize and supervise all our data collection in the Backend

Your capabilities:

  • You know PHP / MySQL / HTML / CSS / Javascript / Larval / & more
  • You have at least 3 years of experience in the field
  • You have a precise and systematic workflow
  • You have a solution-orientated work ethic

Your benefits:

  • We offer a fair and considerable monthly pay with a performance based bonus system
  • You are able to work in an environment where your input is valued
  • You will be working in one of the most renowned working spaces - the factory Berlin
  • You will be part of a well-financed and ambitious Start Up

If you are interested in working with a motivated and driven team, appreciate a leveled hierarchy, and want to revolutionize a market, then send your application to jobs@printpeter.de.

If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact Charly: +49 / 30 692 007 842

jobs.title: Junior Mid Level Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Agencies please do not apply, we are not interested.  We are interested in U.S. residents only, this is full time remote work 9 to 5 type job.


Are you ready to work from home with a flexible schedule with a team of similarly motivated self starters?   Have direct responsibility to make an immediate difference?  See your code in action in days, not months or years? Work on interesting problems across a wide range of technologies and platforms and perhaps introduce some of your own?  Our 20 year old travel technology company with over a billion reservations to our credit needs a junior to mid level software engineer/developer. Duties include developing, collaborating, and working closely with others on our web-based business software to meet the needs of our closely coordinated business unit.


Responsibilities:



  • Serve as a developer implementing enterprise web applications using API driven .NET technologies (C# / VB.Net / JavaScript / AngularJS / Bootstrap) to deliver products to the travel industry as part of ongoing business initiatives

  • Enhance and support existing large, mission-critical .NET applications that support core functions of the business as needed

  • Assist in uncovering and implementing ways to improve the level of customer service, quality, and efficiency of the company

  • Develop new features and make modifications to existing features

  • Test and debug applications to ensure client needs are met

  • Various other duties as assigned

jobs.title: Mobile Architect
jobs.content:
__Location__

Telecommute; or from our Denver, Colorado office.

__Overview__

AudioAddict, Inc. is seeking a talented Mobile Architect to join our distributed Product Development group. This is a full-time development position with a close-knit distributed team.

We currently support native apps for iOS and Android, with other devices of all sizes and shapes still to come. Weâre looking for someone with the expertise to support our current apps, and the foresight to adapt as our needs grow and change.

__Responsibilities__

* Collaborate, communicate, and innovate the design and implementation of technical solutions within the AudioAddict portfolio (di.fm, radiotunes.com, jazzradio.com, rockradio.com, classicalradio.com).
* Ensure that application designs meet nonfunctional requirements (e.g. performance, concurrency, scalability)
* Oversee the proper implementation of projects through coding and code reviews, and deploy code to the app stores.
* Analyze product/business requirements, create and implement flexible, scalable implementation designs.

__Required Qualifications__

* Bachelorâs Degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science or related field
* 5+ years as an application developer, specifically experienced in both iOS and Android
* Proficiency in object-oriented programming in Objective-C (iOS) and Java (Android)
* Expertise in iOS and Android Best Practices
* Passion for music

__Desirable Skills__

Working knowledge of C#, Ruby/Rails, Audio decoding/processing, Xamarin, git/git hub, #/bin/bash, and Agile Development processes

__Personal Attributes__

We are looking for a strong project manager, a self-driven problem solver who is motivated to deliver kick-ass work.

__Compensation__

Salary is determined based on your qualifications and your location â we pay market rates for your area. If you are one of our ideal candidates, let's talk about how to make this the perfect job for you.

Please include your desired salary along with your cover letter when applying.

jobs.title: Linux System Administrator
jobs.content:
Engage, LLC, a full-service digital agency based in Alexandria, VA (Washington, DC metro area), is looking for a Systems Administrator with a strong Linux background. The position is part-time and available as a direct-hire or hourly/contract basis as negotiated. It may be remote or on-site. The ideal candidate will be able to manage multiple servers, provision new environments, manage U.S. House of Representatives virtual servers, and interact with additional outside clients and vendors.

__Job Requirements__

* Strong Linux background (RHEL, CentOS, and Ubuntu preferred)
* Experience with SELinux
* Experience with BASH scripting
* Strong ability to manage and configure LAMP stack, especially the Apache web server
* Experience with both Apache and NGINX web servers preferred
* Experience with MySQL, MariaDB, or PostgreSQL, including diagnosing configuration and slow query issues
* Understanding of networking, Linux routing, firewalls, protocols (NFS, DNS, etc...)
* Experience with backup and restore procedures
* Experience with monitoring services
* Experience configuring SSL certificates
* Sharp ability to diagnose problems and prevent and identify causes of outages
* Ability to quickly provision and configure new web servers
* Ability to respond quickly to outages and situations as they occur
* Strong communications skills and the ability to work with outside clients and vendors professionally
* Must pass background screening for House of Representatives

__Bonus points for:__

* Previous work with the United States House of Representatives (major plus)
* Experience with Amazon Web Services, Elastic Beanstalk, S3, and EC2
* Experience with Laravel Forge for server provisioning
* Experience with VMWare or other virtualized environments
* Experience with Vagrant and creating or provisioning Vagrant boxes
* Experience with WPEngine or similar managed hosting provider
* PHP, Python, or Perl scripting
* CHEF-based provisioning

__About Engage:__

We are a full-service digital agency that is dedicated to impacting the world around us through bold strategy and innovative technology. With clients ranging from political campaigns to top level associations and advocacy groups, we use cutting-edge technology to tell the most compelling story for every project.

__About Our Work Culture:__

We love seeing our employees engage in challenging work, gain hands-on experience, and continuously improve their skills. We take pride in producing high quality and award winning work, but we always find time for Nerf gun fights and team lunches. We love coming to work and think that you will too!

jobs.title: Principal Security Engineer
jobs.content:
__Position Overview:__

Application security assessments are part of our bread-and-butter. Most technical work you do on a regular basis will involve working on assessments that align with your interests and expertise.

* Lead application security assessment engagements
* Perform penetration tests, code reviews, and threat models
* Evaluate web, mobile, desktop, and IoT-baed products
* Enhance and improve service lines offerings 
* Assist sales team with engagement scoping

__Desired skills and expertise:__

* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Strong understanding of software and application security
* Prior software development background
* Familiarity with modern languages, frameworks, and technology stacks
* Track record in vulnerability research a plus
* Track record presenting at major security conferences a plus
* Experience leading technical teams a plus
* Prior security consulting experience a plus
* BS or MS in computer science or engineering a plus

Aside from technical work, you will be making significant, measurable, and frequent contributions to Praetorianâs growth and development. The work you do here will be fun, challenging, and impactful. We like hearing from people. We encourage you to apply if you see a fit. _We ask that you please include a few paragraphs about yourself and what you are passionate about in your application._

__In addition to everything listed thus far, Praetorian provides:__

* $125,000 - $150,000
* Incentive compensation based on utilization and OKRs
* 20% bench-time to pursue security related research and projects
* Health insurance
* No formal vacation policy
* Flexible hours and working environment
* Limited travel requirements. Near 0% for those involved in application security
* Company contributions to training and conferences
* 4% 401K matching vested immediately

_In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire._

jobs.title: Software Engineer (Python, Django, Javascript)
jobs.content:
Details:

  • Build and maintain core features for our network of websites.
  • Ship your code quickly and get it in front of tens of millions of people.
  • Contribute to all aspects of project lifecycle design development testing and deployment.

Requirements:

  • 2-5+ years web development experience.
  • Excellent Python and Javascript knowledge.
  • Exposure to Django in either a professional or personal setting.

Additional:

  • MySQL, Redis, CSS, Django REST Framework, Backbone.js, Google BigQuery experience are plusses.
  • Experience with start-ups and iterative project cycles, experience working on large-scale projects with millions of users or databases with large amounts of content.

Special Perks:

  • Profit sharing. (Yes, we are profitable!)
  • Work from home Wednesdays.
  • A highly cohesive dev team. Tenures range from 2-10 years with Livingly.

About Livingly Media

We’re a fast-moving, well-funded internet publisher that is pushing boundaries in the way content creation and technology converge. Yet our business is simple: We blend original, in-house, licensed and freelanced content with the highest quality photography on the market to deliver an overall informative and entertaining experience. And we do so on a massive scale, with four consumer sites: Livingly, our flagship lifestyle destination, Zimbio, a Top 10 Entertainment News site, Lonny, a Top 20 Home Design site, and StyleBistro, a Top 10 Fashion and Beauty site.

Our office is a casual place where good ideas and strong opinions are pretty much mandatory. We encourage everyone to brainstorm and share any and all new ideas with each other. There are no cultural walls: the engineering team collaborates with the marketing team who collaborates with the editorial team and so on. And we’re all obsessively tuned-in to pop culture, publishing, and technology. We’re located in San Carlos, CA. We offer competitive base salaries, health/dental/vision benefits, generous paid time off, and a world-class foosball league.

jobs.title: Front-end Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a developer with a pixel-perfect mindset and knack for building intuitive user interfaces with compelling visualizations. In this role, you will lead the development effort of major features all the way from concept to deployment. And, as the team grows, you will serve as a mentor for other team members.

Responsibilities

  • Design & implement product features using JavaScript, LESS, Handlebars, and third-party libraries
  • Bring data to life with insightful, actionable visualizations
  • Collaborate with the entire team and customers on feature requirements and prioritization
  • Ensure the continued stability, performance, and quality of the Hospital IQ codebase, and security of customer data
  • Vet, integrate, and enhance third-party scripting libraries such as D3, Highcharts, Bootstrap, Handlebars, and Underscore.js

Qualifications

  • Extensive experience designing and developing complex multi-tenant web-based applications using JavaScript + jQuery + CSS/LESS
  • Object-oriented JavaScript programming skills
  • RESTful API design skills
  • Interest in and exposure to server-side programming, ideally on our stack (Python + Django + MySQL)

Benefits

  • Extensive opportunities for leadership and career growth
  • Stock options in a rapidly growing startup
  • 401(k) plan and generous stipend for health insurance
  • Flexible work schedule, including 100% remote option

About Hospital IQ

Hospital IQ is a passionate, agile team of accomplished leaders with a mission: improve the quality and efficiency of healthcare for everyone. We're taking the best operations management science has to offer and codifying it in an innovative software platform hosted in the cloud.

If you enjoy pushing technology into new territory, collaborating with entrepreneurial innovators and subject domain experts, and embracing feedback from a growing group of loyal customers, you’ll be in good company with us.

We are growing rapidly, and anticipate a number of openings across a range of positions: engineering, marketing, sales, and services.

jobs.title: Frontend Javascript Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Baltimore, MD
URL: https://www.teamgantt.com/jobs/

WHY THIS IS A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY
  • Fully remote position
  • Amazing work/life balance - 40 hour work weeks. We all have families and know it's important to have time outside of work.
  • Fast growing startup with a small team (Thousands of customers in over 120 countries with just 10 employees). Super rare!
  • Profitable company since 2010 with no outside funding. This means we answer to customers, not investors :). It also means that we are financially strong and not waiting for another round of investment.
  • A chance to play a big design role in a popular product.
  • Build something that thousands of companies will use. It’s possible that some of your favorite companies are already customers.
  • More work around the world will get done in a better way because of your efforts.

OVERVIEW
TeamGantt is one of the fastest growing project management applications right now. We are taking a step back to rewrite our handwritten monolith to a web client/api architecture with react. We’re excited to restructure the foundation of our application so we can much more quickly grow the product to accommodate our growing customer base.
We are a small team doing big things. We are currently just a team of ten people, but making a big dent in the project management space. If you enjoy avoiding office politics, corporate ladders, and long meetings, then this is the place for you. TeamGantt is a place for people to focus on their craft and to enjoy their work. You can work from home or a nearby coffee shop. Any quiet work environment that allows you to focus for extended periods of time is good with us.

RESPONSIBLITIES
  • Play a large role in frontend application rewrite (Webpack, React, Redux, SCSS, Mocha)
  • Tweak and contribute to the PHP (Laravel) api
  • Regularly review others’ code
  • Adapt to new technologies and environments for other projects as occasion may require (gulp/wordpress marketing site, React Native mobile app, node slack bot, node deploy bot, Swift OS X Timer, etc.)

ABOUT YOU
  • 3-5 Years of development experience
  • Experience working with frontend applications (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
  • Experience working with MVC server-side frameworks
  • Experience working with APIs
  • Experience working with source control
  • Experience with Webpack, React, Redux, ES6, Mocha, PHP, Laravel, GIT/GitHub a plus
  • Experience working closely with teams and with collaborative learning (cowboy coders and hero programmers probably wouldn’t love it here)
  • Growth mindset and experience running experiments to improve metrics on engagement, retention, activation, and specific aspects of an application.
  • Self motivated
  • Fast learner and ready to get contributing on day one
  • You have some projects that we can check out and play with
  • You care about the details, such as transitions, subtle animations and making the app feel snappy.

BENEFITS
  • Fully Remote - Work from anywhere
  • $5,000 office setup budget for computer, proper chair, desk, etc..
  • Competitive Pay
  • 401k
  • Bonus
  • Be a part of a small team that makes some big accomplishments
  • Fun, friendly company
  • One or two company wide get togethers per year. This year included mini-golf and a fishing charter on the Chesapeake Bay. This year was a trip to the Poconos with skiing, snowboarding, snow tubing, laser tag, zip lines, and fun things for families and children that came along.

To apply: Please send an email to jobs@teamgantt.com with: - A few reasons why you think you would be a good fit - Your resume/LinkedIn Profile - Links to previous projects. This can be mobile, web, application, or any fun side projects that you have completed. Looking forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Engineer
jobs.content:
About Nexsan

NexsanÂ is a global leader in storage, back up and data management solutions that are focused on seamlessly and securely enabling a connected workforce. Its broad solution portfolio empowers enterprises to securely store, protect and manage valuable business data whilst allowing users to sync, share and access files from any device, anywhere, anytime.

Established in 1999, Nexsan has more than 11,000 customers worldwide, with over 40,000 systems deployed in over 100 countries through a comprehensive worldwide network of cloud service providers, value-added resellers and solutions integrators.

Nexsans portfolio of secure archive solutions, high-density enterprise storage arrays, and unified hybrid storage systems are ideal for mission-critical IT applications such as virtualization, cloud, databases and energy efficient, high-density storage for backup and archiving. Nexsan UNITYÂ private cloud solutions are leading the way in securely connecting the modern workforce with business data held securely in primary storage systems around the world.

The engineering team is located in Campbell,Ca,Â Montreal and in the UK. We are a global team working together as a team to implement the Nexsan vision.Â 

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, improve, and maintain scalable, maintainable, user-facing functionality.
  • Participate in ongoing design, implementation, and maintenance of systems across our cloud stack, from frontend to backend and everything in-between.
  • Research and implement modern frameworks and technologies for front-end systems.
  • Mentor and lead technical direction for the cloud development team.

Requirements

  • Demonstrated excellence in PHP, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS web development.
  • Previous experience designing, implementing, extending, and maintaining Web Service APIs.
  • NoSQL database development, including data model design and query performance tuning and indexing.
  • Experience using common modern JavaScript frameworks, such as jQuery, AngularJS, Node.JS, Backbone, Ember, Spine, or react.
  • Object Oriented design experience, including familiarity with Design Patterns.
  • Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and tools.
  • 5+ years professional Software Engineering experience.
  • Familiarity with Version Control Systems (Git, SVN, Perforce, Mercurial, etc.).
  • Ability to write clean, maintainable code.
  • Experience working with Linux on the command-line.
  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

Bonus Points

  • Previous experience with Amazon Web Services (EC2, S3, ELB, Route53, CloudWatch, Glacier, etc.).
  • User interaction design experience.
  • Previous experience using Git.
  • Experience writing and maintaining shell scripts.
  • Historical presence in the open-source community (GitHub, StackOverflow, ServerFault, mongodb-user, etc.).

jobs.title: QA - Automated Test
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Vancouver, B.C., Canada
URL: www.e-xact.com

Job Description
E-xact Transactions is searching for a smart, independent and experienced automated test engineer to join us as a remote contractor to develop automated regression tests and deployment tests. You’ll find that we offer a great working environment with all of the latest tools that make software engineering enjoyable and efficient such as Slack for communications, Bitbucket for code, Jira for ticketing, and Google Hangouts for meetings.
This position is a full-time remote-work contract.

Skills & Requirements
As a remote automated test engineer you will primarily be asked to develop test code to retire existing manual tests with new automated tests. We use a continuous integration platform to test our code branches and release candidates. 
Ideally, you will have the following set of skills and background:
  • Knowledge of test driven development and tools such as Cucumber, Ruby, Selenium and Page Objects.
  • Experience with automated tests for web applications, back end systems, and databases.
  • Experience with JIRA, Bitbucket, Ruby-on-Rails, continuous integration and automated testing frameworks.
  • Excellent communication skills, personable, and proactive. Specifically, you enjoy collaborating with others.

Remote Work
  • In order to facilitate collaboration your work day must overlap within 4hrs of 8am-6pm Monday to Friday Pacific Time. 
  • We make use of Google Hangouts and value quality communication.  You must have high speed Internet and a quality video camera (720p+) and a good microphone. 
  • You must be able to travel to Canada/United States up to twice a year for one week each visit for a team building get-together. 
  • You must be online throughout your work day, using Slack for communication with the distributed team, daily code checkins to Git and ticket reviews in Jira.
  • This is a contract position, paid monthly.  You will be responsible for your own income taxes in your country as a self employed position.  

About E-xact Transactions 
E-xact Transactions is a payment gateway offering e-commerce solutions to merchants and retailers throughout the US and Canada.
  • Established in 1998, E-xact is a financial technology company based in Vancouver, Canada.
  • We process billions of dollars of payments each year.
  • Our system works with the world's largest payment brands.

To apply: All interested applicants, please go to https://exact.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=11

jobs.title: Customer Success
jobs.content:
PersistIQ is a sales technology company that blends the core human element of sales with automation where it counts. Our software empowers salespeople to do more and spend time on what matters.

Backed by Y Combinator, Salesforce, Point Nine and some of the best angel investors in SaaS, we are a team of highly driven individuals who hunger to make big things happen.

We love building amazing software and tackling tough problems. We view every day as an opportunity to do our best work ever, individually and as a team.

We view every customer interaction as a precious opportunity to wow our users and show how much we genuinely care about their success. Weâre looking for someone who is technical enough to understand and address product issues, and also a strong communicator who genuinely cares about working with customers.

This is an opportunity to have a huge impact on the trajectory of the company.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
  • Help new users and companies set up and get started with PersistIQ
  • Respond to customer questions over email, chat, phone, and sometimes in-person
  • Deliver product webinars and demos
  • Write clear and simple documentation and support content
  • Proactively identify and resolve customer issues
  • Work closely with our Product, Sales, and Marketing teams to provide customer feedback

ABOUT YOU
  • Genuinely love helping people and providing a great experience
  • Highly organized and prefer working in fast paced environment
  • Technically proficient and enjoy working with new technologies (weâre building it and our customers are using it!)
  • A team player who enjoys wearing multiple hats
  • Pay attention to the smallest details, because they matter.
  • Great communicator across all channels (clear/concise writer, comfortable on the phone)

REQUIREMENTS

  • Degree from accredited 4-year university
  • 2-3 years experience in client facing sales or customer support role

BONUS

  • Experience using Salesforce.com or other CRMs
  • Prior sales experience
  • HTML and Video Editing software experience

To apply: https://jobs.lever.co/persistiq/dbbbdec2-a967-4dbe-b030-3b7ff8b92a05

jobs.content:

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Principal Software Engineer

About Us

mscripts™ is a fast growing mobile health start-up with headquarters in San Francisco, CA. We provide pharmacies and other health and wellness organizations with mobile solutions delivered in a Software as a Service (“SaaS”) model.   We’re growing rapidly and have over 1,000,000 active users of our service across 20 pharmacy chains.  In addition, we work with pharmacies, pharmaceuticals and other stakeholders to address the problem of medication non-adherence.  Our products consist of a mixture of large enterprise and transactional systems, data management systems, and mobile technology.

Role and Responsibilities

mscripts, LLC is seeking a Principal Software Engineer to develop a highly scalable Spring Java based web services and web applications. This position is specifically for a server-side engineer that can assist with architecture and development for a medical adherence and pharmaceutical application. The ideal candidate should 8 or more years of a technology experience, and a strong expertise in building SaaS applications, web services etc. This position reports directly to the Vice President of Engineering.

Job Requirements

  • Self-driven, self-starter, motivated, and ability to be self-directive
  • Strong attention to detail is an absolute must
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

Technical Requirements

  • 8+ years of experience in designing Java based server side applications (database, job processing, batch processing)
  • Expertise in of Core Java and Quartz Scheduler
  • Expertise in Spring Java and hibernate; J2EE frameworks and design patterns
  • Creation of detailed technical design documents
  • Strong experience in product development and agile development processes - coding modules as needed
  • Design and development skills with SQL and MySQL in particular (or similar database)

Not necessary but a plus to have

  • Experience working with multi-tenant solutions
  • Knowledge of white label solutions
  • Experience with data warehousing
  • Knowledge of security
  • Knowledge of HIPAA
  • Familiarity with Linux systems
  • Experience with AWS
  • Experience working with global teams (India & the US in particular)

jobs.content:
