URL: https://hubstaff.com

Description
Hubstaff is quickly becoming one of the leading solutions in the evolving time tracking space. You'll also assist in the creation of our new project management SaaS product.

We are looking for a talented Ruby on Rails engineer to join our passionate development team. You will help tackle challenging problems and assist with scaling the service to keep up with our fast growth.

The position will report directly to our CTO and work closely with our other engineers. We have projects that require a full-stack skillset but that go deep on back-end architecture and implementation.

The Stack and Requirements
The ideal candidate will have plenty of experience with:
  • Ruby on Rails

If so, please include their email addresses - Do you have any salary requirements? If so, please let me know what they are.

The position will require the candidate to be a member of a small agile development team where he or she will design, develop and test new software applications.

  • Monitoring project status progress and measuring system performance

  • Ensuring compliance with contractual requirements for all engineering tasks

jobs.title: Ruby On Rails Developer
jobs.content:
SweetRush is looking for a RoR Developer rock star to play an important role in building, maintaining, and evolving the software, infrastructure, and technologies that drive our products and services.


(NOTE: Expertise in Ruby on Rails is required and Linux Server IT is desired.)
 
SweetRush has been operating for 14 years and continues to grow. Our IT has been handled by our amazing IT director, and now we need a second, motivated engineer to join this small but critically important team. Our IT team ensures the stability, integrity, and efficiency of our operations and our IT infrastructure.
 
But wait! There’s more! Not only will you be working on IT, but you’ll also be creating innovative software to support and optimize our development and production environments.
 
If you’re passionate about performance and reliability, we'd love to chat!

jobs.title: Opportunity For Product Manager Join A Solutions Focused Team
jobs.content:
This is a remote work position, you may be located anywhere within the Unites States


At InventoryLab we are redefining the workflow of thousands of Amazon sellers. Our product allows third party Amazon sellers to source new inventory, list on Amazon, manage inventory, and analyze their business metrics. We are currently focused on growing our customer-driven team to meet increased demand; adding development, consulting and support staff.


We’re currently wrapping up an iteration (dubbed Bumblebee as a naming convention), finalizing product and technical documentation, as well as refactoring code in order to better our core architecture. We are searching for a Product Manager that can help grow our SaaS business by delivering a consistent experience with our core product while driving the adoption of new features and design.


At InventoryLab we work in small multidisciplinary teams to plan next steps and give advice but we all are responsible for making it happen. You will have the freedom, and responsibility, to chart your own course. Working at InventoryLab means choosing your own work location every day, responsible time off, and a full benefits package.


How we get it done:



  • Our focus is on how we can continue to provide an optimal user experience

  • We use Jira for product management, issue reporting, ideology, and documentation

  • We rely heavily on web APIs and love them like they are our own

  • As our first Product Manager (until now it has been the CEO), you will help determine where we could improve our processes to deliver the best solution


What you will be responsible for:



  • Developing systems and processes to gain insight from the customer

  • Taking customer and internal ideas and wrangling them into a product roadmap

  • Executing the product roadmap by managing the Scrum process

  • Employing project management skills to keep the solution delivery on time and within budget

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager (Part-time)
jobs.content:
About Spidergap

At Spidergap, weâve grown an online start-up into a profitable business used by 100s of businesses around the world. Our 360 Feedback tool is rated by customers as the best available: www.capterra.com/360-degree-feedback-software/spotlight/131885/Spidergap/Spidergap

To quote Jerie Shaw from Shopify, "I was looking for a 360 feedback solution. I tried 10 tools, and all of them sucked except Spidergap, which was amazing"

Our passion is helping organizations to achieve more through employee development. Weâre fueled with the exceptional talent of a successful start-up, and focused on the happiness and quality-of-life of our small team.
 

Weâre looking for a motivated and friendly Customer Success Manager to join the team

Someone whoâs passionate about what they do. Someone we can trust to deliver outstanding service to others, and to do so with a keen understanding of customer need and business impact. Someone who believes in more than work, and is excited by the opportunity to balance work with their families and/or other hobbies. 

As one of first Customer Success Managers, you'll work closely with the co-founders to understand how everything works, how we currently amaze our customers and partners, and where we see opportunities to improve. 

Over time you'll take ownership of all customer support, and be responsible for proactively reaching out to our existing customers (e.g. New Look, Shopify, Fitness First, European Commission, Canva, Sony, and many more) to ensure their projects are a success. 

Youâll also help to optimize our processes, develop training content, and work with our strategic partners from around the world to help them better serve their clients and grow profitable businesses. 

Your passion for helping others and attention to detail will help us to amaze our customers, and to grow our business in a robust and sustainable way. 

Your responsibilities

  • Help us to deliver outstanding customer support via email & chat
  • Follow-up with existing customers to ensure their 360 Feedback projects are successful and help them (and people they know) to get more value from Spidergap
  • Use phone-calls to build trust and help to overcome challenges 
  • Ensure customer problems, feedback and ideas are communicated clearly to the right people
  • Identify ways to better support our customers and increase sales by improving our tool, support and marketing resources
  • Help to develop and optimize our customer support processes and training materials
  • Work with Spidergap Partners from around the world to help them deliver more value to their clients (and our customers!) and make their businesses more successful.

Is this role right for you?

  • Are you keen to work remotely and part-time, perhaps so you can be with your family more often?
  • Do you believe attention to detail and follow-up are important?
  • Do you consider yourself passionate and driven, both about the work, and about life outside work?
  • Do you love 'going the extra mile' to deliver outstanding customer service?
  • Do you have experience helping customers reach their desired outcome?
  • Do you practice regular self-improvement / personal development?
  • Do you find it easy to communicate clearly, in a friendly way?
  • Do you love technology and figuring out how things work (and helping others to do the same)?

If the answer to all of these questions is âyesâ, youâre a great fit to be our new Customer Success Manager!

Note: Any experience with working with people in HR / L&D / Talent development is a bonus but not essential.


Why join us?

An amazing role:

  • Work directly with amazing businesses from all over the world
  • Opportunity to join a tiny but profitable company
  • The job security and salary of a larger company
  • Yet still with the opportunity to help learn from (and shape) a start-up company

And some excellent quality-of-life benefits:

  • 15-20 hour work week, flexible hours
  • Remote working (location not an issue as long as you have a good internet connection)
  • 40 days vacation (inclusive of public holidays, pro-rata)
  • Competitive salary
  • Profit-share bonus
  • 4 months fully paid paternity/maternity leave
  • Co-working space fees
  • Gym membership contribution
  • Ergonomic home office equipment as required
  • Annual meet-up with the team somewhere fun (e.g. Sweden / Spain / Switzerland)

To apply: Keen to take on this challenge? Just fill in this short-form (and remember to attach your CV at the bottom!): https://podio.com/webforms/16423007/1103445

jobs.title: Software Engineer Network
jobs.content:
DigitalOcean’s software engineers develop next-generation cloud infrastructure technology that will change how millions of developers build, deploy, and scale web applications. Our mission is to simplify cloud infrastructure; this requires knowledge in many different fields including distributed systems, virtualization, software defined networking, scale-out storage, real-time data processing, and user interface design.


As a software engineer on the Network team, the software you write will run on tens of thousands of hypervisors across our global infrastructure network.  You will be responsible for building the next generation of networking on our platform: providing flexible, yet simple, primitives that our customers have come to love.


What You'll Be Doing:



  • Driving the design and implementation of the overlay network that supports how droplets interact with each other and the outside world

  • Building exciting new features that will enable developers to build highly available, robust, and secure services

  • Working closely with the network engineering team to build and support a performant and flexible software network architecture

  • Maintaining and ensuring a high standard for reliability and availability across multiple datacenters

  • Evolving our existing architecture and codebases to support building flexible networking capabilities both internally and for the product


Technologies we use:



  • Open vSwitch, Go, Perl, C/C++, MySQL, Libvirt, KVM, chef, git

jobs.title: Software Engineer Compute
jobs.content:
DigitalOcean’s software engineers develop next-generation cloud infrastructure technology that will change how millions of developers build, deploy, and scale web applications. Our mission is to simplify cloud infrastructure; this requires knowledge in many different fields including distributed systems, virtualization, software defined networking, scale-out storage, real-time data processing, and user interface design.


As a software engineer on the Compute team, the software you write will run on tens of thousands of hypervisors across our global infrastructure network. You will define the next generation of cloud services, making developers' lives (both inside DO and in the 'wild') easier by building new services to power the hypervisor, placement, database and event systems. This is a unique opportunity to deliver the best user-experience in the industry to millions of developers around the world.

jobs.title: Software Engineer Storage
jobs.content:
DigitalOcean’s Storage Team builds and runs cloud-scale distributed storage services powering internal and customer-facing services and products. We’re creating flexible and powerful storage solutions that our customers will leverage to ship their software as quickly and easily as possible. We’re looking for engineers throughout the backend, from the filesystem and networking layers to end-user API design and implementation.


What You'll Be Doing:



  • First and foremost, working as part of a team shipping powerful storage solutions

  • Evaluating and deploying distributed block and object stores

  • Building orchestration and APIs in front of petabyte-scale storage clusters

jobs.title: PHP Web Developer
jobs.content:
Summary


Vector Media Group is looking for a full-time PHP web developer to join our team immediately. We’re a growing interactive agency of 35 people in Manhattan's Flatiron District with great clients (like Google, The Associated Press, Nielsen, New York City, St. Regis, Columbia University, and WPP) and an incredible roadmap.


Our development projects are typically built on PHP and are often Laravel, Craft, or ExpressionEngine-based. You don’t need to know those to join our team, as long as you’re experienced with another modern framework (such as CakePHP, Zend, or another MVC- or SOA-oriented system). Given the range of work you’ll be doing you’ll never get bored. We need someone who loves keeping up-to-date on the newest advancements in the field and can figure out when to start applying those advancements to client work.


You’ll be a member of our development team, working closely with our other fantastic front-end and backend developers during every phase of your projects. You’ll also be communicating directly with clients and with our project managers to understand their requirements and present your work. Your job will be fun, challenging, and interesting.


You’ll be working on 2-3 projects at any time; typically one large application and a few smaller projects to keep things fresh. And you’ll work on the perfect development system: a huge monitor and a new computer of your choice.


Responsibilities Will Include:



  • Implementing and improving websites built on PHP/MySQL-based CMSes and frameworks.

  • Working with CSS/HTML layouts and templates. You don’t need to be a designer.

  • Working closely with our front-end development team on site projects. We’ll want and expect your input on the best ways to structure the build — from start to finish.

  • Building internal products and tools

  • Staying up-to-date on the latest development technologies and methodologies.


Requirements



  • Previous CMS and framework experience is highly preferred.

  • Ability to understand user behavior and intent, and use this information to build intuitive apps and websites for our clients.

  • Knowledge of version control systems is a plus but not a requirement; we use git on all projects. 


Benefits



  • Flexible hours and paid vacation policy

  • Lunch paid for by the company, every day, via your own Seamless account

  • Health, Dental, and Vision insurance

  • Retirement plan with company matching

  • Perks and discounts from many stores and services-- cell phone bills, hotels, rental cars, gyms, etc...


Join Us!


If you’re interested please apply as soon as possible, attention Ben Smith. Examples of your real-world work are more important than a perfect resume. If you worked on a project with a team, please tell us which parts you were responsible for.

jobs.title: IOS Mobile Application Developer
jobs.content:
We believe in questioning paradigms and are developing an app that challenges widely held beliefs about social media. By daring to do 'social' differently, we solve many of the problems that are hindering social media's evolution. You will be joining a sophisticated team of developers, data scientists and entrepreneurs for the final stage of the app's development.   We are located in Los Angeles and prefer candidates from the area.


We prefer candidates with high-impact experience developing mobile applications for social media or gaming platforms.


This position requires a close interactive relation to the app's server developer group. This position requires an aggressive and assertive well organized developer who asks questions and thinks designs through.

jobs.title: User Experience Designer
DELIVERY ENGINEER
jobs.content:
DELIVERY ENGINEER

JOB DESCRIPTION:

WHO YOU ARE

Is your background robust with designing, developing infrastructure, and configuration and deployment automations at a large scale?

Do you possess a skill to effectively educate key decision makers and resources of the technical and non-technical benefits that drive next-generation infrastructure?

Do you consider performance, scalability, and reliability in all decision-making?

WHAT YOU WILL DO

At Datapipe, our DevOps Engineers:

  • Leverage DevOps-type techniques to delivery quality, speed and experience for the company and our clients
  • Must be able to identify problems before they happen, dig deep for root causes, and implement solutions that prevent future occurrences
  • Relish the challenge of effectively juggling competing client priorities while learning new technologies and applying them adeptly
  • Hit the ground running to coordinate between multiple delivery teams and IT support
  • Travel up to 50% to meet with clients to drive client technology initiatives and identify opportunities for improvement

Skills & Requirements

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR IN YOU:

  • Three or more years’ developing systems / application deployment / configuration processes emphasis

  • Three or more years managing, diagnosing and debugging matrixed problems across multiple disciplines: 

          o Applications
      o Infrastructure
      o Databases

  • Expertise in leveraging in Automation / DevOps principles, experience with operational tools, and able to apply best practices for infrastructure and software deployment: 

          o Ansible
      o Puppet
      o Chef
      o Saltstack

  • Proficiency in IaaS platforms, AWS preferred. Azure, Google, and VMWare a plus

  • Expertise with one or more configuration management tools

  • Able to investigate, test, and deploy new technologies where little documentation exists

WHAT WE DO:

Datapipe is a global provider of Managed Services and data center infrastructure for IT and Cloud Computing, with data centers throughout the U.S., London, Hong Kong and Shanghai. For more information about Datapipe visit www.datapipe.com

Offer packages

  • Competitive salaries
  • Personal time off
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • 401k, life insurance, and disability benefits
  • Annual training and career development
  • Company-provided equipment, including cell phones
  • Weekly catered lunch in the office

HOW WE DO IT: A next generation MSP, Datapipe is recognized as the pioneer of managed services for public cloud platforms. Datapipe has unique expertise in architecting, migrating, managing and securing public cloud, private cloud, hybrid IT and traditional IT around the globe.

Backed by a global team of experienced professionals and world-class interconnected data centers, Datapipe provides comprehensive cloud, compliance, security, governance, automation and DevOps solutions. Gartner named Datapipe a leader in the Magic Quadrant for Cloud-Enabled Managed Hosting.

What we do and how we do it matters. Datapipe’s culture reflects who are and what we stand for as a company. We measure our success by the success of our clients.

Innovative and Collaborative

Technology equals change. We embrace the challenge of continual improvement and work together, across teams and around the world. Our teams are always seeking to learn, test, prove, and adopt best of breed technologies, processes and services to enable the success of our clients.

Confident and Empathetic

Datapipe is recognized as an industry leader. We are trusted with solving complex, mission critical problems for the world’s most recognized brands. We develop a deep understanding of our clients' business challenges and objectives, taking a personal interest in helping them achieve their goals.

We are committed to a policy of Equal Employment opportunity and will not discriminate on any legally recognized basis, including, but not limited to, race, age, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, citizen, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status or any other basis recognized by federal, state or local law.

jobs.title: Meteor / React Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Seattle, WA
URL: https://pathable.com/careers/

We are seeking an expert Meteor / React developer interested in working from anywhere.

Do you love working with JavaScript, Meteor and React? Are you tired of working for short-lived  start-ups that think "angel funding" is a business model and "VC Funding" is an exit? Do you want the freedom to work from anywhere in the world with a team of passionate developers who love what they do? Then, my friend, we've got the job for you. Our growing, profitable, bootstrapped company is seeking to add a talented, motivated expert Meteor and React developer who is excited about building the next version of our industry-leading product with us (seriously, it is industry leading).

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Work directly with the CTO to help guide application design, architecture and standards of practice
  • Help improve the quality of our architecture and code by teaching the team best practices for both Meteor and React
  • Contribute to open source projects in the Meteor and React ecosystems 
  • Ensure excellent functionality and performance across a wide variety of mobile devices and 1st tier browsers
  • Be creative and proactive about feature and architecture decisions

Skills and Experience:

  • Expert experience developer Meteor and React applications
  • Expert experience using ES6 
  • Excellent communications skills
  • Comfort working in an agile startup environment. Our cycles are extremely fast and your code will be up and running on our production site the first week you start
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-energy, best-idea-wins environment
  • Experience with Redux a huge plus
  • Experience with Ruby a plus

Benefits:

  • Significant equity
  • Competitive salary
  • Health insurance
  • Offices in Seattle, remote working encouraged

Note: We are open to filling this either as a full-time, salaried position or a mid-term (e.g., three month) contract position. 

To apply: Please visit https://www.jsco.re/bkph to apply

jobs.title: Customer Support Specialist
jobs.content:
Order Desk provides custom order management services to our ecommerce customers. Our service allows customers to download their orders from dozens of carts and run the orders through various business rules to automate their fulfillment workflow. As the founder of the company, I am searching for our first hire: a motivated individual to join Order Desk and help support our customers.

The Kind of Person We Are Looking For
You enjoy figuring out complicated puzzles and helping customers. You excel at written communication and can explain complicated concepts clearly. You have empathy for the customerâs situation.

You donât have to be an experienced programmer but you should have an analytical mind and have some experience with HTML/CSS.

Order Desk has a reputation for providing amazing support. We are looking for someone who truly loves helping people.

What Youâll Be Doing
Youâll be answering customerâs questions, troubleshooting their problems, and helping them correctly configure their accounts. When you arenât directly helping customers, youâll be working on writing and improving existing documentation and perhaps even recording video walkthroughs. Youâll also work on building customized sales landing pages.

Requirements
  • Experience with HTML/CSS/JavaScript, familiarity with PHP is a plus
  • Availability during US daytime hours
  • Patient, calm, empathetic, and an amazing communicator
  • Cares about details: proofreads everything
  • Fluent English language skills

To apply: Please apply at https://orderdesk.workable.com/jobs/309305

jobs.title: Front end mobile web developer
jobs.content:
For the past 5 years, MosaLingua has been making extremely efficient language-learning mobile apps. We are a small, international team, made up of travel and language enthusiasts. 
The team also includes 3 other developers and your manager is a developer.
As a software engineer at MosaLingua, you'll help architect and build high-quality web applications that will impact the way millions of people learn online. Join our team of seasoned pros to enjoy autonomy, ownership over projects, and plenty of challenges to keep you engaged and growing.
 
__What we need__

_We're looking for an experienced Front End JavaScript Developer to join our team._

* You must be very good with CSS and Javascript. 
* We need a self-starter who loves to solve problems. 
* If you also speak French, Italian or Spanish, or you are learning a language, itâs a plus, but not required.
* We prefer someone available full time (but it can start part time at the beginning)
* We want a long-term collaboration (with strong opportunities for advancement)
 
__Technology__

Our iPhone/Android apps are made using web technologies (HTML5/JavaScript with Cordova/Phonegap, Backbone.js, RequireJS, Grunt, Sass/CSS, etc.), and the server side consists of several Java apps hosted on Heroku.

__Your responsibilities__

Improve the existing, add new features of the existing app and create new apps (web & mobile). For instance:

 * improve the UX/UI (working with a designer)
 * keep improving the code architecture (this is a long term project)
 * add new features (new exercises to learn languages, gamification and social feature to improve engagement)
 * And lots of other future projects depending on your preferences (we have so many projects, and we are flexible) 

 
__Added perks__

 * 100% telecommute. No more commuting or cube-farmsâwork anywhere you want! Digital nomad friendly ;-)
 * Super flexible time-off policy.
 * Annual company retreat in some really cool places.

__Important__

* No agencies, only individuals
* DO NOT ANSWER IF you are not an experienced Javascript developer and very good with CSS.
* in your answer, please mention the phrase âI have read the whole job postâ
* NO generic application/message

jobs.title: Solutions Architect, South Region
jobs.content:
About The Team:

The charter of MuleSoft Professional Services is to enable our customers to transform their business by accelerating the adoption of the MuleSoft platform with minimal risk, using our world-class expertise, standard methodology and enterprise best practices.

In order to support our rapid growth and reach the next level of scale, we are currently seeking exceptionally talented consulting professionals who can drive successful customer deployments and continuously enhance our services portfolio and engagement best practices.

MuleSoft maintains an extremely high level of satisfaction across our customer base. We also take great pride in our operational efficiency, and the strength of the solutions we provide to our customers.

About The Position:

The Solution Architect provides technical leadership on MuleSoft implementation projects. This person is primarily responsible for evaluating the customer’s technical and functional requirements and for developing a sound architectural blueprint in line with their business goals. As an experienced practitioner, the Solution Architect will advise customers on best practices for on-premise/cloud/hybrid integration and API management.

This person will be an influencer and thought leader and will also possess the in-depth technical expertise and credibility to provide detailed guidance to the implementation team. The Solution Architect will perform hands-on activities as required to ensure project success.

Being in Atlanta is preferred but remote work is fine as long as you have access to a major airport.


Position Deliverables:

  • Conduct requirements gathering workshops and lead the solution design process jointly with customers, partners and MuleSoft experts
  • Contribute subject matter expertise to effort estimation and SOW development
  • Articulate recommendations through compelling presentations and architectural blueprint documents to a variety of audiences, including client Business management and experienced IT architects. Lead technical teams through complex, multi-phased delivery projects and provide hands-on delivery guidance
  • Work with customers to create and influence proper standards for development, governance and operational lifecycle.
  • Identify ongoing risks and pain points throughout the project, develop and implement mitigation measures
  • Identify opportunities for expansion of the MuleSoft footprint as appropriate to meet customer needs
  • Capture project lessons and convert them into architectural best practices applicable to the broader install base; mentor and coach the internal team through internal training sessions. Provide constructive feedback and requirements towards the product team
  • Mentor and train the internal team on design and architecture best practices
  • Improve internal processes, and promote knowledge sharing in the team, by contributing to the knowledge base, blogs, and brown bag lunches
  • Participate in the continuous improvement of MuleSoft products by leading internal work groups and design sessions within Professional Services and across the company

About You:

  • 5+ years demonstrated expertise designing, implementing, and supporting Enterprise-grade technical solutions meeting complex business requirements
  • 3+ years experience providing technical solutions development for on-premise and SaaS applications using JEE and/or JSE frameworks
  • Integration architecture experience with MuleSoft or other solutions including, IBM, BEA, Oracle, Tibco, Progress Sonic, etc.
  • Experience with Tomcat, XML, JMS, WS-*, SOA integration, API Management technologies and standards
  • Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture frameworks such as TOGAF
  • Knowledge of Open Source architectures and/or past contributions to open source projects
  • Design, development and operations experience with highly-available, scalable, and fault tolerant systems
  • Experience designing public and private enterprise secure services using RAML and REST-based APIs
  • Experience profiling and troubleshooting Java application code
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong cognitive ability especially with respect to understanding, documenting, and describing complex technical subjects
  • Interface architecture knowledge with one or more on-premise / SaaS packaged solutions for ERP, CRM, e-commerce, or mobile (e.g. Salesforce.com, NetSuite, Oracle, SAP, WorkDay, etc.)
  • Travel up to 75% of the time (can be higher or lower depending upon customer requirements)
  • Bachelor’s degree in CS or equivalent industry experience
  • Experience delivering in waterfall, scrum, agile, and other methodologies

About Our Benefits:

  • Pre-IPO equity
  • Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family
  • 401(k) and pre-tax health care, dependent care and commuter benefits (FSA)
  • “No policy” vacation policy
  • Mac or PC
  • Annual, all-company weeklong MeetUp trip for collaboration, learning and inspiration

 

 

 

#LI-POST

jobs.title: Full-stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Mavenlink is looking for talented software developers to join our Salt Lake office. We have a great team in Salt Lake, and you'll be joining in the early days, with a chance to influence the culture. You'll step into a supportive environment praised by our engineers for its focus on continuous learning.

Our development culture focuses on strong communication, tight feedback loops, and continuous processes. A productive relationship between business, product, and development teams helps us deliver great software. Our dedication to test-driven development keeps our codebase in great shape.

We write code using pair programming, rotating pairs every day or two so that everyone gains working knowledge across the codebase. Pairing makes things social, speeds development, and makes learning from your peers a minute-by-minute activity. Our team works 8-hour days then goes home to enjoy their evenings.

We have a Ruby / Rails API / JS stack, and we've just started a migration to React, which you'll have a chance to contribute to. Working with us, you can expect to change projects a few times a year, moving toward challenges that interest you. Though we're looking for experienced developers familiar with our stack, we also welcome great engineers from diverse backgrounds.

If you'd like to join a growing, well-run team working on interesting challenges, we'd love to hear from you!

Local candidates only.

jobs.title: Software Engineering Mentor
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Remote
URL: https://www.bloc.io

Bloc offers a flexible, rigorous and unforgettable learning experience to students. Instead of in-browser exercises and lofty promises, Bloc guarantees real growth. Bloc combines demanding course material with weekly tutelage from industry professionals like yourself to create a powerful learning environment.

Bloc’s mentors are experienced developers and designers with a passion for sharing their craft. They believe in the apprenticeship model of education: learning by building under the guidance of an experienced professional.

As a Software Engineering Track Mentor, you will guide students through Bloc’s curriculum covering:

* Rails Web Development
* JavaScript Frontend Web Development
* Software Engineering Principles (algorithms, data structures, design patterns, architecture)
* Open Source Apprenticeship (contributing to and building open source projects)

Bloc mentors meet with students 1-3 times per week, using technologies like Google Hangouts or Skype. During these sessions, mentors answer questions, pair program with their students, and discuss outcome goals. Outside of sessions, mentors use Bloc’s messaging system to answer questions, review code, help students stay motivated, and participate in the Bloc community.

This is a part-time remote employed position with scheduling flexibility and competitive salary. The majority of our mentors have day jobs as software engineers for technology companies or consulting firms while they work with 2-8 students on Bloc.

To apply: Apply at: https://jobs.lever.co/bloc/94dc0b93-6c9a-44d4-b013-39b584d38f2d

jobs.title: Angular JS Developer
jobs.content:
Angular JS Developer

Intuvo is looking for a lead AngularJS coder.  An engineer.  A software developer.  A code monkey.  A web slinger.  A code guru.  Call it what you want, you've been around the front-end block a few times.  We're not going to sit here and spit out a list of 15 different technologies expecting you to be well-versed in them all (SQL DBA with an extensive Java||C++ background, Visual Basic wizard, and an eye for great CSS?!), but we are going to expect you to know Javascript, AngularJS and how to unit-test the $h!7 out of your code.  And speaking of your code, it's more than just code.  It's really more like art, wouldn't you agree?

We're looking for someone who doesn't need a fully detailed spec and five different meetings under their belt before they start writing their first line of code.  The last sentence should excite you, or at the very least make you nervous, in a good way.  We're not going to mention synergies, agile development methodologies and scrum, because they don't taste very good and we're too small of a company for all that big-company jargon.  But we are going to get your head size and send a few hats your way.  We all wear lots of hats here.  We all picked the red pill, not the blue pill.  We're all (a little) mad here.

We're growing fast.  Want to come along for the ride?  If you're still reading, I suspect you do.

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead front end AngularJS, HTML, CSS developer
  • Architect scalable and secure SPA
  • UI/UX working with a seasoned designer

Skills & Experience Needed

  • 1-2 years AngularJS experience
  • 3+ years front end web coding
  • SPA architecture
  • Javascript/jQuery
  • HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap
  • Karma, Jasmine
  • Grunt, VCS

Bonus points for

  • Jenkins/CI
  • Experience developing CRM Platforms
  • Photoshop or graphic slicing experience
  • Coldfusion or Railo experience

 

  •  

- Full time position with health benefits, catered lunches and a membership to the one of the best gyms in the Bay Area (with a pool, tennis courts, indoor basketball, racquetball, weights, group fitness classes, etc.).

- Our environment is set up around developer productivity including the ability to create a flexible schedule around your most productive hours, a sweet developer rig, and all the monitors you can fit on your desk.

- Silicon Valley commuters experience an excellent reverse commute.

- Employees with longer commutes have the option to work remotely 1-2 days a week once fully acclimated to our environments.

- Relocation assistance is possible for the right candidate.

 

About Us

Intuvo is a funded, rapidly growing start-up making Marketing Automation & CRM accessible to medium size companies. We're doing awesome things with ColdFusion, Railo and Angular JS, automating thousands of print & email marketing pieces daily, syncing millions of customer records, and building deep web services.

Based at 100 Enterprise Way in Scotts Valley CA, the former Borland Campus with a three-story gym, amazing grounds and epic offices, we're looking for people who are ready to work hard, play hard, and grow beyond anything they thought possible.

 

To Apply
Submit links to any published code and projects along with a resume in PDF format.  Preference given to candidates providing a personalized cover letter highlighting why they're more than just another applicant.

jobs.title: Cloud Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Cloud Reliability EngineerHome Based - Worldwide
DESCRIPTION
 

Canonical is looking for talented engineers who are excited about open source cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers. Our Cloud Reliability Engineers (CREs) are responsible for designing, building, and operating OpenStack deployments for internal and external customers. CREs also act as the escalation point for our support and operations teams and provide assistance in the form of operational expertise, engineering support, training, and mentoring.

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

 

  • Help define, build, and automate the process for deploying and operating  custom OpenStack deployments
  • Quickly deploy OpenStack onto customer managed hardware
  • Automate processes and implement tooling to make delivery quicker, the service more stable, and the Operations teams more capable of undertaking complex tasks
  • Participate in troubleshooting, capacity planning, and performance analysis activities
  • Provide input to documentation, troubleshooting playbooks, policies and procedures
  • Provide assistance and guidance as the escalation point for the Support and Operations teams
  • Work collaboratively with peers on engineering, operations, and support tasks.
  • Ensuring all service level agreements are met
  • Prioritize work appropriately to consistently achieve departmental and company goals
  • Participate in an on call rotation
 

REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

 

  • Systems administration experience in a high availability environment managing large deployments
  • Knowledge of cloud computing concepts and technologies
  • Practical knowledge of IP networking, routing and firewalls
  • Experience administering infrastructure services such as DNS, DHCP, TFTP, HTTP, etc.
  • Able to take ownership of unfamiliar tasks and problems and see them through to completion
  • Able to communicate clearly and effectively in English, especially using email and IRC
  • Must be self-driven, able to troubleshoot and willing ask others when appropriate to find answers
  • Must be motivated and organised; capable of working from home full time and being highly productive
  • Familiarity with Ubuntu or Debian
 

DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

 

  • Experience  with Openstack, Juju and MAAS
  • Experience with LXC, KVM
  • Experience in a service provider environment
  • Prior experience working from home full time and/or working with a distributed team
  • Scripting skills with Bash, Python and Go
  • Familiarity with Software Defined Networks
  • Experience in a customer facing role
 

 

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer.

To apply: https://ldd.tbe.taleo.net/ldd03/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=CANONICAL&cws=1&rid=1166

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
Data analysis is plagued by a fundamentally flawed workflow that leads to slow turnaround times, high error rates, and fewer insights. By combining analytics tools with a collaborative user experience Mode is alleviating the most pressing bottleneck for analytical organizations. We are looking for a Ruby on Rails engineer to join us in revolutionizing the way the world analyzes data.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

-Develop our core web applications for data analysts and business users

-Define and maintain development practices that let us move fast with quality

-Work with a wide range of tools and technologies (from SQL to Javascript) and be able to evaluate technologies for what we are building

-Determine priorities by estimating the potential impact of projects

-Learn from others and teach those around you

WHAT WE LOOK FOR

-You have built and shipped web applications

-Expert level aptitude with several programming languages (we hire people with backgrounds in any languages, but right now we are primarily using Ruby, Go, Java and Javascript)

-Experience with testing, continuous integration, and continuous deployment

ABOUT MODE

Mode is building the most advanced cloud analytics platform to make businesses and communities more data driven. Analysts and Data Scientists use Mode to analyze data, build visualizations, and share work with colleagues. Companies love the product because their analysts are able to quickly make data more useful to more people.

Our team believes in building software that's meant to be used. In everything we do, we strive to put the people we do it for first. We work hard for our coworkers sitting next to us and for our customers around the world. This starts internally: together we're creating a culture that embraces diversity and learning, humility and gratitude. At the same time, we try not to take ourselves too seriously and strive for a healthy balance between work and personal pursuits.

We do our best to take care of ourselves and each other. As a Mode employee, you can expect flexible PTO, excellent health benefits, a relaxed work environment, top-notch equipment and tools, AnyPerk accounts, unlimited meetings with our Chief Puppy Officer, company events that highlight our team's passions and hobbies, and free in-office meals shared together at our ever-growing lunch table.

Mode is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Mode considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
ZestFinance is excited to be looking for a full stack Sr. Software Engineer! (Los Angeles or San Francisco)

If you’re excited to learn Ruby on Rails, then this is the startup for you! You will be joining a highly-skilled full stack Ruby on Rails (RoR) software engineering team where you will be able to contribute your expertise ranging from API design and development to UI / UX implementation.

At ZestFinance, we work with a great deal of enthusiasm and energy along with a social conscience and passion for leveraging data and technology to transform financial services as we know it.

Responsibilities

Work with Product, Marketing, and Business to design and build the next generation of ZestFinance product roadmap features.

Pair with full stack and front-end engineers to build and integrate APIs with rich, desktop and mobile-friendly front-end interfaces.

Identify and evangelize programming best practices with the full stack software engineering and product teams.

Work closely with DevOps to ensure operational stability and performance while driving a culture of test driven development (TDD) and behavior driven development (BDD).

Lead and participate in design / architecture reviews, as well as code reviews and walkthroughs.

Desired Skills

6+ years of experience designing and developing web applications

Experience with TDD/BDD methodologies

Experience with common internet technologies (e.g. CSS, HTML, JavaScript) with an emphasis on frameworks like backbone.js or AngularJS

Experience designing APIs adhering to the REST architecture style

Experience with analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems (network analysis, performance and application issues)

Experience with continuous integration tools (e.g. Github, Travis CI, Jenkins)

Experience with Amazon Web Services, e.g. EC2, RDS, S3, and Route53

Experience with monitoring/alerting tools (e.g. New Relic, Airbrake, PagerDuty)

Experience with Chef for provisioning servers and deploying applications/services

Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to explain technical issues to a non-technical audience

Strong work ethic and a can-do attitude

B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience

About Zest:

ZestFinance is a technology startup that uses machine learning and large-scale data analysis to transform credit availability for millions of Americans. Over the past 5 years, ZestFinance has built a big data underwriting technology that more accurately predicts likelihood of repayment. ZestFinance uses this technology to make loans to customer that banks typically overlook. ZestFinance also licenses its technology to other companies, including JD.com in China.

ZestFinance was founded in September, 2009, by founder and CEO Douglas Merrill, an accomplished technology executive who previously served as CIO of Google.

We are committed to diversity in hiring, professional development, and everyday discussion. Zest is determined to hire crazy smart people who are different from each other to create broad thinking, lots of different ideas, and by extension, the best team possible.

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a hands-on technical leader to contribute design and development expertise to the backend of our SaaS product. This is primarily a data management and API (back-end) coding role with opportunity to impact the entire product suite. If you like devising clever solutions to challenging problems in a spirit of collaboration, join the team!

Hospital IQ is a passionate, agile team of accomplished leaders with a mission: improve the quality and efficiency of healthcare for everyone. We're taking the best operations management science has to offer and codifying it in an innovative software platform hosted in the cloud.

If you enjoy pushing technology into new territory, collaborating with entrepreneurial innovators and subject domain experts, and embracing feedback from a growing group of loyal customers, you’ll be in good company with us.

We are growing rapidly, and anticipate a number of openings across a range of positions: engineering, marketing, sales, and services.

jobs.title: User Interface (Front-End) Developer
jobs.content:
Who do We Really Want to Hire Next?

As it goes with all early startups, the title is not a one-size-fits-all description, so your responsibilities and future potential to grow and adapt are held in your hands.

What are the Job Responsibilities?

  • Produce consistent, high-quality, elegant solutions to complex UI problems across the web browser UI for Jisto’s enterprise software product.
  • Using stated business requirements and UX specifications, modify existing designs as necessary for software enhancement, and create new designs for new features to be delivered.
  • Craft an elegant and useful UI that connects with users.
  • Create wireframes, workflows, and prototypes, envision edge cases, and articulate why some solutions are better than others.
  • Interface with technical design documentation specifications.

Exciting! What Qualifications are You Looking for in an Ideal Candidate?

  • JavaScript required.
  • Bootstrap and Meteor.js strongly preferred.
  • Experience with a web browser charting library capable of plotting large data sets in real time.
  • Exceptional typography skills, attention to detail and visual form.
  • Fluency in best practices for web browser-based design.
  • Mastery of the tools you use to create your designs.
  • Design portfolio to accompany resume.

What are the Small Print Things at the End?

  • Job Type: Contractor
  • Location: on-site or remote
  • Required Experience: User interface design: at least 4 years
  • Required Education: Bachelor's degree or higher; prior relevant depth of experience equivalent

jobs.title: Application Developer
jobs.content:
In the present world of application development it's difficult to determine where the front-end stops and the back-end begins. While we don't feel wise enough to define where this point may be, we feel the right candidate will be adventurous enough to focus more on how to provide the strongest and cleanest user experience. We're seeking someone familiar with Rails and JavaScript who is interested in creating beautiful and functional work. Compose will lead you to opportunities to learn and grow, while providing excellent conventions (like our internal framework Megatron) to comfortably work within.


As an Application Developer with Compose, you'll make major contributions to the design, function and user experience of our product. You will join a talented and supportive team in a self-managing and open organization. We're remote first and have a diverse group of friendly people located all over the world. We'll give you the respect, freedom, and trust to contribute your talents in a way that you envision.


With great respect/freedom/trust comes great responsibility, and as such it will be crucial that you have the right intrinsic motivators to work with little direction and oversight but still collaborate and seek alternative view-points. If you love making beautiful and functional things and want to have some fun, we'd love to see what you can cook up for us.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.content:
Chargify is looking for a Product Manager for our team.

__You can expect to work on the following types of projects:__

* Investigating product needs and wants directly from our customers
* Developing project briefs and scoping requirements
* Providing design feedback
* Collaborating with all departments and stakeholders for input and feedback
* Tracking project progress and communicating it among the company
* Building and managing both long-term and short-term product roadmaps

__Required credentials:__

* You should be a perfect match for our Core Values:  http://chargify.fish
* Extreme thirst to learn!
* Working Technical Knowledge that allows you to understand technical scoping requirements

__Details:__

This is a remote position for applicants based in the US. You are free to work anywhere.

You're expected to maintain a regular day-to-day schedule and be in the 'office' & responsive during your chosen worktime.  That said, we offer lots of flexibility for adjusting your schedule based on personal/family needs.

Some travel is required (typically 2 or 3 week-long trips a year).

__Benefits:__

Full-time, US citizens will be eligible for our benefits package which includes:

* Medical, dental, and vision insurance plans
* 4 weeks paid time off annually
* 9 paid holidays each year
* Company-paid Life and AD&D coverage with the option to purchase additional coverage
* Company paid Short Term Disability coverage
* 401(k) plan

All team members are eligible for paid conference attendance/travel and periodic team meetups.

__About Chargify:__

We pride ourselves on our core values: http://chargify.fish and hope to find a candidate that demonstrates these core values in their professional and personal life.

Chargifyâs mission is to simplify the complexities of running a subscription business that collects recurring revenue. Our product handles customer signups, subscription management, billing and retention so companies can focus on what is important - growing their business.

Chargify is 5 years old, profitable, and growing every month. We have an open, amiable CEO who engages customers on a daily basis, a CTO with a clear vision of the company's path forward, a stable of seasoned entrepreneurs as backers and advisors, and a close-knit team of remote workers that make Chargify better every day. We're looking for someone who shares our passion for our product and is excited to tell our story across the web.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
You: A frontend developer who loves crafting beautiful applications that work smoothly on all browsers and on mobile. You've exorcised the demons of IE and mobile Safari and they don't scare you. You've been in the trenches for years and have instincts that steer you clear of troublemakers and performance hogs like tag-based selectors and frequent DOM lookups. Your code is maintainable, well-structured, and just works. You enjoy exploring new technologies and being on the leading edge, and you relish the idea of being given a project description and running with it.

Us: A venture-backed start-up in Uptown Oakland that has developed the worldâs first app that allows occupants to control the temperature in their office. Thatâs right, a remote control for your office. And yes, when people use our UI, it works! Weâre solving the biggest complaint people have about their workplace AND saving loads of energy, at the same time. We use some of the latest frameworks and are constantly crafting new features for our customers. We believe that a beautiful and smooth web and mobile experience experience are crucial to our goals as a company.

__SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE__

* 5+ years of industry experience developing large-scale web applications
* In depth knowledge of HTML/CSS/JS across browsers (yes, IE and mobile, too)
* Experience with responsive design, Angular, jQuery, Cordova, Bootstrap
* Ability to write comprehensible, well-structured, highly performant code
* Knowledge of CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, OO design)
* Ability to work in an interdisciplinary team of designers and developers
* Knowledge of frontend unit testing frameworks a plus (karma, protractor)

__OUR STACK__

* Angular
* jQuery
* Bootstrap
* Django
* Cordova
* Git
* Flot, D3
* Travis

__BENEFITS__

* Take what you need vacation policy
* Stock options
* Competitive salaries
* Flexibility on remote working
* Monthly wellness subsidy
* Bright, airy penthouse office in sunny downtown Oakland steps away BART
* Private roof deck with epic views of San Francisco and the Bay
* Lots and lots of snacks
* Apple equipment
* Friday happy hours
* Medical, dental and vision insurance

___We are willing to consider a remote workplace for the right candidate.___

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Building Robotics is a venture-backed start-up in Uptown Oakland. Comfy, our flagship product, helps people control the temperature of their office. We solve the biggest complaint people have about their workplace and save energy to boot.

Modern buildings are complex digitally controlled mechanical systems with thousands of sensors and actuators. We develop infrastructure for wide-scale data collection and actuation that can scale to millions of buildings. Then we make user-friendly software to control and monitor building systems with ease.

Backend engineers at Building Robotics work on a variety of projects. One day you'll develop a new feature for our cross-platform (iOS/Android) mobile app, the next you'll tweak the configuration of lean Linux boxes we install at customer sites around the world. You might also refine our machine-learning algorithm to optimize for comfort and energy efficiency in a building, or perhaps our Django project needs some query optimization. Your code is deployed often, saves energy, and makes people more comfortable.

__DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE__

* Learn new concepts and programming paradigms quickly
* Write well-structured, well-commented, performant code
* Write and maintain unit tests
* Develop develop systems that are distributed, fault-tolerant, and secure
* Collect and analyze timeseries data for millions of points
* Knowledge of Python, Django, POSIX environments, JavaScript
* Experience with agile development, code review, continuous development
* Ability to work on an interdisciplinary team of developers and designers

__TOOLS WE USE__

* Python
* Django
* Celery
* Redis
* Cordova
* Travis CI
* Greenhouse CI
* GitHub
* SaltStack
* Amazon Web Services
* Angular
* Bootstap
* jQuery
* Sass
* Review Board

__BENEFITS__

* Bright, airy penthouse office in sunny downtown Oakland steps away BART
* Private roof deck with epic views of San Francisco and the Bay
* Take-what-you-need vacation policy
* Stock options
* Competitive salaries
* Flexibility on remote working
* Monthly wellness subsidy
* Lots and lots of snacks
* Apple equipment
* Regular happy hours
* Medical, dental and vision insurance

___We will consider a remote workplace for the right candidate.___

jobs.title: Database Engineer
jobs.content:
Shopify's rapid growth means that we have many interesting and challenging problems to solve, most critically in operations. Shopify's 275,000 merchants have bet their businesses on the reliability and performance of our platform, which means that both uptime and efficiency through automation are paramount. This is why we're looking to add a Database Engineer to our growing team.

__RESPONSIBILITIES:__

As part of an elite team of infrastructure engineers, you'll be responsible for ensuring that Shopify stays a robust and secure service. This includes scaling databases, supporting rollouts of HA systems, development of configuration management and automation tools and dealing with distributed systems. As a member of the production engineering team, you'll also be directly responsible for the scalability, performance, and availability of the Shopify infrastructure. You will work closely with support and development teams throughout your day-to-day activities. All members of the production engineering team, including leads, also participate in an on call rotation.

__YOU'LL NEED TO HAVE:__

* Strong experience with MySQL administration, operation and performance tuning
* Experience in running large scale database operations on Linux/Unix
* Proficiency with configuration management tools, such as Chef or Puppet
* The ability to read, write and understand scripts in languages such as Ruby or Python

__IT WOULD BE GREAT IF YOU HAD EXPERIENCE WITH:__

* Galera Cluster
* MySQL HA solutions such as MHA
* MySQL proxies
* Experience with a variety of open source software including nginx, redis, and memcached
* Amazon Web Services and `database as a service` solutions
* NoSQL data stores
* Version control systems like git

__HERE'S HOW TO APPLY:__

If youâre interested in helping us shape the future of commerce, click the âApply nowâ button to submit your application. Please address your cover letter to Kayla Boyer.

Note on Title: If the successful candidate is not a registered Engineer in Ontario an alternative title for this position will be "Database Engineering Specialist"

Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your background is this close to what weâre looking for, please consider applying, even if you arenât able to check every box above. We are dedicated to diversity and providing an inclusive workplace for all and especially encourage members of underrepresented groups to apply.

jobs.title: Sr. Javascript / Ruby Developer
jobs.content:
About us

Sticker Mule is the Internet's fastest growing online printing company. We're privately-owned, profitable and powered by an outstanding remote team that supports the growth of our manufacturing operations. We aim to build one of the Internet’s best technical teams. Currently, our 11 person development team operates in 8 countries and we’re looking for a highly experienced Javascript & Ruby developer to join us.

About this job

We’re looking for a versatile, experienced developer that’s proficient in both Ruby & Javascript. You should have 3 years experience building single page applications using technologies like: Ruby, Rails, React, Gulp, Jasmine, GraphQL, etc. We're obsessive about performance and user experience so it's important that you're passionate about these topics too. Since our team is still small we're only hiring exceptional developers that manage themselves while collaborating with the rest of our team.

You’ll like working for us if…

  1. You like to work remotely and set your own hours
  2. You’re interested in helping us become one of the best ecommerce dev teams
  3. You’re highly experienced and want a stable job with a good work / life balance.
  4. You like solving problems in the best possible way and enjoy working with people that have a similar attitude.

Compensation

  1. Salary: $90k - $135k based on experience
  2. $20k signing bonus
  3. Health & dental insurance (for U.S. applicants)
  4. 4 weeks paid vacation
  5. Flexible work hours

jobs.title: Front End/JavaScript Developer Contract Position
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Boston, MA
URL: www.verndale.com

The Senior Front End Engineer is responsible for creating clean, efficient, standards compliant HTML, CSS, and JavaScript across a wide range of web sites and web applications.

At a high level, you must:
  • Be capable of taking on any size and complexity of Front End project.
  • Be able to deliver the Front End portion of projects on time and on budget.
  • Evaluate frameworks, technologies and tools and determine their relevance to a particular project or the wider department.
  • Work closely with team members from various departments.
  • Be able to manage multiple projects and responsibilities in a fast paced environment.
On a project, you will:

  • Write the majority of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript on a project based on prototypes, designs, and functional documentation.
  • Work closely with the Front End Architect to understand project needs and learn new development technologies.
  • Collaborate with back end engineers to ensure seamless integration of components.
  • Identify and raise potential project risks to the team and help to alleviate those risks.
Technical Expertise

  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3
  • Knowledge of one or more JavaScript frameworks, React preferred. Knowledge of other frameworks such as Angular, Knockout, or Ember is beneficial, but the majority of work will be done in React, jQuery, or standard JavaScript.
  • Strong command of web standards, responsive design, and cross-browser compatibility.
  • Experience with source control systems (SVN, GIT, TFS, etc)
  • Experience developing large web sites and web applications.
  • Experience with ECMAScript2015 (ES6), ECMAScript2016 (ES7) or Babel compiler a plus.
Other Skills

  • Attention to detail. Be able to replicate provided designs and meet all functional requirements of the project.
  • Strong collaboration skills and desire to work in a highly collaborative environment.
  • Effective interpersonal and communication skills (written, verbal and listening)
  • Good judgment, strong problem-solving and decision-making skills, and a finely tuned balance of technical purity and pragmatism.
  • Knowledge of common code design patterns, design principles and industry best practices.
  • Agency experience
  • Remain up to date with industry trends and technologies and be able to apply this knowledge to project work.
  • Sitecore or other enterprise CMS experience a plus.

To apply: Send resume, code sample, and bill rate to mpriest@verndale.com Thanks!

jobs.title: Financial Analyst
jobs.content:
CreditCards.com is seeking a Financial Analyst to join our growing team! You'll be responsible for providing financial planning and analysis support to the CEO and the Senior Management Team. If you're well-versed in the use of financial analysis tools and techniques and are knowledgeable about the software industry, we'd love to speak with you! 

The principal objective of the position is to help drive financial and performance reporting, build revenue and cost models to determine business success and provide sound financial analyses and tools that guide better management decisions. 

This position is based in Austin, TX.

About the Role:

  • Provide financial reports and analysis to ensure that the senior team has the information and understanding needed about the business to make effective decisions.
  • Provide financial analysis in support of new products and opportunities. Also, support the teams by providing financial performance measures and analysis for their businesses.
  • Build financial models for the company to support new initiatives, analyze various scenarios and drive innovative thinking.
  • Maintain company dashboards and provide ad hoc reporting as needed.
  • Partner with senior management team to provide financial models, support, and insight in creating the strategic and financial plans.
  • Conduct financial reviews of the company’s monthly performance for the senior management team, CEO, and others as needed.
  • Provide support for development and updating of the sales, revenue and expense forecasts.
  • Provide financial analysis, variance analysis, and budgeting support throughout the company.
  • Develop and implement financial and operational systems and reports to monitor and evaluate performance.

About You:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or a related area
  • Minimum of 2 years of financial analysis, reporting and planning experience
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Strong computer skills
  • Excel guru
  • Working knowledge of other Microsoft Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook)
  • Detail-oriented and good organizational skills
  • Great problem solving and analytical skills
  • Accounting software experience
  • General knowledge of accounting standards and reporting
  • Ability to manage time well and multi-task
  • Ability to work independently and cohesively with others
  • Ability to meet internal and external deadlines

      Desired Skills

  • SAP experience
  • Familiarity with or experience in an internet-based business environment

**About Us: ****

Bankrate Credit Cards is a leading financial services technology and marketing company that provides consumers with free content, credit information, and financial insights, connects consumers with financial institutions and helps users achieve financial goals and well-being.

Our data-driven algorithmic platform analyzes information on users’ spend and reward preferences, and credit card features and loyalty programs, to optimize consumer payment choices to maximize rewards, minimize fees and interest, and improve cash flow across web and mobile consumer solutions.

We operate CreditCards.com, the leading online credit card marketplace, and a number of other great brands such as Wallaby Financial, CreditCardGuide, CreditCardForum, and more.

We power credit card information for major brands through our API and data enterprise product suite.

A subsidiary of Bankrate, Inc. (NYSE: RATE), we have offices in Austin, TX and Pasadena, CA.

jobs.title: SENIOR RAILS DEVELOPER COMMITTED SUSTAINABILITY
jobs.content:
We think of the internet as a societal nervous system - a growing global network of awareness and intelligence that we must put to good use. Helping to create a more sustainable future requires software skills, analytical experience, business sophistication, and a genuine commitment to ethics and social responsibility. Incorporated in 2000, Green River's team of 18 software engineers collaborates with clients including Starbucks, US Green Building Council, NBCUniversal, B Lab, and many others. We are located in scenic southern Vermont, with satellite offices in San Fransisco, CA, Ashville, NC and Cedar, Ut.


Our projects offer challenges in developing complex scalable algorithms as well as highly designed responsive user interfaces. We’re constantly evolving our approach to software development as new best practices emerge. Together, we’ve created a collaborative atmosphere in our company--shaping together the kind of work and lifestyle we want and fostering career paths through mentorship. This has resulted in exceptionally long-term relationships with both our clients and our staff.


We are looking for an individual who has experience with Rails, SQL, Javascript and CSS, and who can lead a programming team. We offer a competitive salary with great benefits, including 100% of health insurance, five weeks paid time off, retirement benefits, and so on.


As the population rises, the climate changes, and critical resource thresholds are reached and exceeded, it’s becoming increasingly important for information systems to help us obtain and interpret data about people and organizations, in terms of both economic benefits and human and ecological health. This vision of the future is what drives us at Green River.


We look forward to hearing from you.


Please send a cover letter, resume, and links to recent work with a description of your role in that work to jobs@greenriver.com
