jobs.title: Graphic Designer
Elixir Engineer
jobs.content:
If you are an Elixir Engineer and would like to build a new product from the ground up, we want to hear from you.

The Role

As the first Elixir Engineer at HelloSign, you will develop our new platform with new features and scale in mind. In addition to being highly skilled on the technical side, you should also be able to put yourself in the user's shoes and think critically about what you're building. We take pride in our work and want you to as well.

Responsibilities:

  • Help scale this new product and our existing system to support millions of users.
  • While this new platform is purely in Elixir, our existing platform is in PHP. Therefore, PHP knowledge is not required, but it’s nice to have.
  • We believe in using the right tool for each particular job. Other than Elixir and PHP, our stack also includes AWS, MySQL, ElasticSearch, Redis, Memcached, Beanstalkd (for worker queues), SASS, and React JS.

Requirements:

  • Engineering experience: You’ve done web development for 4+ years with an MVC-type framework. Bonus points for strong MySQL experience.
  • Elixir experience: Ideally you have been coding in Elixir and Phoenix for some time and you have deployed and maintained an Elixir project in a production environment. Erlang experience also counts!
  • Teamwork: You’re used to working collaboratively, participating in code reviews, and being a team player.
  • Product centric: You love solving hard technical challenges and producing clean code, but you realize the product and the end-user’s experience is the most important thing. You need to care about the users and think beyond just the technical challenges.
  • Self directed: We’re a startup. We need someone who is comfortable taking an imperfect feature specification and driving it all the way to completion.

About Us:

Our team of 8 engineers is highly collaborative and driven. Though we have areas of specialty, we're also generalists and equally comfortable up and down the stack from writing SASS to optimizing SQL. We support one another and do code-reviews to facilitate learning and reduce friction in our regular release schedule (which happens every 3 weeks). We also believe in having our engineers work closely with our other team members (product management, design, customer support, etc.) and we all share an open office in downtown San Francisco.

HelloSign has seen tremendous growth over the past two years, primarily through word-of-mouth, and we are now focusing on building the future of legal agreements. We are funded by some of the top investors in the valley, including Y Combinator, Greylock, Google Ventures, and US Venture Partners. Our goal is simply to be the way people sign documents everywhere.

We are centrally located in downtown San Francisco by Union Square. Currently at 50 employees, we are growing the company deliberately, with an eye towards maintaining a culture that values lifestyle, fun, and continuous improvement (we were recently awarded the Hirepalooza Culture Award for Lifestyle in early 2015!). Be sure to check us out on TheMuse and Glassdoor!

Life At HelloSign:

We have raving fans who love what we make • We're user-focused and product-driven • We're always evolving with an eye towards improvement • Committed to building a product people want • We have a well-defined culture of fun, continual learning and collaboration • A supportive, familial atmosphere • An open, airy, creative space with communal dining and lounge spaces • We love dogs • Happy hours for unwinding and partaking in shenanigans • A fully stocked kitchen with drinks and snacks • And we'll never forget your birthday!

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Front-End Engineer

HelloSign (YC11) is building the next generation API-focused eSignature service. We are now seeking a Senior Front-end Engineer to take ownership of a lovingly maintained garden of React modules, complete with automated tests and SCSS styling. This garden has been tended to over the past 2 years by our team of 7 full-stack engineers and 1 front-end engineer and it’s taken us far -- but now we’re seeking a technical leader to guide us to the next level. You have a passion for simple, robust architectures and building frameworks and tools for other developers. You value transparency and collaboration. In this position, you will also work closely with our in-house design staff and product teams to create efficient, reusable, customer-facing modules that will comprise HelloSign and HelloFax.

Responsibilities

Build upon and improve an eSignature service that is already used by tens of thousands of enthusiastic users. Lead by example and serve as the front-end expert for the company. Write high-performance, reusable, modular code along with automated tests. Take ownership of the front-end codebase, including React and SASS modules. Set front-end development policies for the engineering team, including coding standards, organization of files and modules, and best practices. Introduce the team to new front-end architectural ideas and concepts. Collaborate closely with our in-house design team to bring their ideas to life. Test and fix bugs across multiple browsers. Identify and resolve performance issues to optimize for speed.

Requirements

5-7+ years of experience building large-scale JavaScript applications. Strong understanding of JavaScript development patterns, such as modules, event delegation, inheritance and closures. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Solid understanding of the full web stack (e.g. HTTP, headers, caching, etc.). Disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance.

Bonuses

BS in Computer Science or related technical field. Familiarity with ES6 JavaScript and libraries including React and jQuery Familiarity with CSS preprocessors like SASS and CSS standards like SMURF/SMACSS. Familiarity with responsive design with grid frameworks like Foundation or Bootstrap. Familiarity with PHP or other object-oriented language. Familiarity with Git or other version control system. Familiarity with AWS or other cloud service a plus.

About Us

Our team of 8 engineers is helpful, curious, and highly collaborative. We believe in an ego-less approach to development and a blameless approach to problem solving. While we work independently, we frequently support each other through code-reviews, daily standups, and pair programming, facilitating learning and reducing friction in our regular release schedule of every 3 weeks. In addition to working with each other, we frequently work cross-departmentally to promote transparency and share knowledge.

HelloSign has seen tremendous growth over the past few years, primarily through word-of-mouth. We are now focusing on building the future of frictionless legal agreements. Funded by some of the top investors in the valley, including Y Combinator, Greylock, Google Ventures, and US Venture Partners, our goal is simply to be the way people sign documents everywhere. We are centrally located in downtown San Francisco by Union Square. Currently at 50 employees, we are growing the company deliberately, with an eye towards maintaining a culture that values lifestyle, fun, and continuous improvement. We were awarded the 2015 Hirepalooza Culture Award for Lifestyle and continue to maintain an overwhelmingly positive presence on Glassdoor and The Muse.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Shiftboard is looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to help develop and operate our B2B SaaS product suite. Our platform is used by over 800 organizations to schedule hundreds of thousands of shift-based workers, and we are planning on expanding that significantly over the coming months and years. This position will play a key role in ensuring our successful expansion.

About the Role

Ownership of the Entire Fleet

*Provision new servers, maintain and upgrade existing servers

*Apply all applicable security patches in a timely fashion

*Ensure appropriate levels of up-time

*Own repeatable and portable (dev sandboxes) processes for configuring servers

*Proactively recommend hardware for capacity, end-of-life, or improvements

*Resolve hardware and software issues in a timely fashion

System Health

*You get all alerts 15 minutes before anyone else

*You resolve all alerts quickly

*Regularly improving the quality of our monitoring

*Ensure all monitors are functioning as expected

Primary Point of Contact for Production Issues

*On-Call (or have found suitable coverage) for all production issues; including but not limited to: DOS attacks, hardware failures, customer impacting software bugs

Deploys

*Get code from dev to staging to production

*Own and document the entire process

Documentation / Knowledge Sharing

*Keep all Ops related documentation up-to-date

*Document current processes

*Train current staff on changes and improvements to previous processes prior to disrupting operations

Tier3 Support

*Correctly and efficiently answer customer service inquires by interrogating logs and the databases

*Handle routine Tier 3 tickets

Office Network

*Ensure appropriate configuration and reliability of the office network

*Proactively monitor for potential issues

*Resolve network issues in a timely fashion

Requirements

*3+ years of professional DevOps experience

*Mastery of one or more server-side scripting languages

*Passion for evaluating new tech & determining potential benefits and applications

*Strong Linux skills

*Proficient in SQL

*Independent, self-motivated, and excited to learn

*Desire to be part of a team and work with other smart engineers

*Flexibility and willingness to jump in wherever needed.

Company Culture

We practice iterative development. We hire smart people and empower them to make a difference. We occasionally make mistakes but we learn from them rather than being paralyzed by them. We believe in hammers for nails and screwdrivers for screws. Find the right tool and use it. We learn. Then we cement that knowledge by teaching what we've learned to others.

What We Offer

Competitive Salary Ownership Opportunity: Employee Stock Option Program Healthcare: Medical/Dental/Vision Benefits 401(k) Commuter Perks: Choose Puget Sound Transit Pass (Orca) or Cash Allowance Fast-paced, rapid career growth opportunity

About Shiftboard

Shiftboard is a leading SaaS provider of dynamic scheduling system software that includes integrated scheduling, reporting and communications tools. Shiftboard is the solution of choice for organizations large and small that have flexible workforces, work-time requirements, and real-time communication needs. Shiftboard is used by workforce operations ranging from 25 to 25,000 people including those serving healthcare, technology, business, facilities services, logistics and manufacturing, security staffing, contact center, non-profit/volunteer, municipal and education, and large events management.

Shiftboard is defined by an insistence on providing an exceptional user experience and customer service results. All of our team members are charged with bringing creativity, logic, and intellectual rigor to their responsibilities in a never-ending quest to serve our customers. We have high expectations of each other and work as a team to deliver a quality product. That mindset, along with our execution, has allowed Shiftboard to create a revolutionary product and grow into the successful, growing business it is today.

jobs.title: Full Stack Rails Javascript Web Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description


The Web Developer will create Ruby on Rails server side code and Javascript code as part of a Facilities Management application. The Web developer will also interface with clients to improve and change existing application installations. This position is on a small team of developers who work hard, are highly motivated and enjoy the freedom of working from home.


We are looking for a candidate with the following qualities:



  • Participate in the product line life cycle from strategic planning to tactical activities

  • Work independently to design, create RoR APIs and application components

  • Work Independently to design, create Web Gui components using Javascript/EXTJS

  • Contribute to business discussions about the project and user interfaces

  • Document development projects

  • Familiar with Git, CI Tools and Deployment Scripts 

  • Writes tests when working on some products
